Water Absorb Clodsire switches into attacks from Greninja, Meowscarada, and Kilowattrel. Iron Treads is an invaluable teammate to remove entry hazards with Rapid Spin and checking Fairy-types like Hatterene and Flutter Mane. Great Tusk, Garchomp, and Sandy Shocks value Quagsire's entry hazards, as it aids in their wallbreaking. Choice Scarf Great Tusk checks Choice Specs Flutter Mane, Chien-Pao, and Greninja and removes held items from Sableye, Corviknight, and Amoonguss to make them more susceptible to Quagsire's entry hazards. Garchomp threatens Grass-types like Amoonguss, Toedscruel, and Brambleghast with its Fire-type coverage and wears down walls such as Toxapex. Sandy Shocks is valued as a Water-type answer, threatening Pelipper, Dondozo, and Slowking as well as Corviknight. Furthermore, it beats Fire teams with Power Gem by taking advantage of sun with Protosynthesis.

sets.name: Physically Defensive (Water)
sets.description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

nu.overview: Umbreon's amazing utility movepool and peerless bulk make it a top-notch support Pokemon and check to many top tier threats, like Bruxish, Qwilfish, and Mabosstiff. Despite its great bulk, Umbreon's offenses are quite lackluster, though this can be somewhat alleviated by STAB Foul Play to punish setup sweepers attempting to exploit Umbreon's passivity, like Coil Eelektross and Bulk Up Ursaring. Setup sweepers that don't mind taking a Foul Play, like Calm Mind Dudunsparce and Quiver Dance Oricorio, can easily take advantage of it. Umbreon also dislikes the plethora of Fighting-types in the tier, like Toxicroak, Medicham, and Paldean Tauros.
nu.comments:
Other Options

Umbreon has a myriad of utility options at its disposal, including being able to set up with Calm Mind. Unfortunately, due to Umbreon's terrible Special Attack, a Calm Mind set typically requires too many boosts to be effective. Umbreon can fit two utility moves if it chooses to use Moonlight instead of Wish and Protect, but the limited PP can become a detriment in longer games. Umbreon can beat setup sweepers that typically take advantage of it, such as Quiver Dance Oricorio and Calm Mind Vaporeon, with Tera Ghost and Curse. Umbreon can also use Taunt and a few extra Speed EVs to stop setup sweepers like Sandaconda and Vaporeon or other support Pokemon like Vespiquen and Muk from using their own status moves. Lastly, Umbreon can trap an unsuspecting foe with Mean Look and wear it down with Foul Play or even drop its stats with Tickle to more easily take it out.

Checks and Counters

Fighting-types: NU has a plethora of Fighting-types, such as Crabominable, Medicham, and Sneasel-Hisui. Umbreon can Terastallize to reverse this weakness, but that always comes with a new set of weaknesses and removes the option to Terastallize later. Other Pokemon like Scyther and Zangoose have a powerful Close Combat that can threaten Umbreon as well.

Opposing Utility Moves: Regardless of Synchronize, a poisoned Umbreon, whether by Toxic or Toxic Spikes, is extremely impaired and struggles to fulfill its role. Trick from a Choice Scarf Haunter or Rotom can completely ruin Umbreon despite it being a suitable check to them otherwise. Taunt from Pokemon like Bombirdier, Qwilfish, and opposing Umbreon can limit Umbreon to only an exploitable Foul Play.

Special Setup Sweepers: Setup sweepers that don't mind Foul Play, mainly special attackers like Oricorio, Vivillon, and a Terastallized Farigiraf can easily boost against Umbreon.

sets.name: Wish Support
sets.description:
Set Details

Foul Play is surprisingly powerful with STAB, letting Umbreon threaten even neutral physical attackers. Umbreon's immense bulk lets it spread status with Thunder Wave or Yawn to support its teammates, and Wish can keep teammates that lack reliable recovery such as Perrserker and Eelektross healthy. While Pokemon like Tera Ground Oricorio and Coil Eelektross are immune to Thunder Wave, Yawn can shut down their setup attempts nicely. Synchronize can deter or punish careless status moves used by the likes of Dudunsparce and Drifblim. Umbreon prefers a Poison or Fairy Tera type to turn the tables on Fighting-types and take U-turn better. Tera Poison also provides a Fairy resistance and an immunity to Toxic and Toxic Spikes from common users like Muk, Qwilfish, and Vespiquen.

Umbreon appreciates Drifblim and Qwilfish for their Fighting resistance. Drifblim can remove entry hazards and take advantage of Umbreon's status moves with Hex, while Qwilfish can consistently punish Fighting-type moves and U-turn from Pokemon like Passimian and Scyther with Poison Point and Rocky Helmet. Bruxish and Rotom appreciate Umbreon's resistance to Ghost- and Dark-type attacks and its ability to inflict paralysis and sleep.

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
With Paradox Pokemon being introduced, Series 2 is bringing big changes to Battle Stadium Singles! This is a modified Series 1 analysis that takes Paradox Pokemon into account. We will update this overview and analysis again once the metagame settles more. For more information on Series 2, check out the resource thread.

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

sets.name: Wish Tank
sets.description:
• Umbreon’s high bulk allows it tank a slew of offensive Pokemon. In particular, it matches up extremely well against Dragapult. A naturally high bulk alongside excellent utility moves means Umbreon can generate tempo while surviving even surprise Tera-boosted attacks.

  • Foul Play: In such a physically leaning format, Foul Play is a strong reliable move to chip the opponent’s Pokemon. In particular, it punishes Swords Dance from Lum Berry Kingambit. Protect also scouts for U-turn and Tera.

  • Wish and Protect: Wish + Protect provides excellent recovery, and with Leftovers's animation as well, is great at stalling out the timer and can also keep teammates healthy.

  • Yawn: Yawn's ability to force switches generates extra Leftovers recovery and generates momentum for its teammates.

  • Thunder Wave: Thunder Wave has excellent synergy with Wish. If the opponent’s Pokemon is unable to attack on the turn Umbreon uses Wish, Umbreon can easily pass the Wish to a teammate.

  • Taunt: Umbreon can Taunt opposing walls and deny their recovery; with foes such as Hippowdon and Corviknight being especially vulnerable.

Tera Types

  • Poison: Tera Poison resists Fighting, Bug, and Fairy and provides an immunity to Toxic.

  • Steel: Tera Steel resists Bug and Fairy, is immune to Toxic, and has a decent matchup against Kingambit and Flutter Mane.

  • Fairy: In a heavily Dragon-centric metagame, Tera Fairy on defensive Pokemon is highly valuable.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 252 Def / 4 SpD with Bold: This spread allows Umbreon to tank a majority of the heavily physical metagame.

  • 172 HP / 252 Def / 60 SpD / 20 Spe with Bold: If running Taunt, 20 Speed EVs outpace Skeledirge and Corviknight while retaining all-around bulk.

Abilities

  • Inner Focus: Inner Focus avoids flinches from Kingambit and Hydreigon, making it a more reliable check.

  • Synchronize: Synchronize punishes attempts to burn Umbreon.

sets.name: Weather Setter
sets.description:
Thunder Wave supports teammates that are still rather slow even under rain or sun like Beartic and Scovillain, respectively. Taunt denies entry hazards, recovery, and status moves. Haze neutralizes setup sweepers like Masquerain, Lilligant, and Hisuian Sliggoo.

Sample set. Stay tuned for updates!

sets.name: Bulky Supporter
sets.description:
• The given EV spread, nature and Eviolite allow Murkrow to survive an Extreme Speed from a Swords of Ruin-boosted Choice Band Dragonite, then invests the remaining EVs in Special Defense.

These are sample sets as we work on proper analyses. Stay tuned!

sets.name: Specially Defensive
sets.description:
Slowking is a specially defensive pivot with access to Chilly Reception, allowing it to keep momentum relatively safely due to the combination of its low Speed and Regenerator. Chilly Reception can also be used for cancelling the effects of opposing weather such as rain and sun while also enabling offensive Ice-types due to snow's Defense boost. Surf is its most reliable STAB move, being necessary to sucessfully check Iron Moth and Iron Valiant. Future Sight threatens more defensive teams when paired with physical wallbreakers such as Baxcalibur and Cinderace, as it threatens opposing defensive Pokemon like Toxapex and Amoonguss. Thunder Wave can alternatively be run alongside Surf, preventing Slowking from being setup fodder for Volcarona and Dragonite. Slowking runs maximum Special Defense EVs in order to switch into a variety of other special attackers such as Walking Wake, Rotom-W, Volcarona, and Hatterene. It also lets Slowking make use of Chilly Reception and Thunder Wave for dynamic counterplay. The investment also gives Slowking more opportunities to safely pivot in front of Pokemon that aren't immediately threatening but can beat it long-term, such as Gholdengo, Garganacl, Hisuian Zoroark, and Choice Specs Dragapult. 0 Speed IVs in tandem with a Sassy nature maximize the odds of slow pivoting in front of foes, which is important to nearly guarantee safely bringing in other teammates. Slowking can utilize Tera Water to remove its Bug-, Ghost-, and Dark-type weaknesses, enhancing its matchup against Gholdengo, Dragapult, Greninja, and Volcarona while also allowing it to absorb U-turn better. Additionally, it also boosts Surf's damage output. Tera Fairy turns the tables on Dragapult and Greninja, allowing it to wall their Choice Specs sets reliably.

Slowking fits on balance teams due to its exclusive access to Chilly Reception, as they can take advantage of both the snow and momentum generated by it. Slowking enjoys being paired with Pokemon that can generate momentum, such as Cinderace, Rotom-W, and Sandy Shocks. This helps its team to pivot around Garganacl to avoid being worn down by its Salt Cure. Slowking is naturally paired with physically defensive walls with good synergy, such as Great Tusk, Amoonguss, and Corviknight, which answer many of Slowking´s checks such as Kingambit, Meowscarada, and Roaring Moon. Slowking is generally vulnerable to becoming fodder for Orthworm, since it can't paralyze targets through Orthworm´s passed Substitutes. As such, Pokemon like Infiltrator Dragapult and Unaware Pokemon like Skeledirge and Dondozo are logical Slowking teammates that fix this issue, with Unaware teammates in particular being crucial for answering setup sweepers like Belly Drum Azumarill and Swords Dance Iron Valiant that are present on hyper offense teams. Dark-types like Kingambit can check and occasionally switch into special attackers that have an advantage against Slowking like Nasty Plot Gholdengo, Choice Specs Greninja, and Choice Specs Dragapult, creating good defensive synergy without lacking offensive capabilities.

sets.name: Defensive Pivot
sets.description: Slowking serves as a decent defensive wall due to its overall good bulk and support movepool, switching into various physical attackers such as Talonflame, Cinderace, and Quaquaval. Chilly Reception lets Slowking pivot into teammates in order to gain momentum, notably Chien-Pao. Slowking's low Speed stat with 0 Speed IVs allows it to switch into a favorable teammate after pivoting. Surf is a reliable STAB move that most notably deals huge damage to Sandy Shocks, Talonflame, and Iron Moth. Ice Beam threatens Garchomp and stops it from using Slowking as a setup fodder. Thunder Wave can be used in order to cripple Iron Moth and Roaring Moon that usually switch into Slowking and can pressure it. Intimidate is the preferred choice of ability, as it combines well with Slowking's ability to pivot, making it difficult to KO. Fluffy can be used as an alternative in order to deal with Roaring Moon better. Rocky Helmet punishes U-turn users such as Cinderace and Quaquaval from freely pivoting against Slowking, while Heavy-Duty Boots keeps Slowking healthy. Slowking fits best on balance teams where it can switch into aforementioned Pokemon while also being able to pivot into teammates like Chien-Pao and Kingambit, providing them a good setup opportunity.

sets.name: Defensive Pivot
sets.description: Thanks to its solid special bulk and excellent longevity between Slack Off and Regenerator, Slowking establishes itself as a passable pivot in the metagame. It can switch into foes like Tornadus-T and non-Toxic Heatran, and it can even scout for Choice Specs users such as Dragapult, Iron Valiant, and Tapu Lele. Future Sight + Teleport or Chilly Reception lets Slowking support its frail offensive teammates such as Mega Lopunny and Dragapult, giving them safe switch ins and amplifying their wallbreaking prowess afterwards. Teleport is a much more reliable way of pivoting, as its higher PP makes it more valuable in longer games and it provides Slowking's teammates with a safe switch in against Ferrothorn and other Teleport users like Blissey and Slowbro. Alternatively, Chilly Reception's snow helps disrupt weather teams like sun and rain as well as support Ice-type teammates like Kyurem and Weavile with its Defense boost. Tera Fairy improves Slowking's matchup against Dragapult and Tapu Koko and maintains its Fighting resistance against Mega Lopunny, while Tera Dark lets it better stomach Ghost-type attacks from Gholdengo and Dragapult at the cost of being weaker against Tapu Lele and Iron Valiant. Both Tera choices importantly prevent Slowking from being Pursuit trapped by Kingambit, Weavile, and Mega Tyranitar. Wallbreakers like Zamazenta, Mega Lopunny, Great Tusk, and Kingambit appreciate Slowking's slow pivoting, with the looming Future Sight pressuring their switch-ins like Toxapex, Buzzwole, and defensive Great Tusk. Moreover, Slowking switches into their revenge killers, notably Nasty Plot Tornadus-T and Choice Scarf Tapu Lele. Defensive Pokemon such as Ferrothorn, Ting-Lu, and Tangrowth cover foes like Weavile, Tapu Koko, and Kartana, respectively; Ferrothorn and Tangrowth also deal with rain wallbreakers like Mega Swampert and Barraskewda that would otherwise overwhelm Slowking despite its Water resistance, with the latter in particular forming a Regnerator core with Slowking.

sets.name: Specially Defensive
sets.description: Defense avoids OHKO from Krookodile’s Knock Off.

sets.name: Assault Vest
sets.description: Thanks to its wonderful typing, gargantuan special bulk, and Regenerator, Assault Vest Galarian Slowking is a potent specially defensive pivot. Additionally, it has access to good offensive options and Future Sight, letting it support and enable offensive teammates. Additionally, Future Sight can help break Substitute from the likes of Baxcalibur and Iron Moth, preventing them from having opportunities to sweep. Psychic can be used over Future Sight as a more consistent alternative, providing more immediate pressure against the likes of Zamazenta, Toxapex, Amoonguss, and Iron Moth. Flamethrower hits Steel-types like Gholdengo, Kingambit, and Corviknight that can otherwise snuff out Future Sight. Surf is key for hitting Pokemon like Landorus-T and Heatran, 2HKOing the former, while also hitting Great Tusk and Iron Moth without having to rely on Future Sight. Alternatively, Ice Beam wrecks Landorus-T, Great Tusk, and Garchomp while also hitting the likes of Dragapult and Dragonite. Tera Fairy gives Galarian Slowking a generally good defensive typing, notably being immune to Dragon-type moves from the likes of Dragapult, Baxcalibur, and Walking Wake. Tera Flying turns Galarian Slowking’s weakness to Ground into an immunity while also making it resist U-turn, allowing it to switch into non-Ice Spinner Great Tusk most of the time. Tera Water lets Galarian Slowking snuff out Fire-types like Cinderace, Volcanion, and Heatran while also resisting Water-type attacks from Pokemon like Hisuian Samurott, Walking Wake, and Azumarill. Additionally, it boosts the power of Surf, letting it potentially OHKO Landorus-T and 2HKO Heatran. 120 Special Defense EVs let Galarian Slowking take two Shadow Balls from Choice Specs Dragapult at full health, while 16 Defense EVs ensure that it can survive two Psyshocks from Choice Specs Iron Valiant after Stealth Rock, which also means surviving Hisuian Samurott's Ceaseless Edge from full health. Ground-immune Pokemon such as Zapdos, Moltres, and Corviknight make for excellent teammates, as they can switch into Ground-type moves from the likes of Great Tusk and overwhelm them. Offensive Pokemon like Dragapult, Iron Valiant, Baxcalibur, and Enamorus heavily appreciate Future Sight being able to overwhelm Pokemon like Garganacl, Amoonguss, and Zamazenta. Galarian Slowking's reliance on Assault Vest to function against Pokemon like Dragapult, in addition to its weakness to Dark, leaves it heavily vulnerable to Knock Off from the likes of Iron Valiant and Meowscarada. As a result, Corviknight is a great partner, as it can take Knock Off and provide Defog support, helping maintain Galarian Slowking's longevity. The weakness to Dark leaves Galarian Slowking especially vulnerable to the likes of Kingambit, Hisuian Samurott, and Roaring Moon. As a result, checks to these Pokemon like Great Tusk and Dondozo make for great partners.

sets.name: Pivot
sets.description:
Galarian Slowking is the tier's premier defensive pivot thanks to its unique defensive profile alongside Regenerator and a spectacular movepool. Future Sight's delayed damage is incredibly difficult to deal with when Galarian Slowking is paired with strong wallbreakers, while Psychic is a fine alternative to immediately damage Great Tusk, Zamazenta, and Sneasler. Chilly Reception allows Galarian Slowking to pivot out, with the added bonus of resetting opposing weather; its poor Speed alongside minimum investment ensures that its teammate can switch in safely. Thunder Wave cripples would-be checks like Heatran and Kingambit, and the speed control against fast threats like Dragapult and Cinderace can greatly aid its teammates. Surf has solid coverage alongside Galarian Slowking's STAB moves, hitting Heatran, Ting-Lu, Landorus-T, and Ursaluna for decent damage. Slack Off provides Galarian Slowking with reliable recovery, and—alongside Regenerator—can give it tremendous amount of staying power. Toxic can be considered over Thunder Wave to force progress against defensive threats like Skeledirge and Dondozo. Ice Beam can greatly pressure Landorus-T, Dragonite, and Dragapult with a single moveslot. Flamethrower punishes Kingambit and Gholdengo. Lastly, Grass Knot hits Tera Water Garganacl hard and can reliably 2HKO Dondozo. Heavy-Duty Boots allows Galarian Slowking to continuously pivot without having Regenerator's recovery nullified by entry hazards, while Shuca Berry allows it to either pivot into or directly retaliate against a Ground-type attack from Great Tusk, Landorus-T, or Enamorus. Colbur Berry allows Galarian Slowking to reliably check Knock Off Iron Valiant and Night Slash Sneasler, both of which can otherwise greatly threaten it. Both Tera Grass and Tera Water grant a resistance to Water-type attacks from Azumarill and Walking Wake. Moreover, Tera Grass turns its Ground weakness into a resistance, while Tera Water allows Galarian Slowking to sponge attacks from Heatran, Cinderace, and Iron Moth while powering up Surf. Tera Flying provides a crucial Ground immunity and U-Turn resistance while keeping Galarian Slowking's Fighting resistance, letting it reliably switch into Great Tusk variants that lack Ice Spinner. A Sassy nature with maximum Special Defense investment can be used to deal with Enamorus and Shadow Ball Iron Valiant more easily.

Galarian Slowking fits on a wide assortment of balance and bulky offense teams, which greatly appreciate its ability to defensively support its teammates while providing significant offensive pressure itself. Powerful wallbreakers like Choice Band Zamazenta, Sneasler, and Ursaluna appreciate Galarian Slowking's ability to both pivot them in safely with Chilly Reception and pressure would-be defensive checks like Corviknight, Toxapex, Skeledirge, and Dondozo with Future Sight, which forces them into 2HKO or even OHKO range against these wallbreakers. Dragon Dance Baxcalibur is a fantastic teammate, as the snow set by Chilly Reception improves its already-solid bulk and allows it to run Ice Body, giving it the opportunity to set up multiple Dragon Dances and devastate opposing offensive teams. Dragapult is a solid teammate, as it appreciates Galarian Slowking's ability to check Enamorus and Booster Energy Iron Valiant; in return, Dragapult can wallbreak or disrupt teams with its own status moves. Zapdos and Landorus-T have solid defensive synergy with Galarian Slowking thanks to their Ground immunity and ability to check physical attackers like Great Tusk while forming a VoltTurn core with it. Garganacl and Kingambit have good defensive synergy with Galarian Slowking, since they can sponge repeated Ghost-type attacks from Dragapult and Gholdengo while it can check threats like Enamorus and Fighting-types like Sneasler, Zamazenta, and some Iron Valiant sets in return. Kingambit in particular appreciates Galarian Slowking's Future Sight support and ability to pressure Fire-types.

Guarantees a 2HKO on Heatran after Stealth Rock damage.

This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

battlestadiumsingles.overview: This Pokemon is a new addition to the Regulation D format! If you have any questions or feel it needs more updates, feel free to post here.

sets.name: AV Tank
sets.description:
• Thanks to its great Special Defense, unique typing, and Regenerator, Galarian Slowking functions well as an Assault Vest user.

  • Assault Vest: While Galarian Slowking has access to Slack Off, Regenerator can provide some recovery if needed, and an Assault Vest increases its Special Defense to titanic levels.

  • Future Sight: Future Sight is Galarian Slowking's strongest move and provides phenomenal field pressure due to hitting two turns after it's used, allowing for combinations with another teammate's move.

  • Eerie Spell versus Psychic: Psychic offers more PP, while Eerie Spell depletes the PP of the last move used by the opponent by 3, which can be useful when fighting against opponents with low PP moves, such as recovery moves.

  • Acid Spray: Acid Spray makes Galarian Slowking much less passive and prone to setup against opponents that aren't immune, and the Special Defense drops can be deadly when combined with Future Sight, alongside making Galarian Slowking harder to check defensively.

  • Earthquake: Earthquake is Galarian Slowking's best option against Heatran and Hisuian Goodra, even when using a Calm nature.

  • Ice Beam: Ice Beam allows Galarian Slowking to hit Ground-types such as Ting-Lu, Landorus-T, and Ursaluna for more damage than its Psychic STAB moves.

  • Flamethrower: Flamethrower hits other Steel-types such as Gholdengo and Corviknight.

  • Calm versus Sassy: If using Earthquake, a Sassy Nature lets Galarian Slowking have a shot at 3HKOing max HP Hisuian Goodra, though at the risk of getting outsped by Amoonguss. A Calm Nature has better odds at Speed tying or outspeeding Amoonguss.

Other Options

  • Psyshock: Despite having little synergy with Acid Spray, Psyshock hits Flutter Mane and Clodsire the hardest before factoring Special Defense drops.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 252 SpD / 4 Spe with Calm / Sassy: This EV spread focuses on Galarian Slowking's ability to take special attacks to the point where powerful super effective hits such as Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Shadow Ball only has a chance of 2HKOing it 75.4% of the time.

  • 252 HP / 28 Def / 84 SpA / 140 SpD / 4 Spe with Modest / Quiet: This spread survives Jolly Choice Band Urshifu-R's Surging Strikes while OHKOing it with Eerie Spell.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Galarian Slowking is perfectly able to function without Terastallization, but it can boost its defensive profile.

  • Normal: A well-timed Tera Normal can severely hamper opponents hoping to take down Galarian Slowking with Ghost-type moves.

  • Poison: Tera Poison removes Galarian Slowking's weaknesses to Ghost-, and Dark-type attacks, and it boosts Sludge Bomb and Acid Spray's power.

  • Grass: Tera Grass turns Galarian Slowking's Ground weakness into a resistance, can help it take Urshifu-R's Surging Strikes better, and provides a handy immunity to Spore.

sets.name: Assault Vest
sets.description: Galarian Slowking is a unique special wall, reliably using Future Sight against passive Pokemon like Toxapex and Clefable while also checking Pokemon like Walking Wake, Iron Valiant, and Iron Moth. It can also take super effective hits from Dragapult and Gholdengo. Flamethrower hits Steel-types like Kingambit, Gholdengo, and Ferrothorn, while Scald allows Galarian Slowking to spread poison and burn alike, crippling common switch-ins like Toxapex, Dragapult, and Gastrodon. Scald also punishes Ground-types like Landorus-T and Great Tusk. Ice Beam catches Ground-types and Dragonite, but it isn't as reliable as Scald, as it leaves Galarian Slowking unable to hit Heatran. Focus Blast instantly KOes Kingambit on the switch and hits Heatran harder, but it is very unreliable. The given EV spread prevents a 2HKO from Choice Specs Protosynthesis Walking Wake's Draco Meteor. Tera Steel helps Galarian Slowking check Fairy-types like Tapu Lele and Hatterene, while Tera Water improves its Walking Wake and rain matchups. Both also make Galarian Slowking neutral to Pursuit from the likes of Kingambit and Weavile. Future Sight support is highly appreciated by Fighting-types like Urshifu-R, Zamazenta, and Iron Valiant, as it pressures their checks in Toxapex, Skeledirge, and Clodsire. They can pressure Pursuit Kingambit, a major roadblock to Galarian Slowking. Knock Off absorbers like offensive Tornadus-T, Clefable, and Gliscor also work well with Galarian Slowking. The former can form a strong Regenerator core pivoting and gaining information through the game. Entry hazard setters like Ferrothorn and Ting-Lu appreciate Galarian Slowking's ability to cripple common Defoggers like Tornadus-T and Zapdos with Sludge Bomb and Scald. In return, Galarian Slowking likes entry hazards wearing down its checks, namely Kingambit, Heatran, and Gholdengo.

sets.name: Defensive Pivot
sets.description: Galarian Slowking is an excellent pivot owing to its combination of Regenerator and Chilly Reception, which gives it some of the best longevity in the tier. With its unique defensive typing and good bulk, it can check a wide variety of foes, notably Fairy-types like Clefable and Tapu Fini and Grass-types such as Serperior and Tapu Bulu. Sludge Bomb serves as a spammable STAB move that can hurt the longevity of targets such as Gastrodon and Mega Sableye by poisoning them. Slack Off provides instant recovery Galarian Slowking can use without needing to switch out. Future Sight lets Galarian Slowking support wallbreakers and threaten Pokemon switching in to check it. Maximizing Galarian Slowking's physical bulk improves its ability to check physical attackers and lets it usually survive at least one Pursuit from an opposing Dark-type. 0 Speed IVs let Galarian Slowking move after its foes when using Chilly Reception, improving its pivoting capabilities. Galarian Slowking best fits on offensive teams looking for a splashable pivot and Future Sight support for wallbreakers that have difficulty coming onto the field, like Meowscarada and Mega Gallade. It struggles the most against Dark-types, which can absorb its Future Sight and threaten it. Tyranitar is a notable example due to its powerful Pursuit and Galarian Slowking's inability to hit it for neutral damage. Thus, bulky Fighting-types like Iron Hands and Buzzwole make good partners. Steel-types such as Aegislash, Iron Treads, and Celesteela also wall Galarian Slowking due to its lack of coverage, so the aforementioned Fighting-types and other checks to Steel-types, such as Fire-types like Iron Moth, are effective support. Entry hazard stackers like Skarmory pair well with Galarian Slowking's ability to spread damage and pivot in offensive threats.

sets.name: Assault Vest
sets.description: Assault Vest Galarian Slowking is an effective special wall that uses its unique typing and wide coverage to act as a versatile tank. The overwhelming majority of special attackers in the tier, including difficult-to-wall foes like Serperior and Iron Moth, lack the means to effectively break through it. Meanwhile, Galarian Slowking's good Special Attack and coverage mean few Pokemon are not threatened by it. Regenerator lets Galarian Slowking have a form of healing while holding Assault Vest. Sludge Bomb is a spammable STAB move that can cripple switch-ins with poison. Future Sight lets Galarian Slowking support wallbreakers while also punishing Pokemon such as Dragon Dance Gyarados that would otherwise try and set up on it. Flamethrower primarily targets Steel-types like Aegislash and Celesteela. Scald hits Ground-types and potentially cripples physical attackers and walls like Skarmory and Mega Tyranitar. This EV spread is used to guarantee that Galarian Slowking will not be 2HKOed by Latios's Choice Specs-boosted Draco Meteor after Stealth Rock and one layer of Spikes, with the remaining EVs being used to augment Galarian Slowking's Special Attack. Galarian Slowking best fits on bulky teams looking for a versatile tank that serves as a blanket check to most of the tier's special attackers. Examples of partners that appreciate this include Clefable, SubToxic Aegislash, and Gastrodon. Entry hazard removers like Tapu Fini are crucial support, as even one layer of entry hazards significantly cuts into Galarian Slowking's recovery. Galarian Slowking struggles the most against Pursuit trappers like Tyranitar, as while no physical attacker enjoys switching into its Scald or Sludge Bomb, they can easily trap it once they're on the field. Bulky Fighting-types like Iron Hands and Buzzwole and defensive walls such as Skarmory and Tangrowth can handle these foes for Galarian Slowking. Aegislash is another notable issue for Galarian Slowking, as its Ghost typing combined with its huge bulk and offenses lets it easily win one-on-one. Ground-types like Iron Treads can serve as effective checks to it.

sets.name: Defensive
sets.description:
Defensive Misdreavus is the glue that holds PU together because of its ability to deal with many of the strongest physical attacking presences in the metagame, such as Lycanroc-N, Alolan Dugtrio, and Perrserker. It has a very strong type for this tier, with very few Pokemon able to hit it for super effective damage. It is also the best Rapid Spin blocker in PU because of this. Will-O-Wisp is great for crippling physical attackers like Lycanroc-N, Gabite, and Alolan Dugtrio. Choosing to run Thunder Wave over Will-O-Wisp can make dealing with Alolan Dugtrio and Gabite more difficult. With Misdreavus able to spread status so well, Hex is the best choice for its STAB move. Power Gem is quad effective against Articuno, Masquerain, and Charizard; it also hits other popular Pokemon like Houndoom, Pyroar, and Rotom-F for super effective damage. Thunderbolt can be opted for instead to better hit Water-types like Golduck, Lumineon, Basculin, and Quaxwell. Taunt is also an option over the two attacking moves to disallow setup sweepers such as Gogoat and Carbink from boosting in front of Misdreavus; it also works well at stopping entry hazard setters such as Carbink, Gabite, and Camerupt. The EV spread allows for better recovery with Pain Split by keeping Misdreavus's HP a bit lower than if 252 HP EVs were used while still keeping its overall bulk by adding the EVs taken from HP into both defensive stats. 56 Speed EVs let it out speed neutral natured Honchkrow and Flapple, as well as Timid Glimmet and uninvested Drakloak. Tera Fighting and Tera Fairy both work well to provide a resistance to Dark-type moves from Pokemon like Honchkrow and Alolan Persian. Although, Tera Fighting leaves Misdreavus vulnerable to Flying-type moves from Articuno, Charizard, and Masquerain and Psychic-type moves from Rabsca and Indeedee-F. On the other hand, Tera Fairy leaves it vulnerable to Steel-type moves from Perrserker and Alolan Dugtrio. Tera Electric is great for boosting Thunderbolt and giving Misdreavus zero weaknesses with its ability. Tera Rock boosts Power Gem, letting it OHKO Charizard and Masquerain.

Misdreavus works well on balance teams looking for a catch-all defensive Pokemon to deal with many of the metagame's top threats. It also works great on entry hazard stacking teams since it is not bothered by the top Rapid Spin user, Quaxwell. Misdreavus thrives when given teammates like Carbink, Dachsbun, and Tinkatuff to deal with Dark-types such as Alolan Persian, Houndoom, and Skuntank. These same Dark-type threats, Alolan Persian, Houndoom, and Skuntank, can help deal with Ghost-type foes like Banette, Drakloak, and opposing Misdreavus. Specially defensive walls like Articuno, Carbink, and Tinkatuff form a nice core with Misdreavus since it can cover physical Pokemon that give them trouble, like Lycanroc-N, Perrserker, and Alolan Dugtrio. Knock Off absorbers and status absorbers are highly recommended to keep Misdreavus healthy enough to deal with all of these Pokemon. Status absorbers are the likes of RestTalk Gabite, Dragonair, and Zangoose, while Knock Off absorbers are usually Dark-types like Alolan Persian and Skuntank.

sets.name: Offensive
sets.description:
Misdreavus is capable of becoming a fearsome sweeper while still retaining its defensive and utility properties, which allow it to switch into a wide range of threats and spinblock effectively. Calm Mind can be used with Draining Kiss and Tera Fairy to turn Misdreavus into a bulky wallbreaker that is difficult to wear down due to Misdreavus's great natural bulk, HP recovery from Draining Kiss, and immediate access to status moves. Tera Fairy is notable for preventing threats like Nasty Plot Alolan Persian from immediately threatening it, and its toolset lends it easy setup opportunities against Gabite, one of the best phazers in the metagame, as well as other passive targets like Dachsbun and Carbink. Alternatively, Nasty Plot can be used along with either Draining Kiss or Power Gem to make Misdreavus more immediately threatening, with Power Gem primarily targeting Fire-types like Pyroar and Houndoom that it would otherwise struggle with as well as specially defensive Articuno. Hex benefits greatly from Misdreavus's ability to spread status and can be amplified with additional status spreaders on the team; alternatively, Shadow Ball can be used on Nasty Plot sets for greater immediate damage output. Will-O-Wisp is useful for preventing targets like Skuntank and Honchkrow from revenge killing it before Terastallization as well as increasing its ability to take hits from Quaxwell. Thunder Wave is another option that cripples special walls like Articuno and opposing setup sweepers like Masquerain. Substitute can also be used as the last move to facilitate setup on forced switches and prevent Skuntank and Rotom-F from crippling it with Toxic or Trick, but it usually gets more value from spreading status. An alternative EV spread of 128 HP / 128 SpA / 252 Spe with a Timid nature can be used on Calm Mind variants for easier setup and more reliable spinblocking.

Misdreavus's effectiveness at spinblocking naturally makes it a great fit on entry hazard stacking teams alongside setters like Whiscash, Carbink, and Masquerain as well as strong wallbreakers like Basculin and Rotom-F. Ground-types like Whiscash and Gabite can reliably switch into offensive checks like Alolan Dugtrio and Houndoom as well as Pokemon that may cripple Misdreavus with Thunder Wave or Encore, such as Tinkatuff and Raichu. Carbink can reliably switch into and deal with Dark-types like Houndoom and Alolan Persian that Nasty Plot variants in particular struggle with greatly before Terastallization, and it can also absorb Knock Off. Gogoat can form an effective bulky setup core with Misdreavus, as they deal with each other's checks, like Basculin and Gabite, respectively, and they pressure mutual targets like Articuno and Carbink better together. Thunder Wave users like Alolan Persian and Tinkatuff can facilitate sweeping for Misdreavus by powering up its Hex; the former can also bring it in safely with Parting Shot and ease the pressure of handling Perrserker, and the latter can create setup opportunities with Encore. In addition, both of these can situationally switch into Knock Off from Pokemon like Banette and opposing Tinkatuff.

sets.name: Entry Hazard Support (Bug)
sets.description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

sets.name: Physical Wall
sets.description: Qwilfish is a premier physical wall in the tier owing to its great defensive typing and abilities, as well as a bevy of amazing utility moves including the highly coveted Spikes and Toxic. Qwilfish can wear down the opposition with its combination of Spikes and Toxic and even prevent Defog and recovery moves with Taunt. Waterfall is used over Liquidation to potentially cause flinching, which works wonders in conjunction with Toxic, although Surf can be used for a 2HKO on Sandaconda and more damage on other physically bulky Pokemon like Drifblim and Klawf. Despite Intimidate being such a high-value ability, Qwilfish typically prefers Poison Point to punish U-turn from the likes of Passimian and Scyther while not activating Passimian's Defiant in the process. Protect can be used with Leftovers for some extra recovery and also to scout moves from Choice item users like Rotom, Bruxish, and Zoroark. Upon scouting these Pokemon, Qwilfish can invert its weakness to Electric- or Psychic-type moves with a timely Terastallization to a respective Ground or Dark typing, letting it spread more poison and set more Spikes. Umbreon is a great defensive partner, sponging general special attacks while boasting an immunity to Psychic. In return, Qwilfish heavily punishes Fighting-type attacks and U-turn, while also resisting Fairy. Phasers like Dragon Tail Dudunsparce and Eelektross make great use of the Spikes Qwilfish sets up, racking up damage for a faster Pokemon to more easily sweep. Choice Scarf Passimian takes advantage of hazard damage while also punishing Defog with its Defiant ability.

sets.name: Defensive
sets.description:
With access to a deep utility movepool, great defensive abilities, and Eviolite, Hisuian Qwilfish can take on many offensive threats. Intimidate is useful to weaken physical attackers, allowing it to tank strong neutral attacks from the likes of Ursaring and Tauros. Hisuian Qwilfish can also make use of Poison Point to punish contact moves, even generally commitment-free moves like Scyther's and Mesprit's U-turn. Barb Barrage is preferred over stronger options like Poison Jab and Gunk Shot thanks to its high chance to poison, as well as dealing double damage to a poisoned target. Taunt dismantles setup sweepers such as Eelektross while also preventing Defog. Haze is an option over Taunt to prevent setup sweepers like Tera Steel Mesprit and Eelektross from exploiting Hisuian Qwilfish's passivity. Toxic can also be run over Taunt to take advantage of Defog users removing your Spikes and cripple opposing walls like Appletun, Articuno, and Eelektross. Crunch is an extra STAB option that beats Ghost- and Psychic-types like Froslass, Rotom, and Bruxish. Alternatively, Crunch punishes teams that have no grounded Poison-type or entry hazard control. Tera Grass enables Hisuian Qwilfish to set more Spikes against Sandaconda and gives Hisuian Qwilfish a resistance to Volt Switch, allowing it to more easily beat Rotom and Eelektross. Alternatively, Tera Ghost lets it spinblock Cryogonal and Avalugg. 56 Speed EVs allow Hisuian Qwilfish to outspeed maximum Speed Cacturne as well as neutral-nature Abomasnow and Farigiraf; Jolly allows Hisuian Qwilfish to always outspeed the latter two.

Wallbreakers like Tauros and Mesprit benefit from Spikes weakening checks like Sandaconda and Hisuian Qwilfish that are somewhat easy to put in 2HKO range. To maximize the effect of Spikes and keep them up as long as possible, Hisuian Qwilfish appreciates help from Rotom, Cryogonal, and Articuno, which all put pressure onto Defog users like Braviary and Lurantis. Without Terastallizing, Hisuian Qwilfish folds to Sandaconda and other strong physical attackers that can switch into it like Toxicroak, Hisuian Sneasel, and both Tauros formes. To help solve this issue, Pokemon such as your own Sandaconda, Hattrem, and Drifblim can pivot into their attacks and threaten them with paralysis or burn. Hisuian Qwilfish is hindered by losing its Eviolite via Knock Off or Trick; pair it with Pokemon that can afford to lose their item such as Sandaconda, Sableye, and Sticky Hold Muk.

sets.name: Swords Dance
sets.description:
Hisuian Qwilfish is a potent rain sweeper. It has neutral coverage for every foe in NU bar Toxicroak and outspeeds every relevant revenge killer under rain. Even outside of rain, it's still a good option for late-game sweeping because its coverage and Eviolite-boosted bulk give it good leverage against most countermeasures the opponent could have. The major selling point to this set is Liquidation, as it always OHKOes Sandaconda after Hisuian Qwilfish uses Swords Dance and Terastallizes.

If you're using Hisuian Qwilfish on a rain team, pairing it with rain setters like Sableye, Electrode, and Whiscash is a must. Additionally, you'll want Floatzel, which is great at weakening potential checks like Tera Water Sandaconda, Qwilfish, and Avalugg. Golduck is also a staple of NU rain teams and benefits from Hisuian Qwilfish weakening Toxicroak. If you're not using a rain team, simply pair Hisuian Qwilfish with wallbreakers like Medicham, Hisuian Sneasel, and Bruxish. Spikes support from options like Froslass and Cacturne helps too to weaken checks like Terastallized Sandaconda and Toxicroak.

sets.name: Bulky Swords Dance
sets.description: Mega Scizor leverages its great bulk and solid defensive typing to serve as a sturdy check to many Pokemon—including Weavile, Kartana, and Tapu Lele—and a solid wincon as well. U-turn allows it to serve as a pivot: easily switching it out of checks such as Gholdengo, Urshifu-R, and Mega Charizard Y, it brings in teammates like Tapu Koko and Dragapult to deal with them. Close Combat can be used to dispose of Steel-types like Ferrothorn and Heatran much more quickly, greatly denting them on the switch. The given EV spread allows Mega Scizor to survive two Close Combats from Mega Lopunny after Stealth Rock and outspeed uninvested Heatran, with the HP and Special Defense EVs helping it check Tapu Lele. Mega Scizor's pivot support is extremely valuable to Pokemon such as Tapu Koko, Rotom-W, and Zamazenta, which all also appreciate how well it exploits defensive Pokemon such as Clodsire, Ferrothorn, and Landorus-T. Rotom-W forms a strong VoltTurn core with Mega Scizor as well, with both pivoting out on their checks and racking up solid chip damage over time. Nasty Plot Tornadus-T appreciates Mega Scizor pressuring specially defensive walls and offensive Pokemon like Weavile and Clodsire, letting it go all-in as an offensive wallbreaker with ease. Mega Scizor wearing down Rotom-W and Heatran is also particularly useful for Tornadus-T, as these Pokemon can heavily damage or cripple Tornadus-T in one way or another. Mega Scizor being completely countered by Gholdengo mandates a Pursuit trapper like Weavile or Kingambit to pressure it. Skeledirge also hard counters Mega Scizor, encouraging the aforementioned teammates as well as Garganacl and Heatran.

sets.name: Swords Dance + 3 Attacks
sets.description: This set takes on a much more offensive role, using its solid defensive typing for easy entry points against Pokemon like Weavile and Kingambit, setting up, and threatening the vast majority of the metagame with its strong Technician-boosted attacks. Close Combat KOes Steel-types like Heatran and Ferrothorn, as well as providing a strong neutral hit against Rotom-W. Dual Wingbeat hits Clodsire and Toxapex for reliable neutral damage and also hits Zamazenta super effectively, Knock Off is an alternative to hit Gholdengo reliably and remove items like Leftovers from Rotom-W and Heavy-Duty Boots from Tornadus-T, Skeledirge, and Volcarona. This allows a teammate or Mega Scizor to wear them down much more easily. Knock Off is especially relevant in Rotom-W's case, as removing Leftovers makes it easier to put into KO range of +2 Close Combat. Running Knock Off makes Toxapex a much worse matchup, however, so Pokemon like Great Tusk and Tapu Koko that can pressure it are appreciated. Sand Tomb can be used to reliably beat Clodsire, Toxapex, and Gholdengo, preventing them from reliably checking it. Offensive Mega Scizor fits much better on hyper offense teams, which appreciate its incredibly valuable—though short-term—defensive utility. Grimmsnarl is a perfect teammate, providing dual screens to let it set up against foes like Great Tusk, Dragonite, and Landorus-T; it also pivots Mega Scizor in and appreciates it baiting in Gholdengo, which prevents Grimmsnarl from pivoting as effectively. Gholdengo itself is also a notable partner, as it appreciates Mega Scizor dispatching the most popular Dark-types in Weavile and Kingambit. Entry hazards from suicide leads like Landorus-T and Garchomp allow Mega Scizor to clean late-game, as its foes must be chipped before any sweeping is done. Entry hazards particularly help in wearing down checks like Urshifu-R and bulkier Garchomp sets. Mega Scizor struggles against bulky Steel-resistant Pokemon like Rotom-W and Volcarona; Dragonite and Dragapult can take care of the latter, switching into Volcarona to set up as it switches into Mega Scizor, whereas Great Tusk can remove Leftovers from the former, making it easier for Mega Scizor to dispatch with +2 Close Combat. Physically defensive Unaware walls in Skeledirge and Dondozo completely wall Mega Scizor, so offensive Pokemon that can bait in or wear down these foes, including Iron Valiant, make for solid partners.

sets.name: Choice Band
sets.description:
• Scizor is a strong priority user and a solid pivot, since it can force out many foes with its strong Bullet Punch, good coverage options, and strong U-turn.
  • Bullet Punch is Scizor's most valuable tool, as it scores OHKOs on two notable threats in Chien-Pao and Flutter Mane, as well as hitting other foes hard, like Iron Bundle and the plethora of Tera Fairy users.
  • Tera Steel is used to further boost Bullet Punch. Most notably, this allows it to 2HKO Chi-Yu and Koraidon, as well as OHKOing Iron Bundle after Stealth Rock.
  • Close Combat is a crucial coverage move to meaningfully damage Corviknight, and it helps against other foes like Ting-Lu, Iron Treads, and Kingambit too. It 2HKOes or OHKOes all of them.
  • Technician-boosted Thief is used to 2HKO Skeledirge and OHKO offensive Gholdengo.
  • The Speed investment allows Scizor to outspeed common defensive staples like Skeledirge, Corviknight, and the rarer Pelipper, as well as other slow attackers like Kingambit and Iron Hands.
  • Scizor fits well on teams featuring Koraidon and/or Miraidon, as its strong Steel-type priority can back them up against their common checks in Flutter Mane, Iron Bundle, and Chien-Pao. Great Tusk is another great option for the same reason.

sets.name: Choice Band
sets.description:
With a Choice Band, Scizor can efficiently act as a strong offensive pivot and a revenge killer against fast offensive threats. This is achievable with Bullet Punch in tandem with Technician, as it revenge kills Dragonite, Roaring Moon, and Iron Valiant. Bullet Punch can also remove slower threats such as Hatterene and Tera Fairy Kingambit. Close Combat grants Scizor coverage against Pokemon such as Iron Treads, Kingambit, and Garganacl and provides strong neutral coverage against foes like Rotom-W and Corviknight, especially if not running the corresponding coverage move. Thief is a good way for Scizor to deal a good amount of damage against Gholdengo, while Trailblaze can be used to deal with defensive Water-types like Rotom-W lacking Will-O-Wisp and Dondozo. Tera Steel is Scizor's best option for a Tera type, since it not only gives a boost to Scizor's Bullet Punch but also makes Scizor resistant to Stealth Rock. Alternatively, Tera Electric + Tera Blast can be run to hit Flying- and Water-types such as Toxapex, Dondozo, Corviknight, and Tera Flying Kingambit. 20 Speed EVs are run in order for Scizor to outspeed Corviknight.

Offensive teams appreciate Scizor's wallbreaking and revenge killing abilities. Scizor gets easily forced out by Great Tusk as well as Fire-types such as Skeledirge, Cinderace, and Volcarona. Therefore, Water-types such as Rotom-W and Azumarill make for good teammates. Rotom-W in particular synergizes well with Scizor, since the two of them can form a potent VoltTurn core. Azumarill also greatly appreciates Scizor pivoting into it. In return, Scizor can check Grass-types they struggle against like Breloom and Meowscarada. Scizor appreciates teammates that allow it to wallbreak much more easily, so entry hazard support from Pokemon like Garchomp are greatly appreciated. Gholdengo is another good teammate, since it can keep hazards on the field for Scizor to exploit in order to sweep late-game. If Scizor isn't running Thief, it can easily be checked by Gholdengo, so Dark-types like Kingambit pair well with Scizor. However, if Scizor is running Thief, it can struggle against Water-types, so Grass-types like Breloom, Meowscarada, and Tera Grass Volcarona make for good teammates. Scizor's lack of longevity means it can struggle with hazards, so hazard removers like Great Tusk, Cinderace, and Corviknight make for good teammates. Most of Scizor's damage output comes from Bullet Punch, so it dislikes Pokemon like Rotom-W, Corviknight, and Gholdengo switching into it. Thus, Pokemon that can counter them such as Meowscarada for the former, as well as Iron Moth for the latter two make for good teammates. Finally, setup sweepers such as Dragapult, Dragonite, and Roaring Moon appreciate Scizor muscling through walls like Garganacl, Tera Fairy Skeledirge, and Ting-Lu. They also appreciate the defensive utility Scizor brings with its ability to check Baxcalibur, Choice-locked Meowscarada, and Calm Mind Iron Valiant.

sets.name: Utility Pivot
sets.description:
Scizor can function as a utility pivot due to its high Attack, good coverage, and ability to force switches from the likes of Iron Valiant and Baxcalibur. Due to its typing, it can check Dragonite, which is a phenomenal offensive threat in OU. Bullet Punch dents Garganacl and Iron Valiant, as well as being able to revenge kill sweepers such as Roaring Moon, Dragonite, and Baxcalibur. Dragonite's Extreme Speed does very little to Scizor in return, and Scizor can break Multiscale on Dragonite. Close Combat nails Kingambit and deals decent damage to Ting-Lu, and while U-turn 3HKOs Ting-Lu, Close Combat can 2HKO if Stealth Rock is up. Alternatively, Defog improves Scizor's matchups against entry hazard users such as Garganacl, Ting-Lu, and Great Tusk. Thief hits Gholdengo, Skeledirge, and Ceruledge for super effective damage, as well as being Scizor's strongest option against Toxapex. Swords Dance can power up Bullet Punch and U-turn, allowing Scizor to break through Garganacl. Tera Steel powers up Bullet Punch, which is key in OHKOing Iron Valiant and Baxcalibur after Stealth Rock. Heavy-Duty Boots makes pivoting easier by ignoring entry hazards.

Scizor best fits on bulky offense and balance teams, as these appreciate a pivot which can force switches to bring in frail wallbreakers. Iron Valiant and Dragapult appreciate the momentum that Scizor provides, as they are 2HKOed by many common attacks. In return, they can handle physical walls that Scizor has trouble getting past such as Great Tusk and Dondozo. Scizor also appreciates entry hazard support from teammates such as Great Tusk, Garchomp, and Ting-Lu, as Scizor puts pressure on the opposing team with U-turn, forcing more switches and helping rack up more damage with hazards. Scizor also suffers from a lack of recovery, so defensive teammates such as Toxapex are appreciated, as they can help take pressure off of Scizor. Dragapult and Rotom-W form a good pivot core with Scizor, with Scizor luring Skeledirge and Dragapult luring Ting-Lu.

sets.name: Swords Dance
sets.description:
With Swords Dance, Scizor serves as a deadly wallbreaker and revenge killer for offensive teams. Close Combat is crucial to 2HKO defensive Rotom-W and defensive Great Tusk, as well as blow through Steel-types such as Kingambit and Iron Treads. Tera Blast paired with Tera Electric has a good chance to 2HKO Dondozo and can OHKO Toxapex, Alomomola, Corviknight, and offensive Gholdengo after a Swords Dance. Tera Electric also removes Scizor's Fire weakness, improving its matchup against Volcarona and Iron Moth, and grants it crucial resistances to Roaring Moon's Acrobatics and Iron Valiant's Thunderbolt. Alternatively, Quick Attack with Tera Normal gives Scizor a tool to pick off offensive Pokemon that resist Bullet Punch, such as Volcarona, Quaquaval, and Greninja. 180 Speed EVs allow Scizor to outspeed defensive Great Tusk and Rotom-W, while 76 HP EVs improve its bulk enough to survive Tera Flying Acrobatics from Roaring Moon.

Scizor is best utilized on fast, offensive teams that appreciate its ability to wear down common defensive cores and keep opposing sweepers such as Roaring Moon, Baxcalibur, and Booster Energy Iron Valiant in check. Glimmora and Great Tusk can set entry hazards to help chip Pokemon like Garchomp and defensive Gholdengo into range of Scizor's attacks. Grimmsnarl can ease Scizor's sweep by setting up screens and appreciates falling back on Scizor to handle threats such as Iron Valiant. Special attackers like Iron Moth, Gholdengo, Greninja, and Iron Valiant can deal with the physical walls that check Scizor, such as Dondozo, Skeledirge, and Great Tusk. Scizor's ability to lure Dondozo and take it out with Tera Blast makes it an excellent partner for other physical sweepers that struggle with it, such as Dragonite, Kingambit, and Baxcalibur. Conversely, Breloom is an excellent partner for Quick Attack Scizor that handles Dondozo and appreciates Scizor keeping Volcarona, Iron Moth, and Dragapult in check.

sets.name: Swords Dance (Bug)
sets.description:
Thanks to its Steel typing, solid bulk, powerful STAB priority, and decent coverage moves, Scizor answers types such as Fairy, Ice, Rock, Ground, and Water. Swords Dance allows Scizor to OHKO the likes of Dragapult and Cyclizar. Technician-boosted Bullet Punch is Scizor's most spammable attack, serving as a priority STAB move to revenge kill sweepers like Belly Drum Azumarill and Flutter Mane. Close Combat answers Steel teams and threaten slower walls like Ting-Lu and Corviknight. Trailblaze allows Scizor to outspeed threats like Great Tusk and Hydreigon at +1 Speed and hits Quagsire and Gastrodon. Fury Cutter provides an additional Technician-boosted STAB move and is mainly used in tandem with Metronome to break Dondozo. Thief offers coverage and allows Life Orb Scizor to answer Gholdengo and 2HKO Skeledirge thanks to the boost from Technician, though Life Orb isn't recommended outside of these scenarios. Alternatively, Metal Coat enhances the power of Bullet Punch without drawbacks. The EV spread maximizes Scizor's damage output and allows it to outspeed uninvested Rotom forms and Adamant Azumarill.

Volcarona is the perfect partner for Scizor, as it's less threatened by Fire-types and can sweep through most Steel, Psychic, and Ground teams. It takes care of Pokemon such as Gholdengo and Klefki; in return, Scizor handles Rock-types like Glimmora and Lycanroc-D and weakens the opposing team to facilitate Volcarona's late-game sweep. Slither Wing offers great coverage against types that Scizor struggles to beat, threatening Electric- and Rock-types with Earthquake, Flying- and Water-types with Wild Charge, and Steel-types with Flare Blitz or Close Combat. Similar to Scizor, Lokix gets two powerful STAB priority moves in First Impression and Sucker Punch which, paired with Tinted Lens, allow it to OHKO faster threats like Greninja, Gengar, and Kilowattrel after chip damage. These priority moves, along with Masquerain's Sticky Web support, allow Bug teams to compensate for their generally slower Speed tier. Another good partner to Scizor is Guts Heracross, which can sponge status moves targeting its teammates and sweep through teams that have been weakened by Scizor. With its combination of Sleep Powder and Energy Ball, Vivillon can take out threats that give Bug teams trouble, particularly Dondozo. Rabsca and Forretress provide substantial support; Rabsca's Revival Blessing offers Scizor a second chance at breaking down the opponent's team, while Forretress's entry hazard stacking and Rapid Spin combination allows its teammates to switch in more safely and make holes in the opposing team.

sets.name: Choice Band (Bug)
sets.description: These are sample sets before we work on new analyses. These will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
This Pokemon has been updated for Regulation D! If you have any questions or feel it needs more updates, feel free to post here.

For more information on Battle Stadium Singles, visit the format page!

sets.name: Swords Dance
sets.description:
• Scizor's incredible power and good typing make it one of the premier priority sweepers, being able to sweep through huge threats such as Flutter Mane and Chien-Pao!

  • U-turn: While pivoting doesn't gel well with sweeping, it makes this kind of Scizor very adaptable, and is especially effective at getting away from Pokemon that threaten with residual damage, like Wo-Chien and Garganacl.

  • Thief: Thief is Scizor's most reliable way of getting past Gholdengo.

  • Close Combat: Close Combat lets Scizor smash through Chi-Yu and Ting-Lu, and 2HKO Corviknight after a boost.

Other Options

  • Trailblaze: Trailblaze will 2HKO even the bulkiest Rotom-W without a boost and deal good chip damage to Dondozo. The Speed boost also comes in handy considering how crowded Scizor's Speed tier is.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium / Low: Terastallization works very well at shutting down common methods of revenge killing or walling Scizor, but its typing is good enough to function without Terastallization. If using U-turn, Scizor can focus on pivoting in some matches, making Terastallization even less needed.

  • Water: Tera Water lets Scizor ambush Chi-Yu, Iron Bundle, and Heatran with a resistance and is especially handy against Fire-types when using Tera Blast.

  • Steel: Boosting Bullet Punch is Scizor's best ticket for revenge killing and late-game sweeping, and it retains its Flying-type resistance into powerful Tera Flying Choice Band users like Dragonite and Landorus-T.

  • Dark: Tera Dark can cushion Shadow Ball from Gholdengo and Flutter Mane, giving it an extra turn to set up or hit back with Tera-boosted Thief.

  • Electric: Tera Electric is Scizor's best shot of breaking past Toxapex and Urshifu-R with Tera Blast, and it does good chip damage to Dondozo.

Items

  • Sitrus Berry and 244 HP EVs: Sitrus Berry trades late-game sweeping power for new setup opportunities, such as avoiding a 2HKO from Modest Gholdengo that lack Choice Specs and a good chance of avoiding a 2HKO from Timid Rotom-W's Hydro Pump. It also has good synergy with Thief, allowing Scizor to steal important items such as Leftovers from Dondozo. Make sure to run 244 Speed EVs to gain an even HP number, letting Sitrus activate after getting hit by Ruination once.

  • Rocky Helmet: Best used with U-turn, Rocky Helmet transforms this Scizor into a good bulky pivot that has the surprising option to sweep late-game.

  • Life Orb: While Life Orb does compromise Scizor's bulk, it's worth it for being able to OHKO Iron Bundle with a boosted Bullet Punch, and has a good shot of OHKOing physically defensive Ting-Lu with a boosted Close Combat as well.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 28 Atk / 204 Def / 20 SpD / 4 Spe with Adamant: This bulky spread avoids the OHKO from Adamant Tera Ghost Life Orb Mimikyu's +2 Shadow Claw. When used with Sitrus Berry, it also avoids the 2HKO from Modest Gholdengo's Shadow Ball.

  • 236 HP / 228 Atk / 20 Def / 20 SpD / 4 Spe with Adamant: This spread gives Scizor enough bulk to survive Tera Dark Life Orb Chien-Pao's Throat Chop, and less residual damage if using U-turn. It also avoids a 2HKO from Timid Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Moonblast. With Sitrus Berry, Modest Gholdengo's Shadow Ball is also no longer a 2HKO.

  • 228 HP / 124 Atk / 156 SpD with Adamant: This Sitrus Berry optimized spread avoids a 2HKO from Jolly Chien-Pao's Crunch, Iron Bundle's Hydro Pump, and Modest Choice Specs Tera Fairy Flutter Mane's Moonblast.

  • 252 HP / 4 Atk / 252 Def with Impish: This defensive spread is best used with U-turn and Rocky Helmet, making Scizor function more like a bulky pivot that can sweep late-game.

Minor Optimizations

  • Slow U-turn: When running U-turn, Scizor can drop the Speed investment from any spread and run a Speed IV of 27 to underspeed opposing Scizor and the rare Chesnaught.

sets.name: Pivot
sets.description:
• Thanks to its high Attack, great defensive typing and solid bulk, Scizor is an effective bulky pivot that can also punish faster foes with Technician-boosted Bullet Punch, such as Flutter Mane, Chien-Pao, and Baxcalibur.

  • Close Combat: Close Combat is Scizor's best option to hit opposing Chi-Yu as well as Steel types, even when using defensive EV spreads.

  • Thief Thief is a great option for hitting Gholdengo hard thanks to the Technician boost.

Other Options

  • Aerial Ace This is an option over Thief to hit Fighting types like Urshifu-R, Annihilape, and Breloom, but leaves you vulnerable to Gholdengo.

  • Trailblaze: Besides gaining a useful Speed boost, Trailblaze does good damage to Urshifu-R and Rotom-W.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: While Terastallization can be quite helpful in either cleaning teams or preparing against Scizor's classic Fire-type issues, the power of its priority and pivoting don't make it needed for it to function consistently.

  • Steel: Choice Band Scizor is a fairly good user of Terastallization, with Tera Steel boosting Bullet Punch to terrifying levels. Tera Steel also softens Scizor's weakness to Fire, letting it avoid the OHKO from attacks like Flutter Mane's Mystical Fire.

  • Water: Tera Water turns its Fire weakness into a resistance, giving Scizor a fighting chance against dangerous Fire-types such as Heatran and Chi-Yu.

  • Dark: Tera Dark works as a single turn surprise to soften Ghost-type attacks from the likes of Flutter Mane and Gholdengo. The power boost to Thief also helps Scizor take a much bigger chunk out of Gholdengo.

Items

  • Choice Band: Choice Band lets Scizor function as a scary late-game cleaner, especially with Tera Steel-boosted Bullet Punch. The high damage output also helps Scizor to break down walls for its teammates.

  • Assault Vest: While much less immediately threatening than Choice Band, Assault Vest lets Scizor more comfortably switch into stray special attacks like Gholdengo's and Flutter Mane's Shadow Ball or Rotom-W's Volt Switch, improving its longevity.

  • Rocky Helmet: Rocky Helmet is perfect for more defensive Scizor, letting it continually switch into weaker physical attacks and wear down the team with U-turn and residual damage.

EV Spreads

  • 236 HP / 68 Atk / 204 Def with Adamant: This spread avoids a OHKO from Tera Dark Life Orb Chien-Pao, is not 2HKOed by Timid Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Moonblast, and reduces the amount of residual damage Scizor receives thanks to the HP stat being 1 lower than divisible by 16.

  • 236 HP / 68 Atk / 204 Def with Adamant: This bulky spread lets Scizor survive +2 Life Orb Adamant Tera Ghost Mimikyu's Shadow Claw.

  • 252 HP / 92 Atk / 164 SpD with Adamant: This spread is meant to be used with Assault Vest, letting Scizor almost always avoid a 2HKO from Modest Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Shadow Ball. It also maintains enough Attack investment to always OHKO uninvested Chien-Pao after Stealth Rock chip.

  • 252 HP / 4 Atk / 252 Def with Impish: Defensive Scizor might seem strange, but when paired with Rocky Helmet, it becomes an effective pivot that can survive extreme attacks: it avoids the OHKO from Choice Band Tera Dark Chien-Pao's Crunch as well as the 2HKO from Adamant Landorus-T's Earthquake. Just note that this will make Scizor focus more on pivoting than revenge killing with Bullet Punch.

Minor Optimizations

  • Slow U-turn: Scizor already has a very slow U-turn, but Scizor can drop the Speed investment from any spread and run a Speed IV of 27 to underspeed opposing Scizor and the rare Chesnaught.

sets.name: Offensive Swords Dance (Steel)
sets.description: Mega Scizor makes for a strong wallbreaker and sweeper on Steel teams thanks to its access to Swords Dance, high Attack stat, and well-rounded bulk. Bullet Punch is Mega Scizor's strongest STAB move, and its priority allows it to revenge kill faster threats such as Mega Diancie, Iron Valiant, and Mega Lopunny. Close Combat is Mega Scizor's strongest coverage move, enabling it to more easily beat Corviknight, Ting-Lu, and Heatran. After a Swords Dance boost, Mega Scizor becomes strong enough to 2HKO Celesteela, opposing Mega Scizor, and physically defensive Gastrodon. Knock Off removes essential items such as Heavy-Duty Boots from Tornadus-T and Black Sludge from Toxapex, and it also provides Mega Scizor with strong coverage against Aegislash, Skeledirge, and Gholdengo. Alternatively, Trailblaze can also be used to 2HKO bulky Water- or Ground-type Pokemon most other Steel-types struggle with such as Mega Swampert and Gastrodon, as well as potentially OHKO Azumarill and Rotom-W after a Swords Dance boost and Stealth Rock damage. 132 Speed EVs are invested in order for Mega Scizor to outspeed Jolly Azumarill as well as Hydreigon and Urshifu-S after a Trailblaze. Heatran and Ferrothorn are great teammates because they are able to set entry hazards to wear down incoming foes, and Heatran also has the added benefit of providing a Fire immunity thanks to its ability. Ferrothorn can also provide passive healing for Mega Scizor via the use of Leech Seed. In return, Mega Scizor is able to threaten faster Fighting-types such as Sneasler and Iron Valiant with Bullet Punch. Gholdengo is able to threaten Toxapex and Tapu Lele, and it along with Aegislash can also hinder foes with Toxic and Thunder Wave respectively if they are running defensive sets, easing set up for Mega Scizor. In return, Mega Scizor can remove Dark-types such as Meowscarada, Ting-Lu, and Galarian Moltres. Specially defensive Celesteela is an excellent special wall that can wall Choice Specs Tapu Lele and Mega Altaria, while also being able to spread status and use Leech Seed to aid Mega Scizor in its sweeping. As Mega Scizor is more vulnerable to hazards compared to other Steel-types, it appreciates hazard removal from the likes of Corviknight, Excadrill, and Iron Treads. Excadrill and Iron Treads also have the added merit of handling Fire-types like Victini and Ogerpon-H. Excadrill can also bypass Mega Sableye's Magic Bounce and inflict poison on it thanks to Mold Breaker, while Iron Treads can threaten both Landorus formes with Ice Spinner.

ru.overview: The tier is still in its infancy and the metagame develops with each passing day. The sample set(s) provided below will be regularly updated until proper analyses are in the works. See it as a rough outline to get started and accustomed to what sets are commonly used.

sets.name: Choice Item
sets.description:
Hisuian Sneasel is one of NU's premier revenge killers, regardless of the item it holds. Choice Scarf sets are wonderful because they reliably beat Calm Mind Jolteon, a feat most other Choice Scarf users fail to do because they're specially offensive. On the flipside, Choice Band sets retain great revenge killing potential because Hisuian Sneasel is so naturally fast, and they're very effective wallbreakers to boot thanks to their solid coverage. For the Pokemon Hisuian Sneasel can't consistently defeat like Tera Ghost Sandaconda, Qwilfish, and Sableye, Switcheroo provides a good means of limiting their defensive capabilities. Picking its Tera type is fairly arbitrary, though Tera Fighting lets Choice Band Hisuian Sneasel 2HKO Sandaconda with Close Combat and Choice Scarf Hisuian Sneasel 2HKO Toxicroak after Stealth Rock; alternatively, Tera Dark provides defensive utility against Mesprit, ensures Night Slash OHKOes Rotom after Stealth Rock, and denies Sableye's Prankster Will-O-Wisp.

Despite Choice Scarf and Choice Band Hisuian Sneasel being somewhat different in function, their teammates are pretty similar. Both benefit from teammates like Clawitzer, Rotom, and Mesprit that can take advantage of Sandaconda so they feel less inclined to Terastallize and deal with it themselves. Where they differ is that Choice Scarf Sneasel is far more suited as a late-game cleaner and, as a result, is more reliant on wallbreakers like Guts Ursaring, Magneton, and offensive Appletun to weaken its checks. On the other hand, Choice Band Sneasel prioritizes its role as a wallbreaker and supports late-game sweepers like Dudunsparce and Trailblaze Scyther.

sets.name: Swords Dance
sets.description:
Hisuian Sneasel is one of NU's most dangerous setup sweepers; with Swords Dance and Trailblaze, very little can stop it if it obtains both boosts. Even some of its sturdiest checks in Sandaconda, Qwilfish, and Tera Poison Appletun can struggle to keep up, and offensive answers like Choice Scarf Mesprit and Rotom become unreliable because they're slower after a single Trailblaze. Tera Grass is fantastic for turning non-Glare Sandaconda into setup fodder and giving Trailblaze the extra power needed to beat Rotom, but Tera Dark enables Hisuian Sneasel to run Night Slash, giving it a better matchup against Ghost-types in Eviolite Haunter, Drifblim, Sableye, and Terastallized Sandaconda while also making it harder for Choice Scarf Mesprit to revenge kill it.

Hisuian Sneasel's Eviolite-boosted bulk, although not stellar, is enough to let it set up on resisted attacks. So, pairing it with pivots like Bombirdier, Rotom, and Braviary that can bring it in against foes like non-Thunder Wave Qwilfish, Muk, and non-Glare Sandaconda if you're using Tera Grass is recommended. Keep in mind, though, that the Sandaconda matchup can be difficult with Terastallization available to your opponent; teammates like Tera Ice Jolteon, Swords Dance Scyther, and Guts Ursaring that can force it to take damage or Terastallize early-game make it far less threatening.

nu.overview: Ursaring is an amazing wallbreaker in NU. Eviolite + Bulk Up Ursaring makes for a fantastic sweeper, while Flame Orb sets make great use of Trailblaze, which makes Ursaring more difficult to revenge kill, and makes for a great status absorber for its teammates. However, Bulk Up Ursaring only has room for one attack, leaving it lacking in coverage, and Flame Orb Ursaring's poor defenses and Speed leave it subject to easy revenge killing.
nu.comments:
Other Options

Ursaring can use Toxic Orb to benefit from Quick Feet, but this set often falls short in both Speed and power. Bulk Up Ursaring can forgo Sleep Talk in favor of another coverage move, but this leaves it quite vulnerable after Rest. Crunch can be used over Play Rough for overall better coverage, but Tera Fairy's defensive attributes and STAB Play Rough are better in most situations. Ursaring can drop a setup move altogether on the RestTalk set, making for a great special tank with a little extra coverage, typically using Body Slam for STAB and Play Rough or Crunch to hit Ghost-types.

Checks and Counters

Anti-setup Pokemon: Bulk Up Ursaring is quite hard to get going against common anti-setup Pokemon like Haze Vaporeon, Strength Sap Drifblim, and Trick Rotom. Tera Fairy at least allows Ursaring an immunity to Dragon Tail, but there are plenty of Encore, Haze, and similar utility move users available that can make it difficult for Ursaring to sweep.

Fighting-types and Coverage: NU is teeming with Fighting-types ready to punch Ursaring in the face; Medicham, Toxicroak, Passimian, and Paldean Tauros pressure Ursaring to switch out or Terastallize for fear of being KOed. Pokemon with Fighting-type coverage like Scyther and Eelektross can chunk Ursaring enough to force it to use Rest before it can accumulate enough boosts to be a threat.

sets.name: Bulk Up
sets.description:
Set Details

Ursaring only gets to pick one offensive move, so Play Rough is preferred for its great offensive coverage and lack of immunities, but Body Slam has more immediate damage and can spread paralysis. With Tera Fairy, Ursaring inverts its weakness to Fighting and gains STAB on Play Rough. Tera Ghost takes subverting its weakness to the extreme, turning the tables on the many Fighting-types in the tier. 88 Speed EVs outspeed Vaporeon and Umbreon, which hamper Ursaring with Haze or Foul Play. The remaining EVs are put into Special Defense to allow Ursaring to wall special attackers while boosting Defense with Bulk Up.

Although its bulk often prevents it from being outright overpowered, Ursaring's setup attempts can be thwarted by utility Pokemon such as Haze Muk and Vaporeon and Encore Cacturne and Zoroark. Wallbreakers like Medicham and Zoroark and entry hazard setters like Qwilfish and Sandaconda assist in breaking through and wearing them down. Knock Off users like Bombirdier, Klawf, and Passimian can leave Eviolite Ursaring vulnerable to following attacks. Knock Off absorbers like Sandaconda and Umbreon make for great teammates. Because it lacks Heavy-Duty Boots or Leftovers to offset hazard damage, Ursaring appreciates hazard control from the likes of Drifblim and Lurantis. Pokemon vulnerable to status infliction like Toxicroak and Vaporeon appreciate the fact that Ursaring punishes the use of status moves like Will-O-Wisp from Drifblim and Glare from Sandaconda.

sets.name: Trailblaze Sweeper
sets.description:
Set Details

Trailblaze lets Ursaring take advantage of passive Pokemon like Chansey and Vaporeon to outspeed faster threats like Scyther and Zoroark after one use and Choice Scarf Passimian after two. Guts Facade easily 2HKOes physically bulky Pokemon like Sandaconda and Dudunsparce. Tera Ghost allows Ursaring to effectively bait Fighting-type moves and boosts Shadow Claw, which can be used to hit Ghost-types like Drifblim and Rotom. Swords Dance allows Ursaring to muscle past setup sweepers like Coil Sandaconda, Eelektross, and Curse Muk while also giving Facade enough power to defeat Steel-types like Perrserker and Tera Steel Eelektross. Alternatively, Close Combat immediately threatens Steel-types like Perrserker and Tera Steel users like Appletun and Eelektross. Tera Fighting and Tera Grass are alternative options used to boost Ursaring's other moves. Tera Grass notably improves Ursaring's matchup against physically bulky Pokemon like Sandaconda and Vaporeon.

Slow pivots like Eelektross and Perrserker help Ursaring enter the battlefield safely, mitigating its frailty and burn-induced timer. Healing Wish from Chansey or Indeedee-F can allow Ursaring another opportunity to shred through the opposition. Oricorio-F and Drifblim can ease the matchup against Fighting-types and use Defog to ensure Ursaring takes minimal damage when hitting the field, and Oricorio-F also has U-turn to bring in Ursaring more often.

sets.name: Specially Defensive Wall (Ice)
sets.description: Piloswine is one of Ice teams' best specially defensive walls, capable of filling some of Ice teams' biggest roles of being an entry hazard setter and Electric immunity. Thick Fat coupled with Eviolite gives Piloswine tremendous bulk, with which it can check dangerous Fire-type threats to Ice such as Volcarona and Mega Charizard Y by disposing of them with Rock Slide. 12 EVs in Attack guarantees an OHKO on offensive Volcarona. Another one of Piloswine's amazing traits is its Ground typing, which makes it a great asset in the Electric matchup by preventing a Volt Switch onslaught while also letting it hit Electric-types super effectively with STAB Earthquake. Toxic is an option to put defensive switch-ins such as Skeledirge and Rotom-W on a timer, helping Piloswine's teammates overpower them, but Roar is an alternative choice to force out threats that may use it to set up, such as Mega Scizor, and to rack up hazard damage from its Stealth Rock and Cloyster's Spikes to wear down threats such as Urshifu-R and Mega Venusaur. Piloswine appreciates Alolan Ninetales's snow and Aurora Veil, which let it wall the opposition more easily. Piloswine is, however, extremely vulnerable to Water-types, so partnering it with Kyurem or Arctozolt is appreciated, as they can easily break Water teams. Substitute Baxcalibur also threatens Poison teams, which can cripple Piloswine with Toxic. Weavile with a Z-Crystal is also a good Knock Off absorber for Piloswine, as losing Eviolite ruins Piloswine; Weavile also forces immense progress by removing key items from Celesteela and Skeledirge, which become susceptible to Stealth Rock afterwards, or outright breaking through them with a Z-Move. Galarian Darmanitan and Shell Smash Cloyster can threaten Steel teams with Flare Blitz and Hydro Pump or Hidden Power Fire, respectively. The Stealth Rocks and Toxic spread by Piloswine also accentuates the breaking power of teammates such as Swords Dance or Dragon Dance Baxcalibur and Belly Drum Cetitan. IronPress Avalugg and defensive Cloyster with Hidden Power Fire are also good partners in being able to shut down Mega Scizor. Avalugg, Articuno, and Cloyster are also capable of removing entry hazards, with the latter two also being able to pivot in Piloswine with U-turn and Teleport, respectively.

sets.name: Nasty Plot
sets.description:
Thanks to its strong offensive typing, access to setup moves, and useful coverage, Houndoom establishes itself as a high level offensive threat in the PU metagame. Fire Blast allows Houndoom to have some extra power and can be especially useful in situations where boosting with Nasty Plot is not possible. It also helps Houndoom to muscle through targets that either are extremely bulky or naturally resist Dark Pulse, such as Tinkatuff. Alternatively, Flamethrower provides a less powerful but more consistent Fire-type STAB attack and eliminates the risk of a missed Fire Blast prematurely ending Houndoom's sweep. Sludge Bomb gives Houndoom a strong special coverage move able to hit certain targets for neutral or super effective damage that would otherwise wall Houndoom handily, such as Carbink, Dachsbun, and opposing Houndoom.
