sets.name: Extreme Speed
sets.description: • This set does not have a full write-up yet. If you'd like to finish this, feel free to reserve it here!

sets.name: Special Attacker
sets.description: • This set does not have a full write-up yet. If you'd like to finish this, feel free to reserve it here!

sets.name: Magic Guard
sets.description: Lucario is a devastating mixed wallbreaker, capable of tearing apart most defensive cores with ease thanks to its strong STAB moves and great mixed attacking stats. Close Combat and Steel Beam have excellent neutral coverage together and hit common walls like Hisuian Goodra and Scream Tail on their weaker defensive stat. Focus Blast 2HKOes standard Corviknight, while Aura Sphere provides a more consistent special attack. In the final moveslot, Nasty Plot allows Lucario to overwhelm slower teams, while Stone Edge provides coverage for Skeledirge and Zapdos. Bullet Punch is also an option that can turn the tables on would-be revenge killers such as Chien-Pao and Meowscarada after some chip damage. Naive is the recommended nature due to its ability to always outspeed Quaquaval and at worst Speed tie with Hisuian Arcanine. Lucario is best used as a mid-game wallbreaker that can pave the way for sweepers like Zamazenta-C and Hisuian Electrode by breaking through Pokemon like Corviknight and Garchomp. Lucario also heavily benefits from slow pivots like Meloetta, Corviknight, and Landorus-T; in return, they switch into Pokemon that threaten Lucario out, like Zapdos, Iron Treads, and Cinderace. While Lucario has limited switch-ins, the ones it does have, like Toxapex and Skeledirge, are very effective without using niche coverage options, so partners that can threaten them, like Zapdos and Quaquaval, are recommended; they can also bring Lucario in on their checks, like Goodra and Corviknight, with U-turn.

sets.name: Stealth Rock
sets.description:
Hippowdon makes for a great mixed wall by virtue of its bulk, typing, and access to reliable recovery. Its superb bulk enables it to check some of the metagame’s most dangerous threats in Pawmot, Salamence, Tyranitar, and Sandy Shocks. It also provides value through Sand Stream to help combat rain teams if given momentum to get in freely, as it can't hard switch into Water-types. Stone Edge enables Hippowdon to pressure Flying-types like Iron Jugulis and Salamence, in addition to being able to beat Taunt Dragon Dance Tyranitar even after it Terastallizes. Roar is also an option, as it allows Hippowdon to phaze setup sweepers like Polteageist in a pinch and synergizes well with entry hazards. Leftovers is the preferred item, as its residual healing improves Hippowdon's overall longevity and preserves Slack Off's PP. The given spread with an Impish nature and Leftovers avoids a 2HKO from Life Orb Pawmot and prevents Hippowdon from being KOed by Hurricane into Draco Meteor from Salamence after Stealth Rock while avoiding a 2HKO from Sandy Shocks without Stealth Rock. Rocky Helmet is also an option to punish physical attackers, primarily U-turn users and Maushold. A specially defensive spread is an option to handle Gengar if Pawmot is less of a concern. Tera Rock pairs well with its sand, as the Special Defense boost it receives gives it a strong matchup versus special attackers like Gengar, Salamence, and Noivern. Additionally, Tera Rock boosts Hippowdon’s Stone Edge to put more pressure on targets like Salamence. After Hippowdon has Terastallized, it is threatened by Pawmot, Sandy Shocks, and Tyranitar, so be careful when Terastallizing. Tera Ghost is an option that makes Hippowdon a strong response versus Slither Wing, Lucario, and Maushold and lets it spinblock against Donphan. Tera Fairy is an option that grants Hippowdon a generally good defensive typing, including a Fighting resistance, and makes it less vulnerable to Greninja. After becoming a Fairy- or a Ghost-type, Hippowdon is unable to check Gengar, and in the case of the latter, Tyranitar sets running Crunch as well. Tera Dragon makes Hippowdon an effective answer to rain teams through the useful Water-type resistance it provides.

Hippowdon most commonly fits on bulky offense or balance teams for its walling capabilities. Talonflame and Noivern make for good partners, as they are capable of grabbing momentum with U-turn off of opposing Decidueye and Wo-Chien swapping in to exploit Hippowdon. Hippowdon can in return easily absorb Knock Off from the likes of Tinkaton in order to preserve the Heavy-Duty Boots they both depend on. Wo-Chien is also a solid pick for a partner as a nice fit on most balance teams, as well as an answer to bulky Water-types that may attempt to annoy Hippowdon. In particular, Wo-Chien’s RestTalk set is capable of swapping in on Quagsire easily, as it is able to shrug off Toxic. Wo-Chien can also relieve pressure from Hippowdon, as it can take on Sandy Shocks. Tinkaton also makes for a good partner, as it is able to take a lot of the pressure off of Hippowdon by taking hits from Gengar and specially offensive Flying-types such as Iron Jugulis, Noivern, and Salamence. Tinkaton is also capable of providing useful Knock Off support by removing opposing Leftovers and Heavy-Duty Boots to enable Hippowdon’s Stealth Rock and sandstorm damage to stick. In return, Hippowdon being able to carry Stealth Rock means that Tinkaton does not need to run it itself and can fit a more useful option. Assault Vest Cyclizar is able to check Greninja and Wo-Chien for Hippowdon and keep Spikes or Toxic Spikes off the field from the former.

sets.name: Physically Defensive
sets.description: Hippowdon is an uncommon defensive Pokemon that checks Pokemon like Koraidon, Great Tusk, and Kingambit thanks to its impressive bulk and Sand Stream. While it can set Stealth Rock, it struggles to do so reliably because of its inability to pressure Corviknight and Great Tusk. Whirlwind phazes foes that attempt to set up in front of Hippowdon, such as Swords Dance Koraidon, Bulk Up Great Tusk, and Swords Dance Tera Flying Kingambit, while also potentially deterring setup attempts by attackers that could expect to force it out, like Miraidon and Chien-Pao. Tera Fairy resists Koraidon's Fighting-type STAB moves and is immune to Koraidon's Outrage and Miraidon's Draco Meteor. Alternatively, Tera Water provides a resistance to attacks such as Koraidon's Flare Blitz, Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash and Ice Spinner, and Palafin's Wave Crash. Hippowdon benefits from being paired with Pokemon able to take on Chien-Pao for it, such as Toxapex and Garganacl, with the former also being able to absorb Toxic Spikes for Hippowdon and the latter benefitting from a Special Defense boost from sand. Special walls such as Clodsire, specially defensive Corviknight, and Blissey are essential to take on dangerous special attackers like Miraidon, Iron Bundle, Flutter Mane, and Walking Wake for Hippowdon. Teammates able to set entry hazards are also appreciated to allow chip damage to quickly rack up when paired with sand, Rocky Helmet, and Whirlwind. Between Earthquake and Whirlwind, Hippowdon is unable to touch Air Balloon Gholdengo, so counterplay to it, such as Ruination Ting-Lu and Kingambit, is recommended. Offensive Houndstone is a very niche potential partner that notably benefits from being paired with Hippowdon thanks to Sand Rush, which somewhat offsets the issue of its low Speed, potentially allowing a boosted Last Respects to clean up an opponent's team.

sets.name: Physically Defensive
sets.description:
• Hippowdon's ability to remove sun makes it a good check to Koraidon. However, Hippowdon's low Special Defense means it's threatened by most common special attackers such as Iron Bundle, Miraidon, and Flutter Mane; it's also very passive, meaning common sweepers like Annihilape can take advantage of it.
  • Whirlwind phazes Pokemon to rack up entry hazard damage; it also phazes boosted Pokemon like Koraidon and Dragonite. Heavy Slam can be used instead to OHKO Flutter Mane and break Gholdengo's Air Balloon.
  • Tera Water lets Hippowdon check Choice Band Palafin, Floatzel, and Koraidon; it also provides a resistance to Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash.
  • Hippowdon's high Defense lets it switch into common physical attackers such as Dragonite, Koraidon, and Great Tusk and punish their attacks with Rocky Helmet; after living a hit, it can then phaze them with Whirlwind or heal itself with Slack Off.
  • Houndstone is Hippowdon's best teammate, as it greatly appreciates sand doubling its Speed. Garganacl and Toxapex are fantastic partners as well; Garganacl gets a Special Defense boost in sand and is also immune to the status that annoys Hippowdon, while Toxapex deals with Pokemon like Chien-Pao.
  • Strong specially defensive walls, such as Blissey and Scream Tail, are also needed. Hippowdon checks Koraidon and Kingambit in return.

sets.name: Bulky Utility
sets.description:
• The given EV spread and nature retains enough Attack for Hippowdon to OHKO Chi-Yu with Stomping Tantrum before investing remaining EVs in HP and Special Defense.

This is a sample set as we work on proper analyses. Stay tuned!

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
With Paradox Pokemon being introduced, Series 2 is bringing big changes to Battle Stadium Singles! This is a modified Series 1 analysis that takes Paradox Pokemon into account. We will update this overview and analysis again once the metagame settles more. For more information on Series 2, check out the resource thread.

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

sets.name: Stealth Rock Support
sets.description:
• Few Pokemon are more reliable at setting up Stealth Rock and phazing than Hippowdon.

  • Whirlwind: This is a more direct phazing option than Yawn, and it is helpful against dangerous setup sweepers that may run Lum Berry, such as Dragonite and Garchomp.

  • Slack Off: Slack Off may seem like an obvious choice to make a defensive Pokemon last longer, but Hippowdon is often more focused on support than walling, so Slack Off doesn't fit every team.

  • Rock Tomb: Rock Tomb not only provides helpful speed control, but also pops Air Balloon on foes Hippowdon would otherwise struggle with, such as Gholdengo.

Other Options

  • Fissure: Hippowdon isn't quite as good at using Fissure as Dondozo and Garganacl, and it can be difficult to fit in, but it does severely punish passive play.

Tera Types

  • Grass: Hippowdon doesn't Terastallize often, but a Grass Tera type does help it against Breloom, Brute Bonnet, and Water-types such as Rotom-W.

  • Steel: Tera Steel allows specially defensive Hippowdon to avoid a 2HKO from Iron Bundle that lack Choice Specs.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 4 Def / 252 SpD with Careful: Patching up Hippowdon's weaker Special Defense is quite useful against special attackers, such as having a 6.3% chance of surviving Gholdengo's +2 Make It Rain, and Choice Specs Hydreigon no longer being able to 2HKO Sitrus Berry Hippowdon.

  • 252 HP / 252 Def / 4 SpD with Impish: A physically defensive spread means not even Choice Band Tera Dragon Dragapult will be able to 2HKO Sitrus Berry Hippowdon.

sets.name: Fluffy
sets.description: Fluffy Hippowdon is a remarkable physical wall thanks to its defensive stats, reliable recovery in Slack Off, and pure Ground typing, letting it check offensive threats like Ceruledge, Kingambit, and Slither Wing. Whirlwind prevents foes like Talonflame from setting up. Rocky Helmet punishes the physical attackers it checks and lets it pseudo-spinblock Cyclizar and Iron Treads; alternatively, Leftovers gives it extra recovery without having to waste Slack Off PP. 25 Speed IVs let it underspeed Corviknight, allowing it to punish its Roost with Earthquake. Specially defensive walls like Corviknight, Florges, and Blissey can compensate for Hippowdon's poor Special Defense and check foes like Chi-Yu and Greninja. In return, they appreciate Hippowdon dealing with Ceruledge, Kingambit, and Slither Wing.

sets.name: Defensive
sets.description: Hippowdon is a bulky Ground-type wall and Stealth Rock setter able to switch into threatening offensive Pokemon such as Choice Scarf Tapu Lele, Iron Valiant, Tapu Koko, and Mega Charizard Y. It can find plenty of time to set up Stealth Rock and spread chip damage with Toxic and its ability Sand Stream. Sand Stream also allows Hippowdon to disrupt opposing weather, which is bolstered by its positive matchup against every other weather setter. Toxic notably nets a ton of chip damage on Defoggers attempting to get rid of Hippowdon's Stealth Rock and Ground-Immune Pokemon switching into Earthquake, such as Rotom-W, Tornadus-T, and Mega Charizard Y. Hippowdon can Terastallize into the Steel typing to avoid Toxic in addition to Grass-, Water-, and Ice-type attacks while maintaining its sand immunity and Stealth Rock resistance. Even beyond the simple type matchup chart changes, it allows Hippowdon to more easily check its targets such as Tornadus-T, Tapu Lele, Zapdos, and Mega Diancie. Maximum Special Defense EVs are ran due to Hippowdon having more valuable special targets than physical, namely the aforementioned Pokemon. Mega Lopunny and Tornadus-T appreciate Hippowdon's presence, as it checks both Choice Scarf Tapu Lele and Zapdos while setting up Stealth Rock to help wear down their checks. Defensively, Hippowdon supports Pokemon such as Garganacl and Skarmory; Garganacl appreciates the sand and its attached benefits and Skarmory appreciates the sturdy Ground-type anchor and special wall. Hippowdon struggles to fend off strong physical attackers like Kingambit, Mega Scizor, Kartana, and Mega Gyarados. For this reason, it pairs exquisitely with strong physical walls such as Skarmory and Buzzwole. Hippowdon also suffers from a Spikes vulnerability, meaning it appreciates Defog support from Pokemon like Tornadus-T and Zapdos.

ru.overview: The tier is still in its infancy and the metagame develops with each passing day. The sample set(s) provided below will be regularly updated until proper analyses are in the works. See it as a rough outline to get started and accustomed to what sets are commonly used.

sets.name: Swords Dance
sets.description: +2 Tera Poison Gunk Shot OHKOes Slowbro.

sets.name: Swords Dance
sets.description: Toxicroak stands out as a very potent late-game sweeper thanks to Swords Dance and Dry Skin, which allow it to switch in and set up on common Water-types like Vaporeon and Qwilfish. Its access to Sucker Punch allows it to revenge kill threats like Choice Scarf Medicham, Bruxish, and Rotom, though it has to be aware of the former two's Tera types and the latter's Will-O-Wisp. Tera Dark gives it a useful Psychic immunity to better the odds versus opposing Bruxish while increasing the power of Sucker Punch. Alternatively, Tera Fighting Toxicroak is able to OHKO Sandaconda, which usually checks it, after a Swords Dance. Toxicroak struggles against the aforementioned Drifblim and Rotom and, without Tera Fighting, Sandaconda. Teammates such as Vaporeon, Eelektross, and Rotom can switch in on its checks and bring it into battle safely. Pokemon that appreciate Toxicroak's presence include Oricorio, Clawitzer, and Bruxish, as they struggle against bulky Pokemon that lose to Toxicroak like Vaporeon, Umbreon, and Chansey.

sets.name: Nasty Plot
sets.description:
Thanks to its access to Nasty Plot, Toxicroak can threaten Pokemon like Sandaconda and Drifblim that beat physical variations of it. Dark Pulse enables it to get around Pokemon that resist its STAB combination, including Ghost-types like Drifblim, Rotom, and Spiritomb as well as Poison-types like Muk and Qwilfish. Alternatively, Vacuum Wave is a solid STAB move with priority to help it revenge kill faster threats like Zoroark, Lycanroc, and Tera Ice Jolteon. Tera Fighting heavily increases Focus Blast's already high damage output, allowing Toxicroak to rip through bulkier teams. Tera Fighting Toxicroak can run a Modest nature to give it a favorable chance to 2HKO Muk at +2 with Focus Blast; however, it becomes noticeably slower, getting outpaced by Mabosstiff, Bombirdier, and Braviary. Tera Dark Toxicroak better checks Bruxish while also boosting Dark Pulse's power.

Without the use of its Tera type, Toxicroak struggles against bulkier teams that often include Muk or Crocalor, so Pokemon that put pressure on them like Sandaconda and Bruxish pair well with it. Bruxish, as well as other Water-types like Clawitzer, appreciate Toxicroak checking bulky Water-types like Vaporeon and Qwilfish. Toxicroak often relies on Spikes from users such as Qwilfish, Vespiquen, and Cacturne to chip away at foes that it can't handle on its own. Since Toxicroak can lure in and remove Ghost-types like Rotom and Drifblim, Pokemon like Scyther and Coil Eelektross appreciate its support.

sets.name: Choice Scarf
sets.description:
Toxicroak differentiates itself from other Choice Scarf users, such as Passimian, by virtue of its defensive utility, being immune to Water-type attacks and absorbing Toxic Spikes. It also doesn't Speed tie with other common Choice Scarf attackers, namely Passimian and Medicham. Close Combat and Gunk Shot can sweep through even remotely weakened teams, especially with a Tera-Fighting Close Combat. Gunk Shot hits Fairy-types that resist Close Combat such as Dachsbun, Florges, and Tera Fairy Drifblim. Earthquake threatens Poison-types such as Muk and Qwilifish. Rock Slide hits Pokemon such as Drifblim and Vespiquen, which may otherwise be troublesome for Toxicroak to deal with. Despite its low-Base Power, Ice Punch is a relatively safe midground option that lacks the type immunities Toxicroak's other moves have while hitting common checks like Sandaconda, Drifblim, and Scyther for decent damage.

Toxicroak struggles with Pokemon that are not threatened by its STAB combination, such as Rotom, Drifblim, and other physical walls such as Sandaconda. Powerful special attackers like Eelektross, Zoroark, and Pyroar can alleviate this issue.

sets.name: Swords Dance (Fighting)
sets.description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

sets.name: Defensive Pivot
sets.description:
Lumineon's combination of an excellent defensive typing, handy utility options with U-turn and Encore, good Speed tier for a pivot, and nifty ability to check special attackers such as Pyroar and Spiritomb allows it to become a decent pivot. Ice Beam is valuable coverage, hitting foes such as Gabite and Dartrix for super effective damage. U-turn allows Lumineon to tank a hit for teammates to get them in safely. This pairs well with Encore impairing Pokemon such as Whiscash or Masquerain attempting to set up entry hazards or boost their stats. Storm Drain allows Lumineon to blanket check some Water-type attackers such as Choice-locked Basculin and Golduck. Tera Grass is normally preferred, giving Lumineon a resistance to Grass- and Electric-type attacks that it would otherwise fear from Pokemon such as Gogoat and Raichu. Alternatively, Tera Dragon can give the same resistances as well as an added resistance to Fire-type attacks in exchange for a resistance to Ground-type attacks. Tera Ghost is an option to wall Quaxwell and check offensive Normal-types such as Zangoose and Pyroar better. Lumineon normally uses a specially defensive EV spread with a Calm nature to take on threats such as Pyroar, Houndoom, and Alolan Persian well, but a more physically defensive EV spread of 252 HP / 252 Def / 4 SpD with a Bold nature allows Lumineon to take on physically offensive foes such as Dragon Dance Charizard, Basculin, and Perrserker better.

Lumineon's best partners are ones that appreciate having a pivot to tank hits for them and allow them in safely as well as ones that enjoy Lumineon's ability to tank Water-type attacks. Setup sweepers such as Nasty Plot Haunter, Gogoat, and Quiver Dance Masquerain enjoy Lumineon's ability to help them come in safely to set up and sweep. Fire-types like Charizard and Pyroar form a strong core with Lumineon, with Lumineon absorbing the Water-type attacks from Pokemon such as Basculin they fear, and in return they break Grass-type threats like Gogoat and Sawsbuck that Lumineon would struggle against. Other Pokemon with pivoting moves such as Alolan Persian, Perrserker, and Electrode can form a VoltTurn core with Lumineon, with Alolan Persian in particular completing a powerful defensive core with by tanking physical hits Lumineon can normally struggle with. Ground-types like Alolan Dugtrio and Gabite can be useful switch-ins to Electric-types like Raichu, allowing Lumineon to be a more powerful pivot.

ru.overview: The tier is still in its infancy and the metagame develops with each passing day. The sample set(s) provided below will be regularly updated until proper analyses are in the works. See it as a rough outline to get started and accustomed to what sets are commonly used.

sets.name: Snow Setter
sets.description: 88 Speed EVs are to outrun maximum Speed invested Choice Specs Arboliva and defensive Pokemon such as Alomomola.

sets.name: Special Attacker
sets.description:
Abomasnow is an amazing bulky wallbreaker thanks to its nearly unresisted STAB moves, coverage, and Aurora Veil alongside Snow boosting its defenses. Giga Drain is used for longevity, but Leaf Storm in tandem with Eject Pack works well to pivot and bring in a setup sweeper that can take advantage of its Aurora Veil. Earth Power takes care of Steel-types that can easily switch into Abomasnow safely like Magneton and Tera Steel Appletun. Ice Shard can be used to finish off Pokemon like Scyther and Mesprit, but it can be a wasted moveslot at times because you give up coverage or Aurora Veil. Leech Seed can be used to trade hits more easily with Blissey, which walls Abomasnow otherwise. A Timid nature is key to outspeed Modest Magneton and neutral-nature Samurott. A Choice Specs set can be run, but being locked into one move can be somewhat detrimental due to its Stealth Rock weakness and loss of bulk. Tera Ground helps with boosting Earth Power damage output and gives Abomasnow an Electric immunity for Magneton and Rotom, which use it to gain momentum otherwise.

Great partners for Abomasnow are ones that can take care of its Fighting- and Flying-type weaknesses like Scyther, Qwilfish, and Rotom. Hattrem and Drifblim are also exceptional partners that, along with tanking Fighting-type attacks, deny entry hazards for non-Heavy-Duty Boots Abomasnow's longevity. Swords Dance Bruxish and Nasty Plot Mesprit are two good offensive partners that can take advantage of Abomasnow's Aurora Veil once Abomasnow takes care of their checks in Cacturne and Magneton. Tauros and Alolan Raichu also appreciate Abomasnow taking care of their checks like Lurantis and Sandaconda and, in turn, can help with breaking through Steel-types.

sets.name: Swords Dance
sets.description:
Thanks to its decent Attack stat in combination with Swords Dance and priority Ice Shard, Abomasnow can be a dangerous setup sweeper that takes advantage of the surprise factor that comes with the set, as it usually uses Swords Dance as a special wall like Blissey, Cryogonal, and Eelektross switches in. While Wood Hammer is more powerful, Seed Bomb can be used over it to still threaten Blissey without recoil. Ice Shard picks off weakened, faster threats like Scyther, Hisuian Sneasel, and Lilligant. Earthquake hits the Steel-types that resist Abomasnow’s STAB moves like Magneton and Tera Steel Appletun. Tera Fire allows Abomasnow to resist hits from Scyther, Pyroar, Magneton, and opposing Abomasnow, giving it a free turn to setup or attack while also granting an immunity to Will-O-Wisp from the likes of Drifblim and Rotom. Tera Ground can be used instead to boost the power of Earthquake, give Abomasnow a Stealth Rock resistance, and surprise Electric-types using Volt Switch.

Ice Shard allows Abomasnow to take out offensive checks like Hisuian Sneasel and Scyther after a Swords Dance boost with minimal chip. To get this chip, Rocky Helmet Pokemon like Qwilfish and Sandaconda work well with Abomasnow, enabling it to facilitate a sweep. Flying- and Fighting-types like Scyther and Toxicroak threaten Abomasnow out, so checks like Rotom, Sableye, and Sandaconda pair well alongside it. Choice Scarf Mesprit pairs well with Abomasnow, threatening Fighting-types out and giving Abomasnow a second chance to sweep with the aid of Healing Wish. Articuno acts as a hard wall for Abomasnow, as it gets a Defense boost in snow and access to Haze. Pokemon like Magneton and Rotom can take advantage of Articuno by threatening it with Volt Switch to obtain momentum and crippling it with Trick, respectively. Pyroar also deals with Articuno quite well with Taunt, blocking Articuno’s Roost, in combination with Will-O Wisp, which lets Pyroar chip away at it.

sets.name: Hail Setter (Ice)
sets.description:
Thanks to its ability to set snow and Aurora Veil, Abomasnow is a valuable choice for Ice-type teams. Its Grass typing provides a way to deal with Water-types such as Azumarill, Basculegion, and Quagsire. Giga Drain is its main STAB move, dealing damage while providing recovery for Abomasnow. Alternatively, it can use Grass Knot in replacement of Giga Drain, allowing it to 2HKO Dondozo. Earth Power allows Abomasnow to hit Steel- and Fire-types, 2HKOing Kingambit and Torkoal and OHKOing offensive Heatran on the switch. The given EV spread allows Abomasnow to outspeed defensive Rotom-W, bulky Gholdengo, and Adamant Azumarill. Abomasnow can run either Icy Rock for more snow turns, which is preferred in Cetitan teams, or Light Clay for more Aurora Veil turns.

Cetitan highly appreciates Abomasnow's snow, as it can utilize Slush Rush to outspeed threats such as Iron Moth, Walking Wake, and Iron Treads. With Earthquake, it serves as a good sweeper against Poison, Steel, and Fire teams, which Abomasnow struggles to go against. Other setup sweepers such as Swords Dance Chien-Pao, Frosmoth, Baxcalibur, and Cloyster enjoy the Defense boost in snow, increasing their survivability and letting them set up and sweep the opposing team. Cloyster is able to survive a Choice Band-boosted Sacred Sword from Chien-Pao under snow and hit it back with a +2 Rock Blast. Baxcalibur is able to survive an Iron Head from Kingambit and 2HKO it with Earthquake. Chien-Pao acts as a strong wallbreaker that appreciates being able to take hits under snow due to its frailty. Frosmoth deals with the Water-type matchup along with Abomasnow, being able to set up a Quiver Dance and sweep the opposing team. The snow also allows the aforementioned setup sweepers to survive revenge killing attempts from foes such as Sucker Punch Kingambit and Extreme Speed Dragonite. Froslass provides team support in Taunt and its own hazards in Spikes, as well as Destiny Bond, which can take out a foe and give Abomasnow a free switch-in. Avalugg's great Defense and access to Rapid Spin make it a great teammate under snow, checking the likes of Kingambit, Iron Treads, and Urshifu-R while also acting as hazard control for its team.

vgc2023.overview:
• Snow lets Abomasnow carve itself a niche in the current metagame.

  • Abomasnow is a decent offensive support Pokemon with Aurora Veil, which partners well with various Ice-types such as Baxcalibur, Cetitan, and Glaceon, as they gain a Defense boost in snow.

  • Abomasnow's offensive typing is well-suited in a metagame filled with Ground-, Dragon-, and Water-types such as Garchomp, Hydreigon, and Rotom-W.

  • Despite the Defense boost in snow, Abomasnow is still fairly specially frail with a poor set of weaknesses that leave it vulnerable to some of the most common special attackers in the format like Gholdengo and Armarouge.

sets.name: Support
sets.description:
• Giga Drain gives Abomasnow some longevity when behind Aurora Veil and lets it beat the likes of Rotom-W and Palafin, which resist Blizzard. Earth Power is an alternative that hits Fire- and Steel-types like Torkoal and Gholdengo, notably OHKOing the former when Terastallized.

  • Abomansow runs items that help it overcome its crucial weaknesses. Focus Sash allows it to take any one hit, such as Rotom-H's Overheat, letting it set up Aurora Veil. Babiri Berry serves a similar purpose, allowing it to survive Gholdengo's Make It Rain and Tera Steel Hydreigon's Flash Cannon.

  • The Speed investment allows Abomsnow to outspeed Garchomp while in Tailwind.

  • Water is the primary Tera type used by Abomasnow, turning its Fire and Steel weaknesses into resistances. Ground is an alternative Tera type that allows it to fire off STAB-boosted Earth Powers, catching its common checks by surprise.

sets.name: Swords Dance
sets.description: Tera Blast Electric allows Weavile to have unresisted coverage, taking out traditional answers like Alomomola, Slowbro, and Quaquaval while still beating Tinkaton and Scizor at +2.

ru.overview: The tier is still in its infancy and the metagame develops with each passing day. The sample set(s) provided below will be regularly updated until proper analyses are in the works. See it as a rough outline to get started and accustomed to what sets are commonly used.

sets.name: Choice Band
sets.description: Thanks to its high Speed, great Attack stat, and good STAB combination, Weavile is able to tear apart offensive teams and set itself apart from other Pursuit trappers in Kingambit and Mega Tyranitar. It can easily trap Pokemon like Gholdengo, Tapu Lele, and Choice Specs Dragapult with Pursuit. Triple Axel has good neutral coverage and threatens a KO on foes like Kartana, Mega Charizard Y, and Iron Valiant, while Knock Off removes items from the likes of Toxapex and Ferrothorn and provides good utility. Ice Shard helps revenge kill Dragapult and faster foes that have been weakened like Mega Lopunny and Tapu Koko. Tera Dark propels Weavile's Knock Off to stellar levels of damage, possibly 2HKOing defensive Toxapex, Corviknight, and Ferrothorn after Stealth Rock while also removing its own weakness to Stealth Rock. Alternatively, Tera Ice allows Weavile to more easily revenge kill Dragapult, Mega Lopunny, and Tapu Koko while also boosting its Triple Axel to insane levels. Although it can safely take unresisted hits from full, Weavile is really frail, so it appreciates being brought onto the field by pivots like Landorus-T, Rotom-W, and Slowbro. The latter also provides Future Sight support, which allows Weavile to beat its most common checks, being Toxapex, Corviknight, and Urshifu-R. It also works well with Pokemon that like having Psychic- and Ghost-types like Gholdengo, Dragapult, and Tapu Lele being removed, like Mega Medicham and Zamazenta. Weavile also appreciates Spikes support from setters like Ting-Lu and Ferrothorn to weaken opposing Ferrothorn and Toxapex, as well as Defoggers like Tornadus-T and Rotom-W to prevent it from being worn down by entry hazards.

sets.name: Swords Dance
sets.description: Weavile's great Speed and Attack paired with Swords Dance makes it one of the most versatile Pokemon in the metagame, being able to wallbreak, revenge kill, and clean late-game. Most of Weavile's checks, such as Urshifu-R, Kingambit, and Heatran, aren't long-term checks and don't like losing their item. It also requires a minimal amount of chip damage on Pokemon like Buzzwole, Iron Hands, and Toxapex to effectively break them. Triple Axel is used for the larger damage output, but Ice Spinner can be used for a consistent and accurate STAB move. Icicle Crash avoids residual damage from contact abilities like Iron Barbs while also avoiding Static, Flame Body, and Rocky Helmet. Knock Off is usually preferred, as it can remove items from Toxapex and Ferrothorn and support Weavile's team, but Darkinium Z paired with Throat Chop allows Weavile to nuke its checks, mainly Toxapex, Corviknight, and Ferrothorn. Tera Dark removes Weavile's weakness to Bullet Punch from Mega Scizor while also propelling Knock Off's damage to nearly unstoppable levels. Pivot support from the likes of Landorus-T, Tornadus-T, and Tapu Koko helps Weavile by bringing it safely onto the field while also allowing it to set up, making it more consistent. Magnezone works well with Weavile, as it can trap and remove Mega Scizor, Ferrothorn, and Corviknight for it. In return, Weavile pressures Ground-types like Landorus-T and Garchomp. Weavile also appreciates being paired with strong wallbreakers that share checks with it such as Kartana, Tapu Lele, and Mega Mawile, as they can overwhelm them throughout the game. Weavile enjoys Spikes support from Ferrothorn, Ting-Lu, and Garchomp, as it forces chip damage on its checks, such as Mega Scizor, Toxapex, and Iron Hands.

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
This analysis is for the Regulation C format of Battle Stadium Singles, which lasts until June 30th, 2023. For more information on this format and its current events, check out this page!

If you feel this analysis is missing anything important or needs an update, feel free to suggest any changes here.

sets.name: Pivot
sets.description:
• Magnezone stands out as one of the best pivots in the metagame, having the tools to deal with dangerous threats such as Iron Bundle, Flutter Mane, Dondozo, and Corviknight.

  • Mirror Coat: If using Sturdy, Mirror Coat can get a shocking KO on powerful Special Attackers that Magnezone struggles to KO, such as Chi-Yu and Iron Moth.

  • Steel Beam: Steel Beam is insanely powerful if sacrificing Magnezone's life is worth it.

Tera Types

  • Water: Offensively, Water Tera Blast nails Ground-types such as Ting-Lu and Hippowdon. It also gives Magnezone a much-appreciated Fire resistance for Pokemon like Chi-Yu, Iron Moth, Skeledirge, and Volcarona, and lets Magnezone take on Iron Bundle's Hydro Pump.

  • Flying: Flying has wonderful defensive synergy with Magnezone, reversing its Ground and Fighting weaknesses, and lets Tera Blast hit Grass-types harder.

  • Fairy: A Fairy-type Tera Blast is very useful against common Dragon-types, most notably Garchomp and Roaring Moon, and hitting bulky Dark-types such as Ting-Lu, Wo-Chien, and Umbreon hard.

  • Fighting: Gaining a resistance to Dark allows Magnezone to surprise and defeat Kingambit, Roaring Moon, and Hydreigon, in addition to dealing plenty of damage to Ting-Lu.

  • Grass: Grass has excellent defensive and offense synergy with Magnezone, especially through its utility against Ground-type attackers and Spore immunity. Most notably, Tera Blast Grass can OHKO max SpD Hippowdon with Choice Specs.

  • Steel: The boost from Tera Steel makes Steel Beam absurdly powerful, with Analytic letting Choice Specs Magnezone OHKO even offensive Multiscale Dragonite!

  • Ground: Tera Ground helps against opposing Magnezone, OHKOs Iron Moth, and deals good damage against Gholdengo and Kingambit.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 252 SpA / 4 Spe with Modest: Magnezone's excellent typing means investing in bulk is a great idea. However, note that some important targets such as Corviknight and Skeledirge are a tad faster than it.

  • 252 HP / 252 SpD / 4 Spe with Calm: With maximum Special Defense investment and Assault Vest, Magnezone becomes a good soft check against Flutter Mane and Iron Bundle, and one of the best pivots in the metagame.

  • 252 HP / 76 SpA / 180 Spe with Modest: While this spread sacrifices a large amount of power, in exchange it outspeeds Adamant maximum Speed Kingambit, who can threaten to deal massive damage otherwise.

  • 252 SpA / 4 SpD / 252 Spe with Modest: If using Sturdy, Magnezone can run maximum Speed to outspeed unexpected foes, such as Specially Defensive Annihilape.

Items

  • Assault Vest: The increase in special bulk helps Magnezone against the myriad of choice item special attacking Dragon-types, like Hydreigon and Dragapult. If using Calm, Magnezone can even take on Flutter Mane and Iron Bundle!

  • Choice Specs: Choice Specs gives Magnezone a devastating amount of power, with even Clodsire having trouble handling it.

  • Air Balloon: The temporary Ground-type immunity helps Magnezone against foes like Garchomp and Dragonite without Terastallizing.

Abilities

  • Analytic: A Magnezone boosted by both Choice Specs and Analytic is incredibly hard to switch into, making it easier for Magnezone to generate momentum.

  • Sturdy: With Sturdy's guaranteed survivability and Magnezone's high damage output, Magnezone will very likely take down at least one Pokemon per game. Sturdy also helps Magnezone play around Dondozo, as it can safely come in on Fissure and use Volt Switch against it, which renders Yawn moot. However, if Magnezone switches into a Yawn and not Fissure, it should be noted that Dondozo often runs Protect to block Volt Switch and ensure Magnezone falls asleep.

sets.name: Choice Scarf
sets.description: Magnezone carves itself a niche thanks to Magnet Pull, which allows it to trap and remove Steel-types such as Mega Scizor, Kartana, Ferrothorn, and Skarmory, potentially forcing the latter three to Terastallize so teammates such as Kartana and Tapu Lele can beat them. Volt Switch lets Magnezone maintain momentum while eliminating foes such as Skarmory and chipping Heatran, which cannot be trapped and removed consistently. Alternatively, Tera Blast + Tera Fighting lets Magnezone remove Kingambit, potentially forcing it to Terastallize as well. Hidden Power Fire hits foes such as the aforementioned Mega Scizor, Kartana, and Ferrothorn. Toxic is another alternative that punishes switch-ins such as Gastrodon, Ting-Lu, and Hippowdon, though it can be difficult to justify over other alternatives, as it hinders Magnezone's effectiveness as a trapper. Magnezone should only Terastallize when it can trap and eliminate Kingambit, since teammates such as Dragapult and Dragonite take advantage of Tera better. The given EV spread allows Magnezone to survive an unboosted Sacred Sword from Kartana. Teammates such as Dragonite and Kartana appreciate Magnezone removing foes such as Skarmory and Ferrothorn, allowing them to sweep easier. The former can also safely switch into Ground-type attacks for Magnezone, while the latter threatens troublesome Ground-types such as Hippowdon and Gastrodon. Teammates such as Dragapult and Landorus-T provide pivoting support for Magnezone, granting it free entry against foes such as Skarmory and Kingambit to ease prediction. Dragapult in particular appreciates Magnezone trapping and removing Kingambit, allowing it to sweep without fear of being Pursuit trapped.

sets.name: Choice Specs
sets.description: Timid can be run to trap Tinkaton, but outspeeds nothing else of note.

sets.name: Wish
sets.description:
X-Scissor hits opposing Grass-types like Flapple and Gogoat; if these Pokemon aren't a concern, Leafeon can run Yawn to force switches, Leech Seed for additional recovery, or Swords Dance to make up for its relative passivity.

Sample set. Stay tuned for updates!

sets.name: Choice Specs
sets.description: Glaceon is a potent special attacker that can pressure common specially defensive threats like Garchomp, Roaring Moon, and Toxapex with Ice Beam + Freeze-Dry. Shadow Ball is used for Skeledirge and Scream Tail, while Mud Shot hits Steel-types like Regenerator Tinkaton and can OHKO Iron Moth. 22 Speed EVs allow Glaceon to outspeed Corviknight, and the rest are invested into bulk to better take hits from Body Press Corviknight and Torch Song Skeledirge. Special attackers like Choice Scarf Sandy Shocks and Iron Moth benefit from Glaceon breaking through special walls like Garchomp and Roaring Moon that they could otherwise struggle with. Glaceon can have a hard time switching in due its poor defensive typing and susceptibility to entry hazards, so having a teammate that can remove hazards and safely pivot it in like Corviknight or Iron Treads is recommended. Glaceon can struggle with bulky Steel-types like Kingambit, so pairing it with a Fighting-type like Lucario or Slither Wing is advised. Glaceon is also slow and would benefit from faster teammates like Choice Scarf Meowscarada that can pressure offensive threats that may threaten it.

sets.name: Hazards Support
sets.description: Thanks to its respectable bulk and fantastic passive longevity with Poison Heal, Gliscor occupies a fantastic niche on defensive teams. Its lack of use for its item slot after its activation combined with its Spikes immunity allows Gliscor to withstand weaker Knock Off attempts from Tornadus-T, Toxapex, and Ferrothorn. Gliscor can use its longevity to act as an excellent Defog user, as it can outlast common Stealth Rock setters such as Landorus-T, Ting-Lu, and Garganacl. Alternatively, Gliscor can opt for Stealth Rock if its team prefers it over Defog. Roost keeps Gliscor healthy alongside Poison Heal, allowing it to drain the PP of moves such as Heatran's Magma Storm and Garganacl's Salt Cure. Toxic allows Gliscor to pressure common entry hazard setters and Ground-immune Pokemon, such as Landorus-T, Ting-Lu, Rotom-W, and Tornadus-T. It also allows Gliscor to cripple offensive Pokemon such as Dragapult and Tapu Lele in a pinch. Tera Fairy gives Gliscor a generally solid defensive typing with few weaknesses, although at the cost of its Spikes immunity. The given HP EVs maximize Gliscor's recovery from Poison Heal and special bulk, with the remainder in Speed to outspeed Rotom-W. Gliscor fits best on defensive teams that appreciate its immense survivability and great support options. As such, Gliscor pairs well with sturdy physical and special walls, such as Skeledirge, Skarmory, Buzzwole, and Clodsire, since its relatively unremarkable bulk puts it at risk of being overwhelmed often. In return, it can switch into weak attacks with problematic secondary effects, such as Toxapex's Scald and Garganacl's Salt Cure, as well as help teammates keep their held items by absorbing Knock Off. Pokemon weak to entry hazards such as Nasty Plot Tornadus-T and Garganacl pair well with Gliscor's Defog support, while they act as threatening late-game wincons after Gliscor has worn down their checks. Gliscor pairs exceptionally well with Toxapex, as they form an incredibly sturdy pivoting core due to their incredible passive recovery.

sets.name: Swords Dance
sets.description: Swords Dance Gliscor is an incredibly potent wincon, using its incredible longevity and solid bulk to effortlessly setup on passive Pokemon such as Landorus-T, Toxapex, and Clefable. Facade provides Gliscor with an excellent alternative move to hit Ground-resistant and -immune Pokemon such as Skarmory, Zapdos, and Buzzwole, with its ample PP ensuring that it can outstall their recovery PP if necessary. Roost provides Gliscor with instant recovery, allowing it to check Pokemon like Mega Diancie and Heatran. The given EVs allow Gliscor to fulfill this purpose with Special Defense investment, with the HP maximizing its recovery from Poison Heal. Tera Fairy allows Gliscor to leverage a typing with few exploitable weaknesses, given Steel-types such as Kingambit and Gholdengo fear its Earthquake, while Tera Water improves Gliscor's matchup against Pokemon like Volcarona and Urshifu-R. However, it comes with more exploitable weaknesses, given the prominence of Tapu Koko, Rotom-W, and Ferrothorn. Gliscor fits best on balance and fat teams, which appreciate its ability to tear through opposing defensive cores while providing enough of a defensive backbone in return to facilitate this. Pokemon like Toxapex, Skarmory, and Gholdengo can exploit Gliscor's temporary checks such as Great Tusk, Skarmory, and Buzzwole, generating progress of their own. On the flip side, revenge killers such as Mega Lopunny and Dragapult can threaten offensive teams, given Gliscor's tendency to be overwhelmed when facing multiple strong wallbreakers. Gliscor appreciates Pursuit support from Mega Tyranitar or Kingambit, as it removes Gliscor's few true walls in Tera Ghost Rotom-W and Air Balloon Gholdengo.

sets.name: Choice Scarf (Psychic)
sets.description:
Gallade is the premier Choice Scarf user on Psychic teams due to its great coverage options and incredible ability, Sharpness. Being able to fire off Sharpness-boosted Sacred Sword is incredibly valuable, as it hits the Steel- and Dark-type Pokemon that give Psychic teams trouble for super effective damage, such as Kingambit, Chien-Pao, and Hisuian Goodra. Knock Off is a great way to make progress against bulkier teams, as well as dissuade Ghost-type Pokemon from switching in on a potential Sacred Sword. Night Slash is also an option to deal more consistent damage to Skeledirge and Gholdengo. Leaf Blade is used to threaten bulky Water-type Pokemon like Quagsire and Rotom-W, as well as OHKO Belly Drum Azumarill. Aqua Cutter is an option over Leaf Blade to hit Pokemon like Landorus, Volcarona and Moltres for super effective damage, but Leaf Blade is often better due to the amount of targets it hits. A Jolly nature is preferred over Adamant, as it allows Gallade to outspeed and still OHKO Greninja, Flutter Mane, and Sneasler, while the extra attack from Adamant is not necessary as most of the moves Gallade uses receive a Sharpness boost.

Espathra is a nice compliment to Gallade, as it appreciates Gallade's ability to deal with Steel- and Dark-type Pokemon like Gholdengo, Hisuian Goodra, Kingambit, and Ting-Lu, which Espathra has little way of hitting for even neutral damage, as well as its ability to remove special walls such as Galarian Slowking and Alolan Muk. Hoopa-U is also a great teammate for Gallade, as the speed of Gallade and sheer power of Hoopa-U synergize nicely to deal with both bulky and fast teams. Hoopa-U is able to threaten an OHKO on defensive staples such as Amoonguss, Toxapex, and Rotom-W with entry hazard support, while Gallade outspeeds Pokemon that would otherwise shut Hoopa-U down, such as Sneasler and Greninja. Armarouge is a strong partner for Gallade, as it provides a nice resistance to Fairy-type attacks and complementary coverage to Gallade's. Armarouge appreciates the removal of special walls such as Hisuian Goodra and Galarian Slowking, allowing it to set up and apply pressure to the opposing team, and it returns the favor by taking out physically bulky foes such as Dondozo, Zamazenta, and Corviknight. Hatterene is Psychic teams' best form of hazard control, which Gallade appreciates as it tends to switch in frequently and can otherwise get chipped. Hatterene also lures in Steel- and Poison-type Pokemon like Iron Treads and Sneasler, which Gallade can take care of. Indeedee is another good teammate for Gallade, as it sets up Psychic Terrain, further strengthening Gallade's Psycho Cut and protecting it from priority moves like Shadow Sneak and Sucker Punch. Indeedee also provides a valuable Ghost immunity, which prevents foes like Flutter Mane and Gholdengo from freely spamming Shadow Ball. Scream Tail is a great defensive teammate for Gallade, as its incredible bulk allows it to switch in to common Choice Scarf users such as Great Tusk, Iron Valiant, and Meowscarada, which would otherwise outspeed and OHKO Gallade. Scream Tail's access to a myriad of utility moves, such as Thunder Wave and Wish, allows it to support Gallade nicely by slowing down the aforementioned threats and increasing its longevity. Mew is a good teammate for Gallade on more offense-oriented teams, as lead Mew is the premier hazard setter for Psychic teams, and Gallade greatly appreciates the support. Galarian Slowking is a great teammate for Gallade as well, as it is able to safely switch into special attacks, as well as Fairy-type attacks that would otherwise give Gallade trouble. Galarian Slowking can also utilize Chilly Reception to give Gallade a free switch in.

sets.name: Choice Scarf (Fighting)
sets.description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

sets.name: All-out Attacker
sets.description:
• With its wide range of moveset options and its offense-boosting ability Sharpness, Gallade is excellent at dueling a wide variety of threats.

  • Shadow Sneak versus Feint: Shadow Sneak is far more consistent as a priority move and deals good damage to targets like Flutter Mane and Gholdengo. Feint is used mostly for winning Focus Sash duels against Chien-Pao's Ice Shard and Sucker Punch.

  • Night Slash versus Knock Off: Night Slash's consistent power is best for pure offense, potentially 2HKOing targets like Bold Gholdengo, assuming they can't stall with Recover and Rocky Helmet. If more utility is desired, Knock Off can be used for removing opposing items.

  • Leaf Blade: Fully invested Sharpness Leaf Blade has a 75% chance of OHKOing 252 HP Azumarill and is Gallade's best hope of muscling past Dondozo.

Other Options

  • Aqua Cutter: Aqua Cutter benefits from Sharpness, but it doesn't add a lot of extra coverage.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Gallade uses Focus Sash or Assault Vest as its main tool for cushioning a big hit and has great natural coverage. Therefore, Tera is reserved mostly for emergency situations.

  • Ghost: Tera Ghost's immunity to Normal- and Fighting-type moves can thwart revenge kill attempts from Mach Punch users and Extreme Speed Dragonite, giving Gallade an opportunity to break Multiscale on the latter.

  • Grass: Tera Grass improves the lead matchup versus Breloom; if Gallade successfully baits a Spore, most sets can beat Breloom without losing Focus Sash. Leaf Blade also becomes an easy 2HKO on Dondozo.

  • Steel: Tera Steel flips Gallade's weakness to Fairy-type attacks to a resistance. The Ice resistance can also be used in a pinch to keep Baxcalibur's Icicle Spear from OHKOing Gallade through Focus Sash.

Items

  • Focus Sash: With Focus Sash, Gallade duels opposing Focus Sash users with its hard-hitting STAB attacks and priority moves.

  • Assault Vest: Gallade has enough Special Defense to make good use of Assault Vest if Focus Sash is already taken, comfortably surviving unboosted hits from targets like Chi-Yu. Furthermore, Assault Vest isn't rendered useless by Stealth Rock chip, making Gallade a safer mid- or late-game option.

  • Scope Lens: While Scope Lens is risky due to Gallade's average bulk and Speed, it pairs well with the increased critical hit ratio many of Gallade's attacks have.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 4 SpD / 252 Spe with Adamant: A maximum offense spread is standard for Focus Sash and Speed ties with offensive Adamant Dragonite.

  • 196 HP / 252 Atk / 60 Spe with Adamant: For sets that run Assault Vest over Focus Sash, this slower spread avoids the OHKO from Focus Sash Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash after Stealth Rock damage. The Speed investment gets the jump on 4 Speed Rotom formes, letting Gallade deal as much damage as possible before getting hit with a burn.

sets.name: Choice Scarf
sets.description:
• With both Trick and Knock Off, Gallade is a decent anti-lead against several early game setups.

  • Trick: Trick with Choice Scarf lets Gallade permanently cripple setup Pokemon like Annihilape and Garganacl.

  • Knock Off versus Night Slash: Knock Off remains a strong disruption move with or without Trick, provided you exercise caution if you've already used Trick. Night Slash has more offensive presence than Knock Off and is a good choice if you really need to hit Gholdengo with consistent damage.

  • Leaf Blade: Leaf Blade is a great coverage option and, if Trick isn't available, your best move against Dondozo.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Choice Scarf Gallade normally isn't a strong user of Tera. It is best used in situations where Gallade already has momentum and needs to preserve it.

  • Ghost: Tera Ghost grants immunity to Mach Punch and Extreme Speed, letting Gallade keep its speed advantage against several targets.

  • Grass: Tera Grass can surprise Spore users like Breloom, letting Gallade score an easy KO or cripple them with Trick. Leaf Blade also becomes a 2HKO against Dondozo.

  • Fighting: Tera Fighting is a no-nonsense option for making Sacred Sword hit harder.

  • Psychic: Tera Psychic boosts Psycho Cut while removing Gallade's Fairy weakness.

sets.name: Swords Dance (Fighting)
sets.description: For Fighting teams, Mega Gallade is one of the best choices, courtesy of its incredible offensive power, typing, and Speed, being the best counter to Fighting's biggest roadblock, Toxapex. Swords Dance increases Mega Gallade's power to the maximum, letting it freely overpower the likes of Mandibuzz and Celesteela. Zen Headbutt beautifully complements a Fighting-type STAB move, as it lets Mega Gallade easily break through any opposing Poison-types that may be annoying walls such as Mega Venusaur, Toxapex, and Clodsire. Knock Off is another tool in Mega Gallade's arsenal, which lets it take care of Psychic- and Ghost-types—such as Gholdengo, Slowbro, and Aegislash—and wears down Celesteela into range of Close Combat finishing it off. Triple Axel is another option to easily take care of Flying-types such as Landorus-T, Dragonite, and Enamorus. Shadow Sneak can also be considered to pick off faster weakened threats such as Gengar, Choice Scarf Blacephalon, and Mega Alakazam. With all its benefits, Mega Gallade has a few checks in Skeledirge and defensive Gholdengo; hence, offensive Great Tusk and Urshifu-R are great partners in helping take these down. Defensive Great Tusk also helps in setting and removing entry hazards, which is appreciated by Mega Gallade. Mega Gallade is also easily revenge killed by faster offensive threats such as Tornadus-T and Choice Scarf Blacephalon, so Assault Vest Iron Hands is a good check to stop these in their tracks and deal good damage back while also being able to pivot in Mega Gallade with Volt Switch. Breloom and Lilligant-H also helps significantly in the Water matchup against the likes of Mega Swampert and Barraskewda; they can also put opposing foes to sleep to make Gallade's setup easier. Choice Scarf Sneasler helps in the Fairy matchup against the likes of Choice Scarf Tapu Lele and Tapu Koko while also being able to set and absorb Toxic Spikes and can U-Turn to pivot in Mega Gallade safely. Iron Valiant is also an amazing partner in the form of a specially offensive threat, complementing Mega Gallade, as it can easily take care of Mega Sableye. Choice Scarf Iron Valiant also outspeeds Mega Swampert under rain and Regieleki under Electric Terrain, making it a great revenge killer if Mega Gallade gets knocked out.

sets.name: Swords Dance (Psychic)
sets.description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

sets.name: Spikes Utility
sets.description:
With excellent Speed, a diverse utility movepool, and Spikes, Froslass is an elite Spikes setter and spinblocker. Taunt shuts down opposing entry hazard setters like Qwilfish, Blissey, and Sandaconda while also preventing Defog from the likes of Braviary and Lurantis. Ice Beam puts additional pressure on the aforementioned Defoggers and targets other walls like Sandaconda and Appletun. Shadow Ball provides higher damage on targets like Mesprit and Ghost-types like Rotom and opposing Froslass. Will-O-Wisp cripples physical attackers like Coil Dudunsparce, Hisuian Sneasel, and Scyther. While Tera Dark is situational, it can become a Knock Off sponge and wall Sableye while inverting its Dark and Ghost weaknesses.

Stealth Rock setters like Bombirdier and Sandaconda contribute to the hazard stacking Froslass provides, with the former removing opposing Heavy-Duty Boots with Knock Off. Wallbreakers like Bruxish and Pyroar can put foes into KO range faster thanks to the extra chip damage. VoltTurn users such as Scyther, Jolteon, and Magneton can not only help bring Froslass in safely, but also wear down other walls like Muk, Appletun, and Umbreon. Defensive walls like Blissey and Sandaconda can circumvent Froslass's low bulk with their reliable recovery and can sponge status moves.

sets.name: Spikes Lead
sets.description: Froslass is an effective entry hazard lead for hyper offense teams, as it can both block Rapid Spin without Terastallizing and deny hazards from opposing leads such as Glimmora, Iron Treads, and Great Tusk via Taunt. In addition to keeping hazards away, Taunt prevents setup attempts from slower Pokemon such as Great Tusk and Annihilape, and it thwarts Corviknight attempting to Defog away Froslass's Spikes. Destiny Bond can potentially take a slower Pokemon down with Froslass or force a switch, buying time to lay more layers of Spikes. Thunder Wave cripples faster leads, particularly Flame Charge Koraidon, and slows them down for Destiny Bond. Cursed Body can be situationally useful to disable attacks from foes holding Choice items, forcing them to switch. Tera Dark makes Froslass immune to Grimmsnarl's Prankster Taunt, whereas Tera Steel blocks Glimmora's Mortal Spin. Froslass should be used on hyper offense teams to support dangerous setup sweepers such as Calm Mind + Agility Miraidon, Swords Dance + Flame Charge Koraidon, and Swords Dance Chien-Pao by weakening opposing Pokemon with Spikes. Gholdengo can notably block Rapid Spin, Defog, and Mortal Spin, ensuring hazards stay up. Grimmsnarl is another good teammate, as it can support the aforementioned setup sweepers via Light Screen and Reflect.

sets.name: Spikes Lead
sets.description:
• Thanks to its Ghost typing and Cursed Body, Froslass is one of the best suicide leads in Ubers. It is unique for having a strong chance of preventing Glimmora from gaining an entry hazard advantage. Great Tusk and Iron Treads also cannot easily anti-lead Froslass with Rapid Spin.
  • Cursed Body sometimes allows Froslass to set more entry hazards than it would normally. In combination with Focus Sash, it has a 51% chance of activating on contact moves.
  • Taunt and Icy Wind are both effective at preventing setup from opposing Pokemon. Taunt also prevents Defog from Corviknight.
  • The last slot is flexible. Thunder Wave can prove useful against faster leads such as Koraidon, as well as crippling Corviknight.
  • Shadow Ball hits Taunt Iron Bundle and Hatterene for great damage.
  • Destiny Bond is a strong tool to play mindgames and force switches, which can be used to set more Spikes layers.
  • Tera Steel is chosen in case blocking Glimmora's Mortal Spin is necessary. Tera Dark can be used to block Taunt from Grimmsnarl.
  • Froslass works best with hyper offense setup sweepers such as Calm Mind Miraidon, Swords Dance Chien-Pao, and Calm Mind Flutter Mane, all of which can sweep much easier with Spikes support. Flutter Mane is a particularly notable teammate for blocking Rapid Spin once Froslass is eliminated.
  • Grimmsnarl is an effective partner for further supporting hyper offense teammates by setting dual screens. Spikes also does significant damage to Grimmsnarl's nemesis, Ting-Lu.

ru.overview: The tier is still in its infancy and the metagame develops with each passing day. The sample set(s) provided below will be regularly updated until proper analyses are in the works. See it as a rough outline to get started and accustomed to what sets are commonly used.

sets.name: Entry Hazard Lead (Ice)
sets.description:
Froslass is a great addition to Ice-type teams as it not only provides an immunity to Fighting-type moves and Rapid Spin, but also serves as a fantastic lead that is able to both set up its own entry hazards and prevent the opponent from doing the same. Taunt prevents hazards and status from foes such as Toxapex, Ting-Lu, and Clodsire, and is also used to deny Defog from Corviknight or Talonflame. However, it must be careful as most Corviknight and Talonflame can simply attack Froslass for super effective damage. When paired with Focus Sash, Taunt increases the chances of Froslass taking an opponent down with Destiny Bond, but it can also be used in tandem with Mental Herb to punish opponents like Sableye, Grimmsnarl, and opposing Froslass that attempt to Taunt Froslass, Taunting them in return. Spikes serves to punish switches on the opponent's side and weaken their team, allowing for Froslass's teammates to clean late-game. Shadow Ball is Froslass's answer to Hatterene, 2HKOing it as it comes in to bounce Spikes back, and it's Froslass's main source of damage to prevent it from being too passive. Froslass's last moveslot can utilize Destiny Bond to take an opponent down with it, but Will-O-Wisp and Thunder Wave are also options to consider as they allow you to status Pokemon that like to play around Destiny Bond, such as Kingambit and Volcarona. Focus Sash is the preferred item as it ensures that Froslass will always get at least one layer of Spikes up, but Mental Herb can also be used to ignore Taunt from faster leads while Heavy Duty-Boots allows Froslass to safely switch back in to block spinners such as Cyclizar and Quaquaval.

All of Froslass's teammates appreciate it spreading Spikes on the opposing field and preventing hazards from going up on theirs. After Spikes, Choice Band Chien Pao 2HKOes Iron Hands, while Shell Smash Cloyster and Belly Drum Cetitan can attempt to set up and sweep without fear of getting stopped by an opposing Focus Sash. Baxcalibur benefits from Froslass paralyzing faster threats like Flutter Mane and Iron Valiant, enabling it to outspeed and take them out, though Froslass needs an intact Focus Sash for this. Similarily, Dragon Dance Baxcalibur and Iron Defense Avalugg also benefit from the opportunities to set up against foes that have been burned by Froslass and no longer pose much of a threat to it. Avalugg can also support Froslass by switching into strong physical attacks to scout. Abomasnow's Snow Warning increases Froslass's physical bulk and makes it less wary of other attacks coming from spinners, such as Great Tusk's Knock Off.

sets.name: Choice Scarf
sets.description: Rotom stands out as a fantastic user of Choice Scarf thanks to its nearly unresisted STAB combination, high Speed tier, and three immunities. Will-O-Wisp lets Rotom cripple opposing physical sweepers such as Passimian, Medicham, and Scyther on top of Toxicroak using Sucker Punch. Trick is very useful to dismantle walls that rely on their item like Sandaconda, Eelektross, and Chansey. Tera Electric and Tera Ghost boost Rotom's STAB attacks even further with no drawbacks, though note that Tera Ghost exposes Rotom to Sandaconda's Glare. Tera Dark is useful for beating Sucker Punch Toxicroak and making Rotom a good lure for Zoroark. Thanks to Rotom's ease switching into opposing Sandaconda, teammates weak to it like Toxicroak, Lycanroc, Perrserker, and Scyther make for great partners; the latter two can even form a VoltTurn core with it. Bruxish, Medicham, and Mabosstiff help Rotom get around common special walls like Umbreon, Muk, and Chansey. Some walls that Rotom benefits from teaming up with include Umbreon, Vaporeon, and Muk thanks to their ability to take on common wallbreakers that can revenge kill Rotom such as Mabosstiff, Bruxish, and Pyroar.

sets.name: Nasty Plot
sets.description:
Rotom takes advantage of common Pokemon such as Sandaconda and Chansey that typically can't threaten it to set up. Will-O-Wisp eases setup and helps weaken checks such as Eelektross and Appletun. Tera Ghost helps Rotom get by Eelektross and Muk while retaining its Fighting immunity, whereas Tera Fairy can catch Dark-type revenge killers like Zoroark and Choice Scarf Mabosstiff off guard.

Rotom's quite customizable: Substitute / Nasty Plot / Thunderbolt or Discharge / Shadow Ball limits revenge killers and makes it easier to choose an offensive Tera type. Protect can be used instead of Will-O-Wisp to scout Choice item revenge killers like Zoroark, Passimian, and Bruxish. These options lack the same consistency as the listed set, though.

Pivots like Passimian, Scyther, and Oricorio formes are great to bring Rotom in against Sandaconda and Chansey, affording it easy setup opportunities. If Rotom is running Volt Switch, pair it with physical wallbreakers such as Bruxish and Toxicroak that can take on blanket special walls like Muk and Umbreon that commonly try to check it.

sets.name: Utility
sets.description: Rotom is an excellent bulky pivot, forcing out common staples like Scyther and Qwilfish with Volt Switch while having a positive matchup against Sandaconda, the most common Volt Switch absorber in the tier. Will-O-Wisp neuters physical attackers such as Passimian and Toxicroak and powers up Hex to chunk special walls like Eelektross and Muk. Protect racks up Leftovers recovery and burn damage while scouting moves from Choice item users such as Zoroark, Bruxish, and Passimian. Tera Electric powers up Volt Switch and removes Rotom's weaknesses to Dark and Ghost, improving its matchup against Mabosstiff, Umbreon, Haunter, and opposing Rotom. Tera Steel gives Rotom a great defensive typing with Levitate, which allows it to shrug off Sandaconda's Ground- and Rock-type coverage as well as take resisted damage from common moves like Lurantis's Leaf Storm and Lycanroc's Stone Edge. Because of Rotom's vulnerability to chip damage, it benefits greatly from reliable entry hazard removal from Pokemon such as Scyther and Lurantis. Powerful wallbreakers such as Ursaring and Medicham appreciate Rotom pivoting them safely into play. Rotom is quite vulnerable to faster attackers such as Zoroark and Bruxish, so it appreciates being paired with defensive stops to these threats, such as Muk and Umbreon. Passimian is a fantastic partner that forms a VoltTurn core with Rotom and revenge kills its offensive checks; it also appreciates Rotom weakening Sandaconda.

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
This analysis is for the Regulation C format of Battle Stadium Singles, which lasts until June 30th, 2023. For more information on this format and its current events, check out this page!

If you feel this analysis is missing anything important or needs an update, feel free to suggest any changes here.

sets.name: Choice Attacker
sets.description:
• Rotom-H sets itself apart from other Fire-types, with its Ground immunity and Volt Switch pivoting. When compared to Rotom-W, it is also much more effective at pressuring Flutter Mane, Gholdengo and Wo-Chien.

  • Trick: Trick gives Rotom-H an excellent tool against defensive foes, such as Dondozo and Skeledirge.

  • Using a neutral nature with a Timid mint: Make sure to get a Rotom-H with a neutral nature and then use a Timid Mint on it. This way, it can't be confused by any Berries given with Trick.

Other Options

  • Discharge: While weaker than Thunderbolt, the 30% paralysis chance can be devastating for some of Rotom-H's more troublesome matchups, such as Chi-Yu. Do note though that Choice Scarf Rotom-H will have a much harder time 2HKOing Assault Vest Azumarill and certain variants of Dondozo.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low / Medium: If not running Tera Blast, Rotom-H normally wants to keep its unique typing for defensive purposes, allowing it to switch into several key threats. The most common exception to this is sets that run Tera Fairy for Dragon-type matchups.

  • Electric: Electric is an easy Tera type to recommend, as it increases damage output and removes all of Rotom-H's weaknesses.

  • Fairy: A Fairy Tera typing with Tera Blast makes Rotom-H much better equipped to handle normally problematic Dragon-types, such as Garchomp, Roaring Moon, and Dragapult.

  • Fire: When paired with Tera Blast, Rotom-H now has a much more reliable Fire-type STAB move than Overheat, but at the cost of retaining all of its normal weaknesses.

Items

  • Choice Scarf: Choice Scarf lets Rotom-H outspeed normally problematic threats such as Iron Bundle.

  • Choice Specs: The extra power makes Rotom-H far more difficult to wall, with defensive Skeledirge getting 2HKOed by Thunderbolt.

sets.name: Defensive Pivot
sets.description:
• Rotom-W's defensive set might be the more known one, but Rotom-H's key resistances to Fairy-type attacks and U-turn, plus its ability to put serious pressure on Gholdengo, make it a good alternative as a bulky pivot.

  • Foul Play: Foul Play is a must-have, as otherwise, Rotom-H is extremely passive against Baxcalibur, which is likely to switch in for an Attack boost from Overheat.

  • Will-O-Wisp versus Thunder Wave: Will-O-Wisp is the preferred status move, potentially shutting down major physical threats such as Dragonite, Mimikyu, and Iron Hands. Thunder Wave is still a reasonable choice, though, stopping special attackers such as Flutter Mane and Iron Moth in their tracks.

  • Trick and Flame Orb: This one-use method of burning may seem silly, but taking away important items can be devastating against certain Pokemon such as Ting-Lu, and Rotom-H can use this to get rid of troublesome Choice items if it's taken a Trick as well. Note that Rotom-H will burn itself if it Terastallizes while holding Flame Orb, which is generally not good outside of blocking sleep or Toxic poison.

  • Using a Neutral Nature with a Bold Mint: If using Trick, it's best to run a neutral nature such as Serious and change the stat boosts with a Bold Mint. This way, Rotom-H won't get confused by any Berry it receives.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Rotom-H's defensive typing is very valuable, so Tera is normally reserved for very specific situations.

  • Steel: Tera Steel with Levitate is a sublime defensive typing, letting Rotom-H better handle huge threats like Dragonite, Garchomp, and Baxcalibur.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy is an alternative option to soak up Dragon-type attacks, and it also gives Rotom-H a better matchup against Great Tusk and Iron Hands.

  • Ghost: While this unfortunately makes Gholdengo a much bigger issue, Tera Ghost is still worth considering for making Rotom-H immune to Dragonite's Extreme Speed and Iron Valiant's Close Combat. It also lets Rotom-H switch out of trapping moves without using Volt Switch.

Items

  • Sitrus Berry: Sitrus Berry is Rotom-H's ticket to staying around the longest, usually avoiding 2HKOs from powerful unboosted attacks such as Dragonite's Outrage and Iron Valiant's Close Combat.

  • Rocky Helmet: Rotom-H's typing makes it a good user of Rocky Helmet, passively punishing physical Fairy-types such as Mimikyu and Iron Valiant and making it a good response to expected uses of U-turn.

sets.name: Offensive Pivot
sets.description: 44 Defense EVs as a benchmark to avoid the 2HKO from Adamant Life Orb Mamoswine whilst maintaining speed.

sets.name: Physically Defensive
sets.description:
Rotom-W is one of the metagame's best defensive pivots thanks to its unique typing accentuated with Levitate, allowing it to check prominent Pokemon like Dragonite, Kingambit, Scizor, and Garchomp. Aside from gaining momentum, its STAB Volt Switch threatens common Pokemon like Corviknight, Dondozo, and Toxapex. Hydro Pump pressures Garganacl, Cinderace, and Skeledirge, but most importantly, it dents Ground-types like Great Tusk and Ting-Lu that attempt to block its Volt Switch. Moreover, its immunity to Spikes and Toxic Spikes make it an even more effective pivot in the face of entry hazards. Aside from gaining valuable Leftovers recovery, Protect scouts for Choice item users like Meowscarada, Iron Valiant, Dragapult, and Greninja, potentially stalls out burn damage, and punishes Cinderace's High Jump Kick. Thunder Wave cripples Dragapult and special Iron Valiant. Will-O-Wisp punishes physical attackers such as Dragonite, Roaring Moon, Azumarill, and Kingambit, and it chips down switch-ins like Amoonguss and Clodsire in the long-term. Tera Steel improves Rotom-W's matchup against Dragonite, Dragapult, and Meowscarada, prevents it from being crippled by Clodsire and Toxapex's Toxic, and makes it resistant to Stealth Rock. Alternatively, Tera Water can be run as a purely offensive option, improving Hydro Pump's damage to 2HKO Garganacl through Leftovers, Unaware Clodsire, and potentially Tera Fairy Skeledirge. The Speed EVs let Rotom-W outspeed uninvested Great Tusk and paralyzed Dragapult.

Rotom-W finds a place on bulky offense teams, especially VoltTurn teams, that maximum its potential. Offensive pivots like Dragapult, Cinderace, Meowscarada, and Scizor form a sturdy pivot core with Rotom-W; Cinderace appreciates being brought in safely on Amoonguss, while Dragapult and Meowscarada similarly like being brought in on Pokemon like Toxapex, opposing Rotom-W, and Garganacl. Entry hazard setters like Ting-Lu, Garchomp, and Great Tusk take advantage of the multiple switches that pivot teams tend to force, crumbling the opposing team slowly just by keeping up momentum; in return, Rotom-W helps check entry hazard removers like Corviknight, Great Tusk, and Iron Treads. Due to Rotom-W's nature of constantly pivoting, spinners and Defoggers like Great Tusk and Corviknight are appreciated; Great Tusk, in particular, can threaten Clodsire, one of Rotom-W's sturdiest answers, while Corviknight's U-turn complements Rotom-W's pivoting duties. Defensive Pokemon like Amoonguss, Clodsire, and Ting-Lu are viable options to cover threats like Breloom, Iron Valiant, and Dragapult, respectively; in return, they enjoy Rotom-W checking Cinderace and Garchomp. Pokemon that can switch into Meowscarada and Great Tusk's Knock Off, such as Corviknight and Amoonguss, are valuable to maintain Rotom-W's longevity from its Leftovers.

sets.name: Specially Defensive
sets.description:
With its unique typing backed up by a good Special Defense stat and access to Volt Switch and Levitate, Rotom-W is one of the best defensive pivots and Ground immunities in the tier. Rotom-W's STAB Hydro Pump lets it threaten Ground-types such as Great Tusk, Ting-Lu, and Sandy Shocks aiming to block its Volt Switch. Its bulk in Special Defense lets it sponge attacks from special attackers such as Walking Wake, Hisuian Zoroark, and Iron Valiant and cripple them with Thunder Wave. Protect lets Rotom-W gain Leftovers recovery as well as scout the intentions of Choice item users like Gholdengo and Greninja. 12 Speed EVs lets Rotom-W outspeed 0 Speed Great Tusk and paralyzed Dragapult. Tera Fairy grants Rotom-W an immunity to some of the tier's most powerful special attacks in Walking Wake's, Dragapult's, and Garchomp's Draco Meteor, allowing it to handle them more easily. Tera Steel provides Rotom-W with a resistance to said Dragon-type attacks and an immunity to Toxapex's and Clodsire's Toxic, making for an excellent defensive typing in conjunction with Levitate. Tera Steel also improves Rotom-W's matchup against Dragonite, letting it cripple it with Thunder Wave and pivot out into one of its teammates.

Bulky offense teams appreciate Rotom-W's defensive profile and ability to pivot while maintaining an offensive presence. Cinderace appreciates Rotom-W's ability to threaten Great Tusk, Ceruledge, and Skeledirge, and in return, it threatens Grass-types such as Amoonguss, Breloom, and Meowscarada that resist both of Rotom-W's STAB moves. Great Tusk can rely on Rotom-W to take Water-type attacks from Walking Wake and Greninja and in return provide hazard removal to keep Rotom-W healthy throughout the game, as well as threaten Water Absorb Clodsire, which completely walls Rotom-W. Rotom-W threatens both Dondozo and Great Tusk, which Kingambit can struggle to break past, and enjoys Kingambit checking Calm Mind Hatterene and Dragon Dance Dragapult that may use Rotom-W as a setup opportunity. While Rotom-W struggles to beat Walking Wake, Dragon Dance Dragonite, and Roaring Moon one-on-one, its ability to cripple them with Thunder Wave lets teammates like Dragapult and Iron Valiant deal with them more easily. Defensive teammates such as Corviknight and Amoonguss can check the aforementioned Grass-types that are troublesome for Rotom-W, and provide bulk for Rotom-W to not get overwhelmed by repeated hits.

sets.name: Choice Scarf
sets.description:
Equipped with a Choice Scarf, Rotom-W provides excellent utility as a fast pivot thanks to its Volt Switch, devastating status moves, and high-Base Power STAB move in Hydro Pump. Volt Switch keeps up momentum during the game, and it can super effectively hit Corviknight, Dondozo, Toxapex, and Greninja, which Rotom-W now outspeeds thanks to its Choice Scarf. Hydro Pump is the strongest move it has, meaningfully hurting a wide range of Pokemon, and it punishes Ground-types such as Greak Tusk, Clodsire, and Garchomp that attempt to block Volt Switch. Rotom-W can outspeed the entire unboosted metagame with its Choice Scarf, allowing it to reliably hit Cinderace, Iron Moth, and Garganacl. Trick is essential to cripple walls that can recover from Rotom-W's attacks, like Toxapex and Tera Fairy Garganacl. Thunder Wave can be used to cripple threats such as Dragapult and Iron Moth, especially since Choice Scarf Rotom-W outspeeds them. Will-O-Wisp is just as useful as Thunder Wave, disarming physical threats like Roaring Moon, Dragonite, Breloom, and Meowscarada. Tera Steel gives Rotom-W an immunity to Toxic from Clodsire and Toxapex, as well as a resistance to Meowscarada's Flower Trick, Breloom's Bullet Seed, Iron Valiant's Moonblast, and Dragonite's Extreme Speed. On top of this, Levitate makes Steel's Ground weakness into an immunity; notably, EdgeQuake can't hit Tera Steel Rotom-W neutrally. Alternatively, Tera Water takes a more offensive approach, boosting the power of Hydro Pump to 2HKO Gholdengo, and it can potentially OHKO physically defensive Garganacl and Clodsire.

Rotom-W sits comfortably on balance and bulky offense teams. It pairs well with defensive Pokemon such as Corviknight, Toxapex, and Amoonguss, which use their Grass resistances and/or recovery to sponge hits like Breloom's Bullet Seed, Meowscarada's Flower Trick, and Ting-Lu's Ruination. Rotom-W pressures entry hazard removers like Great Tusk, Iron Treads, Corviknight, and Cinderace, which helps hazard setters. Great Tusk is a great example, since it also removes hazards to ease Rotom-W's pivoting. More offensive partners like Iron Valiant, Cinderace, and Dragapult love Rotom-W crippling bothersome walls like Ting-Lu and Amoonguss with Trick. In turn, they can effectively check Breloom, Meowscarada, Choice Specs Iron Valiant, Gholdengo, and Choice Specs Dragapult, which can all cause trouble for Rotom-W. When Rotom-W pivots against Corviknight, Dondozo, Toxapex, and Greninja as they switch out, frail attackers such as Meowscarada, Cinderace, and Iron Valiant can safely come in to pressure the incoming Amoonguss, opposing Rotom-W, and Gholdengo.

sets.name: Nasty Plot (Electric)
sets.description:
Rotom-W is a great Nasty Plot sweeper for Electric teams due to Levitate and its bulk, which lets it greatly ease the Ground matchup. Stored Power deals with Unaware and Water Absorb users such as Quagsire and Clodsire, letting it threaten the entirety of Ground teams in conjunction with Hydro Pump. Substitute lets it avoid status and take advantage of passive Pokemon such as Klefki and Toxapex, eases prediction, and forces its checks such as Greninja and Ting-Lu to take damage. The given EV spread prevents Rotom-W's Substitute from breaking to Clodsire's Poison Jab while outspeeding threats such as Gholdengo and Kleavor.

Teammates such as Choice Scarf Sandy Shocks and Iron Hands love Rotom-W's ability to deal with or wear down bulky Pokemon such as Clodsire and Gastrodon, allowing them to clean up types like Poison and Water late-game.
