sets.name: Life Orb
sets.description: The HP, Defense and Special Defense allow Spectrier to survive Outrage from Jolly Haxorus and Hydro Pump from Timid Choice Specs Iron Bundle. The Speed outspeeds Jolly Meowscarada, and the remaining EVs are put in Special Attack.

sets.name: Double Dance
sets.description:
Calyrex is not viable in PU, but this is considered its best set.

The Speed investment lets +2 Calyrex outspeed Choice Scarf Alolan Dugtrio.

sets.name: Double Dance
sets.description:
Grassy Seed should only be used alongside Thwackey, which is the only reliable Grassy Terrain setter. 216 Speed EVs let Wyrdeer outspeed Electrode after using Agility, and the investment in bulk ensures it isn't 2HKOed by Choice Scarf Basculin's Wave Crash. Wyrdeer's EV spread is rather flexible, though, meaning it can be customized to suit a particular team's needs.

Sample set. Stay tuned for updates!

sets.name: Choiced Attacker (Rock)
sets.description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

sets.name: Choice Scarf (Bug)
sets.description:
Kleavor is a great Choice Scarf user for Bug teams because of its naturally high Attack stat, Sharpness ability, and Rock STAB, which is heavily appreciated in Bug teams. Thanks to a Jolly nature and Choice Scarf, it's able to outspeed foes such as Flutter Mane, Chien Pao, and Dragapult and deal heavy damage. Sharpness-boosted Stone Axe smashes common Flying- and Fire- types, such as Enamorus, Skeledirge, and Cinderace, while also setting up Stealth Rock in the same turn. Night Slash punishes Gholdengo, which resists all of Kleavor's other moves, though be wary that Kleavor can only 2HKO it even with Stealth Rock up. Aerial Ace is also an option to hit Great Tusk if it tries to switch in and remove entry hazards set by Kleavor. U-turn picks up momentum for the team and switches Kleavor out against foes such as Landorus-T, Iron Hands, and Azumarill. X-Scissor can be used to deal much more damage than U-turn thanks to being boosted by Sharpness, 2HKOing Amoonguss and Sableye. Close Combat helps Kleavor deal with Steel-types such as Kingambit and Heatran, though the latter requires chip damage to OHKO.

All of Kleavor's teammates enjoy its ability to set up Stealth Rock while also dealing damage in the same turn. Volcarona and Frosmoth appreciate Kleavor's entry hazard support wearing down the opposing team and its ability to deal with Flying- and Fire-types, which enable them to set up and sweep late-game. In return, Volcarona can deal with Steel-types such as Corviknight and Gholdengo, while Frosmoth can deal with Ground- and Water-types such as Landorus-Th and Quagsire. Frosmoth is also a wincon against Flying- and Dragon-types when Stealth Rock is set up. Scizor acts as a sweeper that takes advantage of Kleavor weakening opposing teams, and it also forms a U-turn core that appreciates Kleavor's Fire neutrality with it. Additionally, Scizor can block Toxic from Clodsire and Mortal Spin from Glimmora, and threaten them with either Choice Band-boosted Bullet Punch or setting up with Swords Dance. Lokix, Heracross, and Slither Wing also appreciate the opposing team being weakened by Kleavor, as well as the speed control Kleavor provides. This enables them to finish off foes by making use of priority moves and strong physical attacks, such as Lokix taking out Gholdengo with Sucker Punch or Throat Chop. Forretress provides great hazard control thanks to Rapid Spin, and it's also able to switch into strong physical attacks to scout thanks to its high physical defense and additional Steel typing that grants valuable neutralities that cover Kleavor's weaknesses. Forretress also makes a good pivot thanks to its slow speed and access to Volt Switch.

battlestadiumsingles.overview: This Pokemon is a new addition to the Regulation D format! If you have any questions or feel it needs more updates, feel free to post here.

sets.name: Timber!
sets.description:
• While Stone Axe's accuracy can be off-putting if reliable Stealth Rock setting is a must, Kleavor's unique form of role compression makes it an effective alternative to more defensive setters.

  • Night Slash: Night Slash is Kleavor's best way of dealing big damage to Gholdengo and is a reliable option against weakened Flutter Mane.

  • Feint: Feint's increased priority over other priority attacks make it a great way to pick off Focus Sash foes like Chien-Pao and Iron Bundle. Kleavor being faster means it'll even outpace Dragonite's Extreme Speed!

  • Trailblaze: While Kleavor isn't known for easily sweeping, it's fast enough to outspeed Flutter Mane and Iron Bundle after Trailblaze, and Trailblaze is especially useful when using Tera Grass against Urshifu-R.

  • X-Scissor versus Close Combat: While X-Scissor's coverage on paper isn't impressive, the boost from Sharpness lets it 2HKO Cresselia and Ting-Lu that lack Sitrus Berry.

  • Adamant versus Jolly: If using Feint, Adamant is the best nature choice for maximizing the amount of targets it can pick off after using Stone Axe. For Trailblaze variants, Jolly is preferred to outspeed Flutter Mane, Iron Bundle, and even Dragapult. Jolly also ensures it outspeeds all Gholdengo that lack Choice Scarf.

Other Options

  • Tailwind: Tailwind is an unusual move for Battle Stadium Singles, but Kleavor's disposable nature with Focus Sash can make it justified as a move to use before fainting.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Kleavor's entry hazard setting nature may not make Terastallization seem important, but its archnemesis, Urshifu-R, makes it worth considering, since it can threaten to OHKO Kleavor through its Focus Sash.

  • Grass: Tera Grass is a good response against Urshifu-R, not only resisting its deadly Surging Strikes, but also boosting Trailblaze.

  • Water: Tera Water isn't as offensively useful, but it's still a good way to resist both Surging Strikes and powerful Steel-type attacks like Heatran's Flash Cannon.

  • Bug: Tera Bug isn't great defensively, but it allows Kleavor to 2HKO even Impish Sitrus Berry Ting-Lu with X-Scissor.

  • Ghost: Despite Kleavor's resistance to Extreme Speed, Dragonite often picks off Focus Sash variants, so Tera Ghost is a huge shock for it, though a rather risky Terastallization choice. It also blocks Rapid Spin from Great Tusk, even if it's not particularly common.

Items

  • Focus Sash: Focus Sash makes Kleavor a good lead against a wide variety of foes such as Iron Bundle and lets it easily justify the maximum Speed investment needed to outspeed Gholdengo.

  • Assault Vest: Kleavor's special bulk is mediocre at best, but Stone Axe's entry hazard setting powers can justify using Assault Vest to survive certain attacks that are otherwise impossible without Focus Sash.

Assault Vest EV Spreads

  • 28 HP / 204 Atk / 4 Def / 204 SpD / 68 Spe with Adamant: This more specially bulky spread usually survives Iron Bundle's Hydro Pump, Timid Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Tera Fairy Moonblast, and Jolly Life Orb Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash while outspeeding Garchomp after one use of Trailblaze.

  • 28 HP / 108 Atk / 4 Def / 204 SpD / 164 Spe with Jolly: This spread has enough Speed to outspeed Iron Bundle after using Trailblaze once while usually surviving Timid Tera Fairy Choice Specs Moonblast from Flutter Mane, Non-Choice Specs Iron Bundle's Hydro Pump, and Jolly Life Orb Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash.

  • 140 HP / 52 Atk / 4 Def / 244 SpD / 68 Spe with Adamant: This more extreme spread usually lets Kleavor survive even Timid Gholdengo's Make It Rain, almost always avoids a 2HKO from Modest Chi-Yu's Dark Pulse, and avoids a OHKO from Adamant Life Orb Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash while still outspeeding Garchomp after one use of Trailblaze.

Minor Optimizations

  • Female Gender: While very rare, Cute Charm Enamorus can potentially impact Kleavor, meaning there are no drawbacks to using a female gender.

sets.name: Choice Scarf
sets.description:
• Choice Scarf Kleavor has a very unique niche of being a decent revenge killing pivot that can set up Stealth Rock at the same time!

  • Night Slash: Night Slash is Kleavor's best move against Gholdengo, making it highly recommended, since Kleavor outspeeds it.

  • X-Scissor versus Close Combat: Despite offering less coverage, X-Scissor's sheer power with Sharpness makes it a great option, dealing heavy damage to Cresselia and Ting-Lu and being a strong cleaning option. Close Combat isn't as reliable, but it can let Kleavor more reliably revenge kill threats such as Tera Normal Dragonite and Ursaluna. It's also Kleavor's easiest option to use for revenge killing Urshifu-R.

Other Options

  • Aerial Ace: Aerial Ace isn't particularly strong despite the boost from Sharpness, but it does deal massive damage to Urshifu-R, especially if using the easily accessible Tera Flying.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: While Choice Scarf Urshifu-R is still a major concern, this set's other purpose means that setting up Stealth Rock is required for success, making Terastallization less important.

  • Bug: If using X-Scissor, Tera Bug lets Kleavor 2HKO even Sitrus Berry Ting-Lu, making for an effective late-game cleaner.

  • Grass: If Choice Scarf Urshifu-R is a major concern, Tera Grass is a decent way around it in addition to getting an advantage against Breloom leads.

  • Flying: Tera Flying should only be used with Aerial Ace, which gives Kleavor a 75% chance of OHKOing Urshifu-R after taking Stealth Rock damage.

Minor Optimizations

  • Female Gender: Cute Charm Enamorus is very rare and not important, but it does mean that a female gender is slightly preferred on Kleavor.

sets.name: Choice Scarf (Bug)
sets.description: Choice Scarf Kleavor is one of the best answers to Flying- and Fire-types, like Tornadus-T, Mega Charizard-Y, and Skeledirge, for Bug teams, thanks to its Sharpness-boosted Stone Axe, which has the added utility of automatically setting Stealth Rock. Close Combat synergizes well with Kleavor's STAB moves, crushing Steel-types like Iron Treads. U-turn allows Kleavor to pivot out of Great Tusk and Skarmory to bring in teammates like Araquanid or Volcarona. Night Slash banishes Ghost-types like Gholdengo, Knock Off softens walls like Corviknight and Porygon2 for its teammates, and X-Scissor takes down Slowbro to make way for Mega Pinsir. Araquanid and Galvantula are excellent teammates, as these set up Sticky Web to patch up Kleavor's unassuming speed, even when using a Choice Scarf, allowing it to outspeed Choice Scarf Blacephalon. Additionally, they also help in dealing with pesky Fire- and Flying-types like Volcarona and Landorus, respectively. Physical setup sweepers benefit from Kleavor's ability to set hazards offensively, Knock Off items from walls, and deal with Skeledirge and Slowbro, which often wall Mega Pinsir, Scizor, and Mega Scizor. In return, they deal with Fighting- and Fairy-types like Great Tusk and Mega Diancie. Quiver Dance Volcarona appreciates Skeledirge removed, as this lets it clean up Ghost teams at +1; it can also be brought in against passive walls like Slowbro and Skarmory. Forretress provides Rapid Spin and loves Kleavor's ability to set Stealth Rock, as this allows it to run other hazards like Toxic Spikes or Volt Switch to better support the team. Lokix provides great offensive support with its access to priority in First Impression and Sucker Punch to finish off teams weakened by Kleavor through entry hazards and repeated Knock Offs. It is also a secondary check to Skeledirge, which Bug teams appreciate.

sets.name: Swords Dance
sets.description:
Swords Dance Ursaluna is a peerless wallbreaker that can muscle through even the bulkiest of Pokemon. After Flame Orb activates, Facade 2HKOes even Pokemon as physically bulky as Dondozo and OHKOes physically defensive Great Tusk after a Swords Dance while letting Ursaluna act as a status absorber. Headlong Rush is generally preferred for its higher power, but Earthquake is another good option that avoids Rough Skin and Rocky Helmet damage and lets Ursaluna leverage its good bulk. Fire Punch hits Corviknight, Air Balloon Gholdengo, and Air Balloon Kingambit, which resist Ursaluna's STAB combination. Tera Normal boosts Facade to breathtaking levels, allowing it to cleanly 2HKO physically defensive Corviknight after Stealth Rock. Tera Ghost is an alternative that lets Ursaluna avoid being revenge killed by Fighting-type attacks such as Close Combat from Great Tusk, Iron Valiant, or Sneasler. The given EV spread maximizes Ursaluna's damage output while also ensuring it outspeeds Skeledirge and standard Corviknight. On Trick Room teams, Ursaluna should run maximum Attack and HP investment, a Brave nature, and 0 Speed IVs.

Ursaluna serves as an exceptionally powerful wallbreaker on hyper offense and bulky offense teams. Entry hazard support from Great Tusk, Glimmora, Hisuian Samurott, and Garchomp is appreciated to make Ursaluna even more difficult to wall. Dual screens support from Dragapult can also be considered, since it will further reinforce Ursaluna's excellent bulk, and Dragapult can even provide free switches through Curse or U-turn. Against slower-paced teams, Ursaluna's great bulk and immunity to status give it many opportunities to switch in and start wreaking havoc, but it can struggle against faster-paced, more aggressive teams. Good partners for Ursaluna that excel against offense include Kingambit, Iron Valiant, Dragapult, and Zamazenta, which, in return, appreciate Ursaluna breaking through Pokemon such as Dondozo and Corviknight. Ursaluna enjoys U-turn or Volt Switch support from Rotom-W, Landorus-T, or Dragapult, letting it hit the field multiple times to fire off its insanely powerful attacks. Galarian Slowking is another great teammate for Ursaluna, as it can both provide momentum with Chilly Reception and supplement Ursaluna's firepower with Future Sight. Galarian Slowking can also switch into and pressure some of the Pokemon that give Ursaluna trouble, such as Iron Valiant. Trick Room support from Hatterene and Cresselia is an interesting option to turn Ursaluna's low Speed into an advantage.

sets.name: Guts Wallbreaker (Normal)
sets.description:
144 Speed EVs may be used to outpace Corviknight and 2HKO it with Fire Punch. This Speed investment also lets Ursaluna outspeed Pokemon with a similar speed tier as it, such as Kingambit, Iron Hands, and Azumarill.

This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

sets.name: Swords Dance (Ground)
sets.description:
Ursaluna's unrivaled power makes it a phenomenal addition for any Ground team. After Flame Orb activates, Facade 2HKOes the bulkiest Pokemon in the metagame such as Dondozo, Ting-Lu, and Amoonguss. Because of Flame Orb, Ursaluna can also function as a great status absorber. Earthquake is preferred over Headlong Rush, because it allows Ursaluna to maintain its remarkable bulk as well as having the added benefit of avoiding Rocky Helmet and Rough Skin damage. Swords Dance can be used to bolster Ursaluna's Attack to incredible heights, giving everything a tough time switching in. Drain Punch can be used to give Ursaluna more longevity, while Fire Punch can be used to hit targets like Corviknight and Air Balloon Gholdengo for super effective damage. Alternatively, Ursaluna can run 140 Speed EVs in order to keep up with other pokemon in its Speed tier, such as Kingambit, and outspeeding slightly faster Pokemon that do not run any Speed investment such as Corviknight and Skeledirge. Max HP is used to maximize Ursaluna's bulk, while the 4 Speed EVs are used to outspeed any uninvested Pokemon of the same Speed tier, such as Iron Hands and Alolan Muk.

Ursaluna greatly appreciates entry hazard support from Ting-Lu and Quagsire, as the extra damage could be the difference between a 2HKO and a 1HKO on physically defensive Rotom-W. Ursaluna also appreciates a teammate like Clodsire, which can switch into Water- and Fighting-type attacks from Urshifu-R, Azumarill, and Sneasler, both of which Ursaluna is weak to. Another great teammate for Ursaluna is Landorus-T, which can U-turn and allow Ursaluna to come in freely and launch its extremely powerful attacks. Alternatively, Landorus-I is a fantastic teammate for Ursaluna. Ursaluna is able to deal with the special walls that check Landorus and vice versa. Iron Treads is another great teammate for Ursaluna, as it keeps hazards off the field in order to prevent Ursaluna from taking more damage. Bulkier Pokemon that want to stick around for a long time, such as Ting-Lu, Quagsire, and Clodsire, greatly appreciate Ursaluna's presence, as it can freely switch in to status moves and Knock Off once Flame Orb has activated. Finally, Choice Scarf Great Tusk is another teammate that appreciates Ursaluna. Great Tusk is able to outspeed and OHKO Pokemon that check Ursaluna such as Chien-Pao, Baxcalibur, and Choice Specs Greninja. Once Ursaluna has sufficiently weakened the opposing team, Great Tusk will have an easy time finishing the game with its high speed and powerful attacks.

sets.name: Bulk Up (Ground)
sets.description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

battlestadiumsingles.overview: This Pokemon is a new addition to the Regulation D format! If you have any questions or feel it needs more updates, feel free to post here.

sets.name: Guts Attacker
sets.description:
• With Flame Orb, Guts, and an incredible Attack stat, Ursaluna is an extremely brutal wallbreaker!

  • Earthquake versus Headlong Rush: Earthquake is an easier move to recommend, avoiding contact with Rocky Helmet and preserving Ursaluna's hefty bulk. However, Headlong Rush's extra power can better fit the playstyles of Ursaluna that may aim for a sweep rather than just wallbreaking, such as Trick Room and Jolly variants.

  • Drain Punch versus Close Combat: Drain Punch doesn't offer much extra coverage, but it's Ursaluna's only decent way of restoring health. Close Combat's sheer power does make it decent coverage though and can particularly punish Heatran for Terastallizing into a Grass-type.

  • Ice Punch versus Play Rough: Once Ursaluna is burned, Ice Punch will deal so much damage to Dragonite that even the bulkiest sets can not restore all their health with Roost. Play Rough isn't nearly as effective against Dragonite, but when used with Tera Fairy, Ursaluna can now OHKO Urshifu-R before Flame Orb kicks in.

  • Protect: While Ursaluna is powerful, it needs the Flame Orb activation to truly wallbreak, so Protect can help when switching it in isn't easy.

  • Bulk Up versus Swords Dance: Bulk Up is the prefered setup move for making Ursaluna difficult to revenge kill with physical attacks, but Swords Dance does offer some truly absurd wallbreaking potential, allowing Ursaluna to OHKO even physically defensive Ting-Lu with Facade! Swords Dance can also be a better fit on Trick Room teams due to the limited amount of turns Ursaluna has to sweep.

  • Trailblaze: If using Jolly Ursaluna, Trailblaze lets it outspeed key threats such as Zapdos, both Urshifu formes, Mimikyu, and even Speed tie with Timid Thundurus-T!

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Ursaluna benefits from Terastallization, but it's not integral to its wallbreaking prowess.

  • Normal: Beyond getting rid of Ground's annoying weaknesses, Tera Normal turns Ursaluna into an even more fearsome wallbreaker,

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy does a great job of protecting Ursaluna from powerful Fighting-type attacks and Dragonite's Outrage.

  • Ghost: While Tera Ghost does make the matchup against Flutter Mane and Gholdengo worse, the Fighting immunity can turn a match around in the blink of an eye.

  • Water: Tera Water is the prime Tera type to use when in need of an Ice and Water resistance, which is helpful against Urshifu-R and Chien-Pao.

  • Fighting: If using Drain Punch, Tera Fighting is a reasonable option for restoring even more health, at the cost of being rather weak against Flutter Mane.

  • Grass: Tera Gass is a niche option that lets Ursaluna deal extra damage with Trailblaze while resisting Water-type attacks and taking Spore before Flame Orb activates.

Alternate EV Spreads

  • Brave and a 0 Speed IV versus Adamant: On a Trick Room team, this lets Ursaluna underspeed some major Pokemon such as Ting-Lu and Dondozo. However, some Trick Room teams may still prefer Adamant to outspeed such slow Pokemon if they also function outside Trick Room.

  • 140 HP / 252 Atk / 116 SpD with Adamant or Brave: This more specially defensive EV spread survives some powerful attacks even after burn damage, including Timid Choice Specs Tera Fairy Flutter Mane's Moonblast, Thundurus-T's Grass Knot, Timid Greninja's Hydro Pump, and Modest Chi-Yu's Overheat.

  • 4 HP / 252 Atk / 252 Spe with Jolly: Maximizing Speed may seem strange on such a slow Pokemon, but Ursaluna makes fantastic use of it, making Trailblaze viable due to outspeeding even offensive variants of Zapdos after a boost and letting it wallbreak common Pokemon that often don't invest in enough Speed such as Dragonite and Heatran.

Minor Optimizations

  • Female Gender: Since Ursaluna uses contact moves, a female gender will prevent it from being attracted to the rare Cute Charm Enamorus.

sets.name: Bulky Bear
sets.description:
• Ursaluna's great overall bulk makes it a good choice for either spreading Yawn or setting up Bulk Up.

  • Play Rough: Play Rough is Ursaluna's best Attack against both Urshifu formes, which are common switch-ins to bulkier Ursaluna sets.

  • Ice Punch versus Avalanche: Ice Punch is the most reliable option for dealing big damage to Dragonite, but Avalanche deals so much damage if Ursaluna is attacked that even Defensive Mulsticale Dragonite is unable to Roost back to full health.

  • Protect: Protect has great synergy with Yawn and Leftovers, letting Ursaluna put foes to sleep with less risk to itself.

  • Drain Punch: In addition to being a decent option for Ursaluna to restore its health with, it can be especially effective with Bulk Up, making Ursaluna difficult to take down.

Other Options

  • Taunt: Taunt's a great support move for shutting down common support Pokemon like Ting-Lu, but it's rather difficult to fit in.

  • Flame Orb and Facade: Using Guts on a bulkier set may be very counter-intuitive, but with Yawn, this can make Ursaluna very difficult to check.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Ursaluna is fully capable of functioning without Terastallization, but with it, it has far fewer weaknesses.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy is a fantastic response against the Fighting-type attacks that threaten Ursaluna and means Choice Band Dragonite can no longer 2HKO with Outrage.

  • Water: Tera Water is Ursaluna's best shot against Chien-Pao thanks to the Icicle Crash resistance, and it helps against Urshifu-R as well.

  • Fighting: If using Bulk Up and Drain Punch, Tera Fighting gives Ursaluna a prime opportunity to keep restoring its health, though at the cost of doing far worse against Flutter Mane and Mimikyu.

Abilities

  • Guts: Guts is a fantastic option for punishing Will-O-Wisp from foes like Rotom-W and works well for punishing Toxic Spikes.

  • Bulletproof: This more niche option gives Ursaluna immunity to several major moves, such as Focus Blast, Bullet Seed, Sludge Bomb, and Shadow Ball when Terastallized, particularly helping against Gholdengo if using Tera Water or Fighting.

Alternate EV Spreads

  • *140 HP / 252 Atk / 116 SpD with Adamant This more specially bulky spread allows Ursaluna to take on major special threats, avoiding KOs from the likes of Timid Choice Specs Tera Fairy Flutter Mane, Choice Specs Gholdengo's Make It Rain, and Timid Greninja's Hydro Pump.

  • 252 HP / 20 Def / 236 SpD with Careful: This spread allows Ursaluna to avoid a 2HKO from Timid Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Moonblast after Leftovers recovery.

  • 252 HP / 252 Def / 4 Spe with Impish: Maximizing Ursaluna's physical defense means Tera Water will usually avoid a 2HKO from Choice Band Urshifu's Close Combat after Leftovers recovery.

Minor Optimizations

  • Female Gender: A female gender is slightly optimal for avoiding infatuation from the rare Cute Charm Enamorus.

sets.name: Assault Vest
sets.description:
• Ursaluna's excellent power and bulk make it a good, if unexpected, user of Assault Vest.

  • Drain Punch: Drain Punch's bit of extra healing is useful even without being a STAB move.

  • Play Rough: Play Rough is Ursaluna's best option for punishing Urshifu-R switching in.

  • Ice Punch versus Avalanche: Ice Punch is preferred due to its reliable base power, but Avalanche can threaten to damage Multiscale Dragonite past the ability to recover HP back with Roost.

  • Facade: While Facade is rather weak without the reliability of Flame Orb, it's a devestating way to punish status moves and Toxic Spikes.

  • EV Spread: The bulk investment allows Ursaluna to avoid a 2HKO from Timid Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Moonblast after Stealth Rock damage. Some other Special Attacks it takes on include avoiding a 2HKO from defensive Rotom-W's Hydro Pump, avoiding a 2HKO from two consecutive Make It Rains from Choice Specs Gholdengo, and avoiding an OHKO from Tera Water Iron Bundle.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Terastallization isn't needed for Ursaluna to make good use of Assault Vest, but it can help against some common physical threats.

  • Water: Tera Water covers Ursaluna's big Water and Ice weaknesses, helping a great deal against Urshifu-R and Chien-Pao.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy is Ursaluna's best choice for a Fighting resistance, in addition to helping against powerful users of Outrage such as Choice Band Dragonite and Garchomp.

  • Ghost: If using Bulletproof, Tera Ghost is a good way to flip the tables on Fighting-types without compromising Ursaluna against Flutter Mane and Gholdengo.

Abilities

  • Guts: Even if Guts isn't guaranteed to be activated, switching Ursaluna into status moves like Will-O-Wisp can turn it into a wallbreaker in a pinch.

  • Bulletproof: Bulletproof gives Ursaluna a very useful immunity to some attacks that hit it hard, such as Bullet Seed and Focus Blast. The Sludge Bomb and Shadow Ball immunity is also fantastic when Terastallized.

Minor Optimizations

  • Female Gender: While Cute Charm Enamorus is very rare, there's no drawback in using a female gender to become immune to this ability.

sets.name: Swift Swim
sets.description: Choice Band Basculegion-M is one of the most exceptional rain wallbreakers in the metagame owing to its solid Attack stat, access to a very powerful rain-boosted STAB move in Wave Crash, and dependable Speed tier thanks to Swift Swim, allowing it to outrun and KO formidable adversaries like Great Tusk, Iron Valiant, and Gholdengo. Under rain, Wave Crash applies immense pressure even to Water-resistant Pokemon such as Dragapult, Baxcalibur, and Rotom-W. Aqua Jet proves particularly valuable against swifter foes like +1 Iron Valiant, Iron Moth, and Enamorus. Head Smash always 2HKOes Dragonite and OHKOes Baxcalibur and Volcanion, the latter of which can otherwise come in freely thanks to Water Absorb. Psychic Fangs targets key threats such as Amoonguss, Toxapex, and especially Water Absorb Clodsire while also strengthening Basculegion-M's matchup against screens. Liquidation serves as a viable alternative to Head Smash or Psychic Fangs, as it spares Basculegion-M the recoil damage from Wave Crash, enabling it to consistently inflict damage at the cost of some power. Tera Water boosts its Water-type attacks further; for instance, allowing Basculegion-M to OHKO Kingambit and Greninja with Wave Crash while avoiding the OHKO from the former's Sucker Punch. It also lets Basculegion-M take on other Ghost- and Dark-type attacks in a pinch, including from Pokemon like Gholdengo, Dragapult, and Hisuian Samurott. Basculegion-M seamlessly fits into rain teams, making Pelipper an indispensable partner for setting up rain and facilitating free switches via U-turn. The synergy between Basculegion-M and rain sweepers like Battle Bond Greninja, Zapdos, and Walking Wake is truly remarkable, as they can apply immense pressure and overwhelm their shared checks with their rain-boosted attacks. Zapdos proves invaluable for taking on Grass-types such as Amoonguss, Meowscarada, and Rillaboom as well as Water-types like Dondozo, Tera Water Garganacl, Toxapex, and Azumarill. It also grants Basculegion-M switches with Volt Switch and U-turn against Ting-Lu, Garganacl, and Heatran, which get devastated by Wave Crash. Entry hazard support from teammates such as Ting-Lu, Hisuian Samurott, and Iron Treads significantly augments Basculegion-M's ability to dismantle defensive threats like Galarian Slowking, Tera Fairy Garganacl, and Amoonguss. In return, Basculegion-M serves as a proficient spinblocker, threatening opponents like Great Tusk and Iron Treads. Ting-Lu in particular stands out as an exceptional partner, capable of taking hits from Electric-types such as Zapdos and Sandy Shocks and Ghost-types like Dragapult and Gholdengo. Kingambit similarly excels at soaking up Ghost-type attacks while benefiting immensely from Basculegion-M's wallbreaking and ability to exploit Great Tusk, which can enable Kingambit to sweep late-game.

sets.name: Choice Band (Water)
sets.description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

sets.name: Choice Band
sets.description: Swift Swim in conjunction with powerful STAB Wave Crash backed by a high HP stat to offset recoil makes Basculegion-M a premier rain wallbreaker in the tier. Choice Band is the preferred item for more power so long as it has pivots to fall back on, such as Pelipper, Ferrothorn, and Zapdos. Tera Water is the premier Tera option to pump as much power into Wave Crash as possible, allowing it to 2HKO even Water-resistant foes such as Rotom-W and Ferrothorn. Tera Water also removes its weakness to Sucker Punch from the likes of Hisuian Samurott and Mega Mawile, and it maintains its resistance to Bullet Punch from Mega Scizor, although it removes its immunity to Fake Out from Mega Medicham. This also leaves Basculegion-M susceptible to Wave Crash's heavy recoil damage, so Liquidation is used to mitigate this, and it should be used once Basculegion-M’s checks have been worn down in order to ensure that it does not KO itself with recoil. Basculegion-M thus benefits from an offensive partner like Mega Swampert, which can finish off threats weakened by Basculegion-M. Pelipper is necessary to set up rain for Basculegion-M and also serves as a pivot to give it a free switch, something Basculegion-M has trouble doing, as it prefers to preserve its HP for recoil. Other pivots like Eject Button Ferrothorn and Tornadus-T are also helpful to support Basculegion-M by giving a point of entry to start breaking.

sets.name: Choice Specs
sets.description: Basculegion-F finds itself a useful niche on rain teams, that being one of few special rain exploiters in the tier. Its access to Swift Swim as well as strong STAB options in Surf and Shadow Ball allows it to be immensely threatening once it's brought in, and its ability to hit hard on the special side allows it to pick up 2HKOs on many common Water resistances in the tier such as Rotom-W or Toxapex. Swift Swim is a fantastic ability for Basculegion-F, as it allows the capability to run a Modest nature over Timid, boosting Basculegion-F's breaking capabilities even further. A Speed-boosting nature is unnecessary due to hitting a whopping 510 Speed in rain, outrunning almost every Pokemon in the tier except for Choice Scarf Kartana and Iron Valiant in Electric Terrain. Surf is a great option as a reliable STAB move, because its above-average Base Power and perfect accuracy allow it to be spammed with little to no drawback, while Hydro Pump is a great option for the raw power, 2HKOing Tera Grass Heatran with minimal chip damage and OHKOing Mega Charizard Y in sun. Both of these moves are perfectly complemented by Basculegion-F's secondary STAB option, Shadow Ball, which provides neutral coverage against a majority of the metagame. Very few Pokemon can resist Basculegion-F's STAB combination, which is even further bolstered by Ice Beam as a coverage option. Ice Beam allows Basculegion-F to deal serious damage to Pokemon like Tera Grass Heatran and Dragonite. Basculegion-F is also a phenomenal Terastallization user, as it's able to use Tera Water to both shed its weakness to Kingambit's Sucker Punch and boost Surf to terrifying levels of power, making it capable of sweeping most teams with little to no chip damage. Basculegion-F pairs extremely well with Pelipper, since it's able to set rain and use U-turn to bring Basculegion-F in safely. It also appreciates support from the likes of Ferrothorn and Zapdos, as Ferrothorn can answer Iron Valiant's Moonblast and spread chip damage very effectively with Iron Barbs, and Zapdos can check Choice Scarf Kartana and Rillaboom defensively and threaten crippling paralyses. In turn, Basculegion-F supports them back by KOing Pokemon that'd normally be able to force them out or pivot around utilizing resistances and immunities. For example, it can bait Leaf Blade from Kartana to guarantee a safe switch into Zapdos or it can lure Grassy Glide from Rillaboom, allowing Ferrothorn to come in and start spreading chip damage.

sets.name: Unburden Sweeper
sets.description:
Sneasler can take advantage of its unmatched Speed tier after Unburden and its wide coverage to be a dangerous and unpredictable sweeper. Dire Claw can ease setup or secure a sweep by inflicting checks such as Landorus-T, Skeledirge, and Toxapex with sleep or paralysis in a pinch. On the other hand, Gunk Shot is far more powerful, OHKOing Zapdos and Amoonguss after Swords Dance while avoiding the former's Static. Tera Blast Ground allows Sneasler to hit Skeledirge and OHKO Toxapex, defensive Gholdengo, and Galarian Slowking after Swords Dance. Acrobatics, alongside Tera Flying, allows Sneasler to OHKO Great Tusk after Swords Dance and gives it setup opportunities against other Ground-types such as Landorus-T and Iron Treads. Shadow Claw and Night Slash both retain huge damage on Gholdengo in particular and make Sneasler less reliant on Terastallizing to hit it. The choice between the two largely comes down to Tera type; Tera Ghost grants Sneasler an immunity to Dragonite's Extreme Speed and Great Tusk's Rapid Spin, while Tera Dark makes it immune to Future Sight and retains its Sucker Punch resistance after Terastallizing. Tera Dark Night Slash is also Sneasler's best chance at breaking through Tera Ghost Garganacl. An Air Balloon lets Sneasler set up freely against Ground-types such as defensive Great Tusk and Ting-Lu lacking Whirlwind. White Herb is an alternative that allows Sneasler to activate Unburden itself by using Close Combat instead of being reliant on taking a hit and popping Air Balloon to sweep.

Sneasler is at home on hyper offense teams that can wear down opposing defensive cores for it to sweep late-game. Grimmsnarl and Dragapult are excellent teammates for their ability to set dual screens, which ease Sneasler's setup tremendously, especially if it is running Air Balloon and needs to take a hit in order to sweep. Glimmora and Hisuian Samurott are excellent leads that can provide valuable entry hazard support; Hisuian Samurott in particular can threaten many of Sneasler's checks, such as Great Tusk, Skeledirge, and Gholdengo. Other setup sweepers such as Iron Valiant, Kingambit, and Cresselia are good partners that can break through defensive cores for Sneasler or end games if it falls short of a sweep. Zamazenta is particularly valuable in this role, as it benefits immensely from Sneasler's ability to lure and break through shared checks such as Toxapex, Gholdengo, and Zapdos.

sets.name: Utility Status Spreader
sets.description: Sneasler is a fast offensive pivot that is hard to switch into due to its ability to inflict status with Poison Touch. Dire Claw having no downsides thanks to Protective Pads allows Sneasler to spam it, making it hard to switch into for fear of potential status. Fake Out + U-turn can heavily chip down a foe. Fake Out can also be used for revenge killing foes such as Iron Valiant, Greninja, and Meowscarada. It also completely shuts down Focus Sash leads like Hisuian Samurott, which can be KOed by Fake Out + Close Combat before it can set up Spikes. Shadow Claw or Night Slash can be run over Fake Out, allowing Sneasler to hit checks like Gholdengo and Galarian Slowking, but that would limit Sneasler's ability to disrupt opposing teams with Fake Out and U-turn's poison chances and revenge kill faster targets like Booster Energy Iron Valiant. Sneasler takes advantage of its Protective Pads, allowing it to attack freely without any adverse side effects, preventing status or chip damage from Zapdos, Moltres, Garchomp, and miscellaneous Rocky Helmet users like Corviknight and Landorus-T. Tera Fighting is used for maximum Close Combat damage, letting it 2HKO even Corviknight. Sneasler works well on hazard-stacking teams that appreciate it spreading status and forcing switches, racking up even more damage. Sneasler struggles against Amoonguss, Toxapex, Galarian Slowking, and Dragapult, so good teammates to cover these would be Kingambit, Gholdengo, and Ting-Lu. Kingambit greatly appreciates the chip damage and status Sneasler provides, which helps it grab those OHKOs that it normally couldn't, and it can consistently switch into Dragapult and Galarian Slowking to set up on them. Ting-Lu is able to wall Dragapult and Galarian Slowking with its typing and enormous bulk while being able to set up hazards for further chip. Garganacl is another example of a bulky partner, as its Stealth Rock and Salt Cure damage pair well with Sneasler's status and chip damage.

sets.name: Choice Band
sets.description: Equipped with a Choice Band, Sneasler makes for a great speedy wallbreaker as well as a great pivot, being able to outspeed the likes of Cinderace, non-Choice Scarf Enamorus, as well as unboosted Walking Wake and Iron Valiant. A strong offensive STAB combination of Close Combat and Dire Claw allows Sneasler to threaten bulky Pokemon such as Garganacl, Ting-Lu, Heatran, and Hatterene. Dire Claw is noteworthy, as it has a good chance to cripple its checks such as Landorus-T and Galarian Slowking with status. U-turn not only allows Sneasler to pivot out of its checks, but it can also poison foes with Poison Touch, allowing its teammates to get easier KOs. Shadow Claw or Night Slash allows Sneasler to deal great damage to Skeledirge, Gholdengo, and Galarian Slowking. Tera Fighting further boosts Close Combat's power, allowing it to guarantee 2HKOs against walls it would normally struggle with such as defensive Great Tusk and Dondozo. Sneasler is best utilized on offensive teams, where it can use its wallbreaking abilities to enable sweeps from its teammates. In addition, sweepers and cleaners such as Dragonite, Choice Scarf Enamorus, Swords Dance Iron Valiant, and Kingambit all appreciate Sneasler wearing down their checks with poison or crippling them with paralysis or sleep to give its teammates setup opportunities. Entry hazard support from the likes of Hisuian Samurott and Landorus-T are appreciated, as their hazards wear down incoming foes for Sneasler to wallbreak more easily. For example, Sneasler can OHKO offensive Volcanion and fully defensive Enamorus-T with Close Combat and Dire Claw, respectively, after Stealth Rock damage. Sneasler struggles to break through certain defensive Pokemon such as Landorus-T and Toxapex. Hence, it appreciates Pokemon that can wear them down such as Bulk Up or Ice Spinner Great Tusk and Choice Specs Walking Wake, respectively. Lastly, Sneasler doesn't want to attack Zapdos or Moltres in fear of triggering Static and Flame Body, respectively. Therefore, it appreciates teammates that can offensively check them such as Choice Specs Dragapult.

sets.name: Choice Scarf
sets.description:
Choice Scarf lets Sneasler take its already incredible Speed tier to new heights, putting it ahead of the entire unboosted and even most of the boosted metagame, including +1 Iron Valiant, Roaring Moon, Enamorus, Walking Wake, and even both Basculegion formes under rain. This impressive Speed tier in combination with a high Attack stat and great choices for STAB moves in Close Combat and Dire Claw make Sneasler an effective revenge killer. Sneasler is very good at spreading status via the combination of Poison Touch, Dire Claw, and U-turn, enabling it to wear down its own checks that are vulnerable to poison, like Great Tusk, Dragapult, Zapdos, and Skeledirge. Switcheroo hinders defensive Pokemon like Corviknight, Dondozo, and especially Poison-types that are both unbothered by Sneasler's STAB attacks and immune to poison, such as Galarian Slowking, Amoonguss, and Toxapex. It also frees up Sneasler to change moves, which is desirable in matchups against defensive teams where Sneasler is already fast enough without its Choice Scarf. Shadow Claw and Night Slash fulfil the same role, being used as Sneasler's best option to hit Dragapult, Galarian Slowking, and Gholdengo. Shadow Claw has better neutral coverage, as it isn't resisted by Fairy-types and Fighting-types like Iron Valiant, Enamorus, and Zamazenta; however, there is nothing immune to Night Slash, making it slightly better at spreading status through Poison Touch. Tera Fighting's boost to Close Combat can help Sneasler sweep late-game while also specifically achieving an OHKO on offensive Cinderace as well as a 2HKO on offensive Great Tusk.

Choice Scarf Sneasler performs best on offensive teams that benefit from its ability to revenge kill a plethora of threats. Sneasler's ability to spread status on the likes of Great Tusk, Zapdos, and Landorus-T can be very beneficial to Pokemon that share these checks, like Kingambit, Zamazenta, and Great Tusk itself. It is able to support these Pokemon further by presenting them with opportunities to switch in via U-turn. This can be even further leveraged by pairing Sneasler with other U-turn and Volt Switch users like Cinderace and Zapdos. Spikes and Stealth Rock from the likes of Ting-Lu, Great Tusk, and Hisuian Samurott helps to soften up Sneasler's checks for it to potentially sweep late-game. Ting-Lu additionally is able to switch in on Ghost-types that cause Sneasler trouble like Dragapult and Gholdengo. Defensive Poison-types like Galarian Slowking and Amoonguss are a thorn in Sneasler's side, as they cannot be poisoned and take little damage from Sneasler's STAB attacks. Pokemon able to exploit them like Gholdengo and Heatran are necessary, and they greatly appreciate being brought into these threats by U-turn to boot.

sets.name: Choice Scarf (Poison)
sets.description:
Choice Scarf Sneasler is one of the best cleaners for Poison teams thanks to its powerful STAB moves, like Dire Claw and Close Combat, along with U-turn, which allows Poison teams to preserve momentum while threatening poison with Poison Touch. Choice Scarf allows Sneasler to outspeed Choice Specs Flutter Mane, Regieleki, and opposing Choice Scarf threats like Hisuian Samurott, Enamorus, Iron Treads, Iron Valiant, Roaring Moon and Cinderace. Dire Claw paired with Sneasler's ability Poison Touch gives it a 41.67% chance to inflict poison upon foes, which helps to gradually wear down walls like Ting-Lu and Quagsire, along with a 23.33% chance to inflict paralysis or sleep, disrupting the threat that opposing sweepers pose to the team. While Steel-types are immune to Sneasler's Dire Claw, it can still threaten some of them such as Heatran and Iron Treads with Close Combat. Paired with Switcheroo, it is able to deny opposing walls like Toxapex and Corviknight recovery by passing them the Choice Scarf and forcing them to lock into one move. With the threat of Switcheroo, it also reduces the threat of Pokemon like Dragon Dance Dragonite.

Sneasler pairs well with Amoonguss, which threatens to use Spore against foes and threatens walls like Quagsire and Gastrodon with Giga Drain, along with offensive Pokemon like Great Tusk and Landorus-T. Although Amoonguss can act as a switch-in to Landorus-T, it gets completely countered by its Substitute + Bulk Up set. In addition to that, Amoonguss can use Foul Play to dissuade Ghost-type wallbreakers like Dragapult and Mimikyu from setting up with Dragon Dance and Swords Dance, respectively. Galarian Slowking also synergizes incredibly well with Sneasler, as they form a pivoting core with U-turn and Chilly Reception. Galarian Slowking appreciates Sneasler breaking through Steel-types and spreading status, and Galarian Slowking can support Sneasler by threatening opposing Poison-types with Future Sight, switching in on Gholdengo and threatening it with Flamethrower, and tanking one Earth Power from Landorus and OHKOing it with Ice Beam if Galarian Slowking is running Assault Vest. Toxapex can set up Toxic Spikes for Sneasler to clean easily while the opposing team takes residual damage. It also forms a Regenerator core with Amoonguss and Galarian Slowking and aids Alolan Muk against setup with Haze, thus synergizing well with the momentum provided by Sneasler's U-turn. Alolan Muk is also a great partner for Sneasler, as it provides an immunity to Psychic-type attacks and boasts great special bulk, which allows it to tank attacks from Choice Specs Dragapult and Spectrier and threaten them with Knock Off. Glimmora can set Stealth Rock to support Sneasler's cleaning capability and spin away entry hazards to prevent Sneasler from being worn down, as well as threatening slow Great Tusk with Energy Ball and being a Ground-immune Pokemon that Sneasler can pivot into with Air Balloon. Iron Moth and Salazzle greatly benefit from Choice Scarf Sneasler beating threats like Flutter Mane and Chien-Pao, allowing them to take out foes like Corviknight, Gholdengo, and Klefki, which Sneasler can't break. Salazzle and Glimmora also form a Corrosion core, which helps in the Poison mirror matchup, which Sneasler struggles with. Clodsire is a great teammate to absorb attacks from Iron Valiant, Greninja, and Skeledirge.

sets.name: Boots Pivots (Poison)
sets.description:
Sneasler fills a very unique role on Poison teams, as it's the best offensive pivot the type has access to thanks to an incredible base 130 Attack and 120 Speed stats. U-turn combined with Heavy-Duty Boots will allow it to stay safe throughout the entire game by switching out against an opposing threat to bring that can deal with it; in addition, U-turn comes with a 30% chance to poison thanks to Poison Touch ,which helps make progress when Toxic Spikes aren't down or against Flying-types. Close Combat is a strong nuke against many of the tier's common Dark- and Steel-types like Hydreigon, Kingambit, and Heatran along with other notable Fighting-weak threats such as Baxcalibur, Ursaluna and Hisuian Arcanine. Dire Claw's incredible chance to inflect status allows it to not only slash through prominent Fairy-types like Choice Specs Iron Valiant and Hatterene but also to make progress in matchups where its traits aren't as valuable like Ghost by inflicting crippling statuses on targets like Hisuian Zoroark and Skeledirge. Fake Out can chip threats down and rack up poison damage or fish for poison before using U-turn to leave, while Taunt takes advantage of Sneasler's incredible speed can stop the dangerous status effects from Salazzle and Amoonguss or recovery moves from Toxapex and Corviknight on Flying teams.

Thanks to U-turn, Sneasler can bring in teammates such as specially defensive Alolan Muk or physically defensive Amoonguss to handle would-be answers. In particular, Alolan Muk for with special Psychic- and Ghost-types like Galarian Slowking, Gholdengo, and Basculegion-F with its strong STAB Knock Off. Physically defensive Amoonguss can be bought in on many of the Ground- and Water-types that threaten Sneasler like Great Tusk, Quagsire, and Urshifu-R. Any other physical threat that can threaten Sneasler like Kleavor, Hisuian Arcanine, or Swords Dance Mimikyu can be dealt with by physically bulky Rocky Helmet Toxapex thanks to Infestation trapping and Haze to deal with boosts. Galarian Slowking's incredible special bulk can allow it to sponge hits for Sneasler from powerful special attackers such as Zapdos, Articuno, and Moltres and then safely pivot back into Sneasler with Chilly Reception; it can also use Future Sight combined with Sneasler's incredible Fighting STAB move to deal immense damage to any foe wishing to tank the hits for its team. Air Balloon Glimmora is a valuable ally that can fight off Ground-types like Choice Scarf Iron treads and Sandy Shocks, hit powerful Flying-Type threats like Moltres and Dragonite with Power Gem, remove hazards if Sneasler loses its Heavy-Duty Boots, and put threats that Sneasler detests such as Toxapex, Corviknight and Sableye on a timer with Corrosion Toxic. Salazzle can also spread Toxic against these threats and use Encore to punish setup from Hisuian Goodra and Kingambit. Choice Scarf Gengar helps majorly against Ghost-types that can outspeed Sneasler like Spectrier, Dragapult. and Flutter Mane while Choice Specs with Icy Wind can remove high profile threats like Garchomp and both formes of Landorus, with both Choice sets having powerful coverage in Thunderbolt to shock Flying-Types such as Moltres, Corviknight, and Pelipper.

sets.name: Unburden Sweeper (Poison)
sets.description:
Night Slash with Close Combat lets Sneasler make quick work of Steel teams, while Acrobatics lets it greatly damage Great Tusk. Gunk Shot lets Sneasler OHKO Amoongus and Rotom-W at +2.

This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

battlestadiumsingles.overview: This Pokemon is a new addition to the Regulation D format! If you have any questions or feel it needs more updates, feel free to post here.

sets.name: GottaGoFast (Unburden Sweeper)
sets.description:
• With its good Speed tier and access to Unburden, Sneasler is one of the most potent cleaners in the metagame.

  • Dire Claw: Dire Claw is Sneasler’s preferred Poison STAB move due to its highly disruptive secondary effects, making it a very difficult move to switch into, even for Pokemon that wall it like Dondozo.

  • Fake Out: With a Normal Gem, Fake Out offers both good chip damage and the ability to safely activate Unburden.

  • Swords Dance: While it can be difficult to fit and somewhat risky to go for, Swords Dance allows Sneasler to increase its damage output and clean through teams more reliably.

  • Acrobatics - Acrobatics is a natural pairing with Unburden, providing a massively powerful Flying-type attack once Sneasler’s item is used.

  • Shadow Claw: Shadow Claw is an option to allow Sneasler to better handle otherwise problematic foes, such as Gholdengo.

  • Female Optimization: With the presence of Cute Charm Enamorus, it is recommended that physical attackers be female to avoid potential infatuation upon attacking Enamorus.

Items

  • Normal Gem: When combined with Fake Out, this is Sneasler’s safest way to activate Unburden.

  • White Herb: While less easily activated, not relying on a specific move to activate Unburden allows Sneasler to diversify its move selection more, becoming more of a threat.

EV Spreads

  • 92 HP / 252 Atk / 4 Def / 4 SpD/ 156 Spe with Adamant: This spread allows Sneasler to outspeed up to Booster Energy Flutter Mane and Iron Bundle well as Choice Scarfed Dragapult once Unburden is active without compromising on Power.

  • 76 HP / 252 Atk / Def / 4 SpD / 116 Spe with Adamant: This spread sacrifices some Speed to survive Jolly Urshifu-R’s Surging Strikes and and Modest Gholdengo’s Make It Rain, at the cost of no longer outspeeding Choice Scarf Dragapult with Unburden.

  • 60 HP / 228 Atk / 60 Def / 4 SpD / 156 Spe with Adamant: This spread survives Jolly Urshifu-R’s Surging Strikes and Modest Gholdengo’s Make It Rain without compromising on Speed; however, it loses out on immediate power.

Tera Types

  • Flying-type: Tera Flying gives Sneasler an immunity to Ground-type attacks, allowing it to set up on foes such as Landorus while also boosting the power of Acrobatics even further.

  • Ghost-type: Tera Ghost grants Sneasler an immunity to Extreme Speed, notably allowing it to more consistently beat Dragonite.

  • Ice-type: When used alongside Tera Blast, Tera Ice allows Sneasler to more reliably beat foes like Landorus-T and Dragonite.

sets.name: Swords Dance
sets.description:
Sneasler is a deadly sweeper with its high Attack stat in conjunction with Swords Dance and Unburden. Dire Claw is generally preferred over Gunk Shot for its perfect accuracy and a high chance to cripple the target with status. However, Gunk Shot has considerably more power, allowing Sneasler to OHKO most Zapdos at +2. Acrobatics is Sneasler's most spammable attack, especially if it has Terastallized, as it hits many neutral targets such as Tornadus, Dragapult, and Toxapex for high damage. Sneasler should be brought out when the Terrain matching its item is active, consuming its item and boosting Acrobatics. Alternatively, Tera Ground with Tera Blast can be used to deal massive damage to Gholdengo, Toxapex, and Skeledirge. An Electric Seed or Psychic Seed is recommended to instantly activate Unburden, and the boost to Sneasler's otherwise poor defenses may also facilitate setup. Tera Flying turns Sneasler's Ground weakness into an immunity, which often buys it a turn to set up. Tera Flying also grants STAB on Acrobatics, allowing Sneasler to OHKO Dragapult and physically defensive Great Tusk with Acrobatics after a Swords Dance.

Sneasler serves as an excellent late-game cleaner on hyper offense teams. Entry hazard setters such as Mega Diancie or Landorus-T are useful teammates to help wear down Snealser's checks, such as Toxapex and opposing Landorus-T, into KO range for its attacks. Given Sneasler's item, a Terrain-setting partner such as Tapu Koko or Tapu Lele is mandatory. Tapu Koko provides entry opporunities with Volt Switch and U-turn while also setting Reflect and Light Screen, which facilitates setup. Tapu Lele pressures Toxapex, and its Psychic Terrain blocks priority attacks such as Bullet Punch from Mega Scizor, Fake Out from Mega Lopunny, and Sucker Punch from Kingambit, all of which can otherwise pick off a weakened Sneasler. However, one should be aware that Psychic Terrain will no longer block priority moves against a Tera Flying Snealser that has Terastallized. Other offensive partners that synergize well with Sneasler include Kingambit, Dragonite, and Volcarona, all of which can either assist in breaking through Sneasler's checks, such as Landorus-T, Gliscor, or Toxapex, or finish off a team weakened by Sneasler.

sets.name: Pivot
sets.description: Sneasler can use its combination of high Attack and Speed to function as a potent pivot, racking up chip damage against defensive Pokemon such as Landorus-T, Zapdos, Great Tusk, and other tanks. Its ability, Poison Touch, alongside Dire Claw allows it to spread status and cripple its checks, mainly to enable Hex Dragapult and hit would-be checks like Toxapex, Gastrodon, and Clefable for massive damage. Heavy-Duty Boots allows Sneasler to ignore Stealth Rock and Spikes to continue switching in and retain its offensive presence throughout the game. However, Sneasler is also hindered by contact punishment from the likes of Ferrothorn, defensive Landorus-T and Garchomp, and Zapdos, so Protective Pads helps provide more longevity. U-turn allows Sneasler to function as a pivot, bringing in other offensive threats such as Dragapult along with other special attackers like Tapu Lele to take advantage of physical tanks that can wall Sneasler such as Toxapex, Gliscor, and Landorus-T. U-turn also allows it to easily spread poison with Poison Touch. Fire Punch allows Sneasler to hit Gholdengo, which is immune to its STAB combination, and also dent Mega Scizor. Night Slash could be considered as an alternative to hit Dragapult switching in while also still hitting Gholdengo. Fake Out is another possibility to allow Sneasler to safely poison faster threats. However, Sneasler is easily checked by faster Pokemon that can threaten to revenge kill it such as offensive Tornadus-T, Choice Scarf users such as Urshifu-R or Landorus-T, and powerful priority users like Extreme Killer Dragonite. As such, Sneasler benefits from having a sturdy defensive backbone with Pokemon like Toxapex or Ferrothorn to tank hits that Sneasler dislikes. Sneasler also forces a lot of switches, so it benefits from allies that can set hazards like Ferrothorn, Skarmory, or Heatran, which also switch in on Flying- and Psychic-type moves for Sneasler. Sneasler also has a tendency to be completely walled by the likes of Toxapex, Gliscor, and Landorus-T and benefits greatly from having allies that it can pivot to in order to exploit these checks for damage, like Tapu Lele or Zapdos.

sets.name: Choice Scarf (Fighting)
sets.description: Choice Scarf Sneasler is an extremely fast revenge killer that decimates Choice Scarf Tapu Lele, Quark Drive-boosted Iron Valiant, and Adamant Sand Rush Excadrill for Fighting teams. Close Combat and Dire Claw have near-perfect synergy, aside from Dire Claw's ability to punish passive answers—like Toxapex and Slowbro—that swap into its STAB moves. U-turn pivots Sneasler out of switch-ins such as Skeledirge, Aegislash, and Gliscor, bringing in Choice Specs Iron Valiant and Mega Gallade. Switcheroo further punishes walls like Corviknight if the extra speed is unneeded. Alternatively, Rock Slide lets it revenge kill Quiver Dance Volcarona, freeing up a moveslot on Iron Hands, while Toxic Spikes greatly pressure Fairy teams wary of Dire Claw. Night Slash can also be the final move for Sneasler, as it notably hits Gholdengo and Aegislash, but pivoting out of these threats is usually the better option. Choice Scarf Sneasler is a late-game cleaner, so wallbreakers and setup sweepers such as the aforementioned Kommo-o and Mega Gallade are appreciated, as these deal with Corviknight, Gliscor, and Toxapex. Kommo-o also benefits from Sneasler dealing with Fairy-types, as this allows Kommo-o to use Clangorous Soulblaze. Choice Specs Iron Valiant loves being pivoted in safely against physical walls like Skeledirge and Mega Sableye, which wall Sneasler. Assault Vest Iron Hands is a soft check against Gholdengo and Volcarona and can pivot Sneasler in against walls, which it can inconvenience. Hisuian Lilligant and Breloom deal with Gastrodon and Quagsire and also ease the Water and Ground matchups. As with the other setup sweepers, these also love the setup opportunities Sneasler opens up by being able to punish walls with Dire Claw's additional effects or with Switcheroo. Entry hazard support from Cobalion and Great Tusk is also appreciated, and these provide a secondary answer to Mimikyu and Zeraora, respectively. These teammates also appreciate Sneasler's ability to remove Toxic Spikes, greatly easing the matchup against Water and Poison teams.

sets.name: Entry Hazard Support (Poison)
sets.description:
56 Spe EVs outspeeds Jolly Azumarill.

This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

sets.name: Choice Specs
sets.description:
Choice Specs Enamorus is a ferocious wallbreaker thanks to its amazing STAB move and coverage moves in tandem with a massive Special Attack stat. These attributes are further bolstered by Enamorus's solid Speed tier, outspeeding the likes of Zapdos, Landorus-T, and Hydreigon. Earth Power synergizes amazingly well with Moonblast, hitting Steel-types such as Gholdengo, Kingambit, and Heatran. It also targets the likes of Galarian Slowking, Iron Moth, Toxapex, and Volcanion. Mystical Fire hits Pokemon like Air Balloon Gholdengo and Corviknight that would otherwise resist Moonblast and be immune to Earth Power while outright OHKOing Scizor. Psychic operates as a middle ground between Earth Power and Mystical Fire against most Poison-types, having a chance to OHKO Amoonguss after Stealth Rock and catching Tera Poison Cresselia off-guard. It is also Enamorus's strongest attack against Moltres. Tera Fairy boosts Enamous's Moonblast to absolutely horrifying levels, 2HKOing even Pokemon that resist Fairy like Gholdengo, bulky Cinderace, and Scizor. Tera Ground turns Enamorus's weaknesses to Rock and Electric into a resistance and immunity, making it less threatened by Stealth Rock damage and letting it find opportunities to switch in against the likes of Zapdos and Sandy Shocks. It also boosts Earth Power, letting it OHKO Garganacl and Toxapex. Tera Steel bolsters Enamorus's defensive profile, making it less vulnerable to Poison-types like Galarian Slowking, Amoonguss, and Toxapex while also preventing it being revenge killed by moves like Dragonite's Extreme Speed.

Choice Specs Enamorus is a solid pick on hyper offense and bulky offense teams as a monstrous wallbreaker, tearing apart common bulky Pokemon like Great Tusk, Dondozo, Garganacl, and Ting-Lu. Entry hazard support from the likes of Hisuian Samurott, Ting-Lu, Garganacl, and Heatran help ease prediction for Enamorus, chipping Pokemon like Air Balloon Gholdengo, Amoonguss, and Scizor that could otherwise play around it. Hazard control from the likes of Great Tusk, Hatterene, and Corviknight is essential for giving Enamorus more opportunities to switch in. Late-game cleaners and sweepers such as Kingambit, Swords Dance Sneasler, Battle Bond Greninja, and Calm Mind Cresselia appreciate Enamorus breaking through and overwhelming Pokemon like Ting-Lu, bulky Gholdengo, Toxapex, and Skeledirge, enabling them to clean in the late-game. Enamorus's ability to break through the likes of Great Tusk, Dondozo, and Garganacl means that physical attackers like Kingambit, Dragonite, and Cinderace make for excellent partners, as in return, they can threaten Pokemon like Amoonguss and Scizor. Offensive pivots like Dragapult and Cinderace create offensive momentum for Enamorus to capitalize off of, baiting Dark- and Ground-type moves that Enamorus can safely switch into. Slower pivots like Galarian Slowking and Rotom-W can let Enamorus switch in without taking any damage, further boosting momentum.

sets.name: Calm Mind
sets.description:
Calm Mind Enamorus is a potent sweeper thanks to its high Special Attack and Speed as well as complementary coverage moves. Earth Power lets Enamorus threaten Pokemon that resist Moonblast such as Galarian Slowking, Cinderace, Toxapex, Iron Moth, Heatran, and Clodsire. Enamorus can complement its coverage with Mystical Fire, which allows it to hit Corviknight and Air Balloon Gholdengo. Substitute is another option that lets Enamorus take advantage of the switches it forces and thus find more room to set up. Substitute also protects it from status conditions such as Amoonguss's Spore and Toxapex and Clodsire's Toxic. Agility is another alternative that lets Enamorus outspeed and thus threaten fast offensive Pokemon that would otherwise try to revenge kill it such as Cinderace, Zamazenta, and Dragapult. Timid is the preferred nature, as it lets Enamorus outspeed the likes of Zapdos, Sandy Shocks, and Garchomp, while Modest is usually seen alongside Agility. Heavy-Duty Boots removes Enamorus's weakness to Stealth Rock, letting it come into the field safely throughout the game. Leftovers grants Enamorus recovery and is usually used with Substitute to slowly heal and potentially set up more Substitutes. Life Orb is a more offensive option that increases Enamorus's damage output, letting it secure OHKOs against Choice Band Hoopa-U and even neutral targets such as Zapdos after one Calm Mind. Cute Charm is used over Contrary, as the latter conflicts with Calm Mind, and the former can potentially infatuate opposing male Pokemon, granting Enamorus free turns to set up. Tera Fairy makes Enamorus's Moonblast nearly unwallable, as even resistances such as Corviknight are potentially 2HKOed after one Calm Mind. Tera Ground, on the other hand, boosts Enamorus's Earth Power and turns its weakness to Poison into a resistance, which lets it deny revenge killing attempts from Sneasler and Iron Moth and turns soft checks such as Galarian Slowking into setup fodder. Tera Steel is yet another alternative that improves Enamorus's matchup against Poison-types, particularly Amoonguss, and lets it deny revenge killing attempts from Dragonite's Extreme Speed.

Enamorus fits better on hyper offense and bulky offense teams. Entry hazard setters that fit on these playstyles, such as Great Tusk, Ting-Lu, Glimmora, and Hisuian Samurott, can slowly chip at the opposing team, making it easier for Enamorus to clean up late-game. Enamorus, in turn, denies opportunities for opposing Great Tusk to come in and remove the hazards away with Rapid Spin thanks to its higher Speed and resistance to both of Great Tusk's STAB moves. Its good matchup against Great Tusk, as well as Zamazenta and Dondozo, makes Enamorus a great Kingambit teammate, as it can cover Kingambit's would-be checks. Kingambit, in return, can help against Choice Scarf Gholdengo and Galarian Slowking, which can be troublesome for Enamorus. Choice Specs Dragapult can weaken soft checks that can shrug off one of its or Enamorus's hits, such as Rotom-W, Zapdos, Ursaluna, and Azumarill, and appreciates Enamorus's ability to switch into Dark-type attacks from Hisuian Samurott and Hoopa-U and threaten them back.

sets.name: Choice Scarf
sets.description:
Equipped with a Choice Scarf, Enamorus serves as a great cleaner and revenge killer, outspeeding and threatening some of the tier's most common threats like Dragapult and Zamazenta. Earth Power is great coverage against Pokemon that would switch into Moonblast, such as Heatran, Gholdengo, and Galarian Slowking. Mystical Fire allows Enarmous to 2HKO Air Balloon Gholdengo, which otherwise walls it, and also has a good chance to 2HKO Amoonguss with Stealth Rock support. Tera Fairy boosts Enamorus's already powerful Moonblast, capable of 2HKOing Ting-Lu and physically defensive Garganacl. Tera Ground boosts Earth Power, guaranteeing OHKOs against Kingambit and Volcanion as well as 2HKOing physically defensive variants of both Toxapex and Galarian Slowking, while Tera Steel grants Enamorus many resistances including Fairy and Ice; both also reduce its weakness to Stealth Rock at the cost of taking Spikes damage. Contrary is Enamorus's preferred ability, helping it against Mystical Fire, Parting Shot, and, if Terastallized, Sticky Webs.

Enamorus serves as a great late-game cleaner on various offense teams. It appreciates entry hazard support from the likes of Heatran, Hisuian Samurott, and Landorus-T, so Enamorus can have an easier time to sweep against weakened foes. The three of them can also wallbreak for Enamorus, with Heatran being able to 2HKO both Corviknight and Amoonguss, comma while Hisuian Samurott and Landorus-T can both threaten Galarian Slowking. Teammates like Cinderace and Great Tusk that can remove Stealth Rock make valuable partners. Enamorus dislikes special walls that can hinder it like Dondozo, Assault Vest Toxapex, Cresselia, and Slowking. Hence, teammates that can break down bulkier teams like offensive Zapdos and Kingambit make for good teammates. Zapdos can 2HKO both Toxapex and Dondozo with Thunderbolt, and Kingambit can threaten both Cresselia and Slowking. Kingambit and Enamorus can also both facilitate sweeps for the other, with Kingambit beating Galarian Slowking for Enamorus and Enamorus being able to beat Zamazenta and Great Tusk for Kingambit. Enamorus also pairs well with slower yet bulky wallbreakers such as Ursaluna to deal with offense teams, and in return, Enamorus can provide them Healing Wish support. Lastly, Gholdengo makes for another great partner, as it can switch into Sneasler that can otherwise threaten Enamorus, switch into anticipated status such as Thunder Wave, and also keep hazards onfield placed by Enamorus's teammates.

sets.name: Choice Scarf (Flying)
sets.description:
Enamorus is an excellent revenge killer on Flying teams due to its vast coverage, cleric support via Healing Wish, and amazing Speed, allowing it to outpace Hisuian Lilligant after a Victory Dance as well as Choice Specs Greninja, and Chien-Pao, easing the Dark matchup. Moonblast checks foes with Ice-type coverage moves like Pawmot, Chien-Pao, and Greninja, as well as 2HKOing Assault Vest Iron Hands. Superpower hits Steel-types like Kingambit, Hisuian Goodra, and Air Balloon Heatran, allowing Enamorus to snowball Steel teams with Contrary once Gholdengo has been removed. Alternatively, Mystical Fire hits Air Balloon Gholdengo and Corviknight. Earth Power hits Heatran, Toxapex, and Skeledirge, further improving the Steel and Poison matchups. Healing Wish gives new life to setup sweepers like Dragonite, Landorus-T, and Galarian Moltres. Iron Head is another option to hit Flutter Mane and opposing Enamorus; however, Enamorus's other coverage options hit more foes and are generally more valuable.

Corviknight checks a plethora of foes, including Flutter Mane, Chien-Pao, and Choice Scarf Greninja, as well as providing Defog support to preserve Enamorus's longevity so it can fight off Sucker Punch Kingambit; however, Landorus-T and Landorus offer an Electric-type immunity, checking threats like Regieleki, Sandy Shocks, and Magnezone. Furthermore, Bulk Up Landorus-T is a massive asset in the Poison and Steel matchups, notably setting up on Amoonguss and forcing Heatran out. Dragonite is fearsome in the Water and Flying mirror matchups and heavily appreciates Healing Wish support in return. Moltres is a great check to Chien-Pao, Kingambit, and Gholdengo due to its excellent bulk and ability to burn the former two. Articuno's exemplary bulk and neutrality to Ice-type moves is heavily appreciated, allowing it to check Greninja and Basculegion-F with Freeze-Dry to further improve the Water matchup Zapdos spreads paralysis via Static and Discharge as well as aiding in the Water matchup. In return, Enamorus removes Choice Specs Greninja to let Zapdos effectively wall most Water teams. Galarian Moltres is great in the Ghost matchup, taking on Gholdengo, Skeledirge, and Spectrier.

sets.name: Choice Specs
sets.description: Choice Specs Enamorus is a potent wallbreaker, utilizing its strong Moonblast alongside colorful coverage to punch severe holes into defensive cores. Earth Power and Mystical Fire complement its STAB Moonblast well, with the former hitting Toxapex, Clodsire, Gholdengo, and Heatran, while the latter OHKOes Ferrothorn and Mega Scizor. Focus Blast grants Enamorus its strongest attack to hit Garganacl and Mega Tyranitar, which could otherwise survive Earth Power and Moonblast, respectively, while Psychic provides a safer middle ground option for Toxapex Clodsire, and Mega Venusaur, which staves off its attacks otherwise. Tera Fairy grants Enamorus a power boost to Moonblast, notably allowing it to secure OHKOs against the likes of Landorus-T and Rotom-W, which would barely survive it otherwise. Enamorus fits best on bulky offense teams that appreciate its wallbreaking power while being able to support it adequately. Pivots such as Mega Lopunny, Landorus-T, and Tornadus-T grant Enamorus free switch in opportunities against Great Tusk, opposing Landorus-T, and Rotom-W. The latter two pivots and Great Tusk, also provide entry hazard removal, which aids Enamorus given its Stealth Rock weakness. Enamorus works well with fast cleaners such as Choice Scarf Tapu Lele and Choice Scarf Kartana, as they appreciate Enamorus punching holes into the likes of Gholdengo and Mega Scizor for the latter two to clean up weakened defensive cores.

sets.name: Calm Mind
sets.description: Calm Mind Enamorus serve as a solid wallbreaker, using forced switches from the likes of Great Tusk and Garchomp to set up. It is incredibly difficult to switch into after a boost given its strong Moonblast alongside coverage options in Earth Power and Mystical Fire to hit Fairy-resistant foes such as Heatran, Toxapex, and Ferrothorn, respectively. Alternatively, Enamorus can forgo Mystical Fire for Substitute to take advantage of pivoting attempts as well as sponge attacks from revenge killers such as Mega Lopunny and Iron Valiant, although it makes it less effective at hitting Ferrothorn and Mega Scizor. If using Substitute, Enamorus can opt for Leftovers instead of the standard Heavy-Duty Boots to potentially set up more Substitutes. Tera Ground boosts the power of Earth Power, allowing it to KO most Toxapex and Gholdengo sets after a boost, as well as giving it an immunity to Tapu Koko and Rotom-W's Electric-type attacks. Enamorus fits best on bulky offense and offense teams that appreciate its use as an early- to mid-game wallbreaker while granting it sufficient opportunities to enter the field. Therefore, pivots such as Mega Lopunny and Landorus-T pair well with it, bringing Enamorus in on physical walls it can exploit such as Great Tusk, Buzzwole, and Skarmory. Additionally, Pursuit trappers such as Mega Tyranitar and Weavile eliminate special walls such as Clodsire and Gholdengo that can serve as a roadblock to Enamorus. Fast late-game cleaners such as Choice Scarf Tapu Lele and Choice Scarf Kartana appreciate Enamorus, as they capitalize on it weakening or removing Steel-types for them to clean up.

sets.name: Choice Scarf
sets.description: Choice Scarf Enamorus functions as an interesting revenge killer, being able to KO a range of setup sweepers such as Dragonite, Mega Gyarados, Baxcalibur, and even a weakened Volcarona courtesy of its great speed tier. Additionally, it can serve as a late-game cleaner once its checks such as Toxapex, Gholdengo, and Assault Vest Tornadus-T have been weakened by its teammates. However, its Stealth Rock weakness and relative frailty mean Enamorus struggles to withstand repeated switches as well as priority moves from the likes of Urshifu-R and Mega Lopunny. Tera Fairy boosts the power of Moonblast, notably allowing it to 2HKO Assault Vest Tornadus-T after Stealth Rock. Aside from coverage to hit Steel-types in Mystical Fire and Earth Power, Healing Wish can bring back a weakened teammate in a pinch, potentially being able to change the tide of a game. Therefore, Enamorus fits best on offense teams that appreciate its utility in Healing Wish while providing a positive matchup against opposing offensive teams. Powerful wallbreakers such as Baxcalibur and Volcarona appreciate Enamorus's Healing Wish, giving them a second lease on life, while Enamorus in turn capitalizes on them weakening the likes of Toxapex and Mega Scizor to clean late-game. Enamorus also greatly enjoys entry hazard removal support from Rotom-W, Tornadus-T, or Great Tusk, as it minimalizes its Stealth Rock weakness so it can switch in more effectively mid-game. Enamorus struggles with special wall such as Clodsire and Gholdengo, so Pokemon such as Landorus-T and Great Tusk make for good partners that can take advantage of them.

sets.name: Double Dance
sets.description:
Enamorus-T's good natural defenses and access to boosting moves in Calm Mind and Iron Defense allow it to serve as a viable wincon that is difficult to remove once it starts setting up. What Draining Kiss may lack in power, it makes up for with its ability to keep Enamorus-T healthy, which is critical, since this set is focused on longevity over raw damage. Earth Power pairs exceedingly well with it, giving Enamorus-T impressive coverage that is resisted by only a few Pokemon while hitting threats like Gholdengo and Heatran super effectively. Leftovers help keep Enamorus-T healthy while it racks up boosts, but Heavy-Duty Boosts keeps it safe from Stealth Rock, which poses to cut away a significant amount of HP once Enamorus-T switches in. Grassy Seed can also be run if Enamorus-T is paired with Rillaboom, as the instant Defense boost can aid it greatly in setting up. Terastallization aids Enamorus-T's ability to set up by mixing up its defensive profile;Tera Steel allows it to deal with Poison- and Steel-types, giving it a chance to take Dire Claw from Sneasler and Iron Head from Kingambit, respectively. It also removes its weakness to Electric, giving it a better matchup against Zapdos. In addition, with Overcoat, Tera Steel makes Enamorus-T a very capable Amoonguss switch-in, letting it use it as setup fodder for a potential sweep. Tera Water maintains the resistance to Steel while also giving it a resistance to Ice, which is crucial for avoiding being picked off by Baxcalibur, and can turn Enamorus-T into a useful Walking Wake check in a pinch. The EV spread is designed to keep Enamorus-T as bulky as possible while still allowing it to outspeed uninvested Kingambit, Azumarill, and Ursaluna.

Enamorus-T fits best on bulky offensive teams that allow it to sweep late-game once its checks have been whittled down or removed. Therefore, offensive wallbreakers like Sneasler and Iron Valiant serve as good teammates for it. The latter in particular is good at wearing down Moltres and Corviknight, two common Pokemon that resist both of Enamorus-T's attacks. Offensive hazard setters like Hisuian Samurott also help by wearing down the opponent's team. If Enamorus-T is not using Heavy-Duty Boots, then hazard removal is a necessity, so Pokemon like Great Tusk and Cinderace are further appreciated.

sets.name: Calm Mind (Fairy)
sets.description:
The last moveslot can utilize Grass Knot to beat Unaware Quagsire or Substitute to avoid status, but being able to make progress against Steel-types like Heatran is generally preferred.

This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

sets.name: Trick Room Attacker
sets.description: The EV spread allows Enamorus-Therian to survive an Ice Spinner from Jolly Chien-Pao.

sets.name: Calm Mind
sets.description: The EV spread allows Enamorus-Therian to survive an Ice Spinner from Jolly Chien-Pao.

sets.name: Triage
sets.description: With decent bulk and high Special Attack, Enamorus-T can become a fearsome setup sweeper and revenge killer in spite of its low Speed, including OHKOing Chien-Pao and Quaquaval and 2HKOing specially defensive Garchomp variants while staying healthy thanks to Triage. Enamorus-T also acts as a decent wall that can easily stand up to attacks from the likes of Barraskewda and Meloetta after a boost from Iron Defense or Calm Mind. Earth Power lets Enamorus-T hit Steel-types like Zamazenta-C and non-Earth Eater Iron Treads, and it can OHKO Fire-types like Iron Moth and Cinderace. Enamorus-T benefits from physically offensive teammates like Meowscarada and Chien-Pao that can remove specially defensive Pokemon like Blissey and RegenVest Hisuian Goodra that it would otherwise struggle with. Enamorus-T also needs teammates like Cinderace and Ceruledge that can remove Ground-immune Steel-types, as these otherwise wall it.
