Powerful wallbreakers like Iron Moth and Galarian Zapdos synergize well with Enarmorus-T, weakening opposing Pokemon for it to easily revenge kill.

sets.name: Sheer Force
sets.description: Enamorus-T's high Special Attack and access to great coverage moves make it a powerful wallbreaker that can easily OHKO common specially defensive foes like Garchomp with Moonblast. Mystical Fire covers non-Well-Baked Body Steel-types such as Corviknight, while Earth Power threatens non-Earth Eater Steel-types and Fire-types like Heatran and Skeledirge. Superpower lets Enamorus-T attack Steel-types without guessing which type immunity ability they are running and can more effectively damage RegenVest foes and Blissey. Enamorus-T pairs well with defensive teammates like Hisuian Goodra and Ting-Lu that can switch into attacks for it, as well as entry hazard removers like Regieleki and Iron Treads, as Enarmorus-T is relatively frail without investment and needs support to stay healthy. Enamorus-T also benefits from entry hazard setters like Garchomp and Iron Treads that can help weaken defensive foes like Blissey for Enamorus-T to be able to OHKO them. Fast offensive teammates like Meowscarada and Inteleon also take great advantage of the holes that Enamorus-T creates in opposing teams.

sets.name: Lead
sets.description:
Meowscarada is the fastest Spiker in the metagame that also provides further utility, making it a very potent dedicated lead. Moreover, its immunity to Prankster Taunt from Grimmsnarl, another common lead, lets Meowscarada get the leg up against opposing offensive teams. Taunt in conjunction with its insane Speed tier allows Meowscarada to shut down opposing entry hazard setters and removers like Garchomp, Glimmora, Iron Moth, and Corviknight, annoy defensive Pokemon like Clodsire and Toxapex, and prevent foes such as Kingambit and Dragonite from using it as setup fodder. Aside from threatening Grass-resistant Pokemon like Dragapult, Skeledirge, and Gholdengo, Knock Off's utility allows Meowscarada to soften up and cripple defensive Pokemon like Corviknight and Toxapex, and it works well with Spikes by removing Heavy-Duty Boots from foes such as Amoonguss, Clodsire, and Scizor. Even with Meowscarada's middling Special Attack, Leaf Storm boosted by Overgrow can cleanly OHKO defensive Great Tusk, one of the metagame's most common entry hazard removers. Focus Sash guarantees that Meowscarada can set at least one layer of Spikes and safely puts Meowscarada into Overgrow range. Tera Ghost can be used in a pinch to spinblock Great Tusk, Iron Treads, and Torkoal.

Meowscarada excels at setting up the tempo for hyper offense teams. Offensive Stealth Rock setters like Garchomp and Great Tusk can stack entry hazards to put even more pressure on the opposing team, with mixed Garchomp threatening Corviknight from using Defog; in return, Meowscarada's Knock Off removes Heavy-Duty Boots from the likes of Dragonite, Zapdos, and Moltres to make them susceptible to Stealth Rock. By stacking entry hazards, Gholdengo becomes a near-mandatory teammate to prevent every attempt of hazard removal; Gholdengo also takes advantage of entry hazards itself to pressure checks like Toxapex and Clodsire, which makes Nasty Plot variants particularly difficult to deal with. Setup sweepers commonly found on hyper offense teams such as Dragonite, Kingambit, Iron Valiant, and Iron Moth appreciate Spikes chipping down Pokemon like Dondozo, Great Tusk, Garganacl, and Clodsire. Furthermore, they enjoy Meowscarada crippling defensive Pokemon such as Corviknight and Amoonguss with Knock Off, with Dragonite and Kingambit in particular also appreciating Meowscarada luring in and dealing with Great Tusk.

sets.name: Utility Pivot
sets.description:
With Heavy-Duty Boots, Meowscarada becomes a flexible offensive pivot capable of pressuring the opponent thanks to its high Speed and Protean-boosted U-turn, grabbing momentum for its teammates. Knock Off's high power and item removal make it an excellent move for making progress against foes such as Dragonite, Corviknight, and Toxapex. Flower Trick hits common Pokemon such as Great Tusk, Dondozo, and Rotom-W for super effective damage, and its ability to always score a critical hit is very helpful against Defense-boosting foes like Garganacl. Aside from pivoting, U-turn gives super effective coverage against Hydreigon and Roaring Moon, which resist the combination of Knock Off and Flower Trick. Finally, Sucker Punch is a great option to pick off weakened faster foes such as Dragapult, Choice Scarf Gholdengo, and Speed Booster Energy users such as Iron Moth. Alternatively, Taunt is great for shutting down support Pokemon such as Toxapex, Tera Fairy Garganacl, and Scream Tail. Tera Dark allows Meowscarada to always OHKO Gholdengo with Knock Off and gives it a chance to OHKO it with Sucker Punch. Tera Grass allows Meowscarada's Flower Trick to always 2HKO Garganacl and gives it a chance to OHKO offensive Great Tusk.

Pivot Meowscarada fits on a variety of offensive and balance teams looking for a flexible Pokemon that can both exert pressure on the opponent and grab momentum. Since Meowscarada forces a lot of switches and is adept at wearing down foes with U-turn, entry hazard support from the likes of Great Tusk, Glimmora, and Ting-Lu is greatly appreciated. Meowscarada's ability to remove Heavy-Duty Boots through Knock Off makes it excellent for accentuating hazard damage. Gholdengo is a good partner, as it helps keep entry hazards on the field and can threaten Pokemon that force Meowscarada out, such as Breloom and Amoonguss. In return, Meowscarada threatens Ting-Lu and weakened Greak Tusk, which Gholdengo greatly appreciates. Meowscarada's U-turn support pairs well with powerful wallbreakers such as Choice Specs Dragapult by giving them free entry onto the field. Meowscarada's Knock Off also cripples Corviknight for these two Pokemon. In return, these wallbreakers threaten Pokemon that Meowscarada lures in, such as Amoonguss and Dragonite. Late-game cleaners such as Booster Energy Iron Valiant, Dragon Dance Dragonite, and Kingambit are great partners that can help finish off a team that Meowscarada has worn down. All of the aforementioned offensive teammates appreciate Meowscarada pressuring their checks like Dondozo, Garganacl, and Rotom-W.

sets.name: Choice Band
sets.description:
Choice Band Meowscarada is a powerful offensive pivot that excels at using its high Speed and Protean-boosted attacks to force progress against the enemy team. Knock Off will generally be Meowscarada's most used move due to its high power and ability to force progress through item removal, crippling checks like Corviknight and Amoonguss. Flower Trick is Meowscarada's strongest attack, and its ability to always land a critical hit is very useful against foes that boost Defense, such as Dondozo, Curse Garganacl, and Bulk Up Great Tusk. With a Choice Band, Meowscarada has a good chance to OHKO offensive Great Tusk with Flower Trick. U-turn is great for grabbing momentum against Pokemon Meowscarada threatens out, such as Ting-Lu and Rotom-W, and provides super effective coverage against Hydreigon and Roaring Moon. Sucker Punch lets Meowscarada snipe faster foes such as Dragapult and Choice Scarf Gholdengo. Alternatively, Play Rough is an option that lets Meowscarada do great damage to Dragonite, which otherwise takes little from Meowscarada's attacks. Thunder Punch is a niche option to hit Corviknight and Tera Flying Pokemon like Kingambit and Gholdengo super effectively. Low Kick may also potentially be used to OHKO Kingambit. Both Tera Dark and Tera Grass are good options to boost the power of Meowscarada's STAB moves to enormous levels; for example, Tera Grass enables Meowscarada to OHKO Clodsire most of the time, while Tera Dark Knock Off easily OHKOes standard bulky Cinderace. Tera Fairy is a niche option that boosts the power of Play Rough and can help Meowscarada avoid being revenge killed by priority such as Mach Punch from Breloom, allowing it to OHKO it in return.

Choice Band Meowscarada's unique blend of speed and power lets it act as both a wallbreaker and pivot on offensive teams. In particular, Meowscarada's U-turn support couples well with powerful but frail wallbreakers such as Iron Valiant, Choice Specs Dragapult, and Choice Specs Hisuian Zoroark by giving them free entry onto the battlefield. Hisuian Zoroark can also take advantage of Illusion and its immunity-laden typing to disguise itself as Meowscarada, which may force guesswork from the opponent and give it even more opportunities to fire off its strong attacks. Since Meowscarada forces many switches and can remove Heavy-Duty Boots through Knock Off, entry hazard support from Great Tusk, Ting-Lu, and Garchomp is highly recommended. Gholdengo is another good partner that can prevent attempts to remove entry hazards while also switching into Pokemon that threaten out Meowscarada, such as Breloom, Amoonguss, and Corviknight. In return, Gholdengo appreciates Meowscarada's ability to deal with Clodsire, Ting-Lu, and Tera Water Garganacl. Kingambit is a great Pokemon that can serve as a late-game cleaner after Meowscarada has weakened the enemy team with U-turn and Knock Off. Dragon Dance Dragonite is another great cleaner that, like Kingambit, appreciates Meowscarada's ability to break past Dondozo.

sets.name: Choice Scarf
sets.description:
Equipped with Choice Scarf, Meowscarada outspeeds both the entirety of the unboosted metagame and even some +1 Pokemon like Iron Valiant, Roaring Moon, and Walking Wake. It also has strong offensive pressure thanks to Protean. Knock Off allows Meowscarada to remove important items from Pokemon that rely on them, such as Heavy-Duty Boots from Dragonite and Tera Fairy Skeledirge, as well as Leftovers and Rocky Helmet from Corviknight and Amoonguss. U-turn allows Meowscarada to serve as a fast pivot to keep up momentum, and with the boost from Protean, it can OHKO or dent slower Pokemon like opposing Meowscarada and Greninja. Play Rough allows Meowscarada to threaten Dragon-, Dark-, and Fighting-types such as Walking Wake, Dragapult, Dragonite, Roaring Moon, and Iron Valiant. Trick allows Meowscarada to cripple walls such as Tera Fairy Garganacl, Amoonguss, and Toxapex. Tera Grass removes Meowscarada's Dark typing, eliminating its weakness to Mach Punch from Breloom and Pawmot, and strengthens its Flower Trick. Tera Fairy grants Meowscarada a resistance to Fighting but also keeps its resistance to Sucker Punch while simultaneously boosting Play Rough. Tera Dark boosts the power of Meowscarada's Knock Off, granting it a chance to OHKO Skeledirge. Terastallizing Meowscarada also negates Protean's effects, giving it more a consistent defensive typing.

Choice Scarf Meowscarada fits best on various balance and offensive teams. It appreciates entry hazard support from Garchomp and Ting-Lu, since Meowscarada's Speed and coverage can force many switches, especially with its Knock Off to remove Heavy-Duty Boots from foes. Hazards can also break the Focus Sash of users like Hisuian Zoroark, Ceruledge, and Breloom for Meowscarada to KO them more easily. When Meowscarada isn't running Play Rough, it can struggle against Walking Wake, Iron Valiant, and Dragonite. Hence, Pokemon that can check them, such as Water Absorb Clodsire, Tera Fairy Garganacl, and Dondozo, make for good teammates; Clodsire can handle Walking Wake, Tera Fairy Garganacl can handle Iron Valiant, and Dondozo walls Dragonite. Despite Meowscarada's coverage options, it finds itself struggling to break past walls like Amoonguss and Corviknight as well as offensive Pokemon like Iron Moth. Hence, Meowscarada appreciates Pokemon that can check them like Skeledirge. Meowscarada's role as a pivot means that it can enable sweeps from Iron Valiant by bringing them in on Ting-Lu and Corviknight, respectively.

sets.name: Choice Scarf (Dark)
sets.description:
Meowscarada is a fantastic revenge killer for any Dark team due to its great Speed, coverage moves, and ability in Protean. Flower Trick makes Meowscarada a great late-game cleaner against Ground and Water teams, or just in general, taking out threats such as Great Tusk, Greninja, and Flutter Mane. Knock Off can target Ghost- and Psychic-type Pokemon, such as Gholdengo and Espathra, while removing items from walls such as Toxapex's Black Sludge, Klefki's Light Clay, and Skeledirge's Heavy-Duty Boots. Play Rough allows Meowscarada to clean through weakened Dragon teams, and it's a useful move late-game against other Dark teams. Alternatively, Meowscarada can run Toxic Spikes to cripple foes such as Great Tusk. U-turn picks up momentum for its team on forced switches, for example against Greninja. Choice Scarf plus its Speed and Protean allows it to take on threats such as Greninja, Choice Scarf Great Tusk, and Choice Specs Flutter Mane.

Greninja and Meowscarada can break through each other's checks: Greninja can beat Toxapex and Corviknight for Meowscarada, while Choice Scarf Meowscarada can revenge kill Flutter Mane for Greninja. Chien-Pao can prevent walls such as Toxapex from healing with Taunt, allowing Meowscarada to better pressure Water teams; it can also pressure Flying- and Dragon-types for Meowscarada, beating threats such as Dragonite. Chien-Pao can also break past walls such as Clodsire and Amoonguss for Meowscarada. Kingambit is an incredible late-game sweeper, picking off faster threats like Choice Scarf Flutter Mane with Sucker Punch, and it beats down Fairy-types such as Hatterene for Meowscarada. In return, Meowscarada can pick off Iron Valiant, allowing Kingambit to better pressure Fairy teams. Ting-Lu sets Stealth Rock and Spikes, allowing Meowscarada to clean more easily late-game. Additionally, it can check slower Pokemon such as Toxapex, Corviknight, and Clodsire with Taunt alongside Earthquake or Ruination. It can also stomach strong special attacks such as Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Moonblast, OHKOing Flutter Mane in return with Heavy Slam. Sableye can switch into Fighting-type attacks for Meowscarada, such as Great Tusk's Close Combat, and either cripple their users with Prankster Will-O-Wisp or force them to switch with Prankster Encore. Sableye can also prevent Pokemon like Clodsire and Brambleghast from setting entry hazards thanks to Prankster Taunt. Skuntank can ease the Fairy matchup by beating Hatterene one-on-one, which lets Meowscarada set Toxic Spikes safely. It can also trap Klefki with Fire Spin, preventing dual screens from staying on the field for too long. Finally, Hydreigon can take on walls such as Toxapex for Meowscarada with Substitute + Nasty Plot, safely setting up and overpowering them.

sets.name: Choice Scarf (Grass)
sets.description:
Meowscarada finds itself as the best revenge killer to threatening setup sweepers such as Dragonite, Hydreigon, and Armarouge available to Grass teams thanks to its good offensive stats paired with a strong ability in Protean. This is further supported by a great Speed tier, which allows it to serve as a strong cleaner in multiple matchups such as versus Water, Fighting, Dark and Ghost teams with a Choice Scarf. Flower Trick enables Meowscarada to break through Defense boosted Pokemon such as Curse Dondozo, as well as Pokemon behind dual screens such as Flutter Mane. Play Rough provides the Fairy coverage that enables Meowscarada to threaten Fighting, Dragon, and Dark teams. U-turn is used to allow Meowscarada to pivot out against checks to it, such as Toxapex and Skeledirge, to bring in a teammate that can break through it, such as Breloom and Toedscruel, while also maintaining momentum.

While Meowscarada is an effective cleaner, it cannot exactly break through certain Pokemon by itself. Choice Band Breloom is a great teammate for Meowscarada, as it can break through Meowscarada's checks such as Toxapex, Kingambit, and Clodsire. Meowscarada is also vulnerable to Pokemon with strong priority and revenge killers faster than it such as Breloom and Choice Scarf Flutter Mane. Defensive walls such as Amoonguss and Wo-Chien can switch into said priority attacks and revenge killing attempts for Meowscarada. Amoonguss in particular also removes Toxic Spikes, which can be useful for Meowscarada and its teammates. Brambleghast and Toedscruel provide entry hazard removal in Rapid Spin, while also setting up hazards of their own in Spikes. Abomasnow gives an important Ice neutrality to Grass teams, which in tandem with the Defense boost provided by Snow allows it to serve as an answer to Ice-type threats such as Chien-Pao and Baxcalibur. Swords Dance Iron Leaves and Rotom-C provide counterplay to Corviknight that Grass teams otherwise lack, with the former appreciating Meowscarada pivoting out to it when facing Poison-types such as Dragalge and Toxapex, threatening Poison teams in general with its Psychic-type STAB moves and Fighting-type coverage attacks, while the latter forms a pivoting core with Meowscarada.

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
This analysis is for the Regulation C format of Battle Stadium Singles, which lasts until June 30th, 2023. For more information on this format and its current events, check out this page!

If you feel this analysis is missing anything important or needs an update, feel free to suggest any changes here.

sets.name: CRITTY CAT
sets.description:
• With its good Attack, Speed, and access to Flower Trick and Knock Off, Meowscarada is a potent cleaner that is also hard to switch into.

  • Flower Trick: With its guaranteed critical hit, Flower Trick is a dangerous cleaning move once resistances to it have been sufficiently chipped.

  • Trick And Neutral Natures: Trick can help Choice-locked sets incapacitate an annoying wall, such as Dondozo or Wo-Chien, by locking them into a single move. Make sure to use a neutral nature and use a Jolly Mint on Meowscarada, so it won't get confused by eating any Berry after Trick.

  • U-turn: If using Protean, Meowscarada is a pivot that does far more damage than most users of U-turn,

  • Low Kick versus Brick Break: Low Kick OHKOs Chien-Pao, Roaring Moon, and Kingambit if using Protean, but Brick Break deals far more damage against Chi-Yu.

  • Jolly versus Adamant: Jolly is usually preffered for outspeeding fast threats like Roaring Moon and Iron Valiant, but Adamant 's extra power can be justified on Choice Scarf since it still outspeeds Choice Scarf Garchomp.

Abilities

  • Protean: Protean’s type-shifting allows Meowscarada to make the most of its colorful movepool, particularly on Choice-locked sets, where the limitation to only changing types once is effectively nullified.

  • Overgrow: If you intend to make use of a Tera type other than Grass or switch moves often, Overgrow is worth considering, as it allows Meowscarada more flexibility with its moves by not changing type and removing STAB from Flower Trick or Knock Off.

Items

  • Choice Scarf: With the Speed offered via Choice Scarf, Meowscarada can threaten otherwise faster foes, such as Chien-Pao and Flutter Mane, potentially putting more pressure on offensive teams.

  • Choice Band: Choice Band boosted Meowscarada hits incredibly hard, and with its naturally high Speed it can serve as a cleaner and a potential wallbreaker.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Terastallization overriding Protean means Meowscarada should usually only Terastallize to clean a weakened team late-game.

  • Grass: While Terastallizing does override Protean, Tera Grass Meowscarada can be used to power through teams ill-prepared for it. Dual screens teams in particular are especially vulnerable to the sheer power of Choice Band-boosted Tera Grass Flower Trick.

  • Dark: Tera Dark boosted Knock Off isn't as reliable at sweeping as Flower Trick, but it can surprise bulky Steel-types such as Scizor and Corviknight.

  • Fire: Tera Fire gives Meowscarada a Will-O-Wisp immunity and an Ice resistance that can surprise Chien-Pao and Iron Bundle.

EV Spreads

  • 76 HP / 244 Atk / 108 Def / 4 SpD / 76 Speed with Jolly: This spread allows Meowscarada to outspeed timid Chi-Yu while avoiding an OHKO from Breloom's Mach Punch, Chien-Pao's Ice Shard and Choice Band Dragonite's Extreme Speed.

sets.name: Focus Sash
sets.description:
• With its good Speed and wide movepool, Meowscarada makes for a potent lead.

  • Sucker Punch: Sucker Punch allows Meowscarada to better handle foes such as Flutter Mane and Choice Scarf Gholdengo.

  • Toxic Spikes: Meowscarada is an excellent offensive choice to lay Toxic Spikes, since it puts immense pressure on Ting-Lu leads.

  • Taunt: Thanks to its good Speed, Meowscarada makes particularly excellent use of Taunt, shutting down other entry hazard leads such as Garchomp, Ting-Lu, and Hippowdon.

  • Play Rough: This provides good coverage for Fighting- and Dragon-types that might otherwise pose issues, such as Roaring Moon.

  • Low Kick versus Brick Break: Low Kick is worth considering if your team struggles with Kingambit, but Brick Break will deal far more damage to Chi-Yu.

  • Overgrow: Since this Meowscarada set aims to be more of a supportive Pokemon, Overgrow is preferred to keep STAB on its attacks after it uses its support moves.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: This Meowscarada has very little use for Terastallization, only using it in late-game situations where it can sweep.

  • Grass: When paired with an Overgrow boost, Tera Grass lets Flower Trick deal a huge amount of damage.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy eases Meowscarada's matchup against Choice Band Dragapult, who can threaten to KO through Focus Sash via Dragon Darts.

sets.name: Choice Item
sets.description: With its great Speed and good coverage, Meowscarada is one of the best offense pivots in the tier, as Flower Trick + Knock Off provide excellent power, with Knock Off also frustrating common switch-ins like Corviknight. Alternatively, Choice Scarf sets let Meowscarada outspeed Pokemon like Chien-Pao, Hisuian Electrode, and Regieleki. Dazzling is a option over Sword of Ruin on Choice Scarf sets, letting Meowscarada deal with Slither Wing's First Impression and Ice Shard from Chien-Pao. For the last moveslot, Low Kick targets Kingambit, while Play Rough can potentially break Slither Wing; Power Gem is also a niche option on Choice Scarf sets to revenge kill Bulk Up Talonflame. Wallbreakers like Ceruledge and Iron Moth pair well with Meowscarada by punching holes into the opposing team so that Meowscarada can take over the game later on. Corviknight is also a fantastic partner for Meowscarada, tanking all of the Bug- and Ice-type moves, especially U-turn that threaten Meowscarada while also being able to pivot in Meowscarada safely. Meowscarada also pairs well with Pokemon such as Kingambit and Enamorus-T which appriciate Corviknight being weakened.

sets.name: Choice Band
sets.description:
• Flower Trick is for non-Choice Band Dondozo, Gastrodon, and non-Weakness Policy Ting-Lu.
  • Knock Off is for Espathra, Sableye, and Magnezone.
  • Giga Impact is for non-Chilan Berry Volcarona and offensive Sylveon.
  • Play Rough beats non-Counter Annihilape and Special Attack Booster Energy Walking Wake, while Thunder Punch beats Corviknight.
  • Trick and Shadow Claw can be used for matchups against Bellibolt and Counter Annihilape but are generally not too reliable, as Bellibolt can 2HKO Meowscarada with Thunder after Trick, while Annihilape can use Rage Fist to beat Shadow Claw Meowscarada instead of Counter.
  • Protean can force opponents to guess what move Meowscarada will use. For example, non-Choice Band Iron Hands has to choose between Close Combat and Wild Charge to beat either Flower Trick or Play Rough from Meowscarada. Choosing incorrectly, however, allows Meowscarada to 2HKO Iron Hands.
  • An Adamant nature allows Meowscarada to have a better chance to beat more defensive Sylveon sets and Iron Defense Corviknight. A Timid nature allows Meowscarada to outspeed Iron Moth, Hisuian Zoroark, and non-Speed Booster Energy Walking Wake.

sets.name: Choice Scarf
sets.description:
• Flower Trick OHKOes non-defensive Azumarill and Sandy Shocks and beats Rotom-W.
  • Knock Off OHKOes Dragapult and defeats Espathra, Iron Leaves, and non-Metal Burst Sableye.
  • Play Rough hits Iron Valiant, Roaring Moon, and opposing Meowscarada.
  • Low Kick OHKOes Chien-Pao, Tyranitar, and non-Chople Berry Kingambit.
  • Giga Impact OHKOes non-defensive Volcarona and Iron Moth.
  • Trick can potentially catch bulky Pokemon like Endeavor Donphan and Corviknight off guard by locking them into a useless move.
  • Choice Scarf Meowscarada should be used against fast and frail Pokemon it can OHKO with a super effective move, like Dragapult, Espathra, and Hisuian Zoroark, or Pokemon it can 2HKO and survive a hit from with Protean's type change, like Iron Valiant and Walking Wake.

sets.name: Choice Specs
sets.description:
• Frenzy Plant OHKOes Dondozo, Rotom-W, non-Sap Sipper Azumarill, and some Ting-Lu variants.
  • Dark Pulse beats most Espathra variants, beats non-Metal Burst Sableye, and has a high chance to OHKO Farigiraf.
  • Chilling Water 2HKOes Donphan and usually 2HKOes specially defensive Skeledirge. It also allows Meowscarada to transform into a Water-type and survive Torch Song and Blast Burn from Skeledirge.
  • Power Gem beats Volcarona, Torkoal, and non-Speed Booster Energy Iron Jugulis.
  • Pollen Puff OHKOes Iron Leaves, Wo-Chien, and opposing Meowscarada.
  • While using Dark Pulse beats most Prankster Sableye, using it against Metal Burst Sableye leads to Meowscarada losing, so it should use Frenzy Plant instead.

sets.name: SubSeed
sets.description:
• Alternating between Substitute and Protect after setting up Leech Seed allows Meowscarada to slowly gain HP if it is not OHKOed by the foe. It is a potent Speed trap, meaning most weaker, slower foes lose to it.
  • With Protean, Meowscarada can gain a more useful defensive typing, such as Normal, Water, or Fairy, for the entire battle.
  • Chilling Water allows Meowscarada to defeat Arcanine and Skeledirge.
  • Charm nets wins against non-Choice Band Iron Hands and Garchomp.
  • Mental Herb gives Meowscarada better matchups against Taunt users like Annihilape, Corviknight, and Kingambit, as well as Encore users like Gardevoir.
  • Alternatively, Chople Berry + Leaf Storm defeats most Great Tusk variants. After Protect, Chople Berry also comes in handy versus other Pokemon with Fighting-type coverage like Arcanine.
  • The Defense and HP investment allows Meowscarada to defeat Choice Band Donphan. With low HP investment, Meowscarada also gains relatively more from Leech Seed. Maximum Speed allows Meowscarada to set up Leech Seed against as many Pokemon as possible.
  • When using four status moves, use a Jolly nature to maximize Struggle damage. With Chilling Water or Leaf Storm, use a Timid nature instead.
  • Using Protect before using Leech Seed against the likes of Donphan and Talonflame allows Meowscarada to survive Gunk Shot, Brave Bird, and Flare Blitz.
  • Use Leech Seed turn 1 to stay a Grass-type against foes like Azumarill, Bellibolt, and Dondozo.
  • Use Taunt turn 1 to maintain positive matchups against Espathra and Prankster Sableye.

sets.name: Choice Scarf
sets.description: Choice Scarf Meowscarada leverages its excellent power and Speed tier to act as one of the tier's premier revenge killers, outspeeding boosted offensive threats like Dragon Dance Mega Tyranitar, Rapid Spin Excadrill, and Sandy Shocks, while also blazing past opposing Choice Scarf users such as Enamorus and Latias. Protean increases the damage output of its coverage moves, making them better suited at pressuring targets such as Mega Latias, Galarian Zapdos, and Hydreigon. Knock Off allows Meowscarada to remove important items from walls such as Clefable, Celesteela, and physically defensive Tangrowth, allowing it to break through them more easily. U-turn gives Meowscarada the ability to keep up momentum and in conjunction with Protean, severely dents opposing Meowscarada and Serperior that may try to stay in on it. Thunder Punch is critical for allowing Meowscarada to revenge kill targets like Autotomize Celesteela and Double Dance Galarian Moltres after their respective boosts, especially if the former has already used up its Power Herb; it also OHKOes Gyarados. Alternatively, Play Rough can be used to hit other Fighting- and Dragon-types, most notably Buzzwole, Iron Hands, and Dragon Dance Mega Altaria, while retaining its ability to take out Galarian Moltres. If several of the aforementioned Pokemon are adequately covered by Meowscarada's teammates, Trick can be used to cripple an incoming wall, such as Buzzwole or Amoonguss. Choice Scarf Meowscarada fits best on balance and offensive teams. Pokemon such as Sandy Shocks and Skarmory are appreciated partners for laying entry hazards that capitalize on Meowscarada's ability to force switches and remove items such as Heavy-Duty Boots and Leftovers from the opponent. Defensive pivots such as Galarian Slowking and Utility Jirachi also appreciate Meowscarada's ability to keep threats like Swords Dance Aegislash and Keldeo in check and can opt to safely bring it in against these Pokemon, as Meowscarada's poor defensive attributes often means it cannot switch into them directly. While Meowscarada is able to hit many of them super effectively, it can still struggle to deal lasting damage against walls such as Skarmory and Amoonguss, making offensive teammates that can take advantage of them, such as SubToxic Aegislash, Choice Band Victini, and Choice Specs Latios extremely valuable, all of which benefit from the opportunities provided by Meowscarada's U-turn in return.

sets.name: Choice Band
sets.description: Choice Band Meowscarada packs colorful coverage in conjunction with Protean and its naturally high Speed tier, letting it serve as a powerful offensive pivot. Choice Band allows Meowscarada to OHKO several offensive Pokemon that it otherwise wouldn't, such as Aegislash and Iron Moth. In addition to this, Knock Off cripples defensive walls such as Scizor and Amoonguss by removing their respective items, while also serving as Meowscarada's most common move to use against neutral targets. U-turn allows Meowscarada to rack up momentum against Pokemon it forces out, such as Tyranitar, Hippowdon, and Tapu Fini. Thunder Punch is usually preferred for its ability to 2HKO Skarmory outright, on top of hitting other crucial Flying-type checks such as Enamorus. However, Play Rough can be used instead to provide super effective coverage against other answers, 2HKOing the likes of physically defensive Buzzwole, Mega Sableye, and Mega Altaria. Sucker Punch is also a passable option in the last slot as a priority move that can finish off weakened offensive threats such as Autotomize Celesteela, Z-Celebrate Victini, and Sand Rush Excadrill. Choice Band Meowscarada fits best on more offensive teams, particularly those that appreciate its unique mix of wallbreaking and pivoting capabilities. Frailer offensive teammates that also benefit from Meowscarada's U-turn, such as Mixed Aegislash, Hisuian Zoroark, and Alakazam, can make for good teammates to pressure some of Meowscarada's checks, like Buzzwole and Mega Venusaur. Hisuian Zoroark in particular synergizes especially well, as disguising as Meowscarada with its Illusion ability can help force mindgames with the opponent; the threat of Hisuian Zoroark luring in and eliminating walls such as Buzzwole with Flamethrower can make the opponent much less eager to try and switch them into Meowscarada. Defensive pivots such as Scizor, Galarian Slowking, and Blissey, are also essential to let Meowscarada enter the field safely against more preferable targets, while also being great Pokemon to fall back on when faced with opposing revenge killers, such as Choice Scarf Latias and Enamorus. Galarian Slowking can also use Future Sight to remedy Meowscarada's lack of coverage against Fighting-types such as Buzzwole and Iron Hands. Entry hazard support from the likes of Clefable and Sandy Shocks benefit from Meowscarada's Knock Off removing items such as Heavy-Duty Boots and Leftovers from defensive Pokemon like Clefable, on top of making it easier to break past them.

sets.name: Lead
sets.description: Lead Meowscarada is one of the fastest leads in the entire tier, which makes it highly effective at getting the jump on opposing leads. It also matches up very well against Grimmsnarl, as its Dark typing makes it immune to Prankster. Due to Meowscarada's insane Speed tier, Taunt allows it to dominate other leads by outspeeding and preventing them from getting their own entry hazards up, most notably Excadrill, Mew, and Hydreigon, while also blocking Defog from foes like Tapu Fini and Mandibuzz. Flower Trick, especially in conjunction with Overgrow, allows Meowscarada to deal significant damage to neutral foes before fainting, most notably 2HKOing Stealth Rock Clefable. Knock Off, on top of 2HKOing Lead Mew, can also remove items such as Skarmory's Rocky Helmet and Celesteela's Leftovers, making them easier to break through. Lead Meowscarada's extensive utility and positive matchups against similar archetypes make it a natural fit for hyper offense teams. Offensive Pokemon such as Swords Dance Scizor, Meteor Beam Celesteela, and Calm Mind Latios each appreciate Spikes' ability to wear down several of their grounded checks into range, like Mega Tyranitar and SubToxic Aegislash. Offensive Stealth Rock users, such as Sandy Shocks and Nihilego, can also synergize well with Meowscarada's Spikes to create even more offensive pressure for the opponent. As Lead Meowscarada tends to struggle against Mega Sableye due to Magic Bounce, Pokemon that can take advantage of it, such as Nasty Plot Galarian Moltres and Booster Energy Iron Moth, make for crucial offensive teammates that can fulfill this role effectively. In return, they favor Meowscarada's ability to remove their crippling weakness to Stealth Rock by shutting down the majority of Stealth Rock setters.

sets.name: Choice Scarf (Dark)
sets.description: Thanks to its fantastic movepool and Protean, Choice Scarf Meowscarada is the best revenge killer available for Dark teams, outrunning the likes of Regieleki, Speed-boosted Kommo-o, and Mega Swampert under rain. Flower Trick is Meowscarada's most powerful move, picking off weakened foes such as Tapu Lele and Terrakion. Play Rough is essential, as it deals with many threats to Dark teams like Galarian Zapdos, Mega Gallade, and Iron Valiant. U-turn allows Meowscarada to switch out of unfavorable situations, pivoting into powerful teammates such as Galarian Moltres and Mega Tyranitar while keeping momentum for the team. Knock Off cripples defensive switch-ins—such as Toxapex, Ferrothorn, and Clefable—as well as offensive Pokemon like Zeraora and Iron Treads. Toxic Spikes can be run instead to better pressure Normal, Fairy, and Fighting teams. Meowscarada's teammates appreciate its ability to check a myriad of threats as well as its revenge killing capabilities. Wallbreakers like Galarian Moltres and Hydreigon are great partners to deal with physical walls like Celesteela and Mega Venusaur. Ting-Lu and Tyranitar provide entry hazard support for Meowscarada—ensuring it is able to net more KO's—and are great defensive pivots for it to fall back upon. Similarly, Mega Sableye provides a Fighting immunity, bounces back status moves, and prevents entry hazards from going up, letting Meowscarada switch in unscathed.

sets.name: Choice Scarf (Grass)
sets.description: Meowscarada is an excellent choice for Grass teams thanks to its high Speed and Protean, enabling it to be a threatening revenge killer that can outspeed common threats such as Choice Scarf Iron Valiant and Gholdengo. Flower Trick is Meowscarada's best STAB option and is capable of dealing with weakened Pokemon like Clodsire and Spectrier. Flower Trick's guaranteed critical hit is also very useful in the Fairy matchup and lets Meowscarada revenge kill Azumarill and a weakened Tapu Lele behind Reflect. U-turn allows Meowscarada to maintain an advantage against its defensive checks like Corviknight by being able to pivot into its teammates like Scovillain. Knock Off is a tool to cripple Meowscarada's defensive switch-ins like Toxapex and Klefki in addition to the aforementioned Corviknight. Play Rough is a strong coverage option to threaten opposing Dragon-type Pokemon like Kommo-o, Kyurem, and Latios, which Grass teams tend to struggle against. Low Kick is a less frequent option but lets Meowscarada OHKO Bisharp while threatening Heatran with a 2HKO; however, Play Rough is preferred to have an easier time against Dragon teams. Meowscarada has an easier time revenge killing foes with entry hazard support from Ferrothorn and Cradily. Ferrothorn appreciates Meowscarada's ability to check Fighting-types like Mega Gallade, Iron Valiant and Galarian Zapdos with STAB Play Rough. Hisuian Lilligant is also a fantastic offensive partner for Meowscarada. It is able to check the Flying-types that switch into Meowscarada like Celesteela and Landorus-T while also assisting in the Dragon matchup, outspeeding common Pokemon like Garchomp and Dragonite. Hisuian Lilligant also makes the Steel matchup easier for Grass; its ability to threaten Heatran is appreciated by Meowscarada, while Meowscarada can threaten Gholdengo with Knock Off, which Lilligant cannot beat. Mega Venusaur is also a mandatory defensive partner for Meowscarada; its Bug neutrality and bulk allows it to act as a consistent check to Mega Scizor, which easily switches into any move of Meowscarada, and Venusaur is able to check it with Hidden Power Fire. Mega Venusaur also checks opposing Fairy-types for Meowscarada like Tapu Koko, Mega Diancie, and Iron Valiant, while Meowscarada is able to threaten the Psychic-types that force out Mega Venusaur such as Latios, Mega Alakazam, and Victini. Whismicott is one of the best hazard removal options on Grass, and Meowscarada appreciates not having Stealth Rock and Spikes chip it down, because it comes in often to threaten a KO. Whimsicott's Fairy typing also allows Meowscarada and its teammates not to be overwhelmed by Dragon-types like Garchomp, and it can encore Calm Mind Mega Latias. Celebi with Nasty Plot and Groundium Z can break defensive Steel-types like Heatran and Hisuian Goodra while also being able to threaten opposing Poison-types like Alolan Muk and Toxapex.

sets.name: Defensive
sets.description: Skeledirge is a decent Koraidon check, reliably beating Choice Scarf and Swords Dance + Flame Charge sets while pivoting into and scouting Choice Band Koraidon. Skeledirge is notably immune to trapping by Dugtrio and Gothitelle, which ensures its viability as an alternative to the more passive Toxapex. Torch Song is Skeledirge's most reliable STAB move and gives it the potential to snowball late-game into a sweeper. Will-O-Wisp prevents physical attackers like Koraidon, Great Tusk, and Chien-Pao from setting up on it and also annoys passive Pokemon like Toxapex, Ting-Lu, and Alomomola. Earth Power punishes Miraidon and Chi-Yu as they switch in while also letting it beat Garganacl and Tera Fire Koraidon. Alternatively, Hex complements Will-O-Wisp, doing heavy damage to neutral targets such as Toxapex and Pelipper. Fairy is Skeledirge's preferred Tera Type, granting it a valuable immunity to Koraidon's Outrage and allowing it to absorb otherwise supereffective attacks like Crunch from Chien-Pao and Earthquake or Headlong Rush from Great Tusk. Skeledirge fits best on balance teams that appreciate its ability to neuter Koraidon and can effectively handle the numerous Pokemon that can threaten Skeledirge, such as Great Tusk, Miraidon, and Iron Bundle. As a result, ideal teammates include revenge killers such as Choice Scarf Miraidon and Choice Band Chien-Pao and defensive staples like Corviknight, Clodsire, and Ting-Lu.

sets.name: Defensive
sets.description:
• Skeledirge functions as a catch-all check to the strongest physical attackers in Ubers, notably taking on Koraidon, Zacian-C, and some variants of E-Killer Arceus.
  • Unaware fully prevents Swords Dance Koraidon and Zacian-C from breaking down Skeledirge through pure force, in contrast to other physical walls like Groudon and Toxapex. Unaware even lets Skeledirge have some use against special attackers like Calm Mind + Will-O-Wisp Arceus-Fairy.
  • Torch Song is a good STAB move that boosts Skeledirge's Special Attack each time it's used, making it a good way to force out foes and turning Skeledirge into a potential late-game wincon.
  • There are two options for the secondary attacking move. Hex pairs very well with Will-O-Wisp, becoming a 130-Base Power STAB move. On the other hand, Earth Power is very useful against Pokemon that use Tera Fire to avoid burns, such as Koraidon, and it also hits Miraidon and Eternatus switch-ins hard.
  • The combination of reliable recovery with Slack Off and Heavy-Duty Boots means that Skeledirge can easily stay healthy throughout the game and not worry about entry hazards.
  • Tera Fairy is useful against Choice Band Koraidon in particular, as it can break through Skeledirge with Dragon Claw or Outrage; the downside is that Tera Fairy makes Skeledirge vulnerable to Zacian-C's Behemoth Blade. Tera Flying gives Skeledirge an immunity to Ground-type moves, which can be helpful against Arceus-Ground and Stomping Tantrum Koraidon. Tera Water provides a good all-around neutral defensive type to use which maintains an Ice-type resistance for Chien-Pao and Calyrex-I.
  • Skeledirge offers a great deal of role compression to teams thanks to its ability to reliably check so many offensive threats.
  • Skeledirge's main flaw is that it can be passive and vulnerable to double switches, U-turn, and Taunt.
  • Koraidon can often take advantage of the predictable switch to Skeledirge to bring in deadly offensive threats such as Chi-Yu, Walking Wake, and Kyogre with U-turn. As a result, it may be advantageous to anticipate U-turn in these scenarios.
  • Taunt is often employed as a method to bypass Skeledirge's Will-O-Wisp, especially by Koraidon and E-Killer Arceus. If you expect the foe to use Taunt, taking advantage of the situation and gaining Special Attack boosts with Torch Song is a great way to limit their ability to wallbreak.
  • Ting-Lu and Clodsire are excellent teammates for Skeledirge, as they cover most of the special attackers that come in on it, especially Miraidon, while Skeledirge can in turn handle most physical threats. Together they form a solid defensive backbone.
  • Skeledirge is unable to take on Ground-type physical attackers like Arceus-Ground, Tera Ground Zacian-C, and Groudon without using Tera itself. As a result, Pokemon that resist or are immune to Ground like Corviknight, Giratina-O, Landorus-T, and Arceus-Grass make for good partners. Corviknight has the additional benefit of solidifying the matchup against E-Killer Arceus.
  • Arceus-Fairy is useful as a backup check to Koraidon, and it makes it much more difficult for Koraidon to get easy momentum with U-turn.

sets.name: Bulky Attacker
sets.description:
Skeledirge is a fantastic defensive Pokemon thanks to its great bulk and Unaware letting it check dangerous Pokemon like Iron Valiant, Volcarona, and Hatterene. Unlike other walls, however, Skeledirge can also be a foreboding wincon with Torch Song and its great offensive typing, which gives it nearly unresisted coverage. Will-O-Wisp gives it value against switch-ins such as Ting-Lu, Rotom-W, and Clodsire and cripples physical attackers like Great Tusk and Garchomp. Hex benefits from Skeledirge spreading burns, 2HKOing Pokemon such as Dragonite, Iron Hands, and physically defensive Dondozo unboosted, and Toxapex after a single boost from Torch Song. Tera Fairy bolsters Skeledirge against Dragon-types that would otherwise overwhelm it like Dragapult, Dragonite, Garchomp, and Baxcalibur. It also lets Skeledirge beat Quaquaval and lose its Ground weakness, letting it more easily spread burns against Ground-types like Great Tusk and Garchomp. In a pinch, it can bait Dark-type moves from Pokemon like Kingambit, Roaring Moon, and Meowscarada, Terastallize the same turn, and punish them with Will-O-Wisp. Tera Fairy also maintains Skeledirge's ability to beat Iron Valiant, Volcarona, and Hatterene.

Skeledirge fits on many bulky offense, balance, and stall teams as a much-appreciated answer to common wallbreakers such as Iron Valiant and Hatterene. Skeledirge often ends up entry hazard fodder for Ground-types such as Ting-Lu and Clodsire. Thus, secure hazard removers like Great Tusk and Corviknight are excellent partners. Additionally, Great Tusk can 2HKO the aforementioned Pokemon, helping set Skeledirge up for a potential sweep, while Corviknight walls the aforementioned Ground-types, can bring Skeledirge in later with U-turn, and can absorb Knock Off from the likes of Great Tusk, Meowscarada, and Iron Treads. Pokemon such as Meowscarada and Iron Valiant can overwhelm Skeledirge answers like Gholdengo, Great Tusk, and Ting-Lu. In addition to this, they appreciate Skeledirge's ability to beat Hatterene and, after Terastallizing, Dragapult. Covert Cloak Gholdengo can beat any Garganacl using Skeledirge as setup fodder. Bulky Water-types like Rotom-W and Toxapex help deal with offensive Water-types like Greninja and Quaquaval. Additionally, they can both spread status, facilitating Skeledirge's Hex. Rotom-W in particular can offensively check Ground-types like Great Tusk, Garchomp, and Ting-Lu too, although it cannot directly switch into them. Offensive Pokemon like Great Tusk, Iron Valiant, Kingambit, and Dragonite appreciate Skeledirge halting scary Pokemon, like Volcarona and Iron Valiant, and they help it overwhelm checks like Garganacl, Ting-Lu, and Clodsire.

sets.name: Substitute
sets.description:
With Substitute, Skeledirge can use its typing and bulk to consistently check Garganacl and more easily snowball with Torch Song. Substitute also allows Skeledirge to scout Choice item Pokemon like Roaring Moon and Dragonite, as well as protecting it from revenge killers like Kingambit and Roaring Moon more reliably. Substitute also lets Skeledirge set up against the likes of Garganacl and Cinderace, and it blocks from status from the likes of Toxapex, Clodsire, and Thunder Wave Rotom-W. Maximum HP investment means that Garganacl cannot break Substitute with Salt Cure. 40 Defense EVs let Skeledirge survive two Bulldozes from Focus Sash Breloom, meaning it can consistently outheal Bulldoze, barring a critical hit. 188 Special Defense EVs ensures it survives a Shadow Ball from non-Tera Ghost Choice Specs Dragapult, while 28 Speed EVs let it outspeed Kingambit. Tera Fairy helps stop the likes of Dragapult and Great Tusk from overwhelming Skeledirge, especially the former, which bypasses Substitute with Infiltrator but cannot 2HKO Skeledirge after it Terastallizes. Tera Fairy also prevents Garganacl's Earthquake from breaking Substitute.

Substitute Skeledirge fits best on bulky offense and balance teams as a good check to Garganacl. Pokemon Garganacl can overwhelm such as Dragonite, Hex Dragapult, Dragon Dance Roaring Moon, Calm Mind Hatterene, Corviknight, Toxapex, and Dondozo can lure it in for Skeledirge to set up Substitute on and snowball. Additionally, the former can break through Pokemon that wall Skeledirge, namely Toxapex and Clodsire, and Dragapult and Corviknight also boast U-turn, letting them pivot into Skeledirge on a Garganacl switch-in. The setup sweepers enjoy Skeledirge's potent wallbreaking, too. Toxapex and Dondozo also check Pokemon that overwhelm Skeledirge, such as Dragapult and Greninja. Pokemon that do not mind Knock Off like Great Tusk and Corviknight greatly help this set, as Skeledirge is both weak to Knock Off and reliant on Heavy-Duty Boots due to its Stealth Rock weakness. These Pokemon also double as entry hazard removers, with the former preventing Gholdengo from entering safely and the latter checking Ground-types like Great Tusk and Ting-Lu. Entry hazard setters such as Garchomp and Meowscarada can chip down Pokemon that wall Skeledirge like Ting-Lu and Clodsire. In return, Skeledirge can threaten common entry hazard answers like Hatterene and Corviknight, as well as spinblocking in a pinch.

sets.name: Physically Defensive (Fire)
sets.description:
Skeledirge is a great choice for Fire teams as a non-passive physically defensive wall. With Will-O-Wisp and Unaware, it can check physical set-up sweepers such as Dragon Dance Dragonite or Belly Drum Azumarill that threaten Fire. Additionally, Torch Song lets Skeledirge fire back against these threats while raising its Special Attack and reducing passitivity. Hex pairs incredibly well with Will-O-Wisp, as it threatens large amounts of damage on burned foes, while Shadow Ball is a more consistent STAB option that hits opposing Skeledirge for more immediate damage. Heavy-Duty Boots lets Skeledirge avoid entry hazards chipping away at it whenever it switches in.

Volcarona is a great teammate for Skeledirge, as it can threaten Dark-types that annoy Skeledirge such as Ting-Lu and Kingambit. In return, Skeledirge can burn physical attackers, like Dragonite, giving Volcarona more setup opportunities. Paldean Tauros-F is also a good teammate, since it can threaten the aforementioned Dark-types with its Fighting STAB while also having Intimidate to help neutralize physical attackers that Skeledirge cannot handle on its own, such as Roaring Moon. Additionally, its Choice Scarf set can outspeed and KO Greninja. Torkoal pairs well with Skeledirge due to its ability to both remove entry hazards with Rapid Spin and set them up, all while also powering up Skeledirge's Torch Song. Cinderace is a fairly good partner as well due to High Jump Kick, letting it remove Dark-types aiming to threaten Skeledirge, while also being able to remove entry hazards with Court Change and hit Poison-types such as Clodsire and Toxapex with Zen Headbutt. Scovillain is a good partner, since it can remove Water-types such as Dondozo and Rotom-W with its Grass STAB. Both Talonflame and Air Balloon Iron Moth alleviate Skeledirge's weakness to threats such as Great Tusk and Ting-Lu.

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
This analysis is for the Regulation C format of Battle Stadium Singles, which lasts until June 30th, 2023. For more information on this format and its current events, check out the format page!

If you feel this analysis is missing anything important or needs an update, feel free to suggest any changes here.

sets.name: Defensive Gator
sets.description:
• Thanks to instant recovery, Unaware, and the snowballing potential of Torch Song, Skeledirge is a viable alternative to Dondozo.

  • Will-O-Wisp versus Yawn: Will-O-Wisp vastly improves Skeledirge's match-up against fearsome physical foes such as Kingambit, while Yawn works exceptionally well with Stealth Rock support.

  • Earth Power: If Iron Moth is particularly troubling, Earth Power is the best solution for it. It also hits Chi-Yu switch-ins hard.

  • Substitute: Substitute is a good way around status, especially Garganacl's Salt Cure. It also becomes effective when used on Toxic Spikes teams.

Other Options

  • Encore: When paired with Substitute, Skeledirge can seriously punish passive Pokemon, though at a serious cost in coverage.

  • Flame Charge: Despite Skeledirge's low Speed, stacking Flame Charge boosts can make it difficult to check, though it'll often need multiple boosts to outspeed threats without compromising its bulk.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - High: Skeledirge's defensive typing isn't without its merits, but the wide variety of weaknesses it has often forces Skeledirge to Terastallize to check major threats like Chien-Pao and Dragonite.

  • Fairy: Terastallizing into the Fairy typing removes Skeledirges glaring weakness to Dark and provides an overall superior defensive typing. making Chien-Pao and Ting-Lu far more reasonable to deal with. It also provides a neutral typing for the inevitable Shadow Balls that will be thrown at Skeledirge, like from Flutter Mane or Gholdengo.

  • Normal: While Tera Normal isn't fantastic defensively, it lets Skeledirge severely punish attempts from special attacking Ghost-types such as Flutter Mane and Gholdengo to check it.

  • Water: A Water Tera type lets Skeledirge take on opposing Water attacks, providing a valuable turn to burn foes like Azumarill and Palafin-H. It should be noted that Tera Water tends to be a safer option versus the common Gholdengo, as it does not often run Thunderbolt.

  • Fire: Despite the defensive nature of this set, Tera Fire's increased power for Torch Song is welcome, and it still helps Skeledirge against Chien-Pao.

Items

  • Leftovers versus Sitrus Berry: Residual recovery helps Skeledirge use Torch Song more freely. Leftovers is the best option since Skeledirge has instant recovery, but Sitrus Berry with an even HP stat can be used to restore some health after getting hit by Ruination.

  • Covert Cloak: Covert Cloak ignores the secondary effects of Salt Cure and Acid Spray, improving Skeledirge's match-up against Garganacl, Iron Moth, and Bellibolt.

  • Safety Goggles: The immunity to Spore Skeledirge gains lets it check Breloom, Amoonguss, and Brute Bonnet far more effectively.

  • Heavy-Duty Boots: This makes Skeledirge less pressured to Terastallize to rid itself of its Stealth Rock weakness.

Alternate EV Spreads

  • 220 HP / 76 Def / 212 SpD with Bold: This EV spread allows both Tera Fairy and Water Skeledirge to avoid a 2HKO from a plethora of offensive threats, such as Focus Sash Chien-Pao, Modest Gholdengo, Adamant Azumarill, and Choice Specs Dragapult, while still boasting significant physical bulk.

sets.name: Blunder Song
sets.description:
• With Blunder Policy, this Skeledirge provides a unique approach to offense: it'll either put important foes to sleep or threaten to snowball into a sweep with Speed and Special Attack boosts!

  • Shadow Ball: Even with Skeledirge's wide variety of viable Tera types, Shadow Ball is still an excellent secondary STAB attack for hitting Dragapult, Flutter Mane, and opposing Skeledirge.

  • Earth Power: Earth Power is Skeledirge's best option against Garganacl and Chi-Yu, and it makes checking Iron Moth feasible.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - High: Beyond the many weaknesses Skeledirge's typing has, it only has one shot of having +2 Speed, so Terastallizing is preferred over switching when possible.

  • Fairy: With this Skeledirge's more offensive nature, Tera Fairy's immunity to powerful Dragon-type attacks is a big help, and it makes Tera Blast an effective tool against bulky foes such as Ting-Lu, Baxcalibur, and Garchomp.

  • Water: Besides being a fantastic defensive typing, Tera Water gives Skeledirge the chance to pick off weakened Iron Bundle as they use Hydro Pump and gives it a good attack against Chi-Yu, Garganacl, and Iron Moth.

  • Fire: In addition to removing the troublesome Ghost-type weakness, Tera Fire makes sweeping with Torch Song require less setup.

  • Normal: Tera Normal gives Skeledirge a key Ghost-type immunity, taking advantage of common Choiced Ghost-types such as Gholdengo.

  • Grass: Tera Grass vastly improves Skeledirge's matchup against Breloom, Rotom-W, and Brute Bonnet.

EV Spreads

  • All EV spreads for this set should outspeed Dragapult after missing Sing.

  • 204 HP / 4 Def / 132 SpA / 4 SpD / 164 Spe with Modest: The HP investment in this spread lets Skeledirge survive one Earthquake from Garchomp or one Throat Chop from Jolly Focus Sash Chien-Pao when staying not Terastallizing, and one Choice Specs Hydro Pump from Iron Bundle when Tera Fairy or Tera Normal.

  • 92 HP / 252 SpA / 164 Spe with Modest: This spread sacrifices bulk for being able to OHKO Iron Bundle with Torch Song after Stealth Rock damage and doing the same to Kingambit with Tera Fire.

  • 164 HP / 180 Def / 164 Spe with Bold: This defensive spread allows Tera Skeledirge to always avoid a 2HKO from Jolly Choice Band Dragonite's Extreme Speed and avoids getting 2HKOed by Baxcalibur's 4-hit Icicle Spear when Tera Normal or Fairy.

  • 4 Def / 252 SpA / 252 Spe with Modest or Timid: A huge sacrifice in bulk makes it harder for Skeledirge to set up, but the Speed investment does allow it to outspeed several major Choice Scarf threats after missing Sing. Modest variants will outspeed up to Modest Choice Scarf Chi-Yu and Jolly Choice Scarf Annihilape, while Timid sets will Speed tie with +1 Espathra.

sets.name: Offensive Gator
sets.description: This set does not have a full write-up yet. If you'd like to finish this, feel free to reserve it here!

sets.name: Spinblocker
sets.description: Thanks to its typing and good physical bulk, Skeledirge serves as an excellent spinblocker that can wall common spinners such as Iron Treads with Earth Eater and Quaquaval with Desolate Land. It also walls threats like Choice Band Cinderace and Zamazenta-C and, depending on its ability, Garchomp and Primordial Sea Zapdos. Skeledirge can then use Torch Song to set up on passive opponents like Scream Tail and non-Well-Baked Body Blissey or Will-O-Wisp to burn an incoming foe, including switch-ins like Hisuian Goodra and Alolan Muk. Hex alongside Will-O-Wisp does more damage, but Shadow Ball can be used for more consistent damage. Skeledirge pairs well with hazard setters such as Garchomp and Iron Treads, as it allows them to keep their hazards on the field, and they can in turn handle opposing Well-Baked Body Pokemon. Due to its middling Special Defense, Skeledirge appreciates specially defensive teammates like Blissey and Hisuian Goodra. Additionally, a teammate that covers the type that Skeledirge chooses not to be immune to, such as Quaquaval for Earth Eater variants and Corviknight for Desolate Land variants, helps form a strong defensive core. Dark-types like Meowscarada and Chien-Pao also OHKO Skeledirge with a bit of chip damage, so Pokemon like Galarian Zapdos and Slither Wing that can threaten them are appreciated.

sets.name: Physically Defensive
sets.description:
• Will-O-Wisp burns physical attackers like Iron Hands, Great Tusk, and Annihilape.
  • Torch Song provides consistent damage while also ignoring Substitute, which helps versus Espathra, Volcarona, and Corviknight.
  • Encore shuts down slower Pokemon that use status moves like Soak Bellibolt and Fake Tears Sylveon. It also stops foes like Choice item Gardevoir and Choice Scarf Sableye from using Trick freely.
  • Blast Burn allows Skeledirge to OHKO threats like Iron Treads and Kingambit.
  • The investment in HP and Defense allows Skeledirge to survive Knock Off from Choice Band Meowscarada and Headlong Rush from Attack Booster Energy Great Tusk.
  • In combination with Weakness Policy, Blaze allows Skeledirge to OHKO Meowscarada after Meowscarada transforms into a Rock-type and uses Power Gem.
  • Unaware helps versus setup Pokemon like Bulk Up Annihilape, non-Lumina Crash Espathra, Volcarona, and Swords Dance Iron Hands.
  • Sitrus Berry helps against physical attackers and acts as insurance in case Will-O-Wisp misses against threats like Iron Hands.
  • Mental Herb is useful against opposing Encore users like Annihilape and Gardevoir.
  • Air Balloon is helpful against Ground-types like Great Tusk and Donphan.

sets.name: Defensive
sets.description: When it comes to Unaware Pokemon, Skeledirge is one of the best available; it has great physical bulk and a solid move in Torch Song, which boosts its already good Special Attack. These traits make it a hard-to-break physical wall and a potential wincon as well. Will-O-Wisp lets it cripple physical attackers such as Mega Tyranitar, Garchomp, Great Tusk, and Landorus-T while also punishing Water-types such as Rotom-W. Combined with Will-O-Wisp, Hex helps it overwhelm passive checks in Toxapex, Gastrodon, and Clodsire while also allowing Skeledirge to sweep statused teams. While not as strong as Hex, Shadow Ball is a decent option as it's more consistent. Tera Water allows Skeledirge to beat rain teams by spreading burns against rain sweepers such as Mega Swampert, Barraskewda, and Floatzel. On the other hand, Tera Fairy allows it to counter Dragon Dance Dragapult and avoid Pursuit from Kingambit, Mega Tyranitar, and Weavile while also keeping a Fighting resistance, meaning it can still check Zamazenta. It also removes Skeledirge's Ground weakness, allowing it to comfortably burn Pokemon like Garchomp, Great Tusk, and Landorus-T. Skeledirge struggles against Heatran and Garganacl, as it can't burn them nor deal significant damage to them. Therefore, Pokemon that pressure them like Garchomp and Rotom-W for the former and Cover Cloak Gholdengo for the latter make good partners. Skeledirge also hates losing its item, so Knock Off absorbers like Flyinium Z Tornadus-T and Gliscor make for good teammates. The former can also weaken Heatran for it while Skeledirge can burn Mega Tyranitar. Special sponges like Gastrodon, Clodsire, and Toxapex all appreciate Skeledirge's ability to cripple physical attackers such as Kartana, Mega Lopunny, and Kingambit, alleviating the pressure these Pokemon exert on them. In return, they can all handle special attackers like Gholdengo, Choice Specs Dragapult, and Mega Charizard Y.

sets.name: Physically Defensive (Ghost)
sets.description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

sets.name: Rapid Spin
sets.description: Quaxly is a notable Rapid Spin user in LC due to its access to reliable recovery and good matchup into entry hazard setters like Pawniard and Glimmet; it can also double as a capable sweeper thanks to Moxie. Aqua Cutter gives up some power compared to Liquidation but does not make contact, which avoids activating Greavard's Fluffy and Voltorb's Static, and removes the risk of activating Pawniard's Defiant with a Defense drop. Aqua Jet is STAB priority that OHKOs Hisuian Growlithe, while Brave Bird provides super effective coverage versus Grass- and Fighting-types like Toedscool and Foongus. Encore can lock opposing Pokemon into unfavorable moves, such as weak setup moves, gaining momentum for Quaxly's team. Quaxly can use Tera Grass for a better matchup versus Electric- and Grass-types as well as a valuable immunity to Spore from Foongus and Toedscool. Tera Flying can also be used with Brave Bird to turn Quaxly into a more potent offensive threat. Pokemon weak to Stealth Rock, such as Hisuian Growlithe, Wingull, and Nymble, are great partners for Quaxly, as they appreciate the removal of entry hazards to be used at their full potential. Foongus is another good partner, as it can safely switch into Grass-types and provides valuable Spore support. Pokemon such as Toedscool and Wattrel check Electric-types for Quaxly.

sets.name: Bulk Up
sets.description:
Quaquaval is an amazing setup sweeper due to Bulk Up, Moxie, and Aqua Step to outpace foes like Hydreigon, Iron Moth, and Garchomp. Bulk Up lets it more easily take out threats like Great Tusk, Armarouge, and Ting-Lu and survive attacks from Pokemon such as Baxcalibur, Tera Flying Roaring Moon, and Azumarill. Close Combat hits Pokemon that can take an Aqua Step, like Kingambit, Roaring Moon, Meowscarada, Hydreigon, and Baxcalibur, super effectively. Roost gives Quaquaval longevity to accumulate and take advantage of its boosts, and it allows Quaquaval to switch into Kingambit and Cinderace without fearing chip damage. Taunt shuts down Pokemon like Toxapex, Rotom-W, and Skeledirge by preventing the use of recovery and status-inflicting moves. It also blocks Defense-boosting attempts from Curse and Bulk Up users like Great Tusk and Garganacl. Ice Spinner is a great coverage move that hits Pokemon that would otherwise resist Quaquaval's STAB attacks, like Dragonite, Water Absorb Clodsire, and Amoonguss. 112 Speed EVs allow Quaquaval to outspeed Iron Moth after a boost. Tera Water boosts Aqua Step's power and removes Quaquaval's weakness to threats like Iron Valiant, Azumarill, and Future Sight Slowking. Tera Fighting boosts Close Combat’s power to dent threats like Garchomp and Breloom. It also allows Quaquaval to take less damage from Garganacl’s Salt Cure. Tera Poison is a defensive option that allows Quaquaval to resist Fairy-type attacks from Pokemon like Iron Valiant and Azumarill, absorb Toxic Spikes, and be immune to Toxapex and Clodsire's Toxic.

Quaquaval fits best on offense teams that support its ability to set up and sweep. Entry hazards from Pokemon like Meowscarada and Glimmora give Quaquaval an easier time taking out foes. Pivots like Rotom-W and Cinderace bring Quaquaval safely onto the field against threats like Volcarona, Great Tusk, and Baxcalibur. Cinderace in particular is able to provide entry hazard control with Court Change and can burn foes with Will-O-Wisp, giving Quaquaval an easier time to set up and sweep. Quaquaval targets common Fire-, Ground-, and Dark-types; therefore, it can support teammates weak to them like Corviknight and Gholdengo. In return, Corviknight can pivot Quaquaval into battle, come in on Assault Vest Toxapex, and remove entry hazards. Gholdengo blocks status that prevent Quaquaval from sweeping should it not run Taunt. Quaquaval struggles against Pokemon like Dragonite, Dragapult, and Azumarill; therefore, threats to them like Scizor, Iron Valiant, and Baxcalibur make good teammates. Scizor checks Azumarill, while Iron Valiant and Baxcalibur check Dragonite and Dragapult. Baxcalibur also dents Azumarill heavily, allowing Quaquaval to take it out more easily.

sets.name: Choice Scarf (Fighting)
sets.description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

sets.name: Rapid Spin (Water)
sets.description:
Quaquaval is a great pick for Water teams due to its unique access to Rapid Spin, threatening presence in the Steel and Dark matchups, and potential to snowball unsuspecting teams. Close Combat targets Steel- and Dark-types like Kingambit, Chien-Pao, and Hydreigon. Alternatively, Brick Break may be used to retain Quaquaval's defensive stats and clear dual screens in the Ice and Fairy matchups at the cost of extra damage. Aqua Step enables Quaquaval to function as a potential late-game cleaner and threatens Pokemon like Volcarona, Skeledirge, and Unaware Clodsire. Rapid Spin is used to clear entry hazards, aiding against entry hazard-stacking teams. The given EV spread allows Quaquaval to outpace Flutter Mane and Chien-Pao after a single Rapid Spin or Aqua Step boost, OHKO Flutter Mane after one Moxie boost, and better deal with priority moves from Breloom and Kingambit.

Greninja breaks past troublesome walls like Toxapex, Sableye, and Water Absorb Clodsire due to its wide range of coverage. Toxapex serves as an answer to threats like Meowscarada, Breloom, and Iron Valiant, sets up Toxic Spikes, and hinders Pokemon like Rotom-W, Dragonite, and Quagsire with Toxic. Gastrodon and Quagsire are valued for their Electric-type immunity against Pokemon like Rotom-W, Sandy Shocks, and Magnezon as well as their entry hazards, supporting Quaquaval as a cleaner. Pelipper can set rain to boost Quaquaval's Aqua Step and pressures Grass-types like Breloom, Infiltrator Brambleghast, and Meowscarada with Hurricane. Slowking can safely pivot into Quaquaval with Chilly Reception and aids in late-game cleaning with Future Sight.

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
With Paradox Pokemon being introduced, Series 2 is bringing big changes to Battle Stadium Singles! This is a modified Series 1 analysis that takes Paradox Pokemon into account. We will update this overview and analysis again once the metagame settles more. For more information on Series 2, check out the resource thread.

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

sets.name: Bulky
sets.description:
• While Quaquaval's bulk is only serviceable, having both Roost and a great support movepool makes it a reasonable defensive option that does particularly well against Kingambit.

  • Taunt and Bulk Up: Taunt pairs particularly well with Bulk Up, letting it set up on surprising foes such as Corviknight.

  • Substitute: Substitute lets Quaquaval stall out OHKO moves from the likes of Dondozo, and it protects it from Garganacl's Salt Cure.

  • Encore: Not only does Encore give Quaquaval new chances to set up, but it also punishes passive play from Unaware walls such as Skeledirge.

Tera Types

  • Flying: While it has very little defensive synergy with Quaquaval's previous typing, Tera Flying lets Quaquaval effectively stall out Dondozo if using Taunt, or Substitute and Encore together.

  • Grass: Tera Grass makes Quaquaval's match-up against Rotom-W much smoother.

  • Steel: Tera Steel gives Quauqaval a better matchup against Flutter Mane and Iron Bundle, who can be fairly problematic otherwise.

  • Fairy: With a Fairy Tera type, Quaquaval can set up against most defensive Garchomp thanks to the Dragon Tail immunity.

Items

  • Rocky Helmet: Rocky Helmet pairs well with Taunt and Tera Flying, letting Quaquaval easily play around Dondozo and Corviknight while setting up Bulk Up.

  • Covert Cloak: If running Substitute isn't possible, Covert Cloak is Quaquaval's best shot at defeating Garganacl.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 156 SpD / 100 Spe with Jolly: This EV spread allows Quaquaval to outspeed Meowscarada while raising its special bulk. If not using Bulk Up, running Defense EVs is also viable instead.

  • 244 HP / 4 Atk / 76 Def / 116 SpD / 68 Spe with Careful: The Special Defense investment and Careful nature let Quaquaval survive Choice Specs Hydreigon's Draco Meteor at full health, and the Speed lets it outspeed Garchomp after Aqua Step. The Defense investment lets Quaquaval avoid a 2HKO from Tera Dark Black Glasses Kingambit with one Supreme Overlord boost.

  • 252 HP / 4 Def / 252 Spe with Jolly: Maximizing Speed ensures that Quaquaval outspeeds Choice Scarf Gholdengo, Iron Bundle, Flutter Mane, and Dragapult after using Aqua Step.

sets.name: Moxie Sweeper
sets.description:
• Aqua Step and Moxie give Quaquaval a niche as a late-game sweeper that doesn't always need a turn of setup.

  • Ice Spinner: This is Quaquaval's best way of dealing big damage to Dragonite and Garchomp.

  • Encore: Encore lets Quaquaval punish slower foes such as Corviknight by getting an easy setup opportunity.

  • Roost: Recovery might seem odd on such an offensive Pokemon, but it helps Quaquaval avoid getting worn down against bulkier teams.

  • Aqua Jet: Aqua Jet's ability to pick off weakened threats pairs very well with Moxie, giving it new potential win conditions.

Tera Types

  • Water: Boosting Aqua Step's power opens up new sweeping chances late-game.

  • Electric: Tera Electric lets Quaquaval deal massive damage to Azumarill and wear down Dondozo switch-ins with Tera Blast.

  • Grass: Tera Grass lets Quaquaval potentially set up against would-be checks such as Rotom-W.

  • Fire: With Tera Fire, Quaquaval can get around Will-O-Wisp.

Items

  • Life Orb: The power increase makes sweeping with Aqua Step easier, especially against bulkier foes.

  • Focus Sash: With Focus Sash, Quaquaval trades potential wallbreaking for getting surprise sweeps against more offensive teams.

sets.name: Magic Guard
sets.description: Magic Guard Quaquaval is a formidable offensive Pokemon that also uses its excellent typing and movepool to serve as the premier offensive entry hazard remover in the tier. Wave Crash is a powerful, drawback-free STAB move that deals heavy damage to foes lacking resistance to Water. Brave Bird is used to hit common Water move switch-ins, like Desolate Land users and opposing Quaquaval. Close Combat can be used as a powerful secondary STAB move and is useful for hitting Steel types like Heatran and Hisuian Goodra, but its drawbacks and typing leave Quaquaval vulnerable to Desolate Land users like Iron Moth, Ceruledge, and Volcarona. Rapid Spin has fantastic synergy with Quaquaval's immunity to passive damage and ability to force out common hazard setters like Garchomp and Landorus-T; Quaquaval also appreciates the Speed boost and can use it in conjunction with Swords Dance to sweep later in the game. Roost greatly improves Quaquaval's longevity, allowing it to repeatedly check threats like Chien-Pao and Kingambit, while U-turn is used to safely bring in teammates after Quaquaval forces a switch. Quaquaval is hard to wear down thanks to Magic Guard, but its middling Speed and bulk leave it vulnerable to faster threats like Iron Moth, Zapdos, and Meowscarada. Fast, offensive teammates like Chien-Pao and Iron Moth appreciate Quaquaval's wallbreaking prowress and ability to remove hazards. Thanks to the passive damage immunity, Quaquaval excels as an offensive rapid spinner on hazard stacking teams, where teammates like Garchomp, Ting-Lu, and Glimmora can set hazards without worrying about enemy hazards wearing them down.

sets.name: Defensive
sets.description: Defensive Quaquaval uses its good physical bulk and typing to act as a physically defensive pivot, checking dangerous threats like Kingambit, Chien-Pao, and Hisuian Arcanine. Intimidate allows Quaquaval to weaken foes like Chien-Pao and Cinderace for its teammates, while Fluffy grants better bulk to better check Slither Wing and Roaring Moon. U-turn allows Quaquaval to maintain momentum and allows frailer teammates like Slither Wing and Hydreigon to pivot in safely while Rapid Spin offers role compression by allowing it to remove hazards while having a good matchup against entry hazard setters like Iron Treads and Garchomp. A Relaxed nature and 0 Speed IVs allow it to pivot out as slow as possible. Meloetta is a valuable teammate that can switch in on special threats such as Iron Moth and Zapdos that force Quaquaval out. Physical wallbreakers like Meowscarada and Talonflame have a good type matchup against Quaquaval, hence teammates that can force them out like Zamazenta-C and Regieleki make solid partners.

sets.name: Bulk Up
sets.description: The set(s) displayed are used as a placeholder until an analysis is written for this Pokemon. Stay tuned for any updates!

sets.name: Sticky Web Setter
sets.description: Prankster Spidops is the optimal Sticky Web setter for hyper offense teams. Spikes and Toxic Spikes add more residual damage for opposing switch-ins, which can be valuable for securing KOs. Taunt is used to block setup and Defog, while Circle Throw forces switches and can rack up residual damage in combination with Spikes. Focus Sash is used to ensure that Spidops can get up Sticky Web and at least one layer of Spikes before fainting. Slow wallbreakers like Chi-Yu and Quaquaval appreciate the opportunities provided by Sticky Web support. Setup attackers such as Chien-Pao and Ceruledge also pair well with Spidops, as it enables them to outspeed would-be revenge killers. Spidops struggles to set Sticky Web against spinners, so it's recommended to pair Spidops with a Ghost-type like Earth Eater Skeledirge that can beat spinners like Iron Treads. Additionally, common Dark-types like Kingambit and Roaring Moon can set up on Spidops lacking Circle Throw, so pairing it with a strong Fighting type like Slither Wing is advised.

sets.name: Revenge Killer
sets.description: Nymble's unique combination of STAB First Impression and a powerful ability in Tinted Lens allows it to become one of Little Cup's reliable revenge killers, picking off targets such as Toedscool and sweepers such as Shellder. U-turn allows Nymble to pivot on the switches it forces and avoid problematic matchups, such as Wattrel. Sucker Punch revenge kills foes that have Protect or can safely tank a First Impression, such as Drifloon. Tera Bug boosts Nymble's power to absurd levels, letting it OHKO Hisuian Growlithe. Nymble switches out of battle very often, so hazard control from teammates such as Drifloon, Quaxly, and Toedscool are good partners to have. Mareanie and Pawniard can switch into Nymble's common checks such as Hisuian Zorua and Mudbray well. Pokemon weak to Grass- or Dark-types such as Mudbray and Hisuian Zorua appreciate Nymble forcing out or removing their checks. Hisuian Voltorb and Grookey pair well with Nymble, as they can make a deadly VoltTurn combination.

sets.name: All Out Attacker (Bug)
sets.description:
With access to nearly unresisted First Impression and U-turn due to Tinted Lens, Lokix is an amazing revenge killer for Bug teams. Its ability to scare out many common threats such as Espathra, Chien-Pao, and Dragapult is highly valuable. Lokix struggles to break past many physically defensive walls like Quagsire, Dondozo, and Corviknight; however, it can pivot in teammates—such as Vivillon and Volcarona—that can beat them. A Choice Band with an Adamant nature maximizes Lokix's damage output and can utilise Axe Kick to lure and defeat Steel-types like Kingambit and Iron Treads. Alternatively, Life Orb avoids a Choice lock and makes use of Sucker Punch to pick off threats that First Impression alone cannot such as Gholdengo and Flutter Mane. Throat Chop lets Lokix deal good unresisted STAB damage and prevents Skeledirge from using Torch Song, which is extremely valuable and one of the reasons Lokix is a necessity for Bug teams.

Lokix is highly susceptible to entry hazards and is often not quite strong enough to OHKO many Pokemon. Forretress is a great entry hazard remover and entry hazard setter, fixing both of those issues. Forretress also has a good defensive profile, acting as a sponge for absorbing damage, and it can even form a VoltTurn core with Lokix. Scizor removes Fairy-types that threaten Lokix such as Hatterene and Iron Valiant and allows Lokix to clean up after it has done enough damage. Volcarona takes care of Steel-types that don't fall to Axe Kick such as Corviknight and Scizor. Lokix can remove Ghost-types—such as Gholdengo, Dragapult, and Flutter Mane—to enable Slither Wing and Heracross, letting them spam their powerful Fighting-type moves and clean up after Lokix. Frosmoth can deal with many bulky Ground-types—such as Garchomp, Great Tusk, and Ting-Lu—and Vivillon improves the Fighting-type matchup by beating Great Tusk, Gallade, and Paldean Tauros-W and can answer Dondozo with the combination of Sleep Powder and Energy Ball. Masquerain can set up Sticky Web, which gives Lokix an amazing Speed advantage versus Iron Treads, Iron Moth, and Walking Wake, making Life Orb Lokix immensely threatening.

sets.name: Swords Dance (Dark)
sets.description:
Excellent for the Dark mirror and revenge-kills threats such as Barraskewda.

This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. These will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
Welcome to the next generation of Battle Stadium Singles! In this new and exciting metagame, new ideas are constantly developing, so this analysis will constantly be updated to reflect metagame trends.

If you feel this analysis is not up to date, feel free to check out the thread for this Pokemon and post suggestions. For more resources on Series 1 in general, check out this thread.

sets.name: Tinted Offense
sets.description:
