• The combination of First Impression and Tinted Lens make Lokix one of the most threatening revenge killers in the format, able to outprioritize and KO foes regardless of resistance.

  • First Impression is Lokix's most important attack, but it can only be used as the first attack after it switches in.

  • U-turn can be punishing against offensive and slow teams as the lack of resists means Lokix can keep switching in and dealing big damage with First Impression, at the cost of making it vulnerable to hazards.

  • Leech Life is the strongest Bug-type move Lokix learns outside of First Impression, with the added benefit of healing recoil damage.

  • Sucker Punch is a powerful STAB priority move, enabling Lokix to outprioritize foes even after it has used First Impression.

  • Axe Kick is the only coverage move of note in Lokix's moveset due to its high Base Power. Be wary of the low accuracy and recoil that occurs should it miss.

  • Throat Chop is the most powerful Dark-type move Lokix learns. It also has the side benefit of disabling Roar from Hippowdon and Hyper Voice from Sylveon.

  • Swords Dance is an option to make Lokix a sweeper instead of a revenge killer.

Items

Life Orb: Life Orb enables easier revenge kills at the cost of recoil.

Silver Powder: Silver Powder raises the power of First Impression without the recoil from Life Orb, and it also frees up Life Orb for a teammate to use instead.

Tera Types

Bug: A Bug Tera Type increases the damage of First Impression, allowing Lokix to OHKO foes it could not otherwise, such as Dragapult.

sets.name: Revival Blessing
sets.description:
• Pawmot has a distinct niche as the best Revival Blessing user in the tier.
  • Tera Electric removes the downside of Double Shock, making it much safer to click.
  • Mach Punch helps pick off weakened foes such as Chien-Pao, Iron Bundle, and Tera Steel Koraidon.
  • Leppa Berry's purpose is to attempt to revive as many teammates as possible throughout a game.
  • Pawmot best fits on hyper offense teams, bringing back fainted teammates, but it also has a niche on bulkier teams.
  • Koraidon, Life Orb Chien-Pao and Flutter Mane, and offensive Great Tusk often end up being KOed rather quickly through recoil for the former three and defensive drops for the latter. This makes them excellent targets for Pawmot's Revival Blessing. Choice Specs Chi-Yu is similarly left helpless after consecutive Overheat uses.
  • On bulkier teams, bringing back a self-sufficient wincon such as a fainted Annihilape or Skeledirge can be a viable strategy.
  • Entry hazard setters such as Glimmora and Froslass pair up nicely with the hyper offense aspects of the teams Pawmot finds itself on. Pawmot also beats the best Defogger in the tier in Corviknight.
  • Iron Bundle is a fantastic partner, beating the various Ground-types that switch into Pawmot such as Great Tusk, Iron Treads, and Clodsire.

sets.name: Offensive Support
sets.description:
Pawmot carves out a niche in OU thanks to Revival Blessing, further supporting its teammates. Double Shock is a very strong move, despite its single-use nature, but Thunder Punch is an alternative because of Iron Fist's added power and its ability to threaten Corviknight more reliably. Mach Punch gives Pawmot a form of speed control against offensive threats such as Kingambit, Greninja, and Roaring Moon. Ice Punch hits Ground-types such as Great Tusk, Garchomp, and Clodsire super effectively as well as threats that resist Pawmot's STAB moves like Dragapult and Amoonguss. Tera Electric allows Pawmot to repeatedly use Double Shock, allowing Pawmot to repeatedly hit bulky threats such as Slowking, Dondozo, Corviknight, and Skeledirge while shedding Pawmot's weakness to attacks from Iron Valiant, Hatterene, and Armarouge. Leppa Berry maximizes the use of Revival Blessing.

Pawmot's capabilities allow it to fare best on offensive teams that appreciate Revival Blessing bringing back frail threats. Late-game cleaners such as Kingambit, Roaring Moon, Iron Valiant, and Iron Moth all appreciate Pawmot bringing them back into the game, allowing them another chance to run through the opposing team. Revival Blessing has great synergy with Kingambit in particular as it can be used to increase Kingambit's power from its teammates fainting. Pawmot also fits well on rain teams because of Revival Blessing bringing back teammates like Golduck, Barraswekda, and Floatzel, especially the latter of which that tends to faint from Wave Crash recoil, allowing them to sweep again. Pawmot's biggest challenges are Ground-types such as Great Tusk, Ting-Lu, Clodsire, and Garchomp; therefore, Pokemon that can pressure them, such as Baxcalibur, Walking Wake, Meowscarada, and the aforementioned rain wallbreakers, are great teammates.

sets.name: Wallbreaker
sets.description:
Thanks to its high Speed, unique typing, and powerful Electric-type STAB move in Double Shock, Pawmot sets itself apart as one of the premier wallbreakers in UU. Seed Bomb allows Pawmot to lure common checks such as Quagsire and Gastrodon and OHKO them handily. Alternatively, Ice Punch provides a solid middle ground against Ground- and Flying-types, in cases where losing Pawmot's Electric typing via Double Shock is not ideal, as well as allowing Pawmot to hit Brambleghast effectively, although this does require backup for Gastrodon and Quagsire. Natural Cure allows it to not worry about Talonflame's Flame Body and use Rest to improve its longevity, offsetting the damage from Life Orb and entry hazards. Tera Electric allows for Pawmot to continuously use Double Shock without switching out and increases its power, making it even more difficult to handle. This also helps Pawmot's defensive matchup against threats such as Gardevoir, Noivern, and Brave Bird Talonflame; although, one should still be aware of losing important resistances to strong priority attacks such as Slither Wing's First Impression and Bisharp's Sucker Punch. Heavy-Duty Boots is also an option over Life Orb to preserve Pawmot's longevity.

Pawmot fits well on teams that benefit from its ability to handle common threats such as Tinkaton, Slowking, and Tyranitar by breaking through them with raw power, as well as offensive teams that appreciate its excellent Speed. Reliable entry hazard setters such as Tinkaton and Sandy Shocks are worth considering, as the chip damage they provide makes it even easier for Pawmot to break through defensive threats, with the former also boasting Encore to help generate free turns. Grass-types such as Wo-Chien, Brambleghast, and Tsareena are also appreciated to handle Gastrodon and Quagsire, especially if Pawmot chooses Ice Punch, with the latter two also offering reliable hazard removal. Rock-types such as Tyranitar and Lycanroc-D that handle Talonflame as well as other Flying-types such as Iron Jugulis and Noivern are also appreciated. Scream Tail is also a teammate worth considering, as it has access to Stealth Rock and Encore, as well as Wish to keep Pawmot healthy and Thunder Wave to cripple fast threats like Grafaiai and Gengar while also having a strong matchup against revenge killers such as Noivern and Iron Jugulis. Pawmot also appreciates teammates with pivoting moves, such as Scizor, Tsareena, Noivern, and Grafaiai, to allow it to come in safely, especially against targets such as Tinkaton and Slowking.

sets.name: Choice Scarf
sets.description:
Pawmot is a solid threat in the UU metagame and becomes an excellent revenge killer when paired with Choice Scarf, threatening Pokemon like Talonflame, Wo-Chien, and Salamence. Pawmot's last moveslot can be either Revival Blessing or Seed Bomb. Revival Blessing allows Pawmot to revive a teammate on a forced switch, while Seed Bomb can threaten Pokemon like Quagsire and Gastrodon better. Revival Blessing is more commonly run, as Close Combat can usually do enough damage to break these walls with some entry hazard assistance. An Electric Tera type is vital for Pawmot, as it allows Pawmot to spam Double Shock without repercussion. Natural Cure allows Pawmot to shrug off burns from the likes of Talonflame and Altaria, as they would otherwise hinder Pawmot's offensive presence.

Choice Scarf Pawmot best fits on Spikes stacking teams in need of speed control. This makes Pokemon like Quagsire and Gastrodon good teammates, as they enjoy setting up Stealth Rock or Spikes, and the former can also use Toxic to chip teams down more efficiently for Pawmot. Pawmot struggles to deal with bulky Ground-types like Hippowdon, making teammates like Brambleghast and Wo-Chien appreciated due to their ability to soak up Earthquake while also removing hazards or removing Heavy-Duty Boots to rack up entry hazard damage, respectively. Pokemon that can outspeed Pawmot, like Choice Scarf Gengar and +2 Polteageist, can cause major issues, making priority users like Scizor and Lycanroc-D good partners to KO these threats.

sets.name: Choice Scarf (Electric)
sets.description:
Pawmot is a great Choice Scarf user on Electric teams by virtue of its coverage and utility, being able to deal with Chien-Pao and Flutter Mane. With Revival Blessing, Pawmot can give second chances to fallen offensive Pokemon such as Iron Hands and Choice Specs Zapdos to punch holes in opposing teams. Double Shock allows Pawmot to OHKO threats such as Flutter Mane and Azumarill as well as finishing off Iron Valiant, but this comes with the downside of Pawmot immediately being forced out after using the move. Ice Punch allows Pawmot to deal decent damage to Ground-types that resist both its STAB moves, notably OHKOing both Landorus formes as well as 2HKOing both Iron Leaves and Clodsire. Volt Switch allows Pawmot to pivot out of a check such as Amoonguss into one of its teammates to deal with it. Play Rough and Seed Bomb are usable alternatives, with Play Rough being able to 2HKO Sableye while still hitting Dragon-types and Seed Bomb dealing with Water/Ground types that most Electric-type Pokemon cannot handle efficiently. Notably, Seed Bomb OHKOes specially defensive Gastrodon and 2HKOes physically defensive Quagsire. Grass Knot can also be used, being able to 2HKO Quagsire as well as Great Tusk.

Sandy Shocks provides great hazard support to wear down incoming foes for Pawmot to take advantage of. Ground-immune Pokemon such as Zapdos and Rotom-W are appreciated by Pawmot, being able to switch into an anticipated Ground-type attack from the likes of Great Tusk and Landorus-T. Zapdos can also threaten Grass-types such as Amoonguss, while Rotom-W together with Pawmot can overwhelm Quagsire. In return, Pawmot can revive one of them so it can continue checking Ground-types when needed. Regieleki provides hazard removal and a fast pivot for Electric teams, and in return it appreciates Ground-types being lured in and removed by Seed Bomb Pawmot variants. Assault Vest Iron Hands is another great teammate, being able to switch into attacks that could OHKO Pawmot such as Dragapult's Draco Meteor and Enamorus's Moonblast. Iron Hands can also OHKO the latter when running Heavy Slam. In return, Pawmot can run Seed Bomb to handle Water/Ground types Iron Hands cannot efficiently threaten such as Quagsire, and Swords Dance variants of Iron Hands appreciate it removing Flutter Mane and wearing down Sableye. Magnezone is a great partner, being able to threaten the Fairy-types that can threaten Pawmot such as Hatterene and Flutter Mane.

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
With Paradox Pokemon being introduced, Series 2 is bringing big changes to Battle Stadium Singles! This is a modified Series 1 analysis that takes Paradox Pokemon into account. We will update this overview and analysis again once the metagame settles more. For more information on Series 2, check out the resource thread.

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

sets.name: Offensive Utility
sets.description:
• Pawmot separates itself from Iron Hands by having an excellent support movepool and a good Speed tier.

  • Double Shock and Close Combat: Double Shock and Close Combat are its most important attacks, but note that it can only use Double Shock once without Terastallizing. Once Terastillized, Pawmot you can use Double Shock continuously for big damage, even on foes that resist it.

  • Mach Punch: Priority allows Pawmot to revenge kill better, hitting Meowscarada, Roaring Moon, and Iron Bundle super effectively.

  • Ice Punch: Ice Punch gives Pawmot coverage against Ground-types, most notably Clodsire and Garchomp, in addition to hitting Dragapult for lots of damage.

  • Revival Blessing: Revival Blessing's one shot of reviving a teammate give Pawmot an extremely unique niche in turning battles around, though it doesn't fit all offensive teams.

  • Nuzzle This is notably one of the few ways to inflict paralysis on Gholdengo. Nuzzle is best when used with a Focus Sash, as Pawmot can paralyze the foe and outspeed it the next turn, getting another move off before it faints.

  • Encore: Encore does a great job of punishing passive play, and prevents easy setup from slower defensive foes such as Garganacl.

Other Options

  • Fake Out: This can be used to get an edge against common Focus Sash leads such as Meowscarada.

Abilities

  • Iron Fist: This boosts the power of Mach Punch and Ice Punch, giving Pawmot more powerful priority and coverage.

  • Volt Absorb: Volt Absorb's Electric immunity stops Magnezone, Rotom-W, and Rotom-H from using Volt Switch to create safe switch-ins.

  • Natural Cure: This allows Pawmot to take status moves more freely, such as Yawn from Dondozo or Will-O-Wisp from Skeledirge.

Items

  • Life Orb: Life Orbs enables easier revenge kills at the cost of recoil.

  • Focus Sash: Focus Sash trades the damage boost from the other items for better opportunities to use support moves.

  • Magnet: Magnet will power up Double Shock without the recoil from Life Orb, and it also frees up Life Orb for a teammate to use instead.

Tera Types

  • Electric: An Electric Tera Type allows Pawmot to continuously use Double Shock, making it an effective late-game cleaner.

sets.name: Offensive
sets.description: Pawmot leverages its potent typing that hits popular defensive staples such as Corviknight and Ting-Lu to serve as a powerful wallbreaker. Expert Belt capitalizes on Pawmot's great coverage, while Choice Band allows 2HKOs on neutral targets like Scream Tail and Skeledirge; alternatively, Magic Guard + Life Orb with Double Shock and Thunder Punch can also be used for similar neutral damage and the freedom to switch moves. Mach Punch allows Pawmot to beat faster offensive mons such as Chien-Pao, Meowscarada, and Greninja. Ice Punch allows Pawmot to reliably OHKO Garchomp and beat Clodsire, while Volt Switch can keep up momentum against defensive switch-ins such as Scream Tail and Fluffy Brambleghast. Jolly lets Pawmot outspeed Garchomp and non-Choice Scarf Sandy Shocks, while an Adamant nature bolsters its 2HKO chances on targets such as Scream Tail and Skeledirge with Choice Band Wild Charge. Pawmot often struggles to switch in safely, so it appreciates teammates like Corviknight and Iron Treads that can safely pivot Pawmot in.

sets.name: La Familia
sets.description:
• Maushold is a niche pick that provides entry hazard removal and momentum to hyper offense teams thanks to its versatile signature move in Tidy Up and ability to either sweep a weakened team or wallbreak.
  • Maushold has several viable utility options. Encore limits defensive counterplay and opposing setup attempts, while Taunt prevents foes from using status moves, recovering health, and setting up entry hazards. Thunder Wave gives Maushold's teammates an easier time against the opposing team.
  • It can also choose from several excellent coverage moves. Beat Up grants it coverage against Ghost-types, which wall its main attack, and does not incur damage from Rocky Helmet. Bullet Seed helps against Great Tusk, doing heavy damage to it and bypassing its Rocky Helmet; it is also useful against Garganacl. On the other hand, Low Kick is useful against Steel- and Rock-types. You can tailor Maushold's moveset to what fits your team best.
  • Tera Fire provides Maushold with an immunity to burn, letting it set up on a common answer in Skeledirge. Furthermore, it gives Maushold an Ice resistance, making it less vulnerable to being revenge killed by Chien-Pao's Ice Shard, and a Fighting neutrality, allowing it to possibly survive previously super effective Fighting-type moves such as Great Tusk's Body Press and Koraidon's Collision Course.
  • On the other hand, Tera Normal boosts the power of Population Bomb, allowing Maushold to OHKO Great Tusk and Kingambit and 2HKO physically defensive Corviknight at +1. Another notable upside is that the residual damage of Rocky Helmet is reduced due to Population Bomb needing less hits to KO foes.
  • Tera Grass provides Maushold with a resistance to Ground and STAB on Bullet Seed, allowing it to bypass Rocky Helmet on Great Tusk, Slowking, and Toxapex. Despite this upside, it also gives Maushold an Ice weakness, allowing Chien-Pao to more easily revenge kill it with Ice Shard.
  • Great partners for Maushold are Pokemon that give it more longevity and easier entry, as it has poor bulk and is threatened by most attacks. Grimmsnarl offers screens support, while Koraidon and Miraidon can bring Maushold in with U-turn. In addition, Knock Off support from Great Tusk and Iron Treads helps Maushold by removing Great Tusk and Corviknight's Rocky Helmet, allowing for freer use of Population Bomb.
  • Other great partners are Pokemon that are either weak to entry hazards or appreciate the extra HP, since Maushold can relieve pressure and provide its teammates with easier setup opportunities. Pokemon such as Miraidon, Chien-Pao, Baxcalibur, and Chi-Yu appreciate hazards being cleared, allowing them to be more threatening in return. Moreover, offensive Pokemon also benefit from Maushold's breaking potential; in particular, Koraidon and Kingambit appreciate the removal of Great Tusk and Toxapex.

sets.name: Tidy Up
sets.description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

sets.name: Wish
sets.description:
Dachsbun is the best Wish passer in PU. Its great typing and decent overall bulk give it ample opportunity to keep itself and its teammates healthy while checking threats like Gabite and Alolan Persian. Well-Baked Body also lets Dachsbun switch into Fire-types like Charizard and Houndoom as well as absorb Will-O-Wisp from Misdreavus and Charizard, all of which threaten other Wish passers like Leafeon. Body Press prevents Steel-types from walling Dachsbun and also gets stronger if Well-Baked Body has already been triggered. Play Rough is good coverage alongside Body Press and hits Misdreavus, but Roar can be used instead to force setup sweepers like Gogoat and Carbink out as well as rack up chip damage if entry hazards are up. Copycat can be used to copy entry hazards from Pokemon like Whiscash as well as beat certain setup sweepers like Iron Defense Carbink one-on-one. Tera Steel lets Dachsbun absorb Steel- and Poison-type attacks and gives it an edge against Pokemon such as Sludge Bomb Houndoom, Articuno, and Indeedee-F. Dachsbun can run 64 Speed EVs to outspeed neutral-natured Honchkrow at the cost of some bulk. Dachsbun can also opt for a physically defensive spread to better take on Pokemon like Lycanroc-N and, after Terastallizing, Zangoose.

Dachsbun fits best on balance teams in need of cleric support and a blanket check to various offensive threats. Pokemon like Gabite, Mareanie, and Tinkatuff can check Steel- and Poison-types like Alolan Dugtrio and Skuntank for Dachsbun, and they appreciate Dachsbun coming to their aid against foes such as Articuno and Pyroar. Charizard is another great partner that switches into Steel-types like Perrserker and non-Rock Slide Alolan Dugtrio and can do so repeatedly thanks to the Wishes Dachsbun passes. Setup sweepers like Rotom-F and Gogoat find it easier to boost multiple times in a game with Dachsbun keeping them healthy. Wish support also gives Gogoat an easier time preserving Milk Drink's limited PP, which allows it to play more recklessly early on against threats that Dachsbun baits in, such as Basculin. In return, these setup sweepers make up for Dachsbun's passivity and can threaten out nuisances like Vespiquen and Whiscash. Misdreavus can spread burns to give Dachsbun an easier time against physical attackers like Crabominable and slow opposing walls down with Taunt. Meanwhile, Dachsbun can stand up to Fire-types like non-Tera Steel Charizard, check Dark-types like Alolan Persian and Honchkrow, and reduce Misdreavus's reliance on Pain Split for recovery.

sets.name: Physical Wall
sets.description:
• Dachsbun is a niche counter to Koraidon and useful pivot into Chi-Yu thanks to Well-Baked Body.
  • Body Press gives good neutral coverage with Play Rough and nails Kingambit and Tera Steel users.
  • Wish provides reliable recovery and support for teammates such as Ting-Lu, Great Tusk, and Iron Treads which cannot heal outside of Leftovers.
  • Rocky Helmet is useful for the chip damage on Koraidon, while Leftovers works well with Protect and prevents Choice Specs Chi-Yu from 2HKOing with Dark Pulse.
  • Tera Flying is useful so that Dachsbun can take on Great Tusk in a pinch.
  • Tera Poison makes sure that Toxic Spikes is not a concern.
  • Tera Water is useful against Chien-Pao.
  • Dachsbun faces significant competition as a defensive Fairy-type from Scream Tail and Hatterene. Scream Tail provides superior overall bulk, which helps it handle Great Tusk, and a more useful support movepool, while Hatterene provides practically-unique utility with Magic Bounce.
  • As a Koraidon counter, it also faces competition with Skeledirge, which handles more physical threats than Dachsbun does.
  • Dachsbun's main advantages are its superior Speed, a strong Body Press, and most notably taking on Chi-Yu. It provides great counterplay to the common pairing of U-turn Koraidon and Chi-Yu: U-turn Koraidon often threatens its checks by pivoting Chi-Yu into them, but Dachsbun can take on both threats.
  • Protect Dondozo works well with Dachsbun, as it appreciates Wish support and Dachsbun taking on Koraidon. In return, Dondozo can handle offensive Great Tusk without worry and sweep more easily with Curse.
  • Dachsbun is vulnerable to all entry hazards, so Corviknight, Iron Treads, and Great Tusk are good partners to remove them.

ru.overview: The tier is still in its infancy and the metagame develops with each passing day. The sample set(s) provided below will be regularly updated until proper analyses are in the works. See it as a rough outline to get started and accustomed to what sets are commonly used.

sets.name: Choice Specs
sets.description: 52 Speed EVs are to outspeed Bellibolt. Tera Fairy Tera Blast is used to hit Dragon-types such as Goodra.

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
This analysis is for the Regulation C format of Battle Stadium Singles, which lasts until June 30th, 2023. For more information on this format and its current events, check out the format page!

If you feel this analysis is missing anything important or needs an update, feel free to suggest any changes here.

sets.name: Assault Vest
sets.description:
• With a superb special stat line, Seed Sower, and good moveset coverage, Arboliva can be a deceptively strong and long-living Assault Vest user!

  • Seed Sower: Once activated, Grassy Terrain’s passive recovery and boosting of Grass-type attacks like Giga Drain can help Arboliva survive longer than expected. Grassy Terrain also halving Earthquake’s power is greatly appreciated by bulky teammates like Skeledirge, Arcanine, and Iron Hands.

  • Dazzling Gleam: This move keeps Arboliva from becoming setup bait against foes like offensive Dragonite, and is also your best move into Wo-Chien before Tera.

  • Tera Blast: Tera Blast is a great option for hitting types that Arboliva lacks natural coverage for. Tera Fire lets Arboliva hit Steel-types like Scizor and Tera Electric punishes Tera Flying users like Gholdengo. Both Tera Fire and Tera Electric cover Corviknight as well.

  • Mirror Coat: This set’s massive special bulk can make getting one-shots with Mirror Coat awkward, but it is still a great option, particularly against boosted or super effective hits. Bear in mind though that this won’t work against Chi-Yu as long as it keeps its Dark typing.

  • Leaf Storm: Leaf Storm trades consistency for a single turn of high burst damage and can be worth it if investing in Special Attack.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Arboliva’s raw special stats make it capable of tanking super effective hits without using Tera. Nonetheless, Tera is still a strong tool to extend Arboliva’s uptime and contest matchups that would otherwise capitalize on its mediocre defensive typing.

  • Fire: Tera Fire can flip matchups against Focus Sash Chien-Pao and Choice Scarf Chi-Yu when healthy. If running Tera Blast, it also gives Arboliva the opportunity to contest Steel-types more effectively. Be aware, though, that this significantly worsens other key matchups, like Rotom-W.

  • Poison: Tera Poison is a solid defensive option, especially into Toxic abusers like Toxapex and Clodsire. Notably, it flips several weaknesses, blocks Toxic, and allows for absorbing Toxic Spikes later in the match.

  • Electric: Tera Electric is Gholdengo's worst nightmare. It gives a resistance to Make It Rain, blocks Thunder Wave from defensive sets, and punishes Tera Flying usage that is meant to get around Earth Power. On top of that, Arboliva still hits Corviknight very hard.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy is another great defensive option for neutralizing most of Arboliva's weaknesses, and the extra power behind Dazzling Gleam can make it easier to break defensive Dragonite variants.

  • Grass: Tera Grass removes Arboliva’s Fighting weakness while maintaining Spore immunity, letting it check Breloom. If both Tera and Grassy Terrain are active, Modest Giga Drain can even 2HKO Breloom!

  • Ground: While not as strong defensively, invested Tera Earth Power can OHKO uninvested Chi-Yu and Gholdengo.

EV Spreads

  • 236 HP / 4 Def / 140 SpA / 124 SpD / 4 Spe with Modest: This spread balances bulk and power, avoiding the 2HKO from Choice Specs Gholdengo's Make It Rain and almost always surviving Modest Chi-Yu’s Fire Blast before Tera! If running Tera Ground, there are enough Special Attack EV’s to turn Earth Power into an OHKO against uninvested Chi-Yu and Gholdengo. The Speed EV's Speed tie with 4 Speed Gastrodon.

  • 236 HP / 252 SpA / 20 SpD with Modest: This simple spread still provides plenty of bulk while maximizing Special Attack, working nicely with Leaf Storm and Tera Types that boost Arboliva's coverage moves. If Grassy Terrain is present, fully invested Leaf Storm has a 75% chance of OHKOing 4 Special Defense Garchomp. The bulk investment lets Arboliva always avoid the 2HKO from Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Mystical Fire after Grassy Terrain recovery.

  • 236 HP / 20 SpD / 252 Spe with Modest: While maximum Speed investment may seem a bit strange, it can be worth it when running Tera Fire Tera Blast to get the jump on Scizor, Corviknight and the rare Timid Amoonguss.

  • 236 HP / 4 Def / 148 SpA / 20 SpD / 100 Spe with Modest: This alternative Speed spread gives Arboliva a nice boost in Special Attack while still letting it outrun 4 Speed Azumarill. This is usually more than enough Speed to outrun Ting-Lu as well.

ru.overview: The tier is still in its infancy and the metagame develops with each passing day. The sample set(s) provided below will be regularly updated until proper analyses are in the works. See it as a rough outline to get started and accustomed to what sets are commonly used.

sets.name: Specially Defensive
sets.description:
• The combination of Purifying Salt and access to reliable recovery and Iron Defense makes Garganacl a solid late-game wincon.
  • Body Press gains power very quickly with Iron Defense boosts and provides great coverage in tandem with Salt Cure.
  • Tera Fairy allows Garganacl to continue to set up against Great Tusk and Koraidon, which often switch in to handle Garganacl. Fairy also has few weaknesses in general.
  • Tera Water lets Garganacl take on Water-type attacks from Iron Bundle and Palafin.
  • Tera Steel is the best option to use on a sand team.
  • Garganacl with Special Defense investment works as a great check to Flutter Mane.
  • Pokemon such as Skeledirge, Toxapex, and Scream Tail have a hard time doing any damage to Garganacl, making Koraidon a great partner.
  • Garganacl is unable to take on Miraidon and Iron Bundle. As such, Ting-Lu is recommended for dealing with Miraidon, while Corviknight, Blissey, and specially defensive Scream Tail can handle Iron Bundle.
  • While Garganacl works well regardless of the weather, Hippowdon deserves special mention as a teammate for providing sand support, greatly increasing Garganacl's Special Defense.

sets.name: Curse
sets.description:
Curse Garganacl is a sturdy wall that can spread passive damage and boost to win in the long term. It can take hits from Dragapult, Zapdos, and Iron Moth as well as sit on passive walls like Toxapex, Clodsire, and non-Grass Knot Amoonguss, giving it plenty of opportunites to enter the field. In addition to letting it contest with Attack-boosting foes like Dragonite, Dragapult, and Roaring Moon, Curse boosts Salt Cure's initial damage to threaten Pokemon like Corviknight, which would otherwise exhaust Salt Cure's PP with Pressure. Curse also works well with Earthquake, breaking past Covert Cloak Gholdengo, non-Haze Toxapex, opposing Garganacl, and Skeledirge's Substitute. Stealth Rock is a viable alternative if the team lacks a Stealth Rock user, since Garganacl tends to force multiple switches with Salt Cure and can outlast and annoy common entry hazard removers like Great Tusk and Corviknight. Tera Water lets it take on Kingambit, Gholdengo, Azumarill, and rain teams better, while Tera Fairy improves its matchup against Dragapult, Great Tusk, and Meowscarada, the latter of which can bypass Garganacl's boosts with Flower Trick. The EV spread prevents a 2HKO from offensive Great Tusk's Close Combat or Headlong Rush after Curse, even after its Leftovers is removed by Knock Off.

Curse Garganacl is a valuable asset for balance teams. Defensive teammates such as Corviknight, Toxapex, Skeledirge, and Clodsire cover threats like Great Tusk, Greninja, Iron Valiant, and Gholdengo, respectively. Skeledirge in return appreciates Garganacl switching into Shadow Ball from Dragapult and Hisuian Zoroark, with Tera Water variants dealing with Gholdengo and Water-types as well, while Ting-Lu and Clodsire are secondary checks to Dragapult, Heatran, and Iron Moth, which keeps Garganacl moderately healthy early-game so it can have an easier time sweeping later on. Knock Off users such as Great Tusk and Meowscarada are crucial to remove Covert Cloak and Heavy-Duty Boots from Pokemon like Amoonguss, Clodsire, Gholdengo, Corviknight, and Slowking. Great Tusk, Meowscarada, Toxapex, and Clodsire can also set entry hazards of their own, either allowing Garganacl to forgo Stealth Rock or forming an entry hazard stacking core. Offensive teammates like Dragapult and Choice Scarf Iron Valiant and Meowscarada are great against offensive teams that contain the likes of Dragonite and Roaring Moon—which can overwhelm Garganacl prior to boosting—and can clean up late-game in case Garganacl is unable to fully sweep. In return, Garganacl matches up well against defensive foes that they struggle with, such as Clodsire and Toxapex, especially with Dragapult bringing it into them safely via U-turn.

sets.name: Stealth Rock
sets.description:
Garganacl is a great Stealth Rock setter thanks to its fantastic bulk, longevity with Recover, and ability to easily force switches against Great Tusk and outlast Defog Corviknight one-on-one. Protect alongside Salt Cure wears down entry hazard removal options such as Great Tusk and especially Corviknight due to its limited Roost PP and typing's vulnerability to Salt Cure. Protect also scouts out the intentions of Choice locked Pokemon such as Gholdengo and gives extra Leftovers recovery. Terastallization, lets Garganacl turn the tables on Great Tusk and Iron Treads lacking Iron Head, and makes it an incredibly consistent Stealth Rock setter. Specifically, Tera Fairy lets it completely wall Dragapult, while Tera Water lets it check Gholdengo, though this makes its matchup against opposing Garganacl much tougher. 116 Special Defense EVs let Garganacl take a Draco Meteor from Choice Specs Tera Dragon Dragapult at full health.

Garganacl fits on a wide variety of teams from bulky offense to stall thanks to it setting up Stealth Rock easily and having fantastic longevity. Ting-Lu is a fantastic partner since it can lay Spikes, and check Gholdengo and unboosted Kingambit, and wear down Corviknight much faster with Ruination thanks to Garganacl running Stealth Rock. Meowscarada and Great Tusk provide Knock Off support by removing Heavy-Duty Boots and Covert Cloak from Gholdengo and Toxapex to let Garganacl accrue Salt Cure damage more freely. Great Tusk also removes entry hazards with Rapid Spin. Gholdengo appreciates Great Tusk being worn down, since it shuts down other forms of entry hazard control well and fits alongside Garganacl and other entry hazard setters such as Garchomp. Cinderace lures in and uses U-turn on bulky Water-types such as Dondozo and Toxapex, giving Garganacl free entry to pressure them with Salt Cure.

sets.name: Iron Defense
sets.description:
The combination of Iron Defense + Body Press lets Garganacl serve as a bulky and dangerous setup sweeper, allowing it to beat Pokemon it otherwise loses to, such as Dragonite, Roaring Moon, and Kingambit. Salt Cure wears down common switch-ins such as Great Tusk, Gholdengo, Rotom-W, and Hatterene, as well as passive Pokemon like Toxapex and Corviknight, and forces them to burn recovery PP more often. Recover keeps Garganacl healthy throughout a game to check Pokemon like Ceruledge and Iron Moth and makes it more sustainable as a wincon. Purifying Salt prevents it from being crippled by Pokemon like Toxapex, Rotom-W, and Clodsire. It also provides a handy Ghost resistance, letting Garganacl potentially switch in on predicted Ghost-type moves from Pokemon like Dragapult and Skeledirge. Leftovers provides valuable passive recovery, reducing Garganacl's reliance on Recover. Maximum Special Defense EVs and a Careful nature maximize Garganacl's bulk, making it easier for Garganacl to switch in on Pokemon such as Dragapult, Zapdos, and Heatran and use them as setup fodder. Tera Water provides incredibly valuable resistances, letting Garganacl potentially check Gholdengo and Scizor while retaining its ability to pivot in on Fire-types like Cinderace. Tera Fairy allows Garganacl to turn the tables on Great Tusk while also preventing Breloom from revenge killing it. However, this does remove its resistance to Fire, making it more susceptible to Pokemon like Skeledirge and Ceruledge. Tera Ghost prevents Fighting-types like Iron Hands and Great Tusk from reliably revenge killing Garganacl, letting it use them as setup fodder. It does negate the Ghost resistance provided by Purifying Salt, however, so another switch-in to Dragapult's Shadow Ball should be used.

Checks to strong wallbreakers like Iron Valiant and Breloom are good teammates; examples include the likes of Toxapex, Amoonguss, and Corviknight. While Garganacl is given a Ghost resistance from Purifying Salt, it cannot fully check Dragapult and Gholdengo prior to Terastallization, with the latter completely countering it if it uses Covert Cloak. As such, Pokemon like Ting-Lu and Clodsire make for great teammates. Pokemon like Corviknight and Scizor appreciate Garganacl checking Fire-types like Ceruledge and Skeledirge. Corviknight is notable in that it also forms a strong defensive core with Garganacl, checking Meowscarada for it. Entry hazard removers like Great Tusk and the aforementioned Corviknight are appreciated, as Garganacl is heavily pressured by entry hazards and cannot set up reliably if it is worn down. Frail, offensive Pokemon like Cinderace appreciate chip damage being forced onto their checks and having a strong defensive Pokemon to fall back on. Pokemon like Ting-Lu, Kingambit, and Iron Valiant can pave the way for Garganacl to clean late-game, wearing down or significantly pressuring its checks in Gholdengo, Meowscarada, and Fighting-types like Iron Hands and Great Tusk.

sets.name: IronPress
sets.description:
Garganacl eases the Water and Steel matchups thanks to its signature move, Salt Cure. Iron Defense allows Garganacl to set up, tanking super effective physical hits due to its astronomical base 130 Defense, while also boosting the power of Body Press, which helps nail Dark- and Steel-types such as Ting-Lu, Chien-Pao, and Kingambit. Curse is another option that can buff its Attack, boosting the damage of Salt Cure, but it prevents Garganacl from easily stonewalling physical attackers—such as Dragonite and defensive Quaquaval—and also lowers Garganacl's Speed. Salt Cure is a fantastic STAB move, neutering setup sweepers such as Mimikyu, Corviknight, and Hatterene, as it puts them on a timer, which Garganacl can potentially stall out as it sets up or heals via Recover. Purifying Salt is particularly useful, as it allows Garganacl to absorb incoming status moves such as Toxic from Quagsire or Toxapex as well as Will-O-Wisp from Dragapult or Sableye and punish them with Salt Cure. Garganacl is also able to tank Ghost-type STAB moves from the likes of Choice-locked Flutter Mane and Dragapult. Leftovers is the best item to provide passive recovery; however, Heavy-Duty Boots can allow Garganacl to come in without taking entry hazard damage, as entry hazard stacking is extremely common. As an alternative to the given EVs, 52 Defense EVs with an Impish nature let Garganacl potentially overwhelm Choice Band Scizor, Tinkaton, and defensive Quaquaval if used with Iron Defense.

Tyranitar is an amazing partner for Garganacl, as it sets sand. Tyranitar can also be used as one of the few special attackers Rock teams have access to to nail physical walls such as Great Tusk with Ice Beam; it is also Rock's best check to Kingambit due to it being able to survive a boosted Sucker Punch and OHKO back with Fire Blast. Choice Scarf Glimmora can take on Grass- and Fighting-types such as Breloom and Iron Valiant that may threaten Garganacl out. Glimmora also has fantastic coverage, being able to take on Steel-types such as Gholdengo with Earth Power and Water-types such as Gastrodon and Quagsire with Energy Ball. Glimmora can also provide Toxic Spikes support thanks to its ability, Toxic Debris, which can help Garganacl further wear down and pressure the opposing Pokemon. Teammates that utilize Air Balloon such as Iron Thorns and Drednaw can switch into powerful Ground-type attacks aimed at Garganacl. Drednaw can also utilize its Water-type STAB move to take out opposing Ground-types such as Iron Treads, Unaware Clodsire, and Ting-Lu. Furthermore, Drednaw can also turn the tide against rain Water teams thanks to its ability, Swift Swim. Lycanroc-D is also a really good partner for Garganacl that appreciates its ability to wear down foes so it can clean up late-game. Coalossal is also a good partner that can not only burn foes but also lay down entry hazards. Coalossal can also clear its side of the field as well with Rapid Spin, alleviating chip damage on the team. It also acts as a soft check to Scizor and Meowscarada due to its neutralities and can potentially neuter them with Flame Body.

doublesou.overview: With solid defenses and access to reliable recovery, Garganacl can perform well in a utility role or with setup in Iron Defense. Its biggest selling points are its unique move and ability: Salt Cure offers valuable passive damage, synergizing well with its natural bulk, while Purifying Salt provides a useful immunity to status moves such as Spore and Toxic. Garganacl is difficult to break for many Pokemon, but it matches up notably well into Fire-types such as Chi-Yu and Arcanine, Flying-types like Dragonite and Iron Jugulis, and Amoonguss due to Purifying Salt. As one of the best Wide Guard users, Garganacl can block the format's many powerful spread attacks such as Gholdengo's Make It Rain, Chi-Yu's Heat Wave, and Armarouge's Expanding Force. Iron Defense lets Garganacl play as a potent wincon instead, increasing its Defense whilst simultaneously strengthening its offensive presence through Body Press. These sets can be very difficult to take down, though they often rely on using up Terastallization to be most effective. Garganacl's abysmal Speed means it will usually be relegated to moving last. Rock typing also leaves Garganacl with countless weaknesses, including to Water-, Steel-, and Fighting-type moves, meaning common Pokemon such as Palafin, Gholdengo, Iron Bundle, Iron Hands, and Great Tusk all significantly threaten it. Amoonguss is one of the best partners for Garganacl, being helpful against several of the aforementioned threats, while Garganacl checks Fire-types like Chi-Yu in return, with redirection support and healing being especially critical for Iron Defense sets. Garganacl also appreciates teammates that can check Gholdengo, especially if not using Wide Guard, so Pokemon like Chi-Yu, Arcanine, Ting-Lu, and Kingambit are other desirable additions.
doublesou.comments:
Other Options

Other defensive Tera types are also usable depending on team needs. For example, Tera Poison still provides a Fighting-type resistance but doesn't gain the Dark-type weakness that Tera Ghost does. This means after Terastallization, Garganacl will still be good against Chi-Yu and gains immunity to Toxic Spikes, at the cost of not losing its Ground-type weakness. Tera Water is another alternative, offering helpful resists against Water-types like Palafin and Steel-types like Gholdengo.

sets.name: Bulky Utility
sets.description:
• Salt Cure forms Garganacl's offensive presence, dealing insignificant damage directly but leaving a powerful residual effect that lasts even after Garganacl leaves the field.

  • Recover complements Garganacl's bulk, allowing it to outheal most attacks while Salt Cure passively whittles down foes.

  • Wide Guard stops powerful spread attacks such as Make It Rain, Heat Wave, Expanding Force, and Earthquake. Stealth Rock alternatively offers chip damage throughout the match, breaking Focus Sashes and punishing attempts to remove Salt Cure's effect through switches.

  • Protect lets Garganacl rack up Leftovers recovery and Salt Cure damage. This is especially effective against the Water- and Steel-types that threaten Garganacl, as they take increased damae from Salt Cure's effect.

  • The given EV spread and nature patch up Garganacl's lower Special Defense, making it difficult to break through with both physical and special attacks, which is further aided by Leftovers for even more healing.

  • Purifying Salt provides an invaluable immunity to Amoonguss's Spore and a notable resistance to Gholdengo's Shadow Ball, which assists in stalling it out with Wide Guard.

  • Tera Ghost turns Garganacl's weakness to Fighting-types like Iron Hands and Great Tusk into an immunity, effectively leaving it with a single weakness with Purifying Salt.

sets.name: Iron Defense
sets.description:
• Salt Cure provides passive damage, which is especially useful on this set for Pokemon that resist or are immune to Body Press, such as Gholdengo and Amoonguss.

  • Iron Defense makes Garganacl even more difficult to knock out, while Body Press lets the boosts double as an offensive bonus too.

  • Recover enhances Garganacl's staying power, increasing its effectiveness as a wincon.

  • EVs and nature are used to maximize special bulk, as Iron Defense covers the physical side. Leftovers tops out Garganacl's survivability with some passive healing.

  • Purifying Salt confers immunity to Spore and prevents a traditional form of setup counterplay in Toxic.

  • Tera Ghost gives a valuable Fighting-type immunity, notably including Sacred Sword, which will ignore the Defense boosts, and leaves Garganacl with effectively just one weakness in combination with Purifying Salt.

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
This analysis is for the Regulation C format of Battle Stadium Singles, which lasts until June 30th, 2023. For more information on this format and its current events, check out this page!

If you feel this analysis is missing anything important or needs an update, feel free to suggest any changes here.

sets.name: Defensive
sets.description:
• With Purifying Salt making it immune to status and Salt Cure providing useful chip damage, especially against Water- and Steel-types, Garganacl is a dangerous defensive setup Pokemon.

  • Iron Defense and Body Press: Body Press is the best option for consistency against offensive teams.

  • Fissure: Fissure severely punishes passive play against Garganacl, at the cost of forcing it to rely on Salt Cure residual damage against offensive teams.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - High: Rock has a huge amount of weaknesses as a defensive typing, so Garganacl will usually want to Terastallize to make sweeping more feasible.

  • Ghost: A Ghost Tera type gives Garganacl an immunity to Body Press, giving it the edge against Corviknight and opposing Garganacl, especially when paired with Leftovers. Note that Curse will no longer boost Garganacl's stats when Terastallized.

  • Water: Tera Water vastly improves Garganacl's chances of defeating Gholdengo and Chien-Pao, thanks to no longer being weak to Make It Rain or Sacred Sword.

  • Flying: A Flying typing lets Garganacl take on new foes such as Ting-Lu, Great Tusk, Garchomp, Breloom, and Brute Bonnet, though it makes Garganacl fairly weak to Iron Bundle and Chien-Pao

  • Fairy: Fairy is a fantastic defensive type for Garganacl, giving it a useful Fighting and Dark resistance to help against Chien-Pao and Chi-Yu, and no longer worrying about powerful Dragon-type attacks.

  • Poison: While Garganacl isn't worried about Toxic Spikes itself, it can make an emergency worthy absorber of them with Tera Poison, while also dealing with Fighting-type coverage much better.

  • Steel: Terastallizing into a Steel-type stops Amoonguss from clearing its boosts with Clear Smog and makes Garganacl a decent check to Fairy-types such as offensive Mimikyu and Substitute + Calm Mind Flutter Mane.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 252 SpD / 4 Spe with Careful: If using Tera Flying Garganacl, maximizing Special Defense is the best choice for easier setup.

  • 252 HP / 252 Def / 4 Spe with Impish: In addition to powering up Body Press, a focus on Defense makes setting up on powerful setup sweepers such as Dragonite an easier task.

  • 252 HP / 84 Def / 172 SpD with Careful: This EV spread allows Tera Steel Garganacl to avoid a 2HKO from Breloom's Mach Punch after Iron Defense.

sets.name: Salty Stall
sets.description:
• With some entry hazard support, this Garganacl can be very difficult to outstall, thanks to the constant passive damage from Salt Cure.

  • Protect: Not only does Protect scout for surprise Tera types, but it also goes well with the passive healing from Leftovers.

  • Substitute: This makes Garganacl even more difficult to properly switch into, providing protection against Trick, OHKO moves, and opposing Salt Cure.

  • Fissure: Garganacl's great bulk makes it a prime candidate for fishing with Fissure itself, though its low PP can be an issue in mirror matches.

  • Stealth Rock: Since this set benefits so much from Stealth Rock support, running it on its own is a reasonable sacrifice if Garganacl needs to be more self-sufficient.

Other Options

  • Fling with Light Ball, Toxic Orb, or Flame Orb: Although the loss of Leftovers can be a huge blow for Garganacl, Fling and its associated status inducing items can be a devastating surprise for some of its checks, such as Annihilape and Great Tusk.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: While Rock may be an awful defensive typing, this Garganacl complete focus on taking advantage of Salt Cure means that in some scenarios, it can get away without Terastallizing.

  • Ghost: While removing Purifying Salt's Ghost resistance is a shame, Tera Ghost does wonderfully against Corviknight, Iron Hands, Great Tusk, and opposing Garganacl due to the Body Press immunity, and in general removes all of Garganacl's common weaknesses.

  • Water: Tera Water gives Garganacl a better matchup against Chien-Pao and Gholdengo, in addition to being an excellent defensive typing.

  • Flying: Tera Flying gets rid of the Ground and Fighting weaknesses, giving it a far better chance of beating Great Tusk and Garchomp. It also makes Fissure no longer an issue from Ting-Lu, Dondozo, and opposing Garganacl.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy lets Garganacl tank powerful Fighting coverage such as Chien-Pao's Scared Sword, and shrug off powerful Dragon-type attacks from Garchomp and Dragonite.

  • Poison: Tera Poison's Fighting and Fairy-type resistance is already good, but absorbing Toxic Spikes can be great support for other teammates as well, even if Garganacl never has to worry about the status itself.

  • Steel: Tera Steel gives Garganacl a better matchup against Gholdengo and Flutter Mane, though sharing the Ground and Fighting weaknesses is a big issue.

  • Grass: Tera Grass gives Garganacl a much easier time against Rotom-W and Palafin-H, in addition to a Leech Seed immunity against Wo-Chien and Breloom.

sets.name: Curse
sets.description:
• With Curse's well-known different effect for Ghost-types being brought into play by Terastallization, Garganacl makes dangerous and diverse use of the move!

  • Tera Ghost Curse: If using Tera Ghost, Curse will change its effect, which drastically changes Garganacl's playstyle. While the 50% health cut can make it a tad risky, the Curse affliction is very powerful at wearing down Pokemon, including major foes that take advantage of Salt Cure, such as Covert Cloak Pokemon, bulky Substitute users, and Espathra Baton Pass chains. When combined with Salt Cure, it can even overwhelm bulky Pokemon with recovery, such as Dragonite.

  • Curse and Earthquake: Ghost Curse unfortunately does not work against Gholdengo, so using regular Curse alongside Earthquake makes Garganacl far less passive against against Gholdengo and frail Substitute users such as Flutter Mane. This is especially recommended if using other Tera types.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - High: Salt Cure means Garganacl can still without Terastallization, but to truly take advantage of either facet of Curse, expect to Terastallize it often.

  • Ghost: In addition to being a great defensive typing that leaves Garganacl with only a weakness to Dark thanks to Purifying Salt, this is the Tera type that enables the unique properties of Curse.

  • Water: If messing with Gholdengo is the goal, Tera Water is an excellent choice, resisting the powerful Make It Rain and being a good defensive typing in general.

  • Steel: Tera Steel works very well against Flutter Mane and makes for a Make It Rain resistance against Gholdengo. However, retaining the Ground and Fighting weaknesses means it doesn't change as many matchups as other Tera types.

  • Flying: Tera Flying has excellent synergy with Garganacl's former typing, making it immune to Ting-Lu and Dondozo's Fissure and giving it a much better matchup against Meowscarada and Great Tusk. However, this comes at the cost of still making it vulnerable to Iron Bundle.

sets.name: Specially Defensive
sets.description: Garganacl finds itself as a Stealth Rock setter that fits on balance and stall teams with its ability to force progress through passive damage and maintain entry hazards by annoying popular hazard removal options with Salt Cure. Toxic Debris allows Garganacl to punish weak physical attacks like U-turn from Corviknight and Meloetta, while Earth Eater allows it to check and set up with Iron Defense or Curse on Ground-types like Iron Treads, Landorus-T, and Garchomp, and Water Absorb allows it to check Greninja, Inteleon, and Quaquaval lacking Close Combat. Stealth Rock pairs well with Salt Cure, as Salt Cure heavily chips common hazard removal options like Iron Treads and Corviknight, while Iron Defense and Curse allow Garganacl to act as a bulky cleaner late-game. Protect allows Garganacl to scout the opponent's move, heal with Leftovers, and force more passive damage on foes, while Earthquake and Body Press hit Magic Guard Pokemon like Quaquaval and Heatran that otherwise switch in freely. Garganacl's inability to check common special wallbreakers like Sheer Force Iron Moth and Enamorus-T makes pivots like Regieleki and Slither Wing and physical wallbreakers like Chien-Pao great partners; in return, they appreciate Garganacl's ability to maintain Stealth Rock on the field and annoy their checks like Hisuian Goodra and Corviknight with Salt Cure. Garganacl gets rapidly worn down by entry hazards when carrying Leftovers, making physically defensive hazard removal options like Corviknight and defensive Quaquaval good partners; these Pokemon also check physical wallbreakers that threaten Garganacl like Galarian Zapdos, while it checks the special wallbreakers that threaten them. The aforementioned Magic Guard Quaquaval checks Garganacl lacking Iron Defense + Body Press and can spin away Garganacl's Stealth Rock; Desolate Land Skeledirge can spinblock Quaquaval effectively, making it a good partner for Garganacl.

sets.name: IronPress
sets.description: Garganacl is an astounding wincon due to the combination of Iron Defense + Body Press allowing it to beat Pokemon like Dragonite, Kingambit, and Great Tusk. Salt Cure makes easy progress and accrues chip damage on switch-ins like Gholdengo, Rotom-W, Heatran, and Great Tusk while also forcing Pokemon like Gastrodon and Mega Scizor to burn their recovery PP more often, making them passive and more easily worn down. Recover allows Garganacl to check Pokemon like Tornadus-T and Dragapult long-term and increasess its sustainability as a wincon. Tera Water allows Garganacl to check Pokemon like Gholdengo and Urshifu-R while providing valuable resistances to Steel- and Water-type moves. Notably, It allows Garganacl to stave off rain attackers such as Mega Swampert and Barraskewda. Alternatively, Tera Fairy lets Garganacl reliably set up in front of Pokemon like Great Tusk and Zamazenta while also being a near hard check to Dragapult. Maximum Special Defense investment allows Garganacl to deal with Pokemon like Tapu Koko and Choice Specs Dragapult reliably. Pokemon like Toxapex, Clodsire, and Gholdengo pair well with Garganacl as they serve as reliable defensive checks to strong wallbreakers like Urshifu-R, Iron Valiant, and Tapu Lele, respectively. Entry hazard removers like Tornadus-T and Great Tusk are also appreciated, as Garganacl is susceptible to chip damage from entry hazard. Garganacl mandates Knock Off support to serve as an effective wincon, as it can be pivoted around with Regenerator Pokemon holding Heavy-Duty Boots such as Toxapex and Slowbro without it. As such, partners such as the aforementioned Tornadus-T and Kingambit are useful. It additionally needs entry hazard support from Pokemon such as Clodsire and Heatran to outdamage Regenerator. Wallbreakers like Iron Valiant and Kartana appreciate their checks in Skeledirge and Gholdengo from being worn down by Salt Cure; these Pokemon also appreciate having Garganacl as a wall to fall back on. Pokemon that can support Garganacl to let it clean up late-game like Weavile, Tapu Lele, and Kingambit pair well with it, as they can immediately remove Pokemon that Garganacl would struggle with, such as Covert Cloak Gholdengo and Urshifu-R.

sets.name: Stealth Rock
sets.description: Garganacl is a great entry hazard setter, as it takes advantage of the myriad of switches it forces with Salt Cure and ability to exploit passive Pokemon such as Toxapex and Clodsire. Salt Cure aggressively accumulates chip damage on switch-ins such as Urshifu-R and Kartana, and it punishes entry hazard removers like Great Tusk, Rotom-W, and Tornadus-T. Protect allows Garganacl to accrue more recovery from Leftovers and scout Pokemon like Great Tusk, Iron Valiant, and Dragapult, all while accruing chip damage on them with Salt Cure. Recover maintains Garganacl's longevity against Pokemon like Dragapult and Tapu Koko. Tera Water gives it neat resistances to Gholdengo's Make It Rain and Urshifu-R's Surging Strikes while also improving its matchup against rain wallbreakers such as Mega Swampert and Floatzel. Tera Fairy lets it handle Pokemon like Tera Grass Volcarona and Zamazenta safely, and it renders Dragapult useless against it. Maximum Special Defense investment allows Garganacl to deal with Pokemon like Volcarona, Tornadus-T, and Tapu Lele reliably. Pokemon like Toxapex, Kingambit, and Gholdengo support Garganacl as they deal with strong wallbreakers like Urshifu-R, Gholdengo, and Tapu Lele; Gholdengo in particular makes an amazing teammate as it prevents Defog and Rapid Spin from clearing Garganacl's Stealth Rock while also dealing with Pokemon like Mega Scizor and Kartana. Garganacl appreciates Knock Off users such as Tornadus-T and Toxapex, as they let it beat Regenerator Pokemon such as Slowbro and Toxapex with its own entry hazards. Pokemon that like their defensive checks being worn down due to Stealth Rock and Salt Cure such as Tapu Lele and Mega Medicham appreciate Garganacl's presence, as it wears down Pokemon like Tornadus-T and Gholdengo.

sets.name: Iron Defense
sets.description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

sets.name: Psychic Terrain Attacker
sets.description:
Armarouge carves a niche for itself with its powerful STAB moves and passable Speed alongside its unique setup and offensive utility. Endure allows Armarouge to survive any direct attack, and when combined with Weak Armor's speed boost, it can allow Armarouge to turn the tables on faster physical threats like Great Tusk, Dragapult, Baxcalibur, and Garchomp. Expanding Force is Armarouge's most powerful attack in Psychic Terrain and 2HKOed all neutral targets besides the uncommon Blissey. Moreover, with Spikes support or Tera Psychic, it can reliably OHKO the likes of Clodsire and Baxcalibur. Armor Cannon is Armarouge's strongest move outside of Psychic Terrain and complements Expanding Force well, OHKOing Steel-types like Gholdengo, Kingambit, and Corviknight and 2HKOing Hatterene. Calm Mind capitalizes on the switches it forces, allowing it to always OHKO Rotom-W and Volcarona with Expanding Force while often OHKOing Garganacl. Destiny Bond can instead force a trade against threats it cannot OHKO normally, such as Roaring Moon, Dragonite, and bulky threats like Ting-Lu and Dondozo. If Psychic Terrain is not active, Destiny Bond forces Sucker Punch users like Kingambit into a difficult situation, where they must either KO Armarouge next turn and faint or switch out and let Armarouge land a powerful attack for free. Tera Psychic powers up Expanding Force to ludicrous levels, allowing it to 2HKO specially defensive Skeledirge and OHKO Dondozo, physically defensive Garganacl, Clodsire, Garchomp, Volcarona, and Baxcalibur while OHKOing Assault Vest Toxapex after a Calm Mind boost. Focus Sash gives Armarouge space to survive at least one hit from full HP, allowing it to set up a Calm Mind or hit attackers back, and it can punish a contact move without committing to Endure. A Modest nature gives Armarouge the best odds of OHKOing Clodsire, Rotom-W, Walking Wake, and Baxcalibur after chip damage from entry hazards, but a Timid nature helps Armarouge sweep late-game by outpacing Speed-boosting Walking Wake with Protosynthesis active, outpacing +1 Iron Moth, and tying with +1 Iron Valiant.

Armarouge is a staple on "Psychic spam" teams, which use Psychic Terrain and a litany of powerful setup sweepers to overwhelm opponents at a breakneck pace. Psychic Terrain blocks priority moves, including Kingambit's Sucker Punch and Dragonite's Extreme Speed, rendering Armarouge very difficult to revenge kill after a Weak Armor boost. Indeedee is a mandatory teammate to set Psychic Terrain, and it can wear down Dark-types with Dazzling Gleam. Furthermore, its Healing Wish can give a weakened Armarouge or one of its teammates a second chance to sweep. Polteageist is another common Psychic spam threat that can threaten the Dark-types Armarouge struggles against with a Fighting-type Tera Blast; in return, Armarouge can handle Steel-types, which Polteageist would otherwise be forced to Terastallize against. One of Armarouge or Polteageist can also wear down Ting-Lu, allowing the other to break past it and sweep late-game. Entry hazard control is extremely important, especially hazard removal, since Armarouge greatly prefers having Focus Sash active to sweep. Eject Pack Great Tusk provides excellent role compression for these teams, since it provides both Stealth Rock and Rapid Spin, and it can get Armarouge in safely by activating Eject Pack with Close Combat or Headlong Rush; notably, Armarouge can use Stealth Rock to more easily OHKO Rotom-W, Assault Vest Toxapex, and Clodsire without using up its team's Terastallization. Hatterene can deter opposing entry hazards with Magic Bounce while spreading paralysis with Nuzzle and weakening Dark-types with Dazzling Gleam; it can also use Eject Button to reliably pivot in Armarouge if Psychic Terrain is up. Magic Bounce also deters Taunt users, which can otherwise prevent Armarouge from setting up with Calm Mind and Endure, and Hatterene can also offer Healing Wish support. Lastly, many other setup sweepers can fit well on Psychic Terrain teams to open up a sweep for Armarouge, or to sweep once Armarouge punches holes for them. Volcarona and Dragon Dance Baxcalibur can weaken or eliminate Ting-Lu and Roaring Moon, which Armarouge struggles greatly against, while Armarouge can break past Clodsire and Unaware walls for Volcarona to sweep, and it can deal with Steel-types to assist Baxcalibur.

sets.name: Calm Mind (Psychic)
sets.description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
This analysis is for the Regulation C format of Battle Stadium Singles, which lasts until June 30th, 2023. For more information on this format and its current events, check out the format page!

If you feel this analysis is missing anything important or needs an update, feel free to suggest any changes here.

sets.name: Expanding Force
sets.description:
• Armarouge's combination of powerful STAB moves, excellent coverage, Weak Armor, and Psychic Terrain makes it a strong candidate to use Focus Sash.

  • Psychic Terrain: Psychic Terrain is a powerful setup move for Armarouge thanks to Expanding Force; it also protects Armarouge from priority moves after Weak Armor triggers.

  • Expanding Force: Expanding Force under Psychic Terrain especially with Tera Psychic, is a devastatingly powerful move.

  • Armor Cannon: This helps Armarouge defeat Steel-types as well as Chien-Pao and Wo-Chien, who all resist or block Expanding Force.

  • Aura Sphere: While Armor Cannon covers several prominent Dark-types, Aura Sphere is needed if you want to threaten Chi-Yu or Roaring Moon.

  • Destiny Bond: This is a good alternative to forcefully take down threats that Armarouge can’t easily KO, and it works very well with Weak Armor.

  • Energy Ball: Energy Ball hits the specially defensive Water-types Armarouge might struggle to defeat otherwise, most notably Gastrodon.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low / Medium: Between Focus Sash and Psychic Terrain blocking priority moves, Armarouge is well-equipped to play without Tera. On the other hand, Armarouge can specialize to handle certain matchups better, at which point Tera can become more necessary.

  • Grass: This Tera typing turns Armarouge's Water- and Ground-type weaknesses into resistances, and gives a vital Spore immunity against opposing Breloom.

  • Psychic: With a boost from Tera Psychic, Expanding Force OHKOes even relatively bulky foes such as Garchomp and Flutter Mane. With Stealth Rock, Expanding Force still achieves most notable KOs without Tera Psychic, but the extra damage is still appreciated.

  • Fairy: In cases where setting up Psychic Terrain proves to be more difficult, Tera Fairy grants a resistance to Sucker Punch and makes disrupting other Dark-types like Chi-Yu easier. Its also just a solid defensive typing that neutralizes all of its other weaknesses.

  • Fighting: Tera Fighting is a more niche option for a Dark-type resistance that also powers up Aura Sphere.

Abilities

  • Weak Armor: This ability takes full advantage of Focus Sash, guaranteeing you live a single hit from a physical attacker and granting a big Speed boost thereafter.

  • Flash Fire: While more situational, Flash Fire is worth considering with certain Tera Types like Grass, keeping momentum against revenge killers who use Fire-type attacks. It can also be used with Tera Fairy or Tera Fighting to shut down many variants of Chi-Yu.

sets.name: Offensive
sets.description: • This set does not have a full write-up yet. If you'd like to finish this, feel free to reserve it here!

sets.name: Choice Scarf
sets.description: Choice Scarf Armarouge is a passable revenge killer that outspeeds naturally fast Pokemon like Cinderace and Chien-Pao, threatening them with its high-Base Power STAB attacks. Moreover, it can clean up late-game easily thanks to Psychic Surge, which protects it from common priority attacks such as Slither Wing's First Impression and Kingambit's Sucker Punch. Trick cripples bulky foes it can't immediately threaten like Blissey, Florges, and Garganacl. Focus Blast hits Chi-Yu and Roaring Moon, while Psyshock 2HKOes Clodsire. Utility moves in Destiny Bond and Will-O-Wisp can also be used, with the former checking setup sweepers like Talonflame and the latter punishing switch-ins. Wallbreakers like Greninja can overwhelm shared checks and appreciate Armarouge's Psychic Terrain protecting them from the likes of Ceruledge's Shadow Sneak. Armarouge's susceptibility to entry hazards makes teammates like Defog Corviknight and Rapid Spin Iron Treads valuable options.

sets.name: Stored Power
sets.description: The set(s) displayed are used as a placeholder until an analysis is written for this Pokemon. Stay tuned for any updates!

sets.name: Swords Dance
sets.description:
• Ceruledge is a self-sufficient wallbreaker, which functions thanks to its good offensive and defensive type combination, Swords Dance, Flash Fire, healing from Bitter Blade, and Shadow Sneak. Ceruledge is provided switch-in opportunities thanks to its great matchup against Koraidon, which it can heavily punish if it goes for Fighting- or Fire-type attacks.
  • This is all the more useful when trying to dance around Choice-locked variants. It also threatens out one of the most common defensive staples in Corviknight. This allows it to rack up damage on its checks throughout the game and then set up with Swords Dance to sweep late-game with Shadow Sneak.
  • Shadow Claw is mandatory to be able to break through physical walls like Skeledirge, Toxapex, and Alomomola, which is only made easier with Terastallization and the power boost from Life Orb. These easily allow it to 2HKO Toxapex and Alomomola after a boost. Tera Ghost also greatly helps against Dondozo and Great Tusk, which can often be overwhelmed with good play.
  • Shadow Sneak greatly appreciates the power boost from Tera Ghost, which is newly capable of OHKOing foes like Iron Valiant after a single Swords Dance boost and Miraidon after two rounds of Stealth Rock damage.
  • Adamant is the preferred nature as the power boost it provides is very significant. A specific example is Miraidon needing two rounds of Stealth Rock damage for a +2 Tera Ghost Adamant Shadow Sneak to OHKO it, while Jolly would need three rounds of Stealth Rock damage. Jolly's power drop is too significant and the extra Speed it gives doesn't make a worthwhile difference.
  • Tera Fairy improves Ceruledge's defensive profile even more, as it is now immune to Koraidon's Dragon-type STAB moves. This allows it to get many effortless switches or at least heavily dissuade Koraidon from using anything else other than U-turn.
  • Heavy-Duty Boots is a solid option to ignore entry hazards, making it harder to wear Ceruledge down passively, especially in conjunction with Bitter Blade healing further improving longevity. However, the power drop is very noticeable, as it can often come up short in the scenarios you would rely on it to score a KO, for example it now can't OHKO Flutter Mane with Shadow Sneak.
  • Koraidon is an amazing partner, as they can double up on shared checks and wallbreak for the other one to clean late-game. Most importantly, it hugely powers up Ceruledge's Bitter Blade. Koraidon can also help to dance around Chi-Yu, as it can take Dark Pulse aimed at Ceruledge.
  • Great Tusk can also fit alongside the two, as it can clear entry hazards for Ceruledge and help break Dondozo thanks to its immense power. It can also act as a backup Koraidon check.
  • Flutter Mane can often threaten out the Pokemon used for countering Ceruledge, while Ceruledge can threaten out Flutter Mane's checks. They can synergistically break through teams together.
  • Chien-Pao and Ceruledge often act similarly, as they are both tough wallbreakers with good priority that often share checks. This and their mutually complementing offensive and defensive typings allow them to fit very well together.

sets.name: Bulk Up
sets.description:
With Bulk Up, Ceruledge becomes a formidable setup Pokemon thanks to its great offensive typing and solid bulk. Additionally, Ceruludge's immunity to Will-O-Wisp thanks to Flash Fire is a major advantage, making it more consistent against Pokemon like Rotom-W and bulky Volcarona. Bitter Blade offers Ceruledge much-appreciated recovery, letting it maintain longevity and more easily set up. Shadow Sneak is valuable priority, letting Ceruledge pick off threats such as Dragapult, Gholdengo, Iron Valiant, and opposing Ceruledge that have been worn down. Taunt is important for preventing phazing from the likes of Ting-Lu while also preventing Toxapex's Haze. It also prevents status from the likes of Toxapex and Rotom-W, as well as recovery from defensive Pokemon like Clodsire, Toxapex, and Skeledirge. 12 Speed EVs ensure that Ceruledge is able to outspeed defensive Rotom-W, letting it prevent Thunder Wave with Taunt while being able to set up after Terastalization. Tera Bug gives Ceruledge a generally solid defensive typing with few weaknesses that synergizes well with Flash Fire. Additionally, it turns Ceruledge's Ground weakness into a resistance, letting it more easily take on Pokemon like Great Tusk and Tera Ground Volcarona. Meanwhile, Tera Fairy lets Ceruledge withstand hits from the likes of Choice Specs Dragapult and mixed Iron Valiant.

Ceruledge fits on various offensive teams as a potent wincon thanks to its combination of Bulk Up and Bitter Blade giving it good longevity. Wallbreakers such as Kingambit, Iron Valiant, and Greninja can break through Pokemon that would otherwise check Ceruledge like Dondozo and Garganacl, letting Ceruledge more easily find opportunities to clean. Pokemon like Meowscarada, Great Tusk, and Breloom appreciate Ceruledge's ability to check Volcarona. In return, these Pokemon can wear down threats like Rotom-W for Ceruledge to take advantage of later. Ceruledge's typing leaves it vulnerable to Dark-type Pokemon like Roaring Moon and Hydreigon. Fairy-types like Iron Valiant and Scream Tail make for solid teammates, as they can take a hit from and overwhelm these threats. In return, Ceruledge can act as a much-appreciated check to Pokemon like Iron Moth and Cinderace. Breloom also appreciates Ceruledge's ability to check Fire-types, and in return it can OHKO both Hydreigon and Roaring Moon with Mach Punch. Entry hazard support from the likes of Garchomp, Glimmora, and Meowscarada helps wear down aforementioned checks like Roaring Moon and Hydreigon.

sets.name: Swords Dance
sets.description:
Ceruledge’s access to Swords Dance lets it leverage its powerful STAB combination and great attacking options to function as a threatening wallbreaker. At +2, Ceruledge is capable of OHKOing Corviknight, Amoonguss, bulky Volcarona, and defensive Gholdengo with Bitter Blade. Shadow Sneak serves as a secondary STAB attack, preferred for its priority that lets it heavily damage faster threats like Iron Valiant and Dragapult at +2, OHKOing the latter and making offensive counterplay to Ceruledge harder. Taunt can be run over Shadow Sneak to stop entry hazard setters and sweepers from setting up, giving Ceruledge a chance to break foes with recovery such as Clodsire without the opponent gaining too much progress. Taunt also prevents Ceruledge by being statused by the likes of Clodsire and Rotom-W. Close Combat OHKOs specially defensive Garganacl after a Swords Dance boost while 2HKOing Ting-Lu, physically defensive Garganacl, and Rotom-W, all of which are not threatened by Bitter Blade. Solar Blade threatens Dondozo, Garganacl, Ting-Lu, Rotom-W, and Great Tusk while sun is active. Focus Sash can ensure that Weak Armor and Swords Dance are activated, allowing Ceruledge to sweep more reliably. Life Orb is an alternative option that makes it possible to OHKO Ting-Lu and 2HKO Great Tusk at +2. Weak Armor couples incredibly well with Focus Sash, and its resistances to types like Bug and Fire, allowing Ceruledge to gain a free Speed boost by switching into U-turn from pivots like Corviknight and Cinderace, as well as Pyro Ball from the latter. Flash Fire lets Ceruledge function as a more reliable switch-in to Fire-types like Iron Moth, while potentially powering up Bitter Blade. Tera Fire provides extra power to Bitter Blade in order to OHKO Amoonguss and 2HKO Tera Steel Toxapex before Swords Dance. Tera Fighting provides Ceruledge with a Dark-resistance, allowing it to take attacks from the likes of Kingambit and Roaring Moon, particularly Sucker Punch from the former, in order to gain a Speed boost from Weak Armor. However, beware of other neutral attacks from such threats, as Choice Band Roaring Moon will still be able to OHKO Ceruledge with Dragon Claw. After a Swords Dance, Tera Fighting gives Close Combat enough extra power to OHKO all Garganacl sets, Ting-Lu, and Rotom-W after Stealth Rock chip. Tera Grass can be used together with Solar Blade in order to 2HKO Dondozo under sun. If running a Jolly nature, Ceruledge can outspeed Gholdengo and Baxcalibur, as well as Booster Energy Iron Valiant, Choice Scarf Meowscarada, and +1 Roaring Moon and Adamant Dragapult after a Weak Armor boost. Jolly, however, notably misses out on Adamant’s chance to OHKO Great Tusk and Ting-Lu at +2 with Tera Fighting Close Combat, as well as ensuring a 2HKO against Clodsire with Bitter Blade after Stealth Rock chip.

Ceruledge fits best on offensive teams, mainly those that use sun, in addition to some bulky offense teams that can provide it opportunities to enter battle and set up safely. As one of few viable physical Fire-types, Ceruledge has great synergy with Torkoal, which can activate sun to boost Bitter Blade’s power and allow Solar Blade to be used in one turn. Torkoal also sets Stealth Rock, removes hazards with Rapid Spin, and can spread status with Lava Plume and Yawn to allow Ceruledge safe entry. Walking Wake benefits from Ceruledge’s unique coverage on sun teams, as it appreciates foes like Azumarill and Slowking being removed. In return, Walking Wake can pressure foes like Skeledirge and Great Tusk. Great Tusk and Hatterene are also good partners on sun teams, as they can keep entry hazards off the field so that Ceruledge can enter battle safely with its Focus Sash intact. Ceruledge struggles with physical walls like Rotom-W and Great Tusk, as well as Unaware walls like Skeledirge and Dondozo. Choice Specs Iron Valiant has coverage for these foes, while Booster Energy variants threaten faster attackers like Roaring Moon and Dragapult. Mixed Garchomp puts pressure on most of Ceruledge’s checks, like Dondozo and Skeledirge, while luring in Corviknight so that Ceruledge can take advantage of its U-turn in order to activate Weak Armor. Corviknight itself is a good partner, as it is able to lure in Cinderace, another Pokemon Ceruledge can take advantage of, and pivot Ceruledge into battle safely. But, it can be a drain on momentum for more offensive teams. Ceruledge works well with hazard setters, as extra chip damage helps Ceruledge break foes like Garganacl and Rotom-W. In return, Ceruledge pressures Corviknight and can spinblock with its Ghost typing, but it doesn’t often do so due to bad matchups against common Rapid Spin users like Great Tusk. Examples of hazard-setting teammates include Great Tusk and Meowscarada, with the former being able to check Dark-types like Kingambit in the event Ceruledge cannot Terastallize, and the latter checking Rotom-W and Great Tusk.
