  • 252 Def / 252 SpD / 4 Spe with Careful: With Dondozo's massive HP stat, it's still able to take physical hits fairly well with this spread, while now avoiding a 2HKO from Flutter Mane's Moonblast if it lacks an offensive boosting item.

sets.name: BIG FLOPPA (Assault Vest)
sets.description:
• Dondozo's good power and bulk lend it nicely to an Assault Vest set, and is particularly good at punishing otherwise troublesome special attackers such as Flutter Mane and Chi-Yu

  • Avalanche: Avalanche punishes Flying- and Dragon-types with super effective coverage.

  • Body Press: This is valuable Fighting-type coverage for most foes that would otherwise be a good switch in to Dondozo, such as Meowscarada, Wo-Chien, Magnezone, Kingambit, and Brute Bonnet.

  • Fissure: Fissure allows Dondozo to potentially cheese its way through something that might otherwise wall it.

  • Heavy Slam: Dondozo is heavy enough to deal serious damage to Fairy-types such as Mimikyu and Flutter Mane. Just note that Chien-Pao is shockingly heavy, so Body Press or Wave Crash is preferred against that threat.

  • Earthquake: Earthquake offers more reliable Ground-type coverage at the cost of not being an instant KO like Fissure.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: While Terastallization will help against some specific checks to Dondozo, it's typing is great for general purposes.

  • Grass: Tera Grass removes Dondozo’s usual set of weaknesses and allows it to absorb spore from the likes of Amoonguss, Breloom, and Brute Bonnet.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy grants Dondozo a new set of resistances to take advantage of with its phenomenal bulk and also grants it a powerful STAB to hit Dragon- and Fighting-types with if it runs Tera Blast.

  • Steel: When paired with Heavy Slam, Dondozo can now 2HKO Iron Bundle without Stealth Rock support, in addition to gaining a fantastic defensive typing.

  • Ground: Terastallizing into a Ground-type allows Dondozo to block the Electric-type attacks commonly aimed at it while also giving it STAB on Earthquake.

  • Dragon: Tera Dragon gives Dondozo a resistance to both Electric- and Water-type attacks, allowing it to stand up to Rotom-W much better.

EV Spreads

  • 44 HP / 212 Atk / 252 SpD with Careful: This EV spread avoids a 2HKO from Choice Specs Chi-Yu's Dark Pulse.

  • 252 Atk / 252 SpD / 4 Spe with Adamant: This more offensive spread makes sense if you have better options for Chi-Yu.

sets.name: Curse
sets.description:
• With Unaware, Dondozo becomes an effective and difficult to break Curse user.

  • Fissure: Even with Curse being the point of this set, Dondozo can still effectively fish for OHKOs with Fissure when it's not in a favorable set-up position.

  • Avalanche: Many foes will Terrastallize into a Flying-type to avoid an expected Fissure, which makes Avalanche a particularly useful coverage move.

  • Earthquake: Earthquake helps against Magnezone and common users of Tera Electric such as Baxcalibur.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Water is an excellent defensive typing, so Dondozo won't need to Terastallize often.

  • Grass: With a Grass Tera Type, Dondozo can effectively set up on Breloom and Brute Bonnet.

  • Fairy: The Dragon immunity that Tera Fairy provides makes setting up on powerful foes like Choice Band Dragapult and Roaring Moon much easier.

  • Flying: If using Fissure, Tera Flying is a good choice for potentially beating other Dondozo.

sets.name: Fur Coat
sets.description: Fur Coat Dondozo is a great defensive Pokemon with its high physical bulk and typing, which allows it to wall physical attackers such as Koraidon and Groudon. Spikes supports offensive teammates, while Haze stops foes like Tidy Up Groudon from setting up. Knock Off removes items such as Covert Cloak and Leftovers, and Scald burns provide chip damage on foes. Flip Turn makes it easier to pivot into offensive teammates such as Koraidon, since Taunt, Dark-types, and Magic Bounce don't block it; alternatively, Parting Shot makes the foe easier to handle for Dondozo's teammates, but it's stopped by Taunt and Good as Gold. Heavy-Duty Boots, notably eases Dondozo's pivoting, while Rocky Helmet punishes contact moves such as U-turn and V-create. Covert Cloak protects against secondary effects like confusion from Magical Torque and burns from Scald. Tera Fire allows Dondozo to resist Magical Torque and Grass-type moves from Arceus-Fire, and it maintains Dondozo's resistance to Fire-type moves such as V-create. Dondozo appreciates defensive teammates with typing synergy such as RegenVest Ting-Lu, which helps protect Dondozo from threatening Pokemon such as Eternatus.

sets.name: Prankster
sets.description: Prankster Dondozo with Haze can reliably check physical setup sweepers such as Groudon thanks to its huge physical bulk. Entrainment forces out Pokemon dependent on their abilities, Encore can lock foes into unfavorable moves such as setup moves or V-create, and Glare debilitates fast attackers such as Koraidon and Palkia-O. Parting Shot allows Dondozo to maintain momentum against opposing threats such as Arceus-Ghost with its priority pivoting and attack stat reduction, making it easier for teammates such as Ting-Lu to take hits from them; alternatively, Flip Turn provides a pivoting option unaffected by Taunt, Dark-types, and Magic Bounce. Heavy-Duty Boots, notably eases Dondozo's pivoting, while Covert Cloak protects it from status conditions from moves such as Nuzzle, Mortal Spin, and Magical Torque. Tera Fire improves Dondozo's matchup against Arceus-Fire with Grass-type coverage and lets it resist V-create and Magical Torque, whereas Tera Dark makes Dondozo immune to status moves from other Prankster users and improves its matchup against Ghost- and Dark-types. RegenVest Hisuian Goodra, Ting-Lu, and Fur Coat users synergize with Dondozo, covering threats such as Arceus-Fairy, Groudon, and Palkia-O.

sets.name: Curse
sets.description: A pure Water typing, titanic physical bulk, and Tablets of Ruin make Dondozo a nearly impenetrable physical wall that can blanket check common physical attackers including Cinderace, Roaring Moon, and Chien-Pao. Other options like Unaware can be used to ignore setup sweepers and wallbreakers that attempts to boost past Dondozo, while Magic Guard prevents it from being overwhelmed by entry hazards, Toxic, and Wave Crash recoil. Aside from turning it into a bulky setup sweeper, Curse also lets Dondozo contest with opposing setup from the likes of Talonflame and Kingambit, especially on non-Unaware variants. Earthquake is a necessary coverage move to hit Toxapex and Desolate Land users like Iron Moth, Cinderace, and Ceruledge. Rest + Leftovers provide much needed longevity, with Rest preventing Dondozo from being permanently crippled by Clodsire's Toxic, Iron Moth's Toxic Spikes, and Volcarona and Skeledirge's Will-O-Wisp. Special walls such as Clodsire, Ting-Lu, Garganacl, and Corviknight are necessary to deal with special attackers like Iron Moth, Sandy Shocks, and Chi-Yu respectively; the former three spread further passive damage onto foes between entry hazards, Toxic, Ruination, and Salt Cure, slowly whittling down foes for Dondozo to sweep easier. In return, Dondozo covers the likes of Quaquaval and Cinderace for them.

sets.name: Choice Band
sets.description:
• Heavy Slam beats offensive Sylveon and Choice Band and mixed offense Iron Valiant.
  • Surf bypasses Counter from Choice Band Donphan while still beating Endeavor variants.
  • Avalanche is for Choice Band Meowscarada, while Outrage is for Walking Wake. Both moves, however, can be used to beat Garchomp, Goodra, and non-Disable Dragapult.
  • Water Veil prevents Dondozo from being hit by Will-O-Wisp from Skeledirge and Arcanine, while Unaware gives it a better matchup against Defense Booster Energy Great Tusk and some Espathra sets.
  • The HP and Defense EVs let Dondozo survive two Earthquakes from Choice Band Donphan. Maximum Attack EVs are used to maximize Dondozo's damage output. 0 Speed IVs and a Brave nature allow Dondozo to underspeed Endeavor Donphan and beat it with Surf.
  • An alternative EV spread of 104 HP / 252 Atk / 152 SpD with a Brave nature allows Dondozo to survive Energy Ball from Modest Choice Specs Iron Moth, which it can OHKO in return with Wave Crash.

sets.name: Curse
sets.description: Thanks to its massive physical bulk and ability, Unaware, Dondozo serves as a wall for physical setup sweepers, such as Dragonite, Kingambit, and Dragon Dance Dragapult. Dondozo also annoys rain teams, shutting down wallbreakers such as Floatzel, Barraskewda, and Mega Swampert. With Curse, Dondozo can also function as a late-game sweeper. Liquidation is preferred to Wave Crash given that it has more PP and does not incur recoil. However, Wave Crash can also be considered for its greater power. Leftovers is preferred to maximize longevity; however, Heavy-Duty Boots is worth consideration to fortify switches into entry hazards. Tera Grass transforms Dondozo's Electric and Grass weaknesses into resistances, turning common threats in Tapu Koko and Kartana into fodder and avoiding Leech Seed from Ferrothorn. Dondozo fits best on bulky offense and balance teams, as they greatly appreciate its ability to wall physical setup sweepers. Given its mediocre special bulk, special walls such as Clodsire and Ting-Lu make for good teammates, as they can switch into special attackers such as Tapu Koko, Tera Grass Volcarona, and Choice Specs Dragapult. Gholdengo is another good teammate since it checks dangerous special wallbreakers such as Tapu Lele and Iron Valiant that can play around Dondozo's commonly paired special walls. Other Pokemon that can beat these threats include Mega Scizor and Clodsire.

ru.overview: The tier is still in its infancy and the metagame develops with each passing day. The sample set(s) provided below will be regularly updated until proper analyses are in the works. See it as a rough outline to get started and accustomed to what sets are commonly used.

sets.name: Offensive Spinner
sets.description: Despite having no effect in singles, Commander is used so Gardevoir can't Trace Storm Drain and wall Tatsugiri. Tera Steel turns the tide on Fairy-types such as Gardevoir and Sylveon. It also helps against Cryogonal's Freeze Dry.

sets.name: Nasty Plot
sets.description: Tatsugiri is a decent Nasty Plot user that is able to threaten slower foes with its powerful STAB moves and it provides further utility by functioning as a spinner for teams that appreciate more hazard control. Magic Guard affords Tatsugiri some additional safety from entry hazards and chip damage from the likes of Salt Cure and Toxic. Instead of Hydro Pump, Surf can be used for more reliability. Tatsugiri is able to come in on and threaten spinblockers such as Skeledirge and Brambleghast, allowing it to use Nasty Plot or Rapid Spin on prediction. If left unchecked, Tatsugiri may be able to rack up enough boosts from Nasty Plot + Rapid Spin to serve as a frail sweeper. Due to its mediocre physical bulk, Tatsugiri appreciates physical walls such as Corviknight, which can also serve as a slow pivot to bring Tatsugiri safely into a favorable matchup. Tatsugiri also pairs well with physical attackers, such as Cinderace, that can threaten special walls such as Florges and Blissey, which Tatsugiri struggles against. Tatsugiri also appreciates entry hazards or other chip damage to secure KOs that it would typically miss, so Garganacl, with its ability to use Salt Cure and Stealth Rock, is a helpful teammate. Due to its low Speed, Tatsugiri appreciates faster teammates that can act as speed control, such as Chien-Pao or priority users such as Hatterene.

sets.name: Bulk Up
sets.description:
• Annihilape is a solid setup sweeper due to its good Attack stat, decent bulk, and unresisted STAB combination. It can take advantage of Pokemon such as Corviknight, Blissey, and Clodsire.
  • Bulk Up gives Annihilape the potential to sweep while also making it progressively harder to KO.
  • Taunt allows Annihilape to stay healthy and also stops bulkier Pokemon such as Corviknight, Clodsire, and Toxapex from recovering their health. Rest can alternatively be used with Chesto Berry to get rid of status and recover health, but it fails when Electric Terrain is up.
  • Drain Punch allows Annihilape to recover health and damage foes such as Ting-Lu and Iron Treads.
  • Rage Fist, along with Taunt, makes Annihilape incredibly threatening for slow walls such as Dondozo and Ting-Lu, as their attacks do little damage to Annilhilape while also boosting Rage Fist's power.
  • Tera Water allows Annihilape to take hits from special attackers such as Iron Bundle, Chi-Yu, and Flutter Mane while also letting it resist Flare Blitz from Koraidon.
  • Tera Fairy gives Annihilape an immunity against Dragon-type moves from Koraidon and Miraidon while also letting Annihilape take neutral damage from Ghost-type moves from Gholdengo and Flutter Mane, OHKOing them in return with boosted Rage Fist.
  • Annihilape reaches its full potential on dual screens hyper offense teams, where it can easily take hits while setting up.
  • Special walls such as Ting-Lu and Corviknight are good teammates on balance teams, as Pokemon such as Miraidon, Flutter Mane, and Iron Bundle threaten Annihilape. Corviknight is also able to remove entry hazards for Annihilape. Kingambit as a teammate overwhelms Alomomola and Skeledirge, which are common checks to it and Annihilape.
  • Entry hazard setters such as Glimmora, Froslass, Toxapex, and Clodsire can lure in Corviknight, presenting Annhilape with a great setup opportunity by forcing Corviknight to either use Defog and activate Annihilape's Defiant or give Rage Fist a boost by attacking.

sets.name: Bulk Up
sets.description: Annihilape is a potent sweeper and wallbreaker due to the combination of Taunt and Bulk Up allowing it to set up on many passive Pokemon, and its high bulk makes it difficult to revenge kill. Taunt forces slower Pokemon to attack Annihilape, denying status from Skeledirge, Toxapex, and Clodsire, and it also prevents Haze Toxapex and Whirlwind Ting-Lu from removing Bulk Up boosts. Rage Fist's Base Power scaling lets Annihilape break through Pokemon with high Defense or Unaware, such as Alomomola or Skeledirge. Drain Punch hits Dark-types that resist Rage Fist and helps keep Annihilape healthy. The given EV spread maximizes Leftovers recovery and lets Annihilape outspeed Gothitelle, which would otherwise cripple it with Trick; the remaining EVs are put into Special Defense, helping it survive hits from Chi-Yu, Iron Bundle, and Miraidon. Tera Water allows Annihilape to resist Koraidon's Flare Blitz, Iron Bundle's Hydro Pump, and Chi-Yu's Overheat as well as being an overall good defensive typing, with Tera Fairy being an alternative that blocks Dragon-type attacks from Walking Wake, Koraidon, and Miraidon. Koraidon and Miraidon are good partners for their ability to use U-turn to get Annihilape in safely to set up on Pokemon that check them. Powerful wallbreakers that can break through Annihilape's bulk like Miraidon are a big issue, so dual screens support from Grimmsnarl or a strong defensive core is greatly appreciated. Entry hazard removal from Great Tusk, Iron Treads, and Corviknight is helpful to allow multiple setup attempts per game and remove the especially obnoxious Toxic Spikes. Annihilape is a good spinblocker that deters Defog Corviknight because of Defiant, so entry hazard setters like Ting-Lu, Clodsire, Great Tusk, Iron Treads, and Toxapex, which also have solid defensive utility, are helpful. Annihilape struggles to find opportunities against offensive teams, so speed control like Iron Bundle and Choice Scarf Koraidon is appreciated. Annihilape checks anti-offense threats like Iron Bundle and Choice Scarf Chi-Yu, and it heavily pressures defensive cores, making it a good addition to offensive teams.

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
This analysis is for the Regulation C format of Battle Stadium Singles, which lasts until June 30th, 2023. For more information on this format and its current events, check out the format page!

If you feel this analysis is missing anything important or needs an update, feel free to suggest any changes here.

sets.name: Bulk Up
sets.description:
• Thanks to great bulk and the dangerous Rage Fist, Annihilape is one of the premier bulky set-up sweepers of Battle Stadium Singles.

  • Taunt: Taunt helps you deal with annoying Pokemon like Whirlwind Ting-Lu, Dondozo, Will-O-Wisp Skeledirge, and Hippowdon, to mention a few, forcing them to attack and boost Rage Fist. This can work on Toxapex, but be warned that Toxapex commonly carries Mental Herb, which could get Annihilape poisoned if it doesn't Terastallize.

  • Encore: Encore is an interesting alternative to Taunt, not able to directly shut down defensive answers to Annihilape, but it severely punishes them when Annihilape switches into a support move.

  • Vital Spirit: With Vital Spirit, Annihilape can absorb Spore from foes like Breloom, Brute Bonnet, and Amoonguss.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Terastallization is quite helpful at saving Annihilape from certain extremely powerful wallbreakers such as Chien-Pao, Chi-Yu, and Flutter Mane, but Annihilape is perfectly functional without it.

  • Fire: In addition to giving a useful resistance to Fairy, Fire, and Ice attacks from dangerous foes like Flutter Mane, Chi-Yu, and Chien-Pao, Tera Fire also prevents Will-O-Wisp from hitting.

  • Steel: Steel turns Annihilape's Psychic and Fairy weakness into resistances, as well as being an excellent defensive type overall. It lets Annihilape set up freely on Amoonguss and Toxapex, gives it a better chance of defeating Flutter Mane, and resisting Flower Trick means Meowscarada has a much harder time revenge killing it.

  • Poison: While not as sturdy of a defensive typing as Tera Steel, Tera Poison offers a better matchup against Flutter Mane, does well against Meowscarada, and lets Annihilape freely switch into Toxic and Toxic Spikes later in the match. This also drastically reduces the risk of Taunting Toxapex, which makes this Tera type a menace against stall teams!

  • Flying: Flying helps a lot to avoid Fissure from Dondozo and Ting-Lu, forcing it to attack with moves that boost Rage Fist. It also improves Annihilape's match-up against Great Tusk, and makes Hippowdon an easy foe to set up on.

  • Water: Tera Water is a good choice against Chien-Pao, Chi-Yu, and Palafin-H.

Items

  • Leftovers: Leftovers's residual recovery eases the long-game of setting up.

  • Sitrus Berry and 244 HP EVs: Reducing the HP EVs to 244 gives Annihilape an even HP stat, which lets Annihilape recover its health with Sitrus Berry the moment it gets hit by Ruination. This makes dealing with Ting-Lu and Wo-Chien an easier task.

  • Covert Cloak: Covert Cloak makes Annihilape immune to being Salt Cured, making it a great check against Garganacl. It also gives peace of mind, avoiding potential flinches from Chien-Pao and Chi-Yu, or Special Defense drops from Flutter Mane's Shadow Ball.

  • Punching Glove: Removing contact damage from Rocky Helmet and Rough Skin is helpful against defensive Pokemon such as Garchomp and Dragonite.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 4 Def / 252 Spe with Jolly: Maximum Speed mainly helps Annihilape outspeed Gholdengo, Great Tusk, Baxcalibur, and Modest Chi-Yu. With Bulk Up and Rage Fist improving its offense, Annihilape can invest in HP over Attack.

  • 252 HP / 244 SpD / 12 Spe with Careful: More special bulk can make it much more difficult for special attackers such as Flutter Mane and Chi-Yu to revenge kill Annihilape. This spread in particular has a 62.5% chance of surviving Timid Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Moonblast.

  • 244 HP / 164 Def / 100 SpD with Careful: This EV spread avoids a OHKO from +2 Chien-Pao, which can be especially helpful with Covert Cloak blocking the flinch chance.

  • 252 HP / 156 SpD / 100 Spe with Careful: This EV spread outspeeds Adamant Breloom and Cloyster while still giving Annihilape good special bulk.

  • 252 HP / 196 Def / 60 Spe with Impish: This physically defensive spread will survive Tera Flying Adamant Dragonite's Tera Blast, while outspeeding 4 Speed EV Mimikyu and Jolly Brute Bonnet.

sets.name: Stealth Rock Setter
sets.description:
• Annihilape's good bulk and significant offensive presence makes it an easy to use Stealth Rock setter.

  • Rage Fist: Rage Fist is Annihilape’s strongest move; its power and coverage often lets Annihilape either defeat or significantly chip one of the opponent’s Pokemon on top of getting Stealth Rock up.

  • Drain Punch versus Close Combat: The huge amount of Dark-types in this metagame necessitates a Fighting STAB attack. Drain Punch is preferred in most cases for the extra recovery, but Close Combat makes plenty of sense if using Focus Sash and an offensive EV spread.

  • Taunt: Taunt gives Annihilape a strong matchup into bulky walls such as Ting-Lu and opposing setup foes like Volcarona, while also making it easier to boost Rage Fist’s power.

  • Final Gambit: Annihilape's impressive HP stat makes Final Gambit into a powerful KO trading tool, being able to take out bulky foes like Garganacl, Corviknight, Wo-Chien, and Toxapex.

  • Rock Tomb versus Bulldoze: Rock Tomb is an excellent Speed reducing move for its ability to hit Dragonite, and threaten Volcarona and Iron Bundle. Its low accuracy should be noted as a risk, however. Bulldoze trades hitting Dragonite in exchange for dealing good damage against Gholdengo and Iron Moth.

Other Options

  • Encore: Encore is an incredibly powerful move that can lock the opponent into an attacking move to boost Rage Fist's power. Alternatively, it can lock the opponent into a status move.

  • Fling and Light Ball: This gives Annihilape a chance to paralyze a foe, including Gholdengo that lack Covert Cloak, and break potential Focus Sashes too.

  • Curse: This is an excellent way for Annihilape to retire itself from the battle while putting significant pressure on the opponent to switch out and shutting down gimmicks such as Baton Pass.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: This Annihilape is often used quite early in the game to set up Stealth Rock, so Terastallization is often not needed unless it must check a specific threat.

  • Steel: Tera Steel has excellent defensive synergy with Annihilape thanks to the Fairy resistance and doing particularly well on spreads that are faster than -1 Chien-Pao to move before Sacred Sword lands.

  • Fire: Beyond offering a valuable Fairy resistance, the Ice and Fire resistances make Chien-Pao and Chi-Yu easier to deal with.

  • Normal: Ghost-type attacks are incredibly common. Pokemon such as Gholdengo, Dragapult, and opposing Annihilape all struggle against an unexpected Tera Normal.

  • Poison: Tera Poison has a good matchup against Flutter Mane, and lets Annihilape deal with Toxic and Toxic Spikes without needing to Taunt.

Items

  • Focus Sash: Even when using bulky EV spreads, Focus Sash is useful for surviving an attack from foes that can be difficult to EV for, such as Flutter Mane.

  • Sitrus Berry: Sitrus Berry can be used with specialized spreads to avoid certain 2HKOs. Just make sure to have an even HP stat, to ensure that Sitrus Berry activates after getting hit by Ruination.

  • Roseli Berry: Roseli Berry works well on specially defensive EV spreads designed defeat Flutter Mane leads that lack Focus Sash.

Abilities

  • Vital Spirit: Vital Spirit adds to Annihilape’s reliability as a lead. Immunity to sleep moves from common Pokemon such as Breloom, Brute Bonnet, Dondozo, Hippowdon, and Skeledirge lets Annihilape thrive with more defensive EV spreads.

  • Defiant: While Intimidate Pokemon are far from common from the format, Defiant can take advantage opposing Speed control moves.

  • Inner Focus: This niche ability prevents flinches from Chien-Pao and Dragonite from happening.

Alternate EV Spreads

  • 172 HP / 4 Atk / 212 Def / 4 SpD / 116 Spe with Jolly: This Speed drop based spread allows Annihilape to outspeed -1 Iron Bundle and avoids getting 2HKOed by Focus Sash Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash.

  • 4 HP / 252 Atk / 252 Spe with Jolly: If using Focus Sash and Close Combat together, maximizing Attack and Speed will win the most matchups.

  • 220 HP / 244 SpD / 44 Spe with Careful: This Roseli Berry based spread lets Annihilape survive Modest Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Shadow Ball and outspeed -1 Garchomp and 4 Speed EV Tinkaton.

Sitrus Berry EV Spreads

  • 228 HP / 180 SpD / 100 Spe with Careful: This Sitrus Berry optimized EV spread avoids a 2HKO from Choice Specs Iron Bundle's Hydro Pump, while outspeeding Adamant Breloom.

  • 244 HP / 244 Def / 20 Spe with Impish: This defensive spread is Annihilape's best chance at being a soft check to Chien-Pao, though note that Swords Dance and Terastallization together can still overwhelm Annihilape.

sets.name: Choice Scarf
sets.description:
• Thanks to Final Gambit and a decent Speed stat, Choice Scarf Annihilape can cause shocking upsets by revenge killing even bulky sweepers, such as Dragonite!

  • Shadow Claw versus Rage Fist: Shadow Claw is weak, but it's a reliable Ghost-type STAB move that can reliably OHKO Flutter Mane even when using minimum Attack investment. If you can manage to get Annihilape into a weak attack, though, Rage Fist has much more reward associated with it.

  • Final Gambit: If using maximum HP, Final Gambit can potentially OHKO major defensive threats if Annihilape is healthy, such as Garganacl and Corviknight.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Very Situational: Since Annihilape often sacrifices itself with Final Gambit, Terastallization is usually a bad idea unless absolutely needed for a highly specific, match dependent win condition.

  • Ghost: A Ghost Tera type makes Shadow Claw OHKO Dragapult, as well as giving it a 56.3% chance of OHKOing 4 HP Gholdengo.

  • Normal: Tera Normal gives Annihilape an immunity to Ghost-type attacks, potentially getting it a revenge kill against a bulky Flutter Mane it wouldn't otherwise.

Abilities

  • Vital Spirit: The immunity to Spore gives Annihilape a good opportunity to switch into Breloom, and it need not worry about Yawn.

  • Defiant: While Intimidate is not particularly common, punishing that and Speed drops can lead to devastating surprise sweeps.

sets.name: Stallbreaker
sets.description:
• Taunt denies any status moves from foes like Wo-Chien, forcing them into using their generally weak moves, Counter, or even Struggle.
  • Counter is able to deal massive amounts of damage to physical attackers, like Iron Hands and Choice Band users like Meowscarada, Great Tusk, and Dondozo.
  • Rage Fist can continue to get stronger during a match, even without having to use Bulk Up. In conjunction with Taunt, Annihilape can force Pokemon to attack it, boosting Rage Fist's Base Power.
  • Bulk Up lets Annihilape break past opposing setup sweepers like Swords Dance Iron Hands. Close Combat can be used against the Normal- and Dark-types that are immune to or resist Rage Fist, such as Slaking, Ting-Lu, and Kingambit.
  • The HP and Defense EVs ensure Annihilape isn't 2HKOed by Choice Band variants of Dondozo and Meowscarada. Alternatively, you can run 92 HP / 252 Def / 164 Spe to outspeed Pressure stall Corviknight; it has significantly less overall bulk, however.
  • Against Dondozo, use Taunt turn 1 to stop Curse sets and then use Counter. This allows for Annihilape to beat both Curse and Choice Band Dondozo. Sitrus Berry ensures Annihilape isn't 2HKOed by Dondozo's Wave Crash.

sets.name: Specially Defensive Weakness Policy
sets.description:
• Gunk Shot is for non-Choice Specs Sylveon and Choice Specs Iron Valiant.
  • Encore can deter Skeledirge's and Arcanine's Will-O-Wisp and Iron Hands's Swords Dance due to the threat of them being permanently locked into those moves. It also can be used against Trick from Choice Specs Iron Valiant and Choice Scarf Rotom-W.
  • Screech is for Unaware Dondozo, while Bulk Up lets Annihilape beat Booster Energy Iron Hands.
  • The EV spread gives Annihilape the best odds to survive Choice Specs Iron Valiant's Moonblast. The remaining EVs, which would not help with this, are invested in Speed.
  • Gunk Shot is Annihilape's best option against Choice Specs Iron Valiant. Annihilape needs to choose between Encore and Gunk Shot on the first turn, as Encore counters Iron Valiant's Trick, while Gunk Shot beats Iron Valiant's Moonblast. However, selecting the wrong move can lead to Iron Valiant 2HKOing Annihilape with Moonblast or causing Annihilape to use Struggle after using Disable on Annihilape's Gunk Shot.

sets.name: Choice Band
sets.description:
• Gunk Shot helps Annihilape beat Fairy-types such as Sylveon and Azumarill.

  • Shadow Claw is helpful for dealing immediate damage to Volcarona and Bulk Up Annihilape.

  • Phantom Force can also be run in order to beat common Protect users like Gardevoir and some Espathra variants.

  • Close Combat is Annihilape's strongest STAB move, letting it dent Corviknight.

  • Drain Punch prevents Annihilape from lowering its defensive stats versus Substitute users like Speed Booster Energy Roaring Moon.

  • Outrage beats Dragon-types like Goodra, most Haxorus variants, and Walking Wake.

  • Seed Bomb, Fire Punch, Earthquake, and Counter can be used over Outrage but are generally considered worse moves, as they only hit a limited number of Pokemon, like Gastrodon, Scizor, Clodsire, and Iron Hands, respectively.

  • The Special Defense EVs allow Annihilape to survive one Hydro Pump from Modest Choice Specs Iron Bundle.

  • Against most foes, use the attack that will deal the most damage. It is important to note Weakness Policy users like Magnezone, which Annihilape should not use super effective attacks against to avoid activating its item.

sets.name: Roseli Berry
sets.description:
• Defiant lets Annihilape counter stat-lowering strategies, such as Arcanine's Intimidate and Azumarill's Charm.

  • Roseli Berry lets Annihilape beat Fairy-types that it usually struggles or outright can't win against, such as Sylveon and Azumarill, along with Pokemon with Fairy coverage such as Play Rough + Choice Band Meowscarada.

  • Bulk Up allows Annihilape to survive longer and boost Rage Fist's power, both by boosting Attack and taking hits, in front of foes such as Donphan.

  • Gunk Shot is Annihilape's strongest move against most Fairy-types, such as Azumarill and Sylveon.

  • Drain Punch nails Dark-types, such as Ting-Lu and Chien-Pao, alongside giving recovery against foes such as Donphan and Weakness Policy Ting-Lu.

  • Counter can OHKO physical attackers Annihilape cannot damage easily, such as non-Swords Dance Iron Hands and Azumarill.

  • Taunt and Encore are both used to disrupt various strategies. Taunt is better in denying offensive setup from foes, like opposing Annihilape, and blocking slower Taunt or Encore users such as uninvested Corviknight and Donphan. Encore better punishes defensive setup, such as Garganacl's Iron Defense and stall Arcanine.

  • Annihilape's last moveslot comes with a lot of opportunity costs. Removing Drain Punch gives harder matchups against Dark-types like Ting-Lu. Not slotting Counter forces it to hit physical Fairy-types like Azumarill and Play Rough Meowscarada with Gunk Shot, which has lower accuracy.

  • The HP and Special Defense investment with a Careful nature allows Annihilape to survive a Hyper Beam from Modest Choice Specs Sylveon. 116 Attack EVs let it 2HKO most Sylveon variants with Gunk Shot turn 1 and Rage Fist turn 2, minimizing miss chances. The remaining EVs are put in Speed to outspeed Modest Sylveon and Modest Magnezone.

  • Annihilape struggles to deal with faster Pokemon with super effective STAB moves like Talonflame, most Dragapult variants, and faster Taunt users such as Booster Energy Great Tusk and Corviknight.

sets.name: Defensive
sets.description: Great special bulk and immunity to Electric-type moves make Clodsire a good wall and a solid check to Miraidon and Walking Wake. A combination of Toxic + Earthquake ensures that offensive threats like Koraidon and Chien-Pao and walls like Ting-Lu and Great Tusk cannot switch into Clodsire for free. Clodsire also acts as a good entry hazard setter, as it has access to Spikes, Stealth Rock, and Toxic Spikes. Alternatively, Counter can be used to eliminate defensive Great Tusk, Choice Scarf Koraidon Choice locked into Dragon Claw, and Chien-Pao Choice locked into Crunch. Water Absorb is preferred, as it makes Clodsire immune to Hydro Pump from Iron Bundle and Water-type STAB moves from Walking Wake while also making it so it doesn't ignore the Special Attack drop from Miraidon's Draco Meteor, which Unaware doesn't allow. With Tera Steel and Water Absorb, Clodsire acts as a good Iron Bundle and Walking Wake check while taking Draco Meteor from Miraidon, Psyshock from Flutter Mane, and Ice-type STAB moves from Chien-Pao better. Alternatively, Tera Fire can be used to retain the Ice resistance while also gaining a resistance to Chi-Yu's nuclear Fire-type moves. 32 Defense EVs let Clodsire survive Earthquake from bulky Great Tusk. Great Tusk, Chien-Pao, and Koraidon force Clodsire out, so physically defensive Pokemon such as Toxapex, Corviknight, and Dondozo are good teammates. Gholdengo and Annihilape are also good teammates, as they can block hazard removal attempts from Corviknight, which otherwise can easily remove hazards against Clodsire. Clodsire can't deal with Choice Specs Miraidon properly, so faster Pokemon such as Iron Bundle and Choice Scarf users such as Tera Fairy Dugtrio and Koraidon are good teammates.

sets.name: Defensive
sets.description:
• Clodsire's special bulk combined with its Ground typing makes it one of the best answers to Miraidon, notably thanks to its ability to absorb Toxic Spikes, which would otherwise trouble other defensive Pokemon such as Ting-Lu.
  • Toxic prevents Clodsire from being overly passive and allows it to outlast Iron Bundle.
  • Clodsire is a decent setter of both Spikes and Stealth Rock, freeing up moveslots on teammates like Great Tusk. However, opposing spinners as well as Corviknight have very little issue removing entry hazards against Clodsire.
  • Water Absorb is the preferred ability, as it deters Iron Bundle's Hydro Pump and more comfortably tanks Draco Meteor from Miraidon, since Unaware would otherwise ignore the Draco Meteor special attack drop. It also checks Tera Water Miraidon, which is an important trait it possesses over Ting-Lu. Unaware checks non-Life Orb Calm Mind Miraidon while beating Calm Mind + Taunt Flutter Mane, as well as making Iron Moth's Fiery Dance boosts less of a threat.
  • Clodsire can use Tera Steel to take Miraidon's Draco Meteor far more easily while being able to take on Iron Bundle's STAB moves in conjunction with Water Absorb.
  • Both defensive and balanced teams enjoy Clodsire answering most Miraidon sets, helping fend off Flutter Mane, freeing up moveslots on other entry hazard setters, and pressuring opposing defensive Pokemon with Toxic.
  • Dondozo pairs with Clodsire nicely, as it appreciates Clodsire's ability to switch in on Miraidon's Electro Drift, while Dondozo can take on Chien-Pao and Great Tusk for it.

sets.name: Defensive
sets.description:
Clodsire is a defensive Pokemon with great abilities, using Unaware to sit in front of setup sweepers and Water Absorb to stop a sweeping Walking Wake. Its fantastic defensive typing allows it to absorb Toxic Spikes and nets it nice resistances to Fighting and Fairy, letting it check a unique combination of threatening offensive Pokemon like Iron Valiant, Skeledirge, and Rotom-W. To aid in checking them, it runs Toxic to put these Pokemon on a timer, stalling with Recover as poison damage increases. When they're inevitably forced to switch, their replacement takes damage too since Clodsire sets Stealth Rock or Spikes, racking up even more damage. Leftovers can be used to help preserve Recover’s PP and stay in longer, while Heavy-Duty Boots helps Clodsire switch in and out to wall threats. Earthquake, besides providing direct damage, super effectively damages Pokemon that can't be poisoned like Gholdengo and other Clodsire. Terastallization gives Clodsire much more defensive flexibility as well; Tera Water can help it resist powerful STAB moves from Dondozo and Azumarill which would otherwise scare it out. Tera Flying is another useful option, turning its Ground weakness into an immunity while preserving its Fighting resistance, allowing it to stay in against Great Tusk and Focus Sash Breloom.

Clodsire fits neatly into plenty of balance or stall teams looking for a way to handle special hits, offering support with both setting up hazards and removing Toxic Spikes, and walling sweepers with Unaware. Other hazard setters in particular love stacking hazards alongside it; since it learns both Stealth Rock and Spikes, it can fit with many options, like Spikes Meowscarada or Stealth Rock Garganacl. However, its mediocre Defense and weaknesses to Ground and Ice leave it particularly vulnerable to the the tier's physical wallbreakers, most notably Great Tusk, Dragonite, and Garchomp. As such, Clodsire greatly appreciates having teammates who can check these Pokemon and easily switch into Earthquake or Icicle Crash like Rotom-W, Corviknight, and Tera Water Garganacl. In particular, Clodsire is completely stonewalled by Hatterene and Air Balloon or Tera Flying Gholdengo. The former reflects both Toxic and entry hazards while overpowering its healing with Psyshock, and the latter is immune to Toxic via Good as Gold, even if it loses its Steel typing. Great teammates to help check these two are Gholdengo itself for Hatterene, which threatens Hatterene with Make It Rain and its unpredictable set versatility, and Kingambit for opposing Gholdengo, which resists both of Gholdengo's STAB moves and can immediately threaten to OHKO it back. In turn, these two appreciate Clodsire checking the Fire-types that scare them out, especially Iron Moth and Skeledirge. Bulky Water-types like Toxapex and Dondozo can check the Water-type threats Clodsire fears, like Floatzel and Azumarill.

sets.name: Toxic Spikes (Ground)
sets.description:
Due to its remarkable bulk, unique dual-typing, and two great abilities, Clodsire is a mainstay on Ground teams. Water Absorb stops common Water-type threats like Quaquaval, Dondozo, and Pelipper in their tracks, while Unaware walls setup sweepers such as Gholdengo, Mimikyu, and Volcarona. Poison Jab hits threats like Meowscarada, Rotom-C, and Iron Valiant, while Gunk Shot provides more power against bulkier foes such as Hatterene and Azumarill. Toxic Spike eases the Dark and Fairy matchups due to their lack of entry hazard removal and applies pressure on teams in general, completing Ground's entry hazard stacking core. Toxic may be used instead to punish Pokemon like Rotom-W and Hydreigon, which freely switch-in to Clodsire otherwise. The given EV spread avoids the 2HKO from both Choice Scarf Greninja's Ice Beam and Choice Scarf Meowscarada's Flower Trick.

Great Tusk, Iron Treads, and Ting-Lu appreciate Clodsire checking the aforementioned Water-types as well as other threats such as Iron Valiant and Flutter Mane. In return, Choice Scarf Great Tusk pressures Ice- and Dark-types like Chien-Pao, Baxcalibur, and Choice Specs Greninja. Iron Treads clears entry hazards and threatens Hatterene, and Ting-Lu sets up entry hazards and switches into Psychic-type attacks from Espathra and Indeedee. Unaware Clodsire synergizes very well with Gastrodon, as it checks the aforementioned Grass-types, while Gastrodon switches into Water-type attacks from Dondozo and Barraskewda. Sandy Shocks threatens Flying-types like Corviknight and Pelipper and secures the Fire matchup. Quagsire pairs well with Water Absorb Clodsire, as it checks Chien-Pao, Baxcalibur, and Great Tusk. Furthermore, Quagsire is capable of using Toxic to free up a moveslot for Toxic Spike on Clodsire, expanding the team's hazard stacking ability.

sets.name: Specially Defensive (Poison)
sets.description:
Due to its exceptional Special Defense and ability in Unaware, Clodsire is a wall that checks threats like Hydreigon, Volcarona, and Flutter Mane for Poison teams. Earthquake lets it chip down and eventually beat threats like Volcarona, Iron Valiant, and Gholdengo, while Low Kick deals with the aforementioned Nasty Plot Hydreigon and can heavily damage Kingambit in a pinch. Spikes lets Clodsire take advantage of forced switches and synergizes well with Glimmora, Toxapex, and Skuntank, all together forming Poison's entry hazard-stacking core. Alternatively, Curse turns Clodsire into a threatening wincon and lets it deal with physical attackers. 56 Def EVs may be considered so Clodsire tanks a fully boosted Supreme Overlord Kowtow Cleave from Kingambit and deals heavy damage to it with Low Kick.

Amoonguss and Toxapex are physically defensive walls that complement Clodsire, as they take on threats such as Great Tusk, Scizor, and Quaquaval, which force Clodsire out. Amoonguss can also run Growth, which helps in the Ground matchup, while Toxapex also chips down the opposing team by setting Toxic Spikes and wearing down threats like Chien-Pao with Infestation, Baneful Bunker, and Rocky Helmet. Skuntank is a Psychic-immune teammate that switches into Hatterene, Espathra, and Indeedee, and it can set Toxic Spikes better against types like Fairy and Psychic by trapping switch-ins such as Klefki and Bronzong with Fire Spin. Glimmora provides entry hazard support and removal with Stealth Rock and Mortal Spin, respectively, and it can run Air Balloon or Choice Scarf to handle Ground-types such as Great Tusk and Iron Treads due to its great coverage. Glimmora can also run Corrosion with Toxic and Mortal Spin, improving the Poison matchup and putting defensive Pokemon such as opposing Clodsire and Amoongus on a timer. Iron Moth is another plausible Choice Scarf user, as it handles Steel- and Dragon-types like Iron Treads and Baxcalibur, though it can also run a set with Substitute to handle Kingambit and break down types such as Flying and Water better.

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
With Paradox Pokemon being introduced, Series 2 is bringing big new changes to Battle Stadium Singles! This is a modified Series 1 analysis that takes Paradox Pokemon into account. We will update this overview and analysis again once the metagame settles more. For more information on Series 2, check out the resource thread.

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

sets.name: Support
sets.description:
• While Clodsire is lacking in physical bulk compared to Dondozo and Skeledirge, it makes up for it in having a fantastic support movepool.

  • Yawn: Yawn is very effective at forcing switches, which is especially dangerous if Stealth Rock is set up.

  • Protect: In addition to benefiting from Leftovers, Protect pairs well with Yawn.

  • Low Kick: This prevents Clodsire from being totally walled by Tera Steel Hydreigon.

  • Amnesia: With Amnesia, Clodsire has a far better match-up against powerful special attacking foes such as Hydreigon and Iron Bundle.

  • Black Sludge versus Leftovers: Black Sludge may seem appealing, but it punishes Clodsire for Terastalliizing unless it becomes Tera Poison, so Leftovers is preferred unless Leftovers is already on something else.

Tera Types

  • Flying: With a Flying Tera type, Clodsire no longer has to worry about Earthquake or Fissure.

  • Steel: A Steel Tera type allows Clodsire to take on powerful Dragon-type attacks, without the worry of Gholdengo dealing massive damage.

  • Poison: With Tera Poison, Clodsire not only becomes a better check to Grass- and Water-types such as Meowscarda and Rotom-W, but it can also safely run Black Sludge to punish users of Trick.

  • Fairy: A Fairy Tera type will stop powerful Dragon-type attacks cold without making Clodsire weak to Earthquake, but it comes at the cost of compromising its ability to check Gholdengo.

  • Dark: Espathra's Stored Power is a big issue for Clodsire, so Tera Dark can flip the tables on it.

Abilities

  • Unaware: If you're planning to use Clodsire to its fullest defensive potential, Unaware is the best bet against setup foes.

  • Water Absorb: Water Absorb sacrifices overall defensive potential in exchange for being able to wall Rotom-W without needing to Terastallize. If setting up Stealth Rock is important, this can be worth it.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 252 SpD / 4 Spe with Careful: Maximizing Special Defense is Clodsire's best hope for handling powerful special attackers such as Choice Specs Hydreigon.

  • 252 HP / 252 Def / 4 Spe with Impish: Clodsire's Defense may be mediocre, but with maximum investment, it can pull stunts such as usually avoiding a 2HKO from Jolly Dragonite's Outrage with Leftovers.

sets.name: Specially Defensive
sets.description: A unique defensive typing, reliable recovery, and remarkable special bulk enhanced by Vessel of Ruin allow Clodsire to check prominent special attackers like Iron Moth and Hydreigon. Toxic can cripple Heavy-Duty Boots users like Volcarona and Kilowattrel. Corrosion + Toxic notably hits Corviknight and Toxapex, which are common switch ins and wears them down. Toxic Spikes and Poison Jab are better on Prankster sets to punish Dark-types such as Meowscarada, Roaring Moon, and Ting-Lu; in particular, Toxic Spikes lets Clodsire match up well against hyper offense teams filled with setup sweepers. Prankster + Haze allows Clodsire to shut down setup sweepers, like Volcarona and Polteageist, while they whittle down from poison damage. Pokemon like Garganacl and Scream Tail form a hazard-stacking core with Clodsire. Physical walls like the aforementioned Pokemon, Corviknight, and Dondozo handle physical threats such as Quaquaval and Earth Eater Kingambit that can exploit Clodsire's poor physical bulk.

sets.name: Unaware Wall
sets.description: Clodsire serves as a fantastic special wall, able to take on powerful attackers such as Dragapult and Mega Diancie while simultaneously stopping setup sweepers such as Gholdengo and Volcarona. Spikes are preferred on Clodsire, as the move has more limited distribution and Clodsire enters the field commonly enough to have the opportunity to use the move. However, Stealth Rock can be used if Clodsire's team requires it. Toxic is used to cripple common switch-ins to Clodsire, such as Landorus-T, Tornadus-T, and Great Tusk. Poison Jab can be used to poison post-Tera Gholdengo attempting to remove its Ground weakness, and it forces damage on Tornadus-T faster. Heavy-Duty Boots are preferred on Clodsire to negate its weakness to opposing Spikes teams, although Leftovers are also viable to increase Clodsire's longevity. Unaware is preferred over Water Absorb to negate Clodsire's passivity against setup sweepers, and Water Absorb does little to help against the likes of Mega Swampert and Gastrodon. Tera Dark grants Clodsire a Ghost resistance, which helps against Choice Specs Dragapult and Gholdengo, especially if using Poison Jab against the latter. It also grants Clodsire with a Pursuit resistance against the likes of Kingambit and Mega Tyranitar, which can both exploit its physical frailty. Clodsire fits best on defensively oriented teams that appreciate its special walling and entry hazard support. As Clodsire is weak to most physical attackers such as Kingambit, Great Tusk, and Dragonite, teammates that can cover them, such as Toxapex, Skeledirge, and Buzzwole, make for good partners. In return, Clodsire can switch into Electric-type attacks for the former, and powerful special attackers such as Dragapult for the latter two. Pokemon that benefit from Spikes support, such as Tornadus-T and Gholdengo, also pair well with Clodsire, as Spikes puts pressure on checks to them such as Ting-Lu and Mega Tyranitar. In return, Clodsire appreciates these teammates being able to make more immediate progress. Knock Off users such as the aforementioned Tornadus-T as well as Weavile and Mega Scizor pair well with Clodsire, crippling Heavy-Duty Boots users such as opposing Clodsire and Toxapex, giving Clodsire's entry hazards support a greater impact.

sets.name: Specially Defensive (Ground)
sets.description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

sets.name: Specially Defensive (Poison)
sets.description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

nu.overview: Farigiraf is one of the most threatening Stored Power users in the tier. It has more durability than Veluza and can boost Speed unlike Mesprit and Blissey, giving it more flexibility in how it approaches a sweep. Farigiraf's Cud Chew can grant it unique setup opportunities, as Sitrus Berry turns many 2HKOs into 3HKOs. However, Farigiraf usually needs at least 2 turns to start posing a serious threat; Knock Off from Bombirdier, Haze from Cryogonal and Articuno, and Encore from Sableye can easily disrupt its setup, while simple overwhelming offensive pressure can stop it from getting out of hand.

sets.name: Double Dance
sets.description:
Farigiraf usually wants to use Agility first followed by its other boosting move before it starts outputting damage. Sitrus Berry and Cud Chew allow Farigiraf to shrug off a majority of neutral attacks in the tier, greatly improving its survivability to grant Farigiraf the two turns of setup that it needs. The other alternative to Sitrus Berry is Cud Chew + Lum Berry, giving Farigiraf status immunity for 2 turns, which could allow Farigiraf to set up on the likes of Glare Sandaconda and Toxic or Thunder Wave Qwilfish. The Speed EVs let Farigiraf outspeed neutral-natured Clawitzer & positive Speed-natured Cacturne and Ursaring at +0 while outrunning Choice Scarf Bruxish after an Agility, with the rest of the EVs being invested into Special Attack for maximum damage output. Dazzling Gleam is often preferred over Tera Blast for the ability to hit Dark-types without needing to Terastallize. Tera Fairy is very useful for its Dragon Tail immunity against Eelektross and Appletun, and turns Farigiraf's weaknesses to Dark and Bug into resistances, and also boosts Dazzling Gleam. Sap Sipper can also complement Tera Fairy to completely blank Appletun's dual STAB combination, with Cacturne and Lurantis being bonus setup targets. Armor Tail can be considered to stop priority moves from Pokemon such as Toxicroak and Bruxish while turning Sableye into setup fodder. Farigiraf can also use Calm Mind and a bulkier spread to set up more reliably on weaker special attackers such as Abomasnow, Raichu, and non-Trick Rotom. With Tera Steel, Farigiraf is able to better take on common Haze users like Articuno, Cryogonal, and Hisuian Qwilfish, hitting the former two super effectively with Tera Blast and gaining an immunity to the latter's Poison-type attacks.

Farigiraf's low Speed often mandates using Agility first and also means it generally cannot threaten the opponent until turn 3, as it takes two turns to set up Agility followed by Nasty Plot. Strong teammates that can apply quick and immediate pressure on the opponent make for good partners, such as Tauros, Hisuian Sneasel, and Rotom. Pokemon that can also handle Farigiraf's checks and counters, namely Dark-types and Haze users, are especially appreciated. Nasty Plot + Taunt Houndoom and Trick Rotom or Haunter can bait out defensive responses such as Umbreon, Hisuian Qwilfish, and Blissey in order to cripple them. A double Psychic core involving Farigiraf and either Bruxish or Mesprit can also work to wear down their shared checks and prevent them from answering one or the other. Rest Sandaconda can shrug off attacks from Umbreon and Hisuian Qwilfish while even smacking the latter with Earthquake. Hisuian Sneasel and Toxicroak can threaten Umbreon and Hisuian Qwilfish, whereas Magneton, Pyroar, Houndoom, and Perrserker can switch into Haze Cryogonal and Articuno to apply offensive pressure. Scyther, Bombirdier, Magneton, and Perrserker can force out the opponent's less defensive Pokemon and pivot to give Farigiraf a window of opportunity to set up, with Bombirdier being particularly notable due to its access to Parting Shot and Memento. Abomasnow can provide Aurora Veil support for Farigiraf to make setting up easier.

vgc2023.overview:
• Farigiraf is currently one of the bulkiest Trick Room setters in the meta. Its ability, Armor Tail, prevents its teammates from succumbing to priority moves, making it difficult to prevent Farigiraf from setting Trick Room.

  • Hariyama, Amoonguss, and Kingambit are good partners for Farigiraf. Hariyama and Farigiraf both benefit from each other, as Fake Out allows Farigiraf to more consistently get up Trick Room, which enables Hariyama, as it thrives inside of Trick Room and checks Farigiraf's common counters. Amoonguss can redirect moves targeted at Farigiraf and Spore anything inside Trick Room to take them out of the game. Kingambit benefits from the Snarl that Farigiraf struggles against and plays well in Trick Room.

  • Choice Band Meowscarada and Hydreigon are the biggest checks to Farigiraf, as both threaten to OHKO it. Amoonguss is another check, as it can Spore Farigiraf before it manages to get Trick Room up. It also struggles against Imprison from Indeedee, Gallade, and opposing Farigiraf.

sets.name: Bulky Trick Room
sets.description:
• Hyper Voice is a decently strong Normal-type STAB move for Farigiraf to spread chip damage that softens up opponents for its allies. Psyshock tackles common Psychic-weak Pokemon such as Amoonguss and Gengar, whereas Dazzling Gleam improves its matchup into common checks like Meowscarada and Hydreigon. Helping Hand allows Farigiraf to supplement a harder hitting teammate's damage output. Imprison is used on fast offensive teams that would otherwise struggle against opposing Trick Room teams.

  • Safety Goggles provides an immunity to Spore from Amoonguss and Breloom, who would otherwise prevent Trick Room from going up with it. Sitrus Berry gives Farigiraf longevity with recovery. Colbur Berry allows Farigiraf to consistently get Trick Room up in the face of Meowscarada and Hydreigon.

  • For other notable items, Mental Herb prevents fast Taunt users like Talonflame from interrupting Farigiraf's Trick Room. Life Orb or Throat Spray are good options to improve Farigiraf's already decent damage output. Rocky Helmet can also be used for an answer to unsuspecting Maushold.

  • 180 EVs in HP allow Farigiraf to survive maximum HP Annihilape Final Gambit, and the defensive investment allows it to always survive Tera Steel Choice Specs Gholdengo Make It Rain and Focus Sash Meowscarada Knock Off.

  • Tera Fairy is more of a defensive Tera type, giving it a resistance to all the types that Farigiraf was previously weak to while gaining STAB on Dazzling Gleam. Tera Normal adds damage onto Hyper Voice and removes its Dark weakness.

sets.name: Offensive
sets.description:
Kingambit is a potent late-game cleaner and wincon thanks to Swords Dance, Supreme Overlord, and Sucker Punch, the latter of which helps compensate for its poor Speed tier. Its remarkable defensive profile grants it multiple opportunities to wreak havoc: it soft checks and takes advantage of prominent threats like Dragapult, Meowscarada, and Gholdengo—which can be problematic for offensive teams—while forcing out defensive foes like Hatterene, Toxapex, and Slowking. Iron Head smashes through Fairy-types and Tera Fairy users like Hatterene, Scream Tail, and Skeledirge, Toxapex, and Rotom-W. Low Kick most importantly OHKOes Roaring Moon and opposing Kingambit, and it severely dents Ting-Lu and Iron Treads. Tera Dark—especially alongside Black Glasses, if running it—cranks up Kingambit's damage output for even more late-game potential. Tera Dark in particular allows Sucker Punch to OHKO Gholdengo without a boost, as well as Garchomp at +2, and it also removes Kingambit's Ground weakness for foes like Garchomp and Ting-Lu. Tera Fighting removes all of Kingambit's weaknesses and boosts its Low Kick's damage output, allowing Kingambit to break pass Great Tusk and Dondozo after a couple of Supreme Overlord boosts. Tera Fire is another alternative that flips the matchup against Cinderace, Iron Moth, and Focus Sash Ceruledge, as well as stopping the former two and foes like Rotom-W, Dragapult, and Tera Water Skeledirge from crippling it with a burn. Moreover, the Fighting neutrality allows Kingambit to soft check Iron Valiant and Breloom, and it can set up safely on Body Press Corviknight. Lum Berry gives Kingambit more setup opportunities in the face of status users like Rotom-W and Dragapult, especially if it can't utilize Tera Fire to block their Will-O-Wisp. A Jolly nature allows Kingambit to outspeed uninvested Great Tusk and Rotom-W, and it works well on Low Kick variants to—at worst—Speed tie and OHKO opposing Kingambit.

Kingambit fits well on offensive teams, which range from offense to hyper offense. Entry hazards from teammates like Glimmora, Meowscarada, and Garchomp are near mandatory, as they deactivate Focus Sash on foes like Greninja, Polteageist, and Ceruledge and chip down foes into Kingambit's KO range. Also, these setters tending to faint early-game helps Kingambit accumulate Supreme Overlord boosts. Wallbreakers such as Iron Moth, Dragapult, and Iron Valiant are necessary to pressure the opposition early-game, especially because they can overwhelm and individually threaten Kingambit's checks like Dondozo, Corviknight, and Great Tusk; Iron Moth in particular deals with troublesome Fairy-types if Kingambit lacks Iron Head. In return, Kingambit deals with Dragapult for Iron Moth and Gholdengo for Iron Valiant, with Low Kick variants dealing with opposing Kingambit for Dragapult as well. Other setup sweepers like Dragonite and Roaring Moon are secondary wincons in case Kingambit is unable to fully sweep, especially if it runs Swords Dance to overwhelm their shared checks like Dondozo, Corviknight, and Tera Water Garganacl and Skeledirge. Aside from rain teams weakening the Fire-type moves from Iron Moth and Dragapult, they support Kingambit with wallbreakers like Floatzel, Azumarill, and Greninja, which threaten Great Tusk and overwhelm Dondozo and Tera Water Garganacl and Skeledirge. Kingambit also takes advantage of Floatzel fainting early-game from Wave Crash recoil to gain a Supreme Overlord boost.

sets.name: Bulky Swords Dance
sets.description:
Kingambit is one of the metagame's most powerful late-game wincons due to its high Attack bolstered further by Swords Dance and a fantastic ability in Supreme Overlord, excellent natural bulk and a good defensive typing, and access to a powerful STAB Sucker Punch to make up for its poor Speed. Kowtow Cleave is Kingambit's most reliable STAB option; with a Swords Dance boost and Supreme Overlord's maximum number of boosts, it is powerful enough to OHKO physically defensive Corviknight after Stealth Rock damage the majority of the time. Sucker Punch allows Kingambit to greatly pressure offensive threats, allowing it to eliminate weakened foes like Walking Wake, Hisuian Zoroark, Iron Moth, and Floatzel. With boosts from Supreme Overlord and Swords Dance, it can even handle bulkier threats like Roaring Moon where its high bulk investment allows it to attack them first, survive a hit, and KO them with Sucker Punch thereafter. Iron Head is a consistent STAB option that can eliminate Garganacl, Hatterene, and Tera Fairy Skeledirge while pressuring Roaring Moon without relying on Sucker Punch predictions against Dragon Dance variants. Tera Blast alongside a Fairy or Flying Tera type allows Kingambit to punish Fighting-types like Iron Valiant, Great Tusk, and Breloom by turning its 4x Fighting weakness into a resistance and OHKOing them in return with a super effective attack, though this comes at the cost of requiring Kingambit to Terastallize in order to maximize its coverage. Tera Fairy also improves Kingambit's matchup against Dragon-types like Roaring Moon, while Tera Flying grants it a Ground immunity to allow it to turn Great Tusk into setup fodder. 20 Speed EVs allow Kingambit to outspeed minimum Speed Corviknight, while the HP investment allows Kingambit to survive powerful attacks like Choice Specs Iron Valiant's Moonblast.

Kingambit is an excellent wincon on bulky offense and balanced teams. Ting-Lu and Garchomp provide Stealth Rock and Spikes support to let Kingambit KO Roaring Moon with a boosted Sucker Punch, and the chip damage from entry hazards can make up for fewer Supreme Overlord boosts should some of Kingambit's teammates still be healthy. Iron Valiant can use its strong mixed coverage to pressure Unaware walls like Dondozo and that would otherwise ignore Kingambit's Swords Dance boosts and prevent its sweep, while Hisuian Zoroark can eliminate Dondozo while pressuring Skeledirge and Amoonguss. In return, Kingambit's great bulk and good defensive typing let it check faster offensive threats like Dragapult and Meowscarada while resisting priority from Dragonite. Great Tusk appreciates Kingambit's ability to pressure Fairy-types that force it out, and in return, it wears down Steel-types—especially opposing Kingambit, which this set greatly appreciates, since it does not carry Low Kick—so Kingambit can sweep more easily. Dragon-types like Dragapult, Roaring Moon, and Dragonite all have excellent synergy with Kingambit, as it resists Dragon- and Ice-type attacks and can threaten Fairy-types like Hatterene and Tera Fairy Garganacl with Iron Head; any of these Dragon-types can run Choice item sets to help wallbreak for Kingambit, or Kingambit can assist in wallbreaking earlier in the game to facilitate their sweeps if they opt to run Dragon Dance sets instead. Said Dragon-types resist Fire-type attacks from Cinderace and Iron Moth. Iron Moth itself makes for an effective teammate, as it can handle threats like Corviknight and opposing Kingambit while wearing down walls like Dondozo to help Kingambit sweep. In return, Kingambit's powerful Sucker Punch can pressure fast and powerful physical attackers like Dragapult and Cinderace that Iron Moth cannot reliably set up against. Lastly, Choice Scarf Gholdengo can take advantage of Corviknight and Amoonguss to help Kingambit break through defensive cores long-term and can use Trick to cripple walls like Skeledirge and Dondozo, giving Kingambit opportunities to exploit their newfound Choice locks and wear them down.

sets.name: Swords Dance
sets.description:
Supreme Overlord Kingambit is a terrifying revenge killer and sweeper. Dark / Steel is a great offensive typing that can hit Pokemon such as Skeledirge, Gholdengo, Dragapult, Garganacl, and Iron Valiant super effectively as well as Great Tusk, Ting-Lu, and Corviknight neutrally. Tera Flying completely reverses Kingambit's weaknesses and resistances and can catch Pokemon looking to KO Kingambit with Fighting- and Ground-type moves like Iron Valiant and Great Tusk, off guard. Alternatively, Kingambit can opt for Tera Ghost to better counter Tera Normal Dragonite, as Earthquake becomes neutral against Kingambit and Extreme Speed is ineffective. Similarly, Tera Fairy can be chosen because Kingambit then resists Roaring Moon's Crunch, which cannot OHKO Kingambit without Tera Steel. Kingambit chooses to run 144 Speed EVs to reliably outspeed Corviknight and Swords Dance Iron Hands; the rest of its investment is in HP to maximize bulk.

Kingambit fits very well on hyper and bulky offense teams, as it works very well coming in after its teammates have fallen, such as Iron Valiant, Gholdengo, Breloom, and Dragonite. On hyper offense particularly, Grimmsnarl and Glimmora both work as great leads that set up screens and entry hazards, respectively. Kingambit checks opposing offensive Pokemon such as Dragapult, Gholdengo, and Meowscarada thanks to its defensive typing but loses out against revenge killers such as Breloom and other threats like Calm Mind Iron Valiant, Iron Hands, Dondozo, and Great Tusk; as such, Kingambit appreciates defensive support from Great Tusk, Skeledirge, and Rotom-W and offensive support from Iron Valiant, Gholdengo, and Dragapult.

sets.name: Setup Sweeper
sets.description: Kingambit is a strong late-game sweeper thanks to Supreme Overlord and a strong priority in Sucker Punch. Low Kick can be used over Iron Head to punish Ting-Lu, opposing Kingambit, and Tera Dark Chien-Pao, but is generally outclassed by Iron Head's consistency. The given EV spread allows Kingambit to outspeed uninvested Corviknight, Skeledirge, and Alomomola. Tera Flying lets Kingambit take on Ground- and Fighting-type attacks, turning Great Tusk and Iron Treads into setup fodder. Alternatively, Tera Dark—when used with Black Glasses—boosts Kingambit's Dark-type attacks to impressive levels, allowing it to accomplish feats such as OHKOing Miraidon with +2 Sucker Punch. Leftovers allows Kingambit to come in repeatedly on bulky Pokemon such as Toxapex and non-Body Press Corviknight to wear them down, whereas Black Glasses increases the likelihood of Kingambit sweeping. Kingambit fits on offensive teams that appreciate it cleaning up after other setup sweepers and wallbreakers have broken through or weakened its checks. Offensive Pokemon such as Chien-Pao, Great Tusk, and Koraidon are great teammates, as they can weaken walls like Dondozo, Corviknight, and Great Tusk for Kingambit, and vice versa. Entry hazard setters such as Glimmora, Froslass, and Great Tusk are appreciated to wear down Kingambit's checks, since they tend to not have reliable recovery. On non-hyper offense teams, Kingambit appreciates defensive support to fall back on, such as Great Tusk or Toxapex for Koraidon and Ting-Lu, Clodsire, or Iron Treads for Miraidon.

sets.name: Setup Sweeper
sets.description:
• Supreme Overlord makes Kingambit a threatening late-game sweeper and revenge killer.
  • 144 Speed EVs allow Kingambit to outspeed uninvested Alomomola, Skeledirge, and Corviknight.
  • Tera Flying allows Kingambit to survive otherwise super effective hits from Great Tusk, Iron Treads, non-Choice Band Koraidon, and Annihilape, allowing it to set up or dent these threats with a strong attack. Tera Ghost may be used to grant immunity to Fighting-type moves without a weakness to Ice-type attacks from Iron Bundle and Chien-Pao.
  • Teammates such as defensive Great Tusk, Skeledirge, Corviknight, and Toxapex are good checks to physical threats like Koraidon, Great Tusk, and Chien-Pao. Special walls such as Ting-Lu, Iron Treads, and Clodsire check fast special attackers like Miraidon and Iron Bundle while setting entry hazards for Kingambit. Setting entry hazards and spreading status is especially crucial, as most Kingambit checks have no viable recovery options.
  • Strong wallbreakers like Koraidon, offensive Great Tusk, and Chien-Pao support Kingambit late-game. Choice Scarf Koraidon is an excellent partner, as it outspeeds and threatens Kingambit's checks, and together they are able to overwhelm most of their shared checks.

sets.name: Swords Dance (Dark)
sets.description:
Kingambit is a potent wallbreaker and sweeper on Dark teams, having an excellent secondary typing, great stats, and an amazing ability to tie it all together. Swords Dance allows Kingambit to capitalize on its already great Attack stat, letting it threaten defensive walls such as Toxapex, Amoonguss, and Corviknight. Making up for its lack of Speed, Sucker Punch fits perfectly on Kingambit. In tandem with three boosts from Supreme Overlord, Sucker Punch OHKOes Flutter Mane; it also OHKOes Volcarona after Swords Dance in tandem with two Supreme Overlord boosts. Kowtow Cleave is a reliable heavy-hitting STAB attack, and Iron Head hits Fairy-types such as Hatterene and Azumarill. Supreme Overlord is one of Kingambit's main selling points, allowing it to 2HKO Specially Defensive Corviknight and almost always 2HKO Quagsire after Stealth Rock. The Speed EVs allow Kingambit to outspeed both Corviknight and Skeledirge, both which otherwise can threaten Kingambit with Body Press and Will-O-Wisp, respectively. Leftovers are used to support Kingambit's solid defensive stats, giving it a form of recovery.

Kingambit functions as an excellent late-game sweeper, making use of its ability and setup potential; thus, Kingambit greatly appreciates entry hazard support from Ting-Lu to pressure offensive teams who lack hazard removal. Greninja and Hydreigon cover physically defensive walls, hitting Pokemon such as Great Tusk and Amoonguss that Kingambit would otherwise struggle with. Sableye provides an important Fighting-type immunity to make up for Kingambit's typing. Skuntank can be used in combination with Kingambit to ease the Fairy-type matchup and set Toxic Spikes, chipping foes and making it easier for Kingambit to sweep late-game. Chien-Pao and Meowscarada help make up for some of Kingambit's type weaknesses. Chien-Pao can hit Ground-types such as Garchomp and Great Tusk. Meowscarada can make use of Choice Scarf combined with Play Rough to hit Fighting-types such as Iron Valiant while also hitting Ground- and Water-types such as Quagsire.

sets.name: Swords Dance (Steel)
sets.description:
Kingambit serves as one of the best attackers for the Steel type, boasting impressive physical bulk and monstrous Attack, and the latter gets boosted further by Supreme Overlord and Swords Dance. Its base 50 Speed leaves something to be desired but is supplemented by Sucker Punch. Kowtow Cleave allows it to break through walls that don't resist it such as Skeledirge, which poses a major complication for Steel teams, as well as 2HKOing Quagsire if all teammates have fainted. Sucker Punch can allow Kingambit to defeat threats like Barraskewda and Flutter Mane, which can massively threaten Steel teams. Iron Head damages Pokemon that don't mind Sucker Punch or Kowtow Cleave, such as Ting-Lu or Azumarill. Alternatively, Brick Break destroys dual screens and OHKOes other Kingambit trying to take its STAB moves. 140 Speed EVs allow Kingambit to outspeed walls such as uninvested Skeledirge and Corviknight. Black Glasses boosts its Dark-type moves to dangerous levels without it having to set up Swords Dance, but Leftovers may be used to increase Kingambit's survivability. Chople Berry has a niche in allowing Kingambit to survive Fighting-type moves such as Chien-Pao's Sacred Sword, while Heavy Duty Boots helps it pivot in and out to exert pressure on the opponent without getting chipped.

Scizor's U-turn safely pivots Kingambit in to wallbreak while dealing substantial chip damage; also, its Bullet Punch deals with threats to Kingambit such as Chien-Pao and Iron Valiant, and Close Combat allows it to check threats such as Iron Treads and Ting-Lu. Gholdengo is an excellent partner to freely switch into Fighting-type moves and Will-O-Wisp. Corviknight serves as a potent check to Chien-Pao and clears entry hazards to increase Kingambit's longevity, Magnezone breaks through bulky Water-types such as Toxapex and Dondozo, and it preserves momentum through Volt Switch. Iron Treads serves as another hazard clearer, can set up Stealth Rock to chip any walls Kingambit wants to break through, and can serve as speed control with a Choice Scarf. Klefki sets up dual screens, which allow Kingambit to use Swords Dance far more easily. Tinkaton can wall any Fairy-type moves meant to chip or finish off Kingambit, such as Flutter Mane's Moonblast, and KO many of their users with Gigaton Hammer. Orthworm's Shed Tail can be used with Kingambit to great effect, allowing it to freely use Swords Dance and threaten to sweep the opponent's team.

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
This analysis is for the Regulation C format of Battle Stadium Singles, which lasts until June 30th, 2023. For more information on this format and its current events, check out this page!

If you feel this analysis is missing anything important or needs an update, feel free to suggest any changes here.

sets.name: Bulky Attacker
sets.description:
• Kingambit sets itself apart from most other Dark-types with its bulk and typing, which make it a reasonable check against Gholdengo that lack Focus Blast, and less vulnerable to Flutter Mane.

  • Guillotine: This makes Kingambit far more difficult to wall with foes such as Dondozo and Ting-Lu.

  • Brick Break versus Low Kick: Low Kick is Kingambit's best option against Tera Normal Dragonite and other Kingambit, but Brick Break is preferred because it deals far more damage to Chi-Yu.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Kingambit has a good typing, but its vulnerability to Fighting-type attacks or need to boost its power for late game sweeps means it benefits a lot from Terastallization.

  • Dark: A Dark Tera type makes Kingambit even harder to wall and removes its irritating Ground weakness, though powerful Fighting attacks can still be a problem,

  • Flying: This Tera type covers Kingambit's issues with Fighting- and Ground-type attacks very well and lets it deal big damage to Fighting-types like Annihilape and Great Tusk with Tera Blast.

  • Fairy: With a Fairy Tera type and Tera Blast, Kingambit improves its matchup against Chien-Pao and can deal serious damage to Iron Hands and Great Tusk, but it becomes vulnerable to Gholdengo.

Abilities

  • Supreme Overload: This ability makes Kingambit a deadly cleaner in late-game scenarios, and is generally the most consistent ability.

  • Defiant: Defiant prevents Kingambit from falling to Charm Flutter Mane, and is a good option for punishing speed control options like Rock Tomb.

Alternate EV Spreads

  • 108 HP / 252 Atk / 148 Spe: This EV spread has enough Speed to outspeed most Corviknight and Skeledirge, and it still has enough bulk to survive one unboosted Body Press from Corviknight. Since this is a fairly congested Speed range, feel free to move some Attack EVs to Speed.

  • 4 HP / 252 Atk / 252 Spe: Using maximum Speed might seem absurd on such a slow Pokemon, but outspeeding most Skeledirge, Corviknight, and opposing Kingambit can make this worth it.

Items

  • Assault Vest: Kingambit's bulk is perfect for Assault Vest, letting it preform well against Flutter Mane and Iron Bundle.

  • Black Glasses: While its boost to Dark-type attacks isn't as high as Life Orb's, Black Glasses is a better fit for Kingambit's bulk due to the lack of recoil.

  • Sitrus Berry and 244 HP EVs: The burst of recovery helps Kingambit check Gholdengo better. Make sure to run 244 HP EVs to have an even HP stat. This will make Sitrus Berry activate after one use of Ruination.

sets.name: Stealth Rock Support
sets.description:
• Kingambit's excellent bulk and offensive presence make it a good, if unexpected, setter of Stealth Rock.

  • Brick Break versus Low Kick: While weak, Brick Break is the preferred fighting move for hitting Chi-Yu hard. Low Kick does more damage to Ting-Lu, other Kingambit and Tera Normal Dragonite.

  • Thunder Wave: Thunder Wave isn't a particularly common move on Kingambit, potentially letting it surprise some switch-ins like Iron Moth and Annihilape.

Other Options

  • Guillotine: With Guillotine, passive play from foes like Corviknight and Dondozo becomes far more risky.

  • Taunt: Taunt is effective at shutting down common support Pokemon such as Dondozo and Toxapex.

  • Tera Blast: Tera Fairy Blast is Kingambit's best shot against Iron Hands, one of its biggest checks. It also makes sense with Tera Flying to hit Great Tusk hard.

  • Metal Burst: If using Focus Sash, Metal Burst deals serious damage against a wide variety of leads.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: While Terastallization is fully viable, this Kingambit's focus on setting up Stealth Rock early means its not needed to function.

  • Flying: Tera Flying covers Kingambit's Fighting- and Ground-type weaknesses, making it do especially well against

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy can help prevent Iron Hands, one of the best Kingambit checks in the game, from OHKOing it.

  • Dark: When using Sucker Punch, Tera Dark gives Kingambit some late-game cleaning potential.

Items

Sitrus Berry: Sitrus Berry's quick burst of recovery keeps Kingambit more relevant in the later stages of the game. Make sure to use an even HP stat so that Ruination will activate Sitrus Berry.

  • Black Glasses: Kingambit's bulk and support options make Black Glasses a preferable option over Life Orb for more power, especially when using Sucker Punch.

  • Focus Sash: Focus Sash will let Kingambit survive even the strongest Fighting-type attacks, if Stealth Rock desperately needs to be set up.

  • Chople Berry: Chople Berry eases Kingambit's devastating Fighting-type weakness, though note powerful STAB users of Close Combat such as Iron Hands require massive Defense investment to survive. 252 HP and 12 Defense EVs can be used to survive Iron Valiant's Close Combat.

Abilities

  • Supreme Overlord: Even though this Kingambit is often set out early-game to set up Stealth Rock, Supreme Overlord gives it the flexibility to function later in the game if Stealth Rock isn't needed or if it manages to set up Stealth Rock without much harm to itself.

  • Defiant: Besides punishing the rare use of Intimidate, Defiant lets Kingambit defeat Charm Flutter Mane.

EV Spreads

  • 244 HP / 252 Atk / 4 Def / 4 SpD / 4 Spe: This EV spread gives Kingambit an even HP stat, letting Sitrus Berry activate on the first use of Ruination.

  • 4 HP / 252 Atk / 252 Spe: Maximizing Speed lets Kingambit get the jump on opposing Kingambit and slower variants of Wo-Chien, Skeledirge, Corviknight, and Iron Hands.

sets.name: Swords Dance
sets.description: Swords Dance Kingambit excels as a mid-game wallbreaker that can boost on passive foes and tear through the opponent's team with its Adaptability-boosted STAB attacks. Kowtow Cleave and Iron Head are Kingambit's main attacks, heavily damaging defensive pivots like Corviknight, Hisuian Goodra, Scream Tail, and Garganacl. Sucker Punch lets it predict and punish faster attackers like Quaquaval, Volcarona, and Slither Wing that try and come in to revenge kill. 140 Speed EVs let Kingambit outspeed uninvested Corviknight and Skeledirge. Black Glasses lets Kingambit OHKO Iron Moth with Sucker Punch. Immunity abilities like Well-Baked Body and Earth Eater are options to pick up additional setup chances. Fast endgame sweepers like Chien-Pao, Meowscarada, and Hisuian Electrode benefit from Kingambit's early-game presence, capitalizing on chipped foes and scoring easy KOs. Defensive pivots like Intimidate Corviknight, RegenVest Meloetta, and Fluffy Landorus-T can thwart revenge killers targeting Kingambit and use U-turn to bring it in safely again. Finally, Primordial Sea Zapdos can help Kingambit by forcing Corviknight and Quaquaval, two of its most consistent checks, letting it chip them on their switch-in repeatedly.

sets.name: Swords Dance
sets.description:
Kingambit is one of the best wallbreakers and late-game cleaners in the current metagame, as it possesses fantastic offensive tools to take advantage in STABmons, gaining access to moves like Behemoth Blade and Knock Off, which are further bolstered by Supreme Overlord and Swords Dance.
